enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Primary Venture Partners who leads investments in built-world (proptech), SMB/consumer, fintech and vertical AI. Former founder (D2C footwear) and operator; University of Miami alumnus. Serves on multiple startup boards and focuses on early-stage deals.
enrichment.career_background: Jason Shuman earned a BBA from the University of Miami. He founded Category Five (a D2C footwear brand) before moving into VC as an associate at Corigin Ventures and roles at US Investment Partners and Julius (Chief of Staff). He joined Primary in 2018 and was promoted to Partner/General Partner, leading investments and board relationships across proptech, consumer, SMB and healthcare sectors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & Seed; Built world/PropTech, Vertical AI, SMB & consumer marketplaces, Fintech (SMB/consumer), Healthcare/consumer health

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Worklife Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on the future of work. Former head of GTM/self‑serve strategy at Zendesk; previously worked in growth at Expedia and taught at General Assembly. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
interests: Future of work / remote & hybrid work tooling
enrichment.career_background: Brianne Kimmel founded Worklife Ventures in 2019 and leads the firm’s seed and early-stage investments into companies reshaping how people work. Prior to launching the firm she led go‑to‑market and self‑serve revenue strategy at Zendesk, worked on user growth at Expedia, participated in Y Combinator (W16), and taught product/marketing at General Assembly.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in future-of-work SaaS, developer tools, AI/ML productivity tooling, creator-economy and SMB-focused platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and co‑founder at Homebrew who focuses on seed and early-stage investing. Previously VP Product at Twitter and a Partner at Battery Ventures; began his product career at Google working on AdSense. Holds degrees from the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Satya co‑founded Homebrew in 2013 and invests with a focus on the Bottom Up Economy. Before Homebrew he was VP Product at Twitter, a Partner at Battery Ventures (seed & early-stage investing), and a Senior Product Manager at Google (AdSense); earlier roles include DoubleClick and strategy consulting. He earned a BS in Finance (Wharton) and a BA in Psychology from the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage companies across fintech, consumer/bottom-up products, developer platforms, enterprise SaaS, AI/ML and marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor-operator and executive coach. Partner and board member at GAMEGROOVE Capital (and active with Diaspora Ventures / Sukna Global); previously a partner at 500 Startups and a 10.5-year executive at Yahoo. Has invested in hundreds of pre-seed and seed startups globally.
enrichment.career_background: Marvin Liao is a Silicon Valley investor and former operator with ~25 years of experience. He spent 10.5 years at Yahoo in sales, business development, ad operations and marketing, was a partner at 500 Startups running accelerator programs and seed investing, and currently serves as a partner/board member at GAMEGROOVE Capital while managing other rolling/angel funds and mentoring accelerator programs worldwide.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) startups across gaming, consumer AI & web3, enterprise SaaS, marketplaces, AdTech/MarTech and fintech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding & General Partner at the Berkeley SkyDeck Fund. Silicon Valley engineer, entrepreneur and investor; former founding partner and Managing Director of Junzi Capital Engineering. Holds a B.S. in EECS from UC Berkeley and an S.M. in EECS from MIT; active angel/institutional investor with multiple exits.
enrichment.career_background: Chon Tang is an engineer-turned-investor and entrepreneur. He co-founded Catchpod, served as founding partner and Managing Director of Junzi Capital Engineering (a quantitative trading firm), and is founding partner of the Berkeley SkyDeck Fund, the investment arm of UC Berkeley’s SkyDeck accelerator. He holds a B.S. (EECS) from UC Berkeley and an S.M. (EECS) from MIT.
enrichment.investment_focus: Invests at accelerator/seed stage into early-stage and university-affiliated startups (SkyDeck accelerator checks), with follow-on participation into Series A+; sector focus includes consumer, enterprise, digital health and information technology, and deep/space technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at Bloomberg Beta, where she leads East Coast investing and focuses on the future of work and machine intelligence. Previously led new initiatives at Bloomberg and led SoftBank’s venture review team. Serves on public and private boards and mentors founders through Techstars and Creative Destruction Lab.
enrichment.career_background: Klein began in corporate development and venture roles (including SoftBank, where she led the venture review team), then led new initiatives at Bloomberg before co-founding Bloomberg Beta in 2013. At Bloomberg Beta she invests primarily at pre-seed/seed and early stages and holds board seats on several companies and public boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed), future of work, machine intelligence/AI, enterprise software and security

enrichment.personal_bio: Rahul Vohra is founder and CEO of Superhuman and co-founder of Todd and Rahul's Angel Fund. He previously co-founded Rapportive (acquired by LinkedIn). He is an active angel investor and advisor to early-stage startups across SaaS, developer tools and consumer products.
enrichment.career_background: Rahul Vohra studied computer science at the University of Cambridge and co-founded Rapportive, which was acquired by LinkedIn. He later founded Superhuman, where he serves as CEO. Vohra co-founded Todd and Rahul's Angel Fund with Todd Goldberg and is an active angel investor and advisor to numerous startups, focusing on product, go-to-market and fundraising support.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-focused angel fund (occasionally post-seed/Series A). Sectors of interest include productivity/email, viral SaaS, creator tools, business infrastructure and health/wellness; typical check size $300k–$500k.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Social Leverage focusing on enterprise and early-stage software investments. Former COO of Desk.com after Assistly was acquired by Salesforce; earlier co‑founder/operator at Goowy Media. Active angel/seed investor since ~2011 and serves on/observes multiple portfolio boards.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and operator: co‑founder/leader at Assistly (acquired by Salesforce) and Goowy Media (acquired by AOL); served as COO of Desk.com/Salesforce; joined Social Leverage as a managing partner where he sources and leads enterprise and healthcare seed investments and sits on several boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in enterprise SaaS, healthcare technology, B2B software and cloud infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Operator and investor; founder and CEO of Curious, a long‑term holding company that buys and grows software businesses. Former CMO at Bitly and former CEO of Stamped, with a background in growth and product‑led SaaS.
interests: Acquiring/operating distressed or undercapitalized software companies
enrichment.career_background: Andrew Dumont is a serial operator turned investor. He co‑founded and runs Curious (formerly Curious VC), served as CMO of Bitly, was CEO of Stamped, and held roles at betaworks, Moz and other startups. He focuses on building and operating software companies and providing liquidity or long‑term homes for founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Software-focused investments (SaaS, developer tools); seed/pre-seed minority investments and majority/distressed/special‑situation acquisitions and operational turnarounds.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and angel investor focused on consumer health and DTC brands. Co‑founder/leader of companies including Kettle & Fire, Perfect Keto, Surely and TrueMed; serves as a Venture Partner at Long Journey Ventures. Active on seed/pre‑seed deals in wellness, food & beverage and consumer fintech.
enrichment.career_background: Justin Mares co‑founded Kettle & Fire (2015) and later co‑founded Perfect Keto (2016) and Surely (2021). He founded HelpKitchen (2020), co‑founded Upside Financing (incubated; acquired 2022), and launched TrueMed (Co‑founder & CEO). Mares has served as a Venture Partner at Long Journey Ventures since 2022 and holds a BSBA from the University of Pittsburgh.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) investments in consumer health & wellness, DTC/CPG, food & beverage, and payments/fintech for health

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and co-founder at Homebrew, a San Francisco–based seed-stage venture firm. Former product leader at YouTube/Google; founding product/marketing member at Linden Lab. Holds a BA from Vassar and an MBA from Stanford; invests primarily at seed/pre-seed stages.
enrichment.career_background: Co-founded Homebrew in 2013 and serves as a partner investing in early-stage companies. Previously led consumer product management at YouTube (after joining Google in 2003) and was a founding product/marketing team member at Linden Lab; earlier roles include management consulting and work in media. Education: BA (Vassar) and MBA (Stanford).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage (pre-seed to Series A); focus on fintech, SaaS, marketplaces, APIs/developer infrastructure, and AI/ML.

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor and former senior Cisco executive. Founder of Scheinman Angel Fund and an active angel investor since 2011. Serves on the boards of Zoom, Arista Networks and SentinelOne.
enrichment.career_background: Spent roughly 1997–2011 at Cisco Systems in roles spanning general counsel, corporate development and senior vice president/general management (including Cisco Media Solutions Group). Since April 2011 he has invested personal capital in early-stage technology companies and holds board seats at Zoom, Arista and SentinelOne.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage investments in enterprise software, cloud infrastructure, networking, cybersecurity, and developer tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and founder at Telegraph Hill Capital, based between Barcelona and Silicon Valley. 20+ years of experience in venture capital, M&A and corporate finance (former roles at EY and PwC). Holds an MBA from the University of San Francisco and a BS from the University of Barcelona.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and Managing Partner of Telegraph Hill Capital (THCAP) since ~2007–2008; prior roles include M&A Director at Ernst & Young and Corporate Finance Associate Director at PwC. Serves on boards and as board observer for multiple portfolio companies; background includes corporate finance, valuation and investment roles in Barcelona and the Bay Area.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments focused on B2B SaaS, PropTech/real-estate technology and marketplace/subscription models, primarily in North America and Western Europe.

enrichment.personal_bio: Sam Lessin is a General Partner and co‑founder at Slow Ventures. He previously co‑founded drop.io (acquired by Facebook) and co‑founded Fin; he served as VP of Product at Facebook (2010–2014). He is an active early‑stage investor with bets across consumer, fintech, crypto and creator‑economy companies.
enrichment.career_background: Started his career at Bain & Company, founded drop.io (acquired by Facebook in 2010), then served as VP of Product at Facebook (2010–2014). He co‑founded Fin and is a co‑founder/General Partner at Slow Ventures, investing in pre‑seed through early growth stages. He holds an A.B. in Social Studies from Harvard University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed/Series A) generalist VC focusing on consumer, fintech, SaaS, crypto/blockchain, healthcare and the creator economy.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Ingeborg Investments, leading the firm’s day-to-day investing activities for a family-office-backed platform focused on women-led companies. Previously a managing partner at Revolution’s Rise of the Rest Seed Fund. Holds a BA from Harvard College and an MBA from NYU Stern. Based in the Washington, D.C. area.
enrichment.career_background: Anna began her career on Wall Street as a distressed-debt and special-situations trader, co‑founded a fitness-community startup that was acquired, then joined Revolution where she helped build and lead the Rise of the Rest Seed Fund (many investments and a geography-first strategy). In 2022 she became Managing Partner at Ingeborg Investments, overseeing deal sourcing, portfolio management and industry relationships; she has held board and observer roles for several portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Direct investments in women-led, early-stage startups (seed through Series A), with emphasis on the "full female experience" — motherhood, women’s health, family & consumer products — plus selective investments in women-led funds and later-stage opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Chief Engineer at Engineering Capital who leads and often syndicates seed rounds in technical software and infrastructure startups. Former product leader at VMware (worked on ESX Server) and earlier founder/operator. Holds an MS in Computer Science from Stanford and an MBA from Wharton.
enrichment.career_background: Started as an engineer at Hewlett-Packard and Silicon Graphics, founded Sidana Systems (acquired), then ran product management for VMware's ESX Server. Transitioned to venture investing, founded Engineering Capital to lead seed investments in software/infrastructure companies. Educated at USC (BS CS), Stanford (MS CS) and Wharton (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) enterprise and infrastructure software, cloud/platforms, security, and developer-focused tooling

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and longtime CEO of inDinero and founder of venture firm Mahway; serves as an Investment Partner at XFactor Ventures. Early YC alum and UC Berkeley computer science graduate who invests in fintech and B2B SaaS. Active mentor to founders and advocate for women in STEM.
enrichment.career_background: Jessica Mah founded inDinero in 2010 and has led and scaled multiple startups. She runs Mahway (a venture/venture-creation firm), sits as an Investment Partner at XFactor Ventures, and has participated in Y Combinator. Education includes Bard College at Simon's Rock and a B.S. in Computer Science from UC Berkeley; she is a member of YPO and holds a commercial pilot license.
enrichment.investment_focus: B2B SaaS; FinTech; Pre-seed & Seed

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of The House Fund, a Berkeley-focused pre-seed and early-stage VC. UC Berkeley graduate who launched the fund in 2016 to support Berkeley-affiliated founders. Previously invested at CrunchFund, Dorm Room Fund, and Keiretsu Forum and co-founded Dropsense.
interests: Pre-seed and seed investing / founder support
enrichment.career_background: Started The House Fund in 2016 after graduating from UC Berkeley. Prior roles include investor positions at CrunchFund, Dorm Room Fund (Managing Partner) and Keiretsu Forum; co-founded health data startup Dropsense and has served as an advisor/board observer to multiple portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and early-stage Berkeley-affiliated startups; emphasis on AI/ML, SaaS, robotics, deep tech, and university spinouts.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Matrix focused on B2B SaaS and applied AI; joined the firm as an early-stage investor and works from San Francisco. citeturn7view0turn8view0 Former product leader (VP Product at Quip) with prior roles at SoundCloud and Microsoft. citeturn8view0turn3search4 Holds a BA from Harvard and an MBA from Harvard Business School. citeturn3search7turn8view0
enrichment.career_background: Product operator turned investor: several years as a product leader (including VP Product at Quip) and earlier product/PM roles at SoundCloud and Microsoft; moved into VC as a Partner at Matrix in 2021 where she leads early-stage B2B and AI investments. citeturn8view0turn3search4turn7view0
enrichment.hometown: Born in Cambridge, Massachusetts; raised in Ann Arbor, Michigan. citeturn8view0
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed–Series A) B2B SaaS and applied AI. citeturn7view0turn3search4

enrichment.personal_bio: Jason McCabe Calacanis is an American entrepreneur, angel investor and podcaster. He founded LAUNCH (the LAUNCH accelerator and festival) and Inside.com, hosts This Week in Startups and co-hosts the All-In podcast, and has invested in hundreds of startups. He is the author of the book Angel: How to Invest in Technology Startups.
enrichment.career_background: Calacanis began in digital media (founding Weblogs, Inc., sold to AOL), served briefly as an Entrepreneur-in-Action at Sequoia, then founded Inside.com and LAUNCH. He is a prolific angel investor and runs LAUNCH’s accelerator and related programs (Founder University, The Syndicate), while hosting long-running startup-focused podcasts and public events.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology startups (pre-seed to Series B); consumer marketplaces and on-demand platforms; fintech; productivity/SaaS; media and podcast-related ventures.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Product Hunt and a General Partner at Weekend Fund. Early-stage investor focused on consumer and B2B startups; contributor to the book Hooked: How to Build Habit-Forming Products. Background in product management and writing; maintains a public blog and publishes on LinkedIn.
enrichment.career_background: Began as a product manager in the gaming industry (PlayHaven, InstantAction), co-created Startup Edition, founded Product Hunt in 2013 (later acquired by AngelList), and launched Weekend Fund in 2017 where he invests in pre-seed and seed-stage companies. Writes publicly and has contributed to Hooked: How to Build Habit-Forming Products.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage consumer and B2B startups; focus areas include creator/maker tools, distributed team tooling, audio/voice products, and no/low-code platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Frank Rotman is a founding partner and Chief Investment Officer at QED Investors, a venture firm focused exclusively on fintech. He was an early architect at Capital One (≈13 years) and led QED’s investment in Credit Karma. Rotman has appeared on Forbes’ Midas List multiple years and in March 2025 announced he will transition to Partner Emeritus, effective Jan 1, 2026, to focus on founding startups.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded QED Investors in 2007 and has overseen the firm’s fintech-focused investing as CIO. Prior to QED, Rotman spent roughly 13 years at Capital One where he was an early architect of the business and served as the company’s first chief credit risk officer. He holds degrees from the University of Virginia and has served/serves on multiple portfolio company boards; in 2025 he announced a transition to a part‑time Partner Emeritus role to pursue new startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech/financial services (credit, lending, payments, banking, embedded finance); data- and credit-oriented startups; primarily early‑stage through growth‑stage; global remit (US, UK, Latin America, Asia, Africa)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at Hustle Fund, a pre-seed venture fund that backs very early software startups. Previously a partner at 500 Startups and co‑founder & CEO of adtech startup LaunchBit (acq. 2014). Holds a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Stanford and an MBA from MIT Sloan.
enrichment.career_background: Elizabeth Yin is a recovering entrepreneur turned investor. She co-founded Hustle Fund and leads pre-seed investing there after earlier roles that include Partner at 500 Startups, co‑founder & CEO of LaunchBit (acquired 2014), and product marketing at Google. She blogs and speaks on startup fundraising and founder growth; she holds degrees from Stanford (BSEE) and MIT Sloan (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed software startups (primary sectors: B2B SaaS, fintech, digital health, developer tools, AI/ML); typical initial check size ~$25K–$50K.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at SoGal Ventures, a women‑led early‑stage VC investing in world‑class women and diverse founders. She co‑founded the SoGal community and has focused on building cross‑border dealflow between North America and Asia. Educated at College of William & Mary (BBA) and USC (MSc, Entrepreneurship & Innovation).
enrichment.career_background: Pocket Sun co‑founded the SoGal community and SoGal Ventures (2015/2016) to address funding gaps for underrepresented founders. She serves as Co‑Founder & Managing Partner at SoGal Ventures, has been active across the US, Canada and Asia, and holds a Master of Science in Entrepreneurship & Innovation from the University of Southern California and a BBA from the College of William & Mary. She is based in Vancouver, Canada.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in women‑ and diverse‑led startups across consumer products, digital health & wellness, and future‑of‑living/work themes; primary geographies: US and Asia.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Craft Ventures who leads the firm’s New York office. Former head of Reddit’s East Coast sales team and an early member of Twitter’s New York team. Founder of Riverside Ventures and an active angel investor across consumer and infrastructure companies. Recognized in Forbes 30 Under 30 and Business Insider seed‑investor lists.
enrichment.career_background: Built and led Reddit’s New York revenue and brand partnerships organization after early roles on Twitter’s New York team; founded Riverside Ventures (an angel/SPV vehicle) in 2017 and joined Craft in 2018, where he now invests across seed to growth and sits on/observes several boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Founder‑focused generalist; invests across consumer (DTC, marketplaces, creator/consumer media), gaming/eSports, and B2B SaaS/infra from seed through growth stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Kevin Siskar is CEO & co‑founder of Finta and runs the Firehouse Ventures AngelList syndicate. He is an active pre‑seed/seed investor and host of the Ambition Today podcast. He previously led Founder Institute New York and served as VP, Portfolio & Selection at 43North.
enrichment.career_background: Kevin Siskar studied Cognitive Neuroscience at the University at Buffalo. He co‑founded and serves as CEO of Finta, built and runs the Firehouse Ventures syndicate, and has held leadership roles at Founder Institute (Managing Director) and 43North (VP, Portfolio & Selection). He has also worked as a venture partner/advisor at early‑stage firms and hosts the Ambition Today podcast.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage startups; sectors include FinTech, AI, Enterprise/SaaS, HealthTech, consumer products/marketplaces and Space/Deep Tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Ensemble VC, leading a data-driven early-stage venture firm. Former Head of VC at UTIMCO and investor at Norwest and Bain Capital Ventures; earlier product manager at Yammer. MBA from Wharton and BBA from the University of Texas at Austin; based in Austin, TX.
enrichment.career_background: Conrad began his career as a consultant at Bain & Company, moved into venture investing (Bain Capital Ventures, Norwest Venture Partners), worked as a product manager at Yammer, then led VC investing at UTIMCO (managing a multi‑billion dollar VC portfolio). He is now co‑founder and Managing Partner of Ensemble VC, focusing on data-driven sourcing and early-stage investments. Education: MBA, Wharton; BBA/BA, University of Texas at Austin.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed/Series A); enterprise & developer/productivity software; deep tech & defense; healthcare tech; marketplaces and consumer platforms

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and angel investor. Managing Partner of Rose Tech Ventures; founder and Executive Chairman of Gust; Founder & Chairman Emeritus of New York Angels; author of 'Angel Investing' and 'The Startup Checklist.'
enrichment.career_background: David S. Rose has founded and led multiple technology and real-estate ventures, and has been an active angel investor for decades. He founded Gust (angel investing platform), New York Angels, and Rose Tech Ventures, serves as founder & CEO of US Real Estate Market (USREM), and has lectured/chaired programs at Singularity University and major business schools. He is a bestselling author on angel investing and startup operations.
enrichment.investment_focus: Very early-stage (angel/seed) investments in PropTech, FinTech and platform/SaaS businesses (primarily U.S.-based).

enrichment.personal_bio: Arjun Sethi is a co‑founder of Tribe Capital and a serial entrepreneur turned investor. He was previously a partner at Social Capital and co‑founded startups including MessageMe and LOLapps. Sethi serves on boards of several tech companies and has led Tribe’s investments across enterprise software, crypto and fintech.
enrichment.career_background: Sethi co‑founded Tribe Capital in 2018 after investing at Social Capital. Prior to investing he founded and led consumer startups (MessageMe, LOLapps) and held product leadership roles at Yahoo. At Tribe he has overseen venture and crypto investments and served on boards such as Carta, Relativity Space and Kraken; he has also co‑founded incubations and fintech ventures tied to Tribe.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to growth‑stage technology companies with emphasis on enterprise software, crypto/web3, fintech, and AI/data‑driven opportunities

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Managing Partner at Tekton Ventures; veteran Silicon Valley entrepreneur and early-stage investor with 15–20+ years of experience. Serves/has served as a Venture Partner at Partech (and listed with FEBE/Febe Ventures) and has backed 100+–150+ early-stage companies across the US, Europe and Asia, including Coupang and Toss.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Tekton Ventures (seed/early-stage global VC) and leads the firm’s investing activity. Prior roles include Venture Partner at Partech, partner at Ignite Ventures, co‑founder of On‑Air Networks (acquired), early employee at OnePage Software (acquired by Sybase), and an early career in management consulting at PA Consulting Group. Holds a BS from the University of Southern California.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in fintech, consumer (e‑commerce/marketplaces), enterprise software and mobile, with a global focus (US, Europe, Asia).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Saka Ventures. Over 25 years of experience across technology, finance, entrepreneurship, venture capital and blockchain, with prior role as Partner at 500 Startups leading India investments.
enrichment.career_background: Previously a Partner at 500 Startups (led India investments), Pankaj spent 12+ years in financial firms including J.P. Morgan, Long‑Term Capital Management and GlobeOp. He founded Teknatus Solutions, co‑founded HeadStart Network Foundation, launched Startup Weekend India, and has been an active angel investor and advisor to startups, funds and governments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments in SaaS, fintech, AI/data, blockchain and consumer tech; primarily India and US-focused startups targeting large global markets.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Baukunst, a San Francisco–based pre‑seed venture collective. Former Partner at Bolt; founder of Women In Hardware. Leads/pre‑seed investments in companies combining design and technology.
enrichment.career_background: Kate McAndrew built Bolt’s venture practice as a Partner before co‑founding Baukunst in 2022. She has spent a decade+ as a first‑round lead investor and board member, focusing on pre‑seed and seed companies at the intersection of the digital and physical worlds and running Baukunst’s inaugural $100M fund.
enrichment.investment_focus: Leads pre‑seed rounds (typical checks ~$500K–$2M) in "creative technologists" building at the frontiers of technology and design — sectors include hardware, consumer products/marketplaces, design tools, applied AI, and health/physical product innovation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and early-stage investor; General Partner/CEO at A7V. Founder and former CEO of Micello (indoor mapping), which was acquired by HERE Technologies in 2018. Also founder of HappyBoards and a Venture Partner at NextGen Venture Partners.
enrichment.career_background: Ankit Agarwal founded Micello in 2007 and led it through product and B2B growth until its acquisition by HERE Technologies in 2018. He has run A7V (a personal/family office and venture studio) since 2019, invests across early-stage technology sectors, and has founded consumer business HappyBoards. He has also served as a Venture Partner at NextGen Venture Partners.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) technology startups across PropTech/Real Estate, SaaS/Enterprise, Marketplaces, Web3/Blockchain, and FinTech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Atlanta-based entrepreneur, investor, and podcast host focused on real estate and PropTech. Co‑founder/operator of startups including Luxer One, DropLocker and Laundry Locker; now invests and advises early‑stage companies through Infinite Niches and related networks. Hosts The Multifamily Hangout and is active in industry groups (NMHC, NAA, ULI).
enrichment.career_background: 20+ years working at the intersection of real estate, logistics and technology. Co‑founder of Luxer One (package locker systems) and early team roles at DropLocker and Laundry Locker; has held growth/partnerships roles and advisory positions (On Deck, Xeal, Moderne Ventures, Atlanta Tech Village) and participates in industry organizations and boards focused on multifamily and proptech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments (angel / pre‑seed / seed) in real estate/PropTech, multifamily and built‑world solutions; logistics/last‑mile, hardware & smart‑cities, climate/energy adjacent tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and operator of Hamlet (local/civic-AI); co‑founder of Scripted. Former marketing executive (GoodRx, Metromile) and active angel investor. Serves as a Scout for Sequoia Capital and is a Forbes contributor.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and operator: co‑founded Scripted; held senior marketing roles including CMO at Metromile and VP Marketing (B2B) at GoodRx; founded Hamlet in 2022. Active angel investor and joined Sequoia’s scout program in 2022. Education: B.A., Claremont McKenna College; MBA, UCLA Anderson School of Management.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups; marketplaces, AI/ML, marketing technology, future-of-work/labor platforms, civic/local government tech

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and managing partner of Incisive Ventures, a pre-seed VC focused on technology that "reduces friction at scale." Serial entrepreneur and former Microsoft/Accenture employee who has raised venture capital as a CEO and invested as an angel in hundreds of startups. Based in the Pacific Northwest and active in pre-seed to seed-stage B2B software investing.
interests: Technology that reduces friction at scale
Vertical-market B2B/B2B2C SaaS and AI-enabled software
enrichment.career_background: Martin Tobias is a serial entrepreneur and investor. He worked at Accenture and Microsoft early in his career, served as a venture partner at Ignition Partners, and has been CEO/founder of multiple companies (including Loudeye, Imperium Renewables, Upgrade Labs). He founded Element 8 (E8) Angels and launched Incisive Ventures in 2020 to invest in pre-seed technology companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed technology (B2B/B2B2C) — vertical-market SaaS, AI/data, fintech and marketplaces; thesis: companies that reduce friction at scale.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Baukunst, a San Francisco–based collective investing in pre‑seed, design‑led technology companies. Fifteen years in product, design and engineering; led teams that worked on the first iPhone and multiple generations of iPods. Previously on the founding team at Pearl Automation and a partner at Bolt.
enrichment.career_background: Engineering and product leader turned investor. Worked at Apple on iPod/iPhone product development, was a founding team member and VP Product at Pearl Automation, partner at Fictive Kin, and later a partner at Bolt before co‑founding Baukunst. Education: BSE, Mechanical & Aerospace Engineering, Princeton University; MS, Mechanical Engineering, Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Design‑led hardware and software companies; pre‑seed / seed stage; consumer electronics, product engineering, manufacturing and developer tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Hustle Fund, an early‑stage VC that invests in pre‑seed and seed startups. Former founder of Beat The GMAT and Read Your Story and former product leader at Intuit and Instagram. Invests with an emphasis on founder execution and customer acquisition (what he calls "hustle").
enrichment.career_background: Founded Beat The GMAT (acquired) and co‑founded Read Your Story (acquired); worked in product roles at Intuit and as a product manager at Instagram; was a venture partner/entrepreneur-in-residence at 500 Startups before co‑founding Hustle Fund in 2017, where he serves as General Partner.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed software startups (SaaS, developer tools, fintech, digital health) with emphasis on founder execution, growth, and customer acquisition.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and partner at Notation Capital who focuses on hard tech, infrastructure, and product. A software engineer by training with experience in distributed systems and scalability; has worked with New York technical startups and studio companies for many years.
enrichment.career_background: Co-founded Notation Capital and serves as a partner focused on first-check investments for technical founding teams. Previously served as Chief Architect/VP-level engineering roles at betaworks and acted as a technical advisor to companies including Bitly, Chartbeat, and Hyperpublic. Educated at Vanderbilt University (studied physics and English).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / first-check investments into early-stage technical teams; focus areas include infrastructure, hard tech, developer tooling, product-led B2B, and select crypto/web3 and enterprise software opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Managing Partner at v1.vc, a seed-stage venture capital firm. Early-stage investor since 2006 and former founding-team/VP Business Development at AVX Aircraft; founder & CEO of Generation Think Tank; early employee at Crocs. Listed as based in Boulder, CO in public bios.
enrichment.career_background: Co-founded v1.vc in 2015 and serves as Managing Partner, leading seed-stage investments across B2B AI, consumer, and frontier tech. Prior to v1.vc he was on the founding team and VP of Business Development at AVX Aircraft (VTOL developer), founded Generation Think Tank (digital marketing), and was an early employee at Crocs. Active as an angel investor and board member in multiple startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage investing focused on B2B AI/enterprise software, consumer startups, and frontier/near-frontier technologies (early-stage).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner and Managing Partner at Cool Climate Collective, an early‑stage climate‑tech investment collective. Former Program Director for Terra.do’s Climate Change for VCs program and co‑founder of Qureos. Active angel investor focused on early-stage ClimateTech and operator support for founders.
enrichment.career_background: Mehrad co‑founded Cool Climate Collective in 2021 and leads sourcing, diligence and syndication for early‑stage climate investments. He previously served as Program Director at Terra.do, co‑founded Qureos, and has held operator roles spanning product, growth and innovation programming with involvement in MENA accelerators and startup studios. He consults and advises climate founders and runs a personal angel portfolio concentrated on climate and deep‑tech startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage ClimateTech (pre‑seed/seed): decarbonization, carbon removal, advanced materials & manufacturing, energy & storage, food & water security, AI/efficiency for climate

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of RareBreed Ventures, a Baltimore-based pre-seed fund. Former software engineer and Department of Defense contractor who has been a two-time founder (one exit). Previously worked on the seed investment team at TEDCO and launched a state-backed minority pre-seed program.
interests: Investing in founders outside major tech hubs
enrichment.career_background: Mac Conwell began as a software engineer and DoD contractor (top-secret clearance), cofounded two startups (one IP exit), then joined Maryland Technology Development Corporation (TEDCO) where he helped create a Minority Business Pre-seed Fund. In September 2020 he founded RareBreed Ventures to write pre-seed checks (concentrated, often first checks) into founders outside traditional tech ecosystems.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed stage (concentrated first checks, typically up to ~$250K); industry-agnostic with emphasis on founders outside Silicon Valley/NY/MA and sectors including consumer/beauty, fintech, healthtech, AI and web3/crypto.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at SV Angel; joined the firm in 2009 after business development work at EQAL. Works closely with portfolio companies across AI, fintech, developer tools, and consumer marketplaces. Named to Forbes Midas and Midas Seed lists (multiple years).
enrichment.career_background: Joined SV Angel in 2009 from EQAL and now serves as a managing partner; active in seed and early-stage investing and involved with SV Angel’s portfolio and platform partnerships. Studied history at UCLA and participates with the UCLA VC Fund; recognized on Forbes Midas lists in recent years.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments across AI/ML, fintech, developer tools & infrastructure, enterprise SaaS, marketplaces, and crypto

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Geek Ventures, an NYC‑based early‑stage fund focused on immigrant founders. Former engineering leader with 20+ years building software and ML teams at Google, Meta and other companies, and an active angel investor in 150+ startups. Founded Geek Ventures in 2021 to support immigrant entrepreneurs in the U.S.
enrichment.career_background: Ihar grew up in Belarus, earned a computer science degree, and moved to the U.S. in 2013. He spent 20+ years as an engineering leader (roles at Google, Meta/Facebook, Lightning AI and others) and became an active angel investor before founding Geek Ventures in 2021. At Geek Ventures he focuses on pre‑seed and seed investments into immigrant‑founded startups across SaaS, hardware and deep tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments (pre‑seed to seed); immigrant founders; sector focus includes SaaS, AI/ML, hardware, robotics and deep tech

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Structure Capital based in San Francisco. Software architect and digital-product leader with early experience at Dell and as co‑founder/EVP of a digital agency. Advises and invests in seed‑stage startups; has served as CTO at Copia and sits on company boards.
enrichment.career_background: Started as a programmer at Dell, built and sold a digital agency, and held senior technology and product roles for clients including Qualcomm, NFL and Pixar. Joined Structure Capital as Director/Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence and is now a Partner; has also served as CTO of Copia and advises early‑stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed‑stage investments in companies that leverage under‑utilized assets (zero‑waste/circular economy), marketplaces and platform businesses; also interested in SaaS, AI/ML, and consumer/enterprise products.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner of MHS Capital based in San Francisco. Early-stage investor focused on seed and Series A opportunities. Serves or has served as a board director/observer at multiple technology companies including Udemy, Opower and Simply Measured.
enrichment.career_background: Graduated from Stanford (BA) and began his investing career at Internet Capital Group before joining VerticalNet as SVP of M&A and Partnerships. He founded MHS Capital in 2006 and has since led or participated in early-stage investments and board roles across consumer, enterprise software, education and fintech companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed / Series A) investments in consumer internet, marketplaces, enterprise/SaaS, EdTech and FinTech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Social Leverage and co‑founder/chairman of StockTwits. Serial angel and seed investor with a long track record of fintech and consumer investments (including early stakes in Robinhood and eToro). Author and former founder of Wallstrip (acquired by CBS).
enrichment.career_background: Howard Lindzon founded Social Leverage in 2009 and has led its seed-stage investing in fintech, enterprise SaaS and consumer companies. He co‑founded StockTwits in 2008 (served as CEO and later chairman), previously ran a hedge fund (Lindzon Capital Partners), and created Wallstrip (acquired by CBS). Over his career he has invested in and advised numerous startups and written about markets and investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage investments in Fintech, Enterprise SaaS, and Consumer internet

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Managing Partner at Climactic, a seed/early-stage climate-tech VC. Former Managing Director at Mayfield and former Chief Strategy Officer at Lyft. Serial founder (Snapfish, Fitmob) with an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BS in Mechanical Engineering & Robotics from Carnegie Mellon.
enrichment.career_background: Raj Kapoor is a serial entrepreneur-turned-investor: co‑founder/CEO of Snapfish (acquired by HP) and Fitmob (acquired by ClassPass); Managing Director at Mayfield Fund (led early investments including Lyft and Rubicon Project); Chief Strategy Officer & head of business for Lyft’s self‑driving division. He co‑founded Climactic to invest in software‑first climate tech and holds an MBA from Harvard and a BS from Carnegie Mellon.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) climate tech; software-first solutions for enterprise and mobility; typical initial checks ~$1.5M–$3M.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and managing partner at Shrug Capital, a consumer‑focused early‑stage venture firm he launched in 2018. Formerly led marketing and content roles at Product Hunt and AngelList. Known for sourcing consumer and cultural‑moment startups and providing growth/marketing support to portfolio teams.
enrichment.career_background: Niv Dror worked in marketing and community roles at Product Hunt and AngelList before founding Shrug Capital in 2018. At Shrug he invests at seed and early stages, often backing consumer‑facing products and helping with go‑to‑market, messaging, and introductions; his portfolio and public profiles list investments across consumer, entertainment, and productivity companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer‑focused early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) startups — consumer internet, direct‑to‑consumer products, entertainment/social platforms, and growth/marketing-driven businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at 1517 Fund, an early‑stage VC that backs dropouts, students and "sci‑fi" deep‑tech founders. Previously a founding team member and program director for the Thiel Fellowship and founder/director of Innovations Academy, a K–8 charter school. Focuses on pre‑seed/seed investments and community building for young and unconventional founders.
interests: Supporting dropouts, students and non‑traditional founders
enrichment.career_background: Danielle cofounded 1517 Fund in 2015 and serves as a General Partner. Before 1517 she was on the founding team of the Thiel Fellowship (led design and operations, ~2010–2015) and earlier founded and directed Innovations Academy, a K–8 project‑based charter school in San Diego. She runs 1517’s sourcing and community efforts focused on young, uncredentialed and deep‑tech founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed in deep tech (hardware, biotech, quantum), developer tools and software; founders without traditional degrees (dropouts/renegade students).

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner and co‑founder of Untapped Capital, an early‑stage VC. Creator of BabyAGI and the PixelBeasts NFT project. Focuses on AI, web3, and a "build‑in‑public" approach to sourcing and product work. Based in Bellevue, Washington, USA.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and General Partner at Untapped Capital (founded 2020). Previously Director of Pipeline and Program Manager (Disney Accelerator) at Techstars, and Venture Partner / SVP at Scrum Ventures. Holds a BA in Economics from Claremont McKenna College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage startups across AI/ML, web3, fintech, climate/cleantech, proptech/smart cities, hardware & robotics, media/gaming, and consumer/B2B SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CEO of Techstars, a global mentorship-driven accelerator and early-stage investor. Longtime entrepreneur (founder of Pinpoint Technologies and earFeeder) and co-author of Do More Faster. Active in building accelerator programs and supporting early-stage founders worldwide.
enrichment.career_background: David G. Cohen co-founded Techstars in 2006 and has led its accelerator and seed investing efforts globally. Before Techstars he founded Pinpoint Technologies (acquired) and earFeeder (acquired), and has served on several boards and advisory panels including Endeavor Colorado and the Silicon Flatirons Center. He co‑authored Do More Faster and returned to the CEO role at Techstars in May 2024.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed/seed-stage, accelerator-led investments and mentorship; sector-agnostic with emphasis on SaaS, fintech, climate/energy and developer/platform businesses

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at SoGal Ventures. Venture capitalist, designer, and educator who invests in early‑stage consumer and health startups, with an emphasis on diverse and women‑led founding teams across the U.S. and Asia. Focuses on design‑driven products and the intersection of machine learning/AI and healthcare.
enrichment.career_background: Previously a strategy & operations consultant at Deloitte; co‑founder of A‑Level Capital (a student‑led venture fund). Holds dual graduate degrees (MBA/MA Design Leadership) from Johns Hopkins University and MICA and a BA from Georgetown. Active speaker and instructor on healthcare innovation and design.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage investments in consumer, health & wellness, and frontier technologies (AI/ML); aims to be first institutional investor for diverse and women‑led founding teams across the U.S. and Asia.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founding partner at Floodgate and an early seed-stage investor known for backing companies that became category leaders. Former founder/operating executive (Motive; roles at Tivoli/Silicon Graphics) and author of Pattern Breakers. Regularly speaks and podcasts about product and startup strategy.
enrichment.career_background: Mike Maples Jr. co-founded Floodgate (originally Maples Investments) and has been a prominent seed investor since the mid-2000s. Prior to investing he was an entrepreneur and operating executive (notably co-founder of Motive and product/marketing roles at Tivoli and Silicon Graphics). He is an author and podcaster and has been named on the Forbes Midas List multiple times.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in consumer and enterprise technology — software, marketplaces, developer tools, AI, fintech, and transportation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Matter Ventures, an accelerator and early-stage investor focused on media and journalism startups. Formerly built the Runway incubator at Innovation Endeavors and taught design thinking at Stanford’s d.school. MBA, Stanford Graduate School of Business; Morehead Scholar, UNC-Chapel Hill.
enrichment.career_background: Corey Ford co‑founded Matter in 2012 and led its accelerator and investment activities, supporting early-stage media ventures. Earlier he ran the Runway pre‑team incubator at Innovation Endeavors, taught design thinking at Stanford’s d.school, and began his career producing documentary films for FRONTLINE (PBS). He is a Kauffman Fellow and holds an MBA from Stanford GSB.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage media and journalism (pre‑seed/seed), content platforms, audio/podcasting, and mission‑driven storytelling startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Cyan Banister is a co‑founder and General Partner at Long Journey Ventures and a longtime angel investor. She was previously a partner at Founders Fund and co‑founded Zivity. Banister is known for early checks into companies such as Uber, SpaceX and DeepMind and writes the newsletter "The Ugly Duckling."
interests: AI / deep learning and deep tech
enrichment.career_background: A self‑taught engineer and operator, Banister held technical and leadership roles at IronPort before becoming an active angel investor. She co‑founded Zivity, later joined Founders Fund as its first female investing partner, and in 2020 became a co‑founder and partner at Long Journey Ventures. Over the last decade she has backed many early‑stage companies across consumer, fintech, AI and hardware categories.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) investments in marketplaces, AI/ML & deep tech, fintech/lending, creator economy and workforce/job‑creation businesses (also interested in AR/spatial and hardware/space).

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at 500 Global who leads the firm’s Southeast Asia activity and global early-stage investing. Former founder of Groupsmore (acquired by Groupon) and SAYS.com (acquired/listed). Has led 180+ seed investments across Southeast Asian tech startups, including early bets in Grab, Carousell and Bukalapak.
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur-turned-investor: co-founded Groupsmore and SAYS.com before joining 500 (originally 500 Startups) as a venture partner and later becoming Managing Partner. He oversees 500’s Southeast Asia activities and has personally led well over a hundred seed investments in regional tech companies, supporting founders on product, go-to-market and scaling.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed) investments across Southeast Asia and other emerging markets; marketplaces, consumer internet, fintech, SaaS and ecosystem/impact-oriented startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Cake Ventures, a seed/pre-seed VC focused on demographic change. Former Venture Partner at 500 Startups and venture scout at Lightspeed; Kauffman Fellow (KF26) with a BA in Political Science from the University of Miami. Based in San Francisco.
interests: Women-led consumer products and women's health
enrichment.career_background: Monique Woodard founded Cake Ventures to back companies shaped by major demographic shifts (aging, women’s spending power, majority-minority). Prior to Cake she was a Venture Partner at 500 Startups, a Venture Scout at Lightspeed, advised SoftBank’s Emerge program, co‑founded/led Black Founders, and has 15+ years as an operator, founder and ecosystem builder. She is a Kauffman Fellow and holds a BA from the University of Miami.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed investments in consumer and B2B startups addressing demographic change (aging & longevity, women's spending/health, majority-minority markets)

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment Associate at Visible Hands (VC) who supports the firm’s accelerator-backed portfolio; three-time founder (most recently TheClub) and MBA graduate from The College of New Jersey. Focuses on backing underrepresented founders and early-stage, tech-enabled startups.
enrichment.career_background: Darrel Frater has served as an Investment Associate at Visible Hands where he helps manage the firm’s accelerator portfolio. Prior roles and activities documented in public profiles include Venture Fellow at Score 3 Ventures and founder/CEO of TheClub; he holds an MBA from The College of New Jersey and has acted as a mentor/advisor in multiple founder programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage, accelerator-led investments in tech and tech-enabled startups; diversity-focused (women and founders of color); industry-agnostic (SaaS, creator tools, fintech, health, consumer, enterprise).

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner and Co‑Founder at Reach Capital, focused on early‑stage companies that expand access to learning. Previously co‑founded the NewSchools Seed Fund and worked in finance (Merrill Lynch, Morgan Stanley). Born in Queens, New York and raised in Connecticut.
enrichment.career_background: Wayee co‑founded Reach Capital (spinout from NewSchools) and invests in seed to Series B education and learning‑adjacent startups. Earlier she co‑founded the NewSchools Seed Fund, led edtech field‑building work at NewSchools Venture Fund, and started her career in finance (Morgan Stanley, Merrill Lynch). She serves on arts and university boards and supports Bay Area education organizations.
enrichment.hometown: Born in Queens, New York; raised in Connecticut
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage education technology (K–12 and higher education), future of work / workforce learning, health & learner wellbeing, collegiate sports/NIL

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at Right Side Capital Management; co-founder and member of the RSCM executive team. 25+ years in financial services, formerly Head of Alternative Investments at Legend Merchant Group and founder/president of Hotovec, Pomeranz & Co. Holds a BA from the University of Colorado.
enrichment.career_background: Managing Director and co-founder of Right Side Capital Management (RSCM), focused on systematic, high-volume pre-seed investing since 2012. Prior roles include Head of Alternative Investments at Legend Merchant Group and President & Founder of Hotovec, Pomeranz & Co.; early career work in private client wealth management. Education: BA, University of Colorado.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage, capital-efficient technology startups (primarily US & Canada); typical checks $100K–$500K; broad tech sectors with emphasis on revenue-generating, engineering-first teams.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co-founder of Atman Capital. Former early employee at SendGrid and a venture associate at FundersClub; co-founded ONEVC. Holds an MS from University of Colorado Boulder and has co-founded and exited startups in Brazil. Grew up in São Paulo, Brazil.
enrichment.career_background: Pedro Sorrentino is a venture investor and operator who founded Atman after co-founding ONEVC. He was an early SendGrid employee (employee #11), worked at FundersClub as a venture associate, and previously founded startups in Brazil (including Recomind, later acquired by Buscapé). He serves on boards (notably Kovi and Rocket.Chat) and focuses on connecting U.S. and LatAm founders with capital and growth resources.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed stage; US and Latin America; B2B/SaaS, commerce, consumer, and fintech

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and partner at Davidovs Venture Collective (DVC). Runs a rolling early‑stage fund that writes $50–200k checks into US pre‑seed and seed startups and leverages a community of founders, engineers and angels. Repeat founder with operating and VC experience (e.g., Cherry Labs) and advisor roles at companies including Dating Group and inDriver.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Davidovs Venture Collective (DVC) in 2021 to run a community‑backed rolling fund. Previously co‑founded Cherry Labs and held investment and operating roles at firms including iTech/Gagarin; serves as advisor or board member for multiple startups. Holds an MSc in International Business in Emerging Markets (University of Edinburgh).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed / seed) US tech startups — AI/ML, robotics/CV, enterprise software (future of work), fintech, edtech, creator economy; community-backed rolling fund model.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator with experience in urban tech and education ventures. Former Senior Associate at Urban Innovation Fund and Director at Tumml; has held leadership roles at High Resolves and is founder of Human Leadership Lab. Background includes corporate law and public policy (Harvard Kennedy School).
enrichment.career_background: May Samali trained as a corporate lawyer in Sydney and earned an MPP from Harvard. She served as Director at Tumml, was an early member of the Urban Innovation Fund team (Senior Associate), and later held operator roles at High Resolves (COO/CEO, Ventures). She is the founder of Human Leadership Lab and has served as a venture partner/advisor to network VC firms.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed investments in urban-focused sectors: transportation, energy & sustainability, proptech, govtech, edtech, fintech, public safety

enrichment.personal_bio: David Aronoff is Chairman and Managing Partner at MCJ and was a General Partner at Flybridge Capital Partners (joined 2005). He focuses on infrastructure, semiconductors, SaaS, IoT and cybersecurity and has served on multiple company boards. He holds a BS (University of Vermont), an MS (USC) and an MBA (Harvard Business School).
enrichment.career_background: Nearly three decades in technology investing and operations: early technical roles at Bell Labs and Chipcom; co‑founder/COO of HappyPuppy/Attitude Network; nearly a decade at Greylock Partners in early‑stage investing; General Partner at Flybridge Capital Partners (joined 2005); now Chairman & Managing Partner at MCJ, and board member/advisor to multiple technology companies and institutions.
enrichment.investment_focus: Semiconductors, infrastructure & cloud, developer platforms, SaaS, IoT and cybersecurity (now also climate tech via MCJ)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of the Not Boring newsletter and Not Boring Capital. Writes long-form analysis on technology and strategy and uses that audience to source and support early-stage investments. Based in Brooklyn, New York.
enrichment.career_background: Graduated from Duke University. Began in investment banking (Bank of America / Merrill Lynch), worked at Breather (General Manager NYC, later VP of Experience), then launched the Not Boring newsletter and expanded into investing via the Not Boring Syndicate and Not Boring Capital, focusing on narrative-driven, hard-technology and web3 startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series B; deep tech (bio, energy, aerospace, materials), web3/crypto, fintech, developer/AI infrastructure and select consumer & marketplace companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Subtraction Capital who focuses on early-stage enterprise/B2B software. Former aerodynamics engineer at Boeing and later product/marketing executive at companies including NextCard, Coupons.com, Practice Fusion and Atlassian. Mentors product, engineering and marketing teams and invests in companies he would want to work for.
enrichment.career_background: Paul trained as an aerospace engineer (BS, Iowa State) and worked as an aerodynamics engineer at Boeing before moving into product and marketing leadership roles (NextCard, Coupons.com, Practice Fusion, Atlassian). He co-founded/served as partner at Subtraction Capital (founded 2013), investing in early-stage enterprise software and advising portfolio companies; holds an MS in Manufacturing Systems Engineering from Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) enterprise/B2B software with emphasis on healthtech, fintech, data/analytics/AI, marketing & sales modernization; occasional deep-tech (aerospace/robotics).

enrichment.personal_bio: CEO and Partner at BCF Ventures, a Montreal‑based corporate venture fund. Multi‑sector early‑stage investor focusing on B2B cloud/SaaS and AI-enabled enterprise software. Former Founder Institute director and long‑time startup mentor and operator.
enrichment.career_background: Sergio A. Escobar leads BCF Ventures (launched 2018) and is also affiliated with Lalotte Ventures. He has 15+ years as a tech entrepreneur and operator across aerospace, eCommerce, manufacturing, AgTech and fintech, and has served as Director of Founder Institute Montreal and mentor/advisor for Techstars, Creative Destruction Lab and other accelerator programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed/Seed+ and early‑stage investments in B2B cloud & SaaS enterprise software leveraging AI, big data/analytics and security; sector emphasis on healthcare, logistics & supply chain, regulatory/legal tech and enterprise software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at SOSV who founded SOSV’s life‑sciences practice in Europe (IndieBio/RebelBio). Co‑founder of CoderDojo and WeForest, former early investor/co‑founder at XING, and a public speaker on tech and sustainability. Serves in diplomatic and nonprofit roles, including as a special diplomatic envoy for St Kitts and Nevis and Chair of the SENS Research Foundation.
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur, investor and philanthropist. Early career included COO at Davnet and early involvement with XING; later co‑founded CoderDojo and WeForest. At SOSV since 2011, he founded the firm’s European life‑sciences accelerator (RebelBio/IndieBio EU) and leads sourcing for SOSV’s Ireland fund; he also holds board/advisory roles (e.g., SENS Research Foundation).
enrichment.investment_focus: Life sciences / synthetic biology, healthtech & longevity, climate/planetary health, deep tech (hardware/quantum software), early‑stage seed / pre‑seed investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CEO of Allocate; former Senior Managing Director who led venture/private‑fund coverage at First Republic Bank and earlier roles at Silicon Valley Bank. Kauffman Fellow, host of the Venture Unlocked podcast, and active angel investor. Holds a B.S. in Finance (San José State University) and an MBA (Santa Clara University).
enrichment.career_background: Spent ~22 years in venture banking at Silicon Valley Bank and First Republic, advising hundreds of VC/PE firms and completing billions in structured debt transactions; later co‑founded Allocate to provide infrastructure and access for private fund investing. Active angel investor and writer/podcaster on venture topics; completed Kauffman Fellows program.
enrichment.investment_focus: Venture capital (early‑stage & emerging managers), private funds and GP services; venture banking and venture debt

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at The Venture Collective (TVC) based in New York. Focuses on pre-seed/seed investing across healthtech, consumer (food & beverage), education, AI and Web3. Former Head of Human Capital / Operating Partner at Primary Venture Partners; founding member of Kindred and Chief; mentor at Techstars. Holds a BBA from University of Minnesota Duluth and an MBA from The College of Saint Rose.
enrichment.career_background: Spent ~10 years as an operator in early-stage startups before moving into venture in 2015. Served as Operating Partner / Partner, Human Capital at Primary Venture Partners (2015–2020). Joined and helped build The Venture Collective as a General/Partner (2020–present). Also serves as a fund advisor and mentor (e.g., W Fund, ADP Ventures, PeopleTech Partners, Techstars) and is a founding member of Kindred and Chief.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and Seed stage; sectors include healthtech/health IT, consumer (food & beverage), education, AI, Web3/crypto, and synthetic biology/biotech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner in Bessemer’s New York office who invests in early‑stage financial services, consumer, and education companies in the U.S. and Europe. Former early employee at Foursquare and ex‑investment banker. Holds an MBA from Wharton and an MA from the Lauder Institute (UPenn). Born and raised in New York City.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Bessemer in 2013 and is a partner based in New York focusing on early‑stage fintech and consumer investments. Before venture he spent multiple years at Foursquare (director of mobile & international business development) and six years in investment banking and equity capital markets. Education: MBA (Wharton), MA (Lauder Institute, UPenn), BA (History, Northwestern University).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in fintech / financial services, consumer and education; emphasis on fintech infrastructure, embedded finance, developer platforms, vertical software and cross‑border (Europe) opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Managing Director at Adverb Ventures. Former Chief Product Officer at Slack and Director of Product at Twitter; co‑founder of the #ANGELS angel collective and founder of Nearby. Serves on the boards of Zillow Group and Eventbrite; holds an MBA from UC Berkeley and a BBA from University of Texas at Austin.
enrichment.career_background: April Underwood is a product and platform leader turned investor. She led product and platform at Slack (first CPO) after five years as Director of Product at Twitter, held earlier roles at Google, Climate Corporation, Travelocity and Intel, co‑founded the #ANGELS angel collective, founded Nearby, and in 2023 co‑founded Adverb Ventures where she invests in early-stage startups. She also serves on the boards of Zillow Group and Eventbrite.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed through Series A); invests across product-led tech startups including Future of Work, developer tools, consumer health, marketplaces and platform businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Samuel Harrison is a co‑founder of Blockchain.com Ventures and an early‑stage crypto investor. He has led blockchain investments at Blockchain.com Ventures and later co‑founded Faction (Lightspeed Faction) where he serves as a managing partner. Previously he led early‑stage investments at Naspers/Prosus and began his career in finance at Morgan Stanley.
enrichment.career_background: Started in finance (Morgan Stanley), joined Naspers/Prosus where he led early‑stage investments (2014–2018), co‑founded Blockchain.com Ventures in 2018 and served as a managing/venture partner there, and later co‑founded/became Managing Partner at Faction / Lightspeed Faction while remaining affiliated with Blockchain.com Ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage blockchain & crypto (Seed–Series A); token and equity investments across DeFi, infrastructure, developer tooling, and NFTs/gaming.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Sunset Ventures, an early‑stage LA & SF fund. Former investor at Samsung Next and equity research analyst at Morgan Stanley. Founder of Emerging LA and active in gaming, Web3, AI, and fintech investing.
enrichment.career_background: Brandon Hoffman is Co‑Founder & General Partner at Sunset Ventures (pre‑seed/seed). Previously he was a venture investor and Head of Research at Samsung Next and an Internet equity research analyst at Morgan Stanley. He founded the Emerging LA community and co‑founded Diverse Angels. Education includes Wharton (MBA), Harvard Kennedy School (MPA), and California State University, Fullerton (BA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in gaming, AI, Web3/blockchain, fintech/payments, and consumer/mediatech startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Guillaume "G" Cabane is a growth advisor, angel investor, and co‑founder/general partner at HyperGrowth Partners. He previously served as VP of Growth at Segment, Drift, and Gorgias and advises numerous B2B SaaS and data startups. He also operates as a scout/angel affiliated with Sequoia Capital.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced growth operator and advisor: early career included ~6 years at Apple; later held VP Growth roles at Segment, Drift, and Gorgias; co‑founded HyperGrowth Partners to advise and invest in high‑growth B2B startups; active angel investor and Sequoia scout focusing on seed/early rounds and GTM scaling.
enrichment.investment_focus: B2B SaaS; growth & go-to-market; seed and early-stage investments; data/AI; fintech

enrichment.personal_bio: John Richards is the founder and managing partner of Startup Ignition Ventures and an active angel investor and mentor based in Provo, Utah. He co-founded BoomStartup, taught entrepreneurship at Brigham Young University, and previously held senior roles related to InfoSpace and Google Fiber in Utah.
enrichment.career_background: John Richards built an early career in publishing and online directories that led to executive roles during the InfoSpace era, later serving as an associate professor of entrepreneurship at BYU and managing partner of UtahAngels. He co‑founded BoomStartup, worked on Google Fiber operations in Provo, and launched Startup Ignition (and Startup Ignition Ventures) to run entrepreneur bootcamps and make pre‑seed investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments in SaaS, B2B and vertical-industry software, with interest in consumer and mobile software and early-stage enterprise tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co‑founder at Unovis Asset Management, leading the firm’s activities in North America and Israel. Investor focused on alternative proteins and food‑system innovation with prior experience founding a CPG brand and working across logistics, culinary operations and creative services. Holds a BA from Universidad Iberoamericana and an MBA from Babson College.
enrichment.career_background: 25+ years across the food value chain: corporate banking and logistics roles; founded Bodhi Natural Snacks (CPG); ran a restaurant and a creative agency; later served as a venture partner at New Crop Capital before co‑founding and serving as Managing Partner at Unovis Asset Management. Serves on/has served as director or board advisor for several portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in alternative proteins (plant‑based, fermentation, cultivated), foodtech and consumer food & beverage (seed to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner and GM / co‑founder of Angel Squad at Hustle Fund. Former operator (early roles at Lyft, Zoox, BlackBird) who now builds angel syndicates and runs investor education programs. Focuses on pre‑seed and seed investing, particularly marketplaces and consumer tech.
enrichment.career_background: Brian Nichols is co‑founder and GM of Hustle Fund's Angel Squad (started 2020). He previously co‑founded RewardTag and held early/operator roles at Lyft (market operations), Zoox, and BlackBird. He founded and scaled the Lyft syndicate (UpLyft) and ran the On Deck Angels program before joining Hustle Fund to build Angel Squad and lead syndicate/SPV investments alongside the fund.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage startups; marketplaces and consumer tech; building/teaching angel syndicates and SPV investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Pantera Capital, focused on the firm’s venture and token investments in blockchain and digital assets. Joined Pantera in 2014 and has led or supported 100+ crypto-related investments and firm research/public commentary. Holds a BA from the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Paul Veradittakit is a Managing Partner at Pantera Capital (since 2014), where he focuses on venture and token investments across the crypto ecosystem. Prior to Pantera he was an associate at Strive Capital and earlier worked in consulting and research roles (Hatch Consulting, LECG). He serves or has served as a board member/advisor to multiple crypto companies and mentors several accelerator programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early to growth-stage venture and token investments in blockchain, cryptocurrencies, DeFi, crypto infrastructure, and tokenized real-world assets

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder of Branch (mobile deep-linking and attribution) and an investment partner at XFactor Ventures. Focuses on B2B and mobile-first startups and supports female founders. Born and raised in Romania; educated at Cornell (BS) and Stanford (MS, MBA).
enrichment.career_background: Madalina (Mada) Seghete co‑founded Branch (deep linking and mobile attribution) and previously co‑founded Kindred Prints. She led community and developer marketing at Branch, co‑founded the Mobile Growth community, and joined XFactor Ventures as an investment partner (2019). She holds a BS in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Cornell and an MS and MBA from Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments (typically $100k–$150k) in companies with at least one female founder; sector focus includes B2B software, mobile-first products, games and consumer startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Technology entrepreneur and angel investor. Founder of SpeakerText (acquired), co‑founder of Dishcraft Robotics, and founder of OASIS / TalkTastic. Runs a personal investment vehicle, Guerrilla Capital, and writes the newsletter "Accelerate or Die."
enrichment.career_background: Former NYC paramedic and journalist (The New York Times/Newsweek). Founded SpeakerText (acquired), co‑founded Dishcraft Robotics, and later founded OASIS / TalkTastic. Has worked in early‑stage BD roles and acts as an angel investor/advisor through Guerrilla Capital, backing companies across AI, robotics, biotech and climate sectors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed-stage angel investments in AI, robotics, climate/cleantech, biotech/healthtech, consumer marketplaces/social commerce, and Web3/crypto.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Flybridge Capital Partners and co‑founder of XFactor Ventures. Former founder/CEO of Fashion Project and Dough; invests in consumer, marketplaces and commerce‑driven businesses. Based in Boston, MA.
enrichment.career_background: Anna Palmer is a two‑time founder turned investor. She co‑founded XFactor Ventures (a seed fund backing women founders) and served as co‑founder/CEO of Fashion Project and Dough. She joined Flybridge as General Partner in 2020, serves on several startup boards (e.g., Intramotev, MelodyArc, Returnalyze), and holds a B.A. from Eureka College and a J.D. from Harvard Law School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) consumer, commerce 3.0, marketplaces, community‑driven businesses; supports female and gender‑diverse founding teams.

enrichment.personal_bio: Reid Hoffman is an entrepreneur, investor, author, and podcaster. He co-founded LinkedIn, served as an early executive at PayPal, and joined Greylock as a partner in 2009. He co-founded AI companies including Inflection AI and Manas AI and has served on multiple public and private boards.
enrichment.career_background: Hoffman was an early PayPal executive and co‑founded LinkedIn in 2003. After years as a prolific angel investor, he joined Greylock in 2009 focusing on early‑stage companies with network effects. He has co‑founded AI startups (Inflection AI, Manas AI), authored several business/AI books, hosts the Masters of Scale podcast, and serves on boards including Microsoft and Aurora.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer and enterprise software; network‑effect businesses; AI and transportation/automation

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Khosla Ventures who invests in enterprise and infrastructure companies that leverage ML/AI, robotics and hardware acceleration. Background spans research science and early-stage engineering with advanced degrees in electrical/computer engineering and an MBA from Harvard. Has led or co-led KV investments in multiple AI, robotics and hardware startups.
enrichment.career_background: Kanu (Kanupriya) Gulati joined Khosla Ventures in a full-time investing role in 2017 after operating and research roles at startups and technology companies. She has over a decade of engineering and research experience (including Intel and Cadence), was an early engineer at GPU-accelerated analytics startups, worked briefly at Zetta Venture Partners, and holds a Ph.D. and M.S. in electrical/computer engineering (Texas A&M) plus an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth investments in enterprise applications and infrastructure that leverage ML/deep learning/NLP/LLMs, robotics & autonomous systems, and hardware acceleration.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Goat Capital, an early‑stage fund and incubator he started with Justin Kan. Serial founder and angel investor who has co‑founded companies including Fractal, Rye and Stash and advised startups such as Flipboard and Expa. Holds a B.A. in Economics from Columbia University.
enrichment.career_background: Robin Chan is a serial entrepreneur‑investor based in the U.S. He co‑founded Goat Capital (2020) with Justin Kan and has founded or co‑founded startups including XPD Media, Operator, Fractal, Rye and Stash. Chan has served as an advisor to companies such as Flipboard, Expa and Sleeper and has a background in business development and media at firms including Verizon; he holds a B.A. in Economics from Columbia University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A) investments in gaming/digital entertainment, digital health, e‑commerce/marketplaces, climate tech and fintech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Scale AI and founder/general partner at Backend Capital; currently founder & CEO of Passes. Early‑stage angel and operator with a background in product design and engineering. Known for investing in engineering‑led startups and the creator economy.
enrichment.career_background: Studied computer science / HCI at Carnegie Mellon (left for a Thiel Fellowship). Early roles included internships at Facebook and product design at Quora and Snapchat. Co‑founded Scale AI in 2016 and left in 2018. Founded Backend Capital (2019) to invest in early‑stage technical founders and launched Passes (2022), a creator monetization platform.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in engineering‑led startups (seed/pre‑seed); AI/ML and developer tools; creator‑economy and consumer internet platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at Brickyard, an early-stage venture firm and founder residency based in Chattanooga, TN.
