Previously co‑founded Bellhops (operations/COO role) and consumer app The House. Invests in and supports pre-seed/seed technology startups through Brickyard’s on-site founder outpost.
enrichment.career_background: Matt Patterson is a co‑founder and General Partner of Brickyard (founded 2021), a Chattanooga‑based early‑stage investment firm and founder outpost. Before Brickyard he co‑founded Bellhops (served as an early operator/COO) and later launched The House. He is based in Chattanooga and works with founders who relocate to Brickyard to accelerate toward product‑market fit.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage technology companies (Brickyard writes ~ $300–500K checks); sector‑agnostic focus including SaaS, marketplaces, consumer/e‑commerce, hardware and logistics.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Bloom Equity Partners (founded 2020). Former co‑founder & CEO of SaplingHR (acquired by Kallidus). Serves on boards of Soutron Global, RightCrowd and Viostream and invests via MacVentures Group.
enrichment.career_background: Bart founded Bloom Equity Partners to acquire and grow lower‑middle‑market software and tech‑enabled services businesses. Prior to Bloom he co‑founded SaplingHR (acquired by Kallidus), held operating roles including at General Assembly, and has been an active angel/early investor and board member across enterprise software companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Majority investments and growth‑oriented buyouts in B2B software, enterprise/SaaS and tech‑enabled business services (lower‑middle‑market).

enrichment.personal_bio: Former business journalist and internet pioneer who founded Mediabistro (sold 2007). Founding partner and managing partner at Supernode Ventures, investing in pre-seed and seed-stage tech startups. Known for early angel investments (e.g., Appboy/Braze) and for running networking/events for founders, investors and media.
enrichment.career_background: Laurel Touby founded mediabistro.com in the late 1990s and led the company through growth and its 2007 sale. After building an angel portfolio she launched Flatiron Investors (now Supernode Ventures) and serves as founding/managing partner, focusing on pre-seed/seed investments and leveraging a large media and investor network to support portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / seed-stage, sector-agnostic early-stage tech with emphasis on B2B/SaaS, FinTech, HealthTech and media-related companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Archetype, an early‑stage venture firm focused on crypto and Web3. Active in seed‑stage crypto investing since 2015 with early involvement in projects including Chainalysis, Mina, NEAR and Balancer. Previously led blockchain investments at Accomplice and co‑launched ConsenSys’ venture arm.
enrichment.career_background: Ash began investing in blockchain and crypto in 2015 at Converge VC, later co‑launching ConsenSys’ venture arm and serving as a partner leading blockchain investments at Accomplice before founding Archetype in 2021. He focuses on sourcing and leading seed and early rounds for protocol and crypto infrastructure teams and has written and spoken on crypto investing topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage investments in crypto, blockchain protocols, Web3 infrastructure, and DeFi

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Founding Partner Emeritus of Foundry Group; co‑author of Venture Deals and co‑founder of SRS Acquiom. Former attorney and in‑house VC general counsel; long‑time adjunct professor at the University of Colorado. Known for early‑stage technology investing and work on standard VC documents.
enrichment.career_background: Started as a software consultant and then earned a J.D.; practiced corporate law at Cooley and served as Managing Director & General Counsel at Mobius Venture Capital. Co‑founded SRS Acquiom and Foundry Group, where he led early‑stage investments; co‑authored Venture Deals and has served as an adjunct professor and senior fellow. Listed as Partner Emeritus/retired from day‑to‑day partner duties at Foundry in 2020.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology (seed to Series B): enterprise SaaS, developer tools, IoT/robotics, consumer platforms and fund‑of‑funds/GP investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at Lobby Capital with ~25 years working with technology entrepreneurs. Previously a partner at August Capital for 20 years. Invests across enterprise software, infrastructure, SaaS, fintech/payments and consumer marketplaces. Lecturer in entrepreneurship and venture capital at Stanford GSB and Harvard Law School.
enrichment.career_background: David Hornik is a founding partner of Lobby Capital. Prior to Lobby he spent two decades as a partner at August Capital and earlier practiced law at firms including Cravath and Perkins Coie. He founded The Lobby conferences and VentureBlog/VentureCast, teaches at Stanford and Harvard Law, and serves on multiple nonprofit and museum boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/Series A) investments in enterprise software, SaaS and infrastructure; fintech/payments; marketplaces and consumer services.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Gradient Ventures, Google’s AI-focused seed fund. Former founder and CEO of Radius, a B2B customer data platform. Early investor in companies including Lyft, Udemy and Palantir; focuses on AI- and data-driven startups.
enrichment.career_background: Software engineer early at Facebook; co‑founded and served as CEO of Radius (grew to 100+ employees and raised >$100M). Joined Gradient Ventures as a general/ managing partner, leading seed and early-stage investments in AI- and data-rich companies. Briefly studied Philosophy & Computer Science at UC Berkeley before leaving to work on startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage (pre-seed, seed, Series A) investments in AI/ML and data-rich startups — primarily B2B SaaS, developer tools and fintech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Indian‑born American entrepreneur and angel investor. Co‑founder and former CEO of AngelList and founder of The Hit Forge (an early‑stage fund launched circa 2007). Known for early-stage investments in companies such as Uber, Twitter (X), and Postmates and for public commentary on startups, crypto, wealth, and wellbeing.
interests: Entrepreneurship, wealth creation, and personal development
enrichment.career_background: Naval Ravikant is an entrepreneur and investor who co‑founded Epinions and AngelList, launched the early‑stage fund The Hit Forge (circa 2007), and has founded/co‑founded other ventures including MetaStable (crypto hedge fund) and Spearhead. He is widely active as an angel and seed investor and publishes podcasts and writing on business and personal philosophy.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A) technology startups — consumer marketplaces, developer tools/platforms, and crypto/blockchain projects.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and first CTO of LivingSocial and a former partner at Lightspeed Venture Partners. Active angel investor since 2013 through Batalion Capital, backing early‑stage consumer and technology startups. Writes and publishes at aaronbatalion.com.
enrichment.career_background: Aaron co‑founded HungryMachine (later LivingSocial) and served as its CTO through its rapid growth. He joined Lightspeed as a partner in 2015, led consumer‑tech investments, and stepped away from institutional venture around 2018 to focus on building and angel investing via Batalion Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage investments in consumer internet, marketplaces, e‑commerce/social commerce, developer tools/SaaS, web3/crypto, and hardware/autonomous systems.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder of The General Partnership and former Partner at First Round Capital. Background spans product, marketing and creative leadership (including Creative Director at AND1). Focuses on founder interviewing, coaching and hands-on "sweat equity" partnerships with early-stage companies.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded The General Partnership (joined/formed 2021). Spent over a decade at First Round Capital (Principal/Partner, 2008–2021). Earlier career includes Creative Director at AND1 and founding responDESIGN; holds an MBA from The Wharton School and a BA from Haverford College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Formation (pre‑seed/seed) and breakout stage companies; sectors include FinTech, developer tools/infrastructure, e‑commerce, Web3/crypto, SaaS and data/platform companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Operating/Investment partner at Andreessen Horowitz who leads Early Stage Venture (ESV) programs and founder‑enablement products. Trains the firm’s deal & research team and publishes on AI, product, and company‑building. Former product and UX executive at Opsware, HP Software, Loudcloud; BS in Symbolic Systems from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Operating Partner at Andreessen Horowitz (Early Stage Venture Programs), where he builds enablement products (Founder Library, LLM chatbot) and organizes founder programs. Prior roles include VP of Products & UI Design at Opsware/HP Software, Sr. Director at Loudcloud, and product roles at Netscape and Oracle. Stanford BS in Symbolic Systems.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (Seed/Series A) technology startups — enterprise software, AI/ML, developer tools and marketplaces; founder enablement and operations

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Lendtable and founder / Solo GP of ShareBear Capital. Thiel Fellow and Forbes 30 Under 30 alumnus with a background in finance and product (roles at JPMorgan, Goldman Sachs and Dropbox). Based in San Francisco.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in special situations/private-equity groups at J.P. Morgan and Goldman Sachs, served as a machine‑learning product manager at Dropbox, and has founded multiple startups (including Lendtable). Currently invests through ShareBear Capital as a solo GP; member of the Thiel Fellowship and recognized on Forbes 30 Under 30.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) startups; fintech / personal finance; crypto / web3; marketplaces & e-commerce; AI / ML

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director / CEO of Alchemist Accelerator and co‑founder of the program. Fenwick & West Lecturer of Entrepreneurship at Stanford University. Former member of the DFJ investment team and earlier roles in product management and consulting. Holds BS and MS (Stanford) and an MBA (Harvard Business School).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and long‑time leader of Alchemist Accelerator (enterprise‑focused seed accelerator). Previously on the DFJ investment team where he led early institutional investments (including Justin.TV/Twitch, PubMatic, Vizu and others). Earlier worked in product management at enterprise startups and as a consultant at McKinsey & Company. Educated at Stanford (BS, MS) and Harvard Business School (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage enterprise (B2B/B2B2C) startups—technical founding teams; enterprise software and deep‑tech (AI, quantum, cleantech) focused on customer traction and revenue generation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Erica Brescia is a Managing Director at Redpoint Ventures focused on early-stage infrastructure, developer tools, and security investments. She previously co-founded Bitnami and served as Chief Operating Officer of GitHub, and serves on the board of the Linux Foundation.
enrichment.career_background: Erica co-founded Bitnami (YC W13), which was acquired by VMware, and later served as COO of GitHub where she helped scale the company. She has been a board member of the Linux Foundation since 2016 and joined Redpoint as a Managing Director leading seed and Series A investments in infrastructure, developer tools, DevOps, security and AI.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed, Series A) investments in infrastructure, developer tools/DevOps, open source, security, and AI.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner and co-founder at Flybridge Capital Partners and Senior Lecturer at Harvard Business School. Focuses on AI, vertical SaaS and fintech startups and runs The Graduate Syndicate micro-seed fund. Author of books on venture capital and startup careers; active in diversity and education non-profits.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Flybridge (2003) and earlier co‑founded Upromise (President & COO, acquired by Sallie Mae). Served in senior roles at Open Market (IPO 1996) and began his career at The Boston Consulting Group. Teaches entrepreneurship at Harvard Business School and founded The Graduate Syndicate micro‑seed fund.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage, AI-native companies (vertical AI / AI-native vertical SaaS); fintech; consumer/internet commerce; data infrastructure and developer platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Capital Factory, an Austin-based accelerator and early-stage investor. Serial entrepreneur who founded OtherInbox and earlier email startups (e.g., SKYLIST, UnsubCentral). Active angel investor, mentor and Entrepreneur in Residence at the University of Texas. Based in Austin, Texas.
enrichment.career_background: Joshua Baer founded Capital Factory and serves as its CEO; he previously founded and led several email-related companies (SKYLIST, UnsubCentral, OtherInbox) and has been an active angel investor and mentor. He teaches startup courses at the University of Texas, has served in advisory roles to multiple startups, and has been recognized as a Henry Crown Fellow and Eisenhower Fellow.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and seed investments (primarily Texas-based startups), developer/enterprise SaaS, email & marketing technology, dual-use commercial/government tech

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder and Co‑Managing Partner of DCVC, a deep‑tech venture firm. Tech entrepreneur and investor with decades of experience; founded Da Vinci Systems and has served in multiple VC roles. Holds a degree in Physics from Yale and is named on 50+ patents.
enrichment.career_background: Matt Ocko co‑founded DCVC (Data Collective) and is co‑managing partner. Previously founded Da Vinci Systems (VP of R&D) and has held investing/partner roles at firms including VantagePoint, SOFTBANK Technology Ventures/Mobius, Sevin Rosen and Archimedes Capital. He has led investments across deep‑tech sectors and is listed on 50+ patents; holds a Physics degree from Yale University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Deep tech (computational/synthetic biology, space/geospatial, robotics & applied AI, quantum, large‑scale compute); seed through growth stages; companies with national‑security and industrial resilience applications.

enrichment.personal_bio: Repeat founder and angel investor; currently CEO & co‑founder of Groupthink. She previously co‑founded and led Mattermark, held early marketing/product roles at Twilio and GitLab, and has served as an investing partner/limited partner at XFactor Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Danielle Morrill is a repeat entrepreneur and operator — co‑founder and CEO of Groupthink, co‑founder and CEO of Mattermark, and co‑founder of Referly. Her prior roles include marketing and product leadership at Twilio and GitLab, and she has acted as an investing partner/limited partner at XFactor Ventures while making personal angel investments and providing executive coaching.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed & seed; female‑founded startups. Sector focus includes B2B SaaS, developer tools, AI/ML, data infrastructure/analytics, and deeptech (including aerospace).

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur, educator and investor focused on building Puerto Rico’s startup ecosystem. Former Director of Operations at Parallel18 and currently leads investment efforts for P18Ventures. Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering (UC Davis) with founder experience in biotech and education startups.
interests: Early-stage venture investing in Puerto Rico & LatAm
enrichment.career_background: Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering from UC Davis; founder of Inserogen (biotech spin-off) and BetaBox Labs (education/innovation experiences). Served as Parallel18’s founding Chief Operations Officer / Director of Operations, built the accelerator curriculum and mentor network, and now leads P18Ventures and investment initiatives on behalf of Parallel18 and the Puerto Rico Science, Technology & Research Trust. Also has held adjunct teaching roles and works as a consultant and angel investor.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed �to Series A) startups across software, fintech, healthtech/biotech, edtech and marketplaces; primary geography Puerto Rico and Latin America, with international cohorts.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and angel investor. Co‑founder and Chairman of Niu Ventures and Managing Partner of Bragiel Brothers; has launched multiple regional and vertical funds and invested in early rounds of numerous technology companies. Based in San Francisco and active with early‑stage founders in LATAM and other emerging markets.
enrichment.career_background: Paul Bragiel is a long‑time startup founder and investor who founded companies (Paragon 5, Meetro, Lefora) and launched seed funds and accelerators (i/o Ventures) before creating regional and vertical funds including Savannah Fund, Golden Gate Ventures, GameFounders, Sisu Game Ventures, Presence Capital, SMOK Ventures and Niu Ventures. He is Managing Partner at Bragiel Brothers and serves as co‑founder/chairman of Niu Ventures.
enrichment.hometown: Mt. Prospect and South Barrington, Illinois, USA
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and early‑stage tech startups (primarily Brazil/LATAM; also Korea & Japan) — software, SaaS, developer platforms, fintech, marketplaces, logistics.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Divergent Capital (based in New York). Former general partner at K50 Ventures and Kairos and an active angel investor since 2014. Background as a founder/operator and head of growth with a BA from NYU Stern.
enrichment.career_background: Katie Shea co‑founded Divergent Capital in 2021 and leads early‑stage investments focused on technical and consumer founders. Prior roles include General Partner at K50 Ventures and Kairos, founder of a consumer manufacturing company (FUNK‑tional Enterprises), and growth/marketing leadership at startups such as Ordergroove and Homejoy. She has been an active angel investor since 2014.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed and early stage investments in technical and scientific founders and consumer startups — areas include AI/ML, advanced manufacturing, robotics, materials, biotech/healthtech, and consumer DTC/brands.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at 43, an earliest‑stage fund that invests in pre‑product startups. Early‑stage investor and 2x founder with a background in growth marketing and product/market fit. Based in San Francisco; UC Berkeley (Haas) alumnus.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Growth Pilots (acquired by Wpromote), served as Vice President of Growth & Innovation at Wpromote, and is a founding partner at Tempo Ventures in addition to co‑founding 43. Work history includes senior roles in SEM, paid acquisition, and advising startups; educated at University of California, Berkeley (Haas School of Business).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑product / earliest‑stage (pre‑seed/seed); operator‑led investing focused on helping founders reach product‑market fit; seed checks in consumer and enterprise software with emphasis on growth/marketing and AI.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner of Monochrome Capital. Co‑founder of WP Engine and former Principal at Ridge Ventures; prior product/engineering roles at Uber, BBC and MySpace. Focuses on seed and early‑stage technical B2B startups.
enrichment.career_background: Ben Metcalfe is the founder and managing partner of Monochrome Capital (founded 2020). He co‑founded WP Engine, served as a Principal at Ridge Ventures, led Uber’s public‑policy product team (Revolution), and earlier worked as a software engineer and platform lead at BBC and MySpace. He is a Kauffman Fellow and writes publicly about product, platform and developer‑focused startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage B2B: SaaS, developer tools, cloud infrastructure, AI/ML, cybersecurity and Web3-related developer platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Canvas Ventures (Canvas Prime) who leads early‑stage investments in fintech, digital health, AI and SaaS. Previously led early investments including Lending Club, Luminar and Doximity. Holds a BS in Chemical Engineering (University of Missouri) and a JD/MBA from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Started at Procter & Gamble, was an early employee and VP of Marketing at NextCard, then joined Morgenthaler Ventures in 2007. Co‑founded Canvas (2013) and has been named repeatedly to Forbes’ Midas List for venture investors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (Series A/B) investing in FinTech, digital health, AI/ML, SaaS and marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Software engineer turned founder and investor. Founded EdgiLife / LoveWithFood (acquired 2018) and served as CEO of Whistle Labs; now an Investment Partner at XFactor Ventures and General Partner at Transform Capital. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Aihui Ong built EdgiLife (and consumer brand LoveWithFood) from product to multi‑million revenue and exited in 2018. She later served as CEO of Whistle Labs and has held operating roles at SnackNation. She is a General Partner at Transform Capital, an Investment Partner at XFactor Ventures, and mentors at 500 Global and Techstars. She holds a BSc in Computer Science (National University of Singapore) and an MBA (Warwick Business School).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed; CPG & DTC; Consumer tech and e-commerce; AI & data-driven insights; B2B software and commerce enablement; supporting female/underrepresented founders

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and angel investor; co‑founder/CEO of Houseparty and Meerkat and currently CEO/co‑founder of Towns/Here Not There Labs. Served as a scout for Sequoia Capital and has backed early-stage consumer and web3 startups. Educated at the Technion and originally from Israel.
enrichment.career_background: Ben Rubin co‑founded Meerkat and later Houseparty (acquired by Epic Games). He has served as a Sequoia Capital scout (starting 2017), was an EIR at Benchmark, and now leads Here Not There Labs / Towns, focusing on decentralized messaging and community protocols. He trained as an architect at the Technion and often frames product design in spatial/architectural terms.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer social and messaging, real‑time video/streaming, and decentralized/web3 protocols (seed to early VC)

enrichment.personal_bio: Startup Operations lead at Keshif Ventures, based in San Diego. Angel investor and founder with prior roles as a founding partner at VegasTechFund and founder of Millennial Technology. Focuses on data‑science‑centric teams, AI and Web3 at early stages.
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur and early‑stage investor. Founded Millennial Technology and SchoolCenter (acquired into Blackboard), was a founding partner at VegasTechFund, and has served in startup community roles (BoomStartup, Startup San Diego). Currently heads startup operations and scouting at Keshif Ventures, working with data‑centric and AI/Web3 teams.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/pre‑seed) B2B software and enterprise SaaS; data science & AI applications; Web3/blockchain; developer tools and infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director and founder of Otherwise Fund, a founder-angel network based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Early-stage investor with seed and multi-stage checks; known for early bets in companies such as Figma, Notion and Robinhood. Former head of Index Ventures’ seed practice and previously worked in product roles at Google and YouTube.
enrichment.career_background: Terrence began investing at Index Ventures (2010–2017), where he co-created and led the firm’s seed practice and incubated an angel fund. In 2017 he launched Otherwise (a founder-angel network) and serves as its Managing Director while investing independently; earlier career roles include product and marketing roles at Google and YouTube. He holds graduate degrees from LSE and Stanford GSB and a BA from Colgate University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Founder-angel / network model; primarily seed and pre-seed (sometimes into Series A/B); check sizes roughly $100K–$1M; geography: US/Canada; sectors: SaaS, marketplaces, AI/GenAI, Web3/crypto

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at CapitalX, an early-stage/rolling fund focused on enterprise and B2B software. Active angel/seed investor since 2011 who publicly lists notable early investments including Zapier, Cruise, Rippling, Retool and Algolia. Regularly invests at pre-seed/seed check sizes and positions herself as a hands-on, founder-focused operator-investor.
enrichment.career_background: Previously a consultant at Accenture and an operator/founder (co‑founded Spartan Camera / Hunting Camera Online). Holds an M.S. from Georgia Institute of Technology and a B.S. from Beijing Jiaotong University. Launched CapitalX (rolling fund / early-stage VC) and has been an active angel investor and founding partner in prior VC vehicles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) B2B — enterprise software and SaaS; also fintech and frontier/deep tech. Typical checks ~$100K–$250K (rolling fund / high-conviction seed investing).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at #ANGELS and co‑founder / Co‑CEO of Honeycomb Labs. Former VP, Media at Twitter who now advises and invests in early‑stage companies and has served on corporate and nonprofit boards.
enrichment.career_background: Chloe Sladden was an early Twitter executive (VP, Media) where she built media partnerships and content strategy. She cofounded the angel collective #ANGELS in 2015 and later co‑founded Honeycomb Labs; she has advised startups and served on boards (including Gannett and PL+US). She holds graduate and undergraduate degrees from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Individual/angel seed investments in early‑stage consumer internet, developer tools, marketplaces, health/biotech and enterprise software; emphasis on operator‑founders and increasing women on cap tables.

enrichment.firm_name: Jumpstart Foundry (part of Jumpstart Health Investors)
enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at Jumpstart Health Investors and co‑founder of Jumpstart Foundry; founder and managing partner of Jumpstart Nova. Active early‑stage healthcare investor and ecosystem builder in Nashville; co‑founder and minority owner of Nashville Soccer Club and author of Create and Orchestrate.
enrichment.career_background: Marcus Whitney is a founding partner of the Jumpstart Health Investors platform and co‑founder of Jumpstart Foundry (a Nashville‑based pre‑seed healthcare fund). He founded Jumpstart Nova (a fund focused on Black‑led healthcare companies) and previously founded/led initiatives including the Health:Further conference and companies such as Clariture Health and Moontoast; earlier in his career he held technology leadership roles at Emma. He serves on several industry and nonprofit boards and is a public speaker and author.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed healthcare startups (health IT, digital health, tech‑enabled services, consumer health/wellness, diagnostic devices); seed/Series A for Black‑founded and led healthcare companies (Jumpstart Nova).

enrichment.personal_bio: Israeli technology entrepreneur and investor. Co‑founder and CEO of Papaya Global (global payroll & payments platform) since 2016 and participates as an NFX scout/angel investor. Has backed early-stage startups across enterprise SaaS, HRTech, payments and marketplaces.
enrichment.career_background: Eynat Guez co‑founded Papaya Global in 2016 and has served as its CEO, growing the company into a global payroll and payments platform. Prior to Papaya she founded Relocation Source and Expert Source and held operational roles at LR Group and Cellcom Guinée. She holds a BA from the Open University of Israel and is active as an angel/scout investor (listed as an NFX scout).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed — enterprise SaaS, HRTech / workforce, fintech/payments, marketplaces, consumer internet

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Center Electric, focused on early‑stage companies in the Internet of Things and hardware. Former executive at Dolby, Intel and PricewaterhouseCoopers and co‑author of The Dragonfly Effect. Mentor and guest lecturer on social technology, growth marketing and product strategy.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Center Electric (2014) with Jay Adelson and serves as General Partner. Prior roles include executive positions at Dolby Laboratories and Intel and consulting at PricewaterhouseCoopers; founded Vonavona Ventures. Co‑authored The Dragonfly Effect (2010) and acts as a venture mentor/guest lecturer (Berkeley, Columbia, Stanford).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A) investments in IoT, consumer electronics/hardware and infrastructure for connected devices.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and founder of at.inc/, a San Francisco–based seed/early-stage venture firm. He has led seed rounds for companies such as Netlify and Wescover and has advised/invested in startups including HoneyBook, Placer.ai and Opendoor. Focuses on partnering with founders at the earliest stages and providing hands-on operational support.
enrichment.career_background: Founded and runs at.inc/ (formerly Tank Hill Ventures) as Managing Partner; prior experience includes founding/operating startups (including TaxJoy) and early roles at product/analytics companies. Educated at Ben-Gurion University of the Negev and Tel Aviv University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage startups; founder-first partnering at incorporation; developer platforms & web infrastructure; proptech and real-estate technology; B2B SaaS and SMB tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Reciprocal Ventures, leading the firm’s investment operations and thesis development with a focus on crypto and Web3. Joined Reciprocal in 2017 and helped shift the firm to invest primarily in blockchain, developer infrastructure, and DeFi. Previously an early business hire at FiscalNote (Head of Revenue Operations & Strategy) and a Jr. Equity Sector Specialist at Morgan Stanley. Holds a B.A. in Economics from Lafayette College.
enrichment.career_background: Craig Burel is a General Partner at Reciprocal Ventures (joined 2017), where he leads day-to-day investment activities, deal execution, and portfolio support for the firm’s crypto‑focused strategy. Before Reciprocal he was an early commercial hire at FiscalNote (Head of Revenue Operations & Strategy) and earlier worked on the Institutional Equity desk at Morgan Stanley. He holds a B.A. in Economics from Lafayette College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) investments in Web3/blockchain and crypto-native infrastructure, DeFi, and developer platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur-turned-VC who co-founded Pinnacle Systems and joined Trinity Ventures in 2006. Invests primarily in early-stage consumer and business applications and services, with current deep dives in autonomy, mobility and digital health. Former founder/CEO with operating and board experience across media, mobility and consumer startups.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and CEO of Pinnacle Systems (grew to a public company; acquired by Avid in 2005). Joined Trinity Ventures as a General Partner in 2006. Prior operating roles include Mindset Corporation, Atari and Unisys. Holds an M.S.E.E. from Stony Brook University and a B.S.E.E. from Birla Institute of Technology & Science (Pilani).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture investments in consumer and business applications/services; mobility, autonomy and digital health.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Primitive Ventures and a long-time crypto investor focused on protocol and infrastructure investments. Formerly Managing Director at DHVC (Danhua Capital); holds a Master’s in Information Systems from Carnegie Mellon University and a Bachelor’s from Sun Yat‑sen University.
enrichment.career_background: Started her career at eBay in product/analytics roles, served as Managing Director at DHVC (Danhua Capital), and in 2018 founded Primitive Ventures to invest from the team’s balance sheet in web3/crypto projects across seed to Series A.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3/Blockchain and crypto protocols; early‑stage (seed—Series A) investments in protocol infrastructure, token projects, and on‑chain economies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and managing partner of Listen (founded 2010), entrepreneur and brand builder who invests in early-stage consumer startups. Former Leo Burnett account leader; adjunct lecturer in startup branding at Northwestern Kellogg. Serves on multiple consumer-focused company boards and nonprofit boards in the Chicago area.
enrichment.career_background: Jeff Cantalupo founded Listen in 2010 and leads its consumer-focused investing and brand-building efforts. He began his career at Leo Burnett in brand and advertising roles, and later moved into angel and venture investing. He teaches startup branding at Northwestern’s Kellogg School of Management and holds board seats at several Listen portfolio companies and local nonprofits. He earned a BA from the University of Iowa.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage consumer brands (CPG, food & beverage, wellness, femtech), consumer internet and consumer-facing fintech; typical check sizes from pre-seed to Series A (sweet spot ~ $1.5M).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Executive Managing Director of Sozo Ventures. Veteran venture investor and entrepreneur; emeritus Executive Chairman/CEO of the Kauffman Fellows. Lectures at Stanford and has served as a Visiting Professor at Waseda University.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of Sozo Ventures; previously co‑founded Reference Media in Tokyo, served as General Partner at JAFCO America and ran U.S. operations for Copan. From 2008–2016 he served as CEO of the Kauffman Fellows (now emeritus Executive Chairman) and has taught at Stanford and Waseda University while advising multiple VC firms and startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early to growth‑stage technology companies (advanced data technologies, enterprise software/fintech, e‑commerce, IoT, healthcare IT) with focus on supporting startups planning global expansion (notably entry into Japan).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and managing partner of Trajectory Ventures and Trajectory Capital. Lifelong entrepreneur and investor focused on disruptive technology across AI, adtech, fintech and infrastructure. Serves on multiple public and private boards and is CEO of Collective Audience (appointed 2023).
enrichment.career_background: Peter Bordes has 30+ years as an operator, founder and investor. He founded MediaTrust, served as CEO of Kubient (led the company through an IPO in August 2020), and later founded Trajectory Ventures/Trajectory Capital. He is a board director at several companies (including Beasley Broadcast Group and Fraud.net), co‑founder/managing partner of TruVest, and vice chair of Ocearch.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑to‑growth stage technology companies in AI, data/analytics, adtech/digital media, fintech/payments, cybersecurity, cloud/compute infrastructure and mobility/aerospace.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner and co‑founder at Bow Capital, focused on late‑seed and early Series A investing. Former product/growth and operating roles at Foursquare and Maven Clinic and prior investing roles at Bessemer and Khosla. Holds degrees in Economics and Computer Science from UC Berkeley. Based in New York and originally from the East Bay, California.
enrichment.career_background: Rafi began his career as a consultant at The Boston Consulting Group, then moved into product and growth roles (including Foursquare) before transitioning to venture investing at Bessemer Venture Partners and Khosla Ventures. He served as COO & Head of Growth at Maven Clinic and co‑founded Bow Capital in 2018, where he is a General Partner. He holds BA/BS degrees from the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.investment_focus: Late seed / early Series A-stage investments in consumer internet, marketplaces, logistics/transportation, financial inclusion/insurtech and enterprise software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at 8‑Bit Capital. Serial entrepreneur and operating executive who has held CEO/COO/CFO roles (notably Friendster) and was COO at Nuzzel and Neo. Host of the Something Ventured podcast. Holds an MBA from Kellogg School of Management and the CFA designation.
enrichment.career_background: Kent Lindstrom is a Silicon Valley operator-turned-investor. He co-founded 8‑Bit Capital after serving in senior operating roles — including CEO/CFO/COO at Friendster, COO of Nuzzel, and COO of Neo (Digital Garage’s software division). He previously founded PlacePop and NetRead and worked in technology/finance practices at Deloitte. He hosts the Something Ventured podcast and holds an MBA from Northwestern (Kellogg) and a CFA.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) software — focus areas include AI, cloud, cybersecurity, enterprise, fintech, and social.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and angel active in crypto/DeFi and Web3. Former Partner at ParaFi Capital and earlier worked in investment banking and growth investing. Publicly visible in the DeFi community and a participant in NFT/DAO activity.
enrichment.career_background: Santiago Roel Santos began in investment banking (financial sponsors) at J.P. Morgan, moved to growth investing at Sageview Capital, served as Director of Research & Growth at Elysium Health, and later joined ParaFi Capital as a Partner focused on crypto and DeFi. He is also identified in public sources as a founder of Inversion (a crypto/private-equity strategy) and an active angel investor in Web3 projects.
enrichment.investment_focus: DeFi and Web3 protocols, crypto infrastructure, NFTs/gaming, early-stage token and venture investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Lolita Taub is the founder and General Partner of Ganas Ventures, a Latina-led VC that writes $100K checks into pre-seed and seed community‑driven startups across the US and Latin America. She is a community builder who runs a large founders/funders newsletter and matching tools to connect underestimated founders with capital and investors. Based in San Diego, she holds an MBA from IE Business School and a BA from the University of Southern California.
enrichment.career_background: Former sales and operator in enterprise tech (IBM, Cisco), Lolita moved into VC as a Principal at Backstage Capital, served as a scout for Lightspeed, co‑founded The Community Fund, and later launched Ganas Ventures. She has also held roles at Catalyte (Chief of Staff/Corporate Development), been an LP/venture partner in several networks, and runs community and matching products to support early‑stage founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed checks (typically $100K) into community‑driven Web2 and Web3 startups headquartered in the US and Latin America, with emphasis on diverse/BIPOC and underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner and co‑founder of Flybridge Capital Partners (founded 2002). Early‑stage investor focused on developer platforms, data infrastructure, and AI‑infused complex systems. Co‑founder and investment partner at XFactor Ventures; long‑time board member of MongoDB.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Flybridge in 2002 after serving as a General Partner at Greylock Partners (joined 1994). Earlier worked at Company Assistance Limited (Warsaw) and Bain & Company. Holds a BA (Stanford) and an MBA from Harvard Business School (Baker Scholar).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in AI, data infrastructure, developer platforms, AI‑native vertical SaaS, and AI‑infused complex systems.

enrichment.personal_bio: Former U.S. Marine and founder-operator turned investor. Founder of Lincoln Group and an early angel who backed companies including Lyft, Postmates and Wish. Currently a managing partner at Outlander (Outlander Labs/Outlander VC), focused on early-stage startup investing.
enrichment.career_background: Paige Craig served in the U.S. military, founded Lincoln Group (a private military/defense contractor), then moved into startups and angel investing. He has been an active seed-stage investor for over a decade and is a founder/managing partner of the Outlander investment platform and related funds, leading early-stage investments across consumer and enterprise technology.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & seed / early-stage technology: marketplaces, AI, autonomy/defense & dual-use, fintech, SaaS and consumer hardware.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at New York Venture Partners; serial entrepreneur and former founder of SPOT, Launch.it and BrandYourself (acquired). Holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and has sourced, diligenced and invested in dozens of early-stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Managing Director at New York Venture Partners since 2015, where he focuses on pre-seed/seed investments and portfolio support. Previously co‑founded Launch.it and SPOT and was an early co‑founder/CMO at BrandYourself; holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BS from Syracuse University (Whitman School).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed (early-stage); sectors: AI/ML, frontier tech (robotics, space), VR/AR, SaaS, consumer & developer tools, digital transformation

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Cool Climate Collective and a movement-driven startup investor. Former Venture Partner/EIR at 500 Startups and Google for Startups; co‑founder of Storefront and SocialEarth. Listed on Forbes 30 Under 30 and active in climate tech, Web3, and startup ecosystem programs.
enrichment.career_background: Tristan co‑founded Storefront (marketplace for retail pop‑ups) and SocialEarth, and later served as a Venture Partner at 500 Startups where he helped direct accelerator and seed investments (~$30M) across 200+ startups. He has been Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Google for Startups, a Terra ClimateTech VC Fellow, and since 2021 is a Founding Partner at Cool Climate Collective, investing in early‑stage climate solutions and operating a syndicate model.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage climate tech (Pre‑seed/Seed) via syndicate/SPVs — decarbonization, materials & biotech, food/agriculture systems, circular economy, and founder/operator support for go‑to‑market and scaling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and angel investor focused on human augmentation; founder of the Human Augmentation Syndicate and co‑founder of Reveri. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area and active as a board member and early‑stage investor. citeturn0search2
enrichment.career_background: Founded and led multiple internet companies (I/PRO, Topica, TextMarks) and has served on boards including Strava, NeoSensory and Freedom Financial; co‑founder of Reveri and active angel investor. Holds a B.S. (MIT) and an MBA (Stanford). citeturn1search2
enrichment.investment_focus: Human augmentation (exoskeletons, enhanced/extra senses), wearables, brain–computer interfaces, genomics. citeturn0search5

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Turtle Ventures and a longtime marketplaces investor and operator. Co‑founder and board member of Rev; early team member at oDesk (Upwork). Former General Partner/Managing Director at Jackson Square Ventures and Venture Partner at FJ Labs. Holds a BS in Mechanical Engineering from MIT.
interests: Early-stage SaaS and marketplace-enabled consumer businesses
enrichment.career_background: Josh Breinlinger began as an engineer/consultant, was an early member of oDesk (now Upwork), co‑founded Rev, and later joined VC (Sigma/Sigma West then Jackson Square Ventures). He founded Turtle Ventures to invest in defensible marketplace/network-effect companies and has served as a Venture Partner at FJ Labs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Marketplaces and network-effect companies (early-stage seed/Series A); e-commerce and consumer marketplaces; select SaaS and proptech/real estate marketplace opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Adam Nash is co‑founder and CEO of Daffy, a consumer fintech donor‑advised fund platform. He is a longtime product executive and angel investor who previously served as President & CEO of Wealthfront and as a product leader at LinkedIn and Dropbox. Nash is an adjunct lecturer at Stanford and holds BS/MS (Computer Science) from Stanford and an MBA from Harvard.
interests: Charitable giving / philanthropy and donor‑advised funds
enrichment.career_background: Product and operations executive turned founder and investor. Nash led product at LinkedIn, was President & CEO of Wealthfront, and served as VP of Product & Growth at Dropbox before co‑founding Daffy; he also serves on boards (e.g., Acorns, Shift) and teaches personal finance at Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage/seed consumer fintech and financial services; product‑led consumer software and marketplaces; developer/tools and fintech adjacent charitable‑tech

enrichment.personal_bio: Dr. Paul Judge is a serial technologist, entrepreneur and investor. He is a co-founder and partner at TechSquare Labs and co-founder and Executive Chairman of Pindrop. He holds a Ph.D. in network security from Georgia Tech and a B.S. from Morehouse College.
enrichment.career_background: Paul Judge co‑founded CipherTrust (served as CTO), Purewire (co‑founder/CTO), Luma (co‑founder) and Pindrop (co‑founder, Executive Chairman). He served as Chief Research Officer at Barracuda Networks after Purewire’s acquisition, and has been a founding partner at TechSquare Labs and involved in multiple venture initiatives and funds. He holds a B.S. from Morehouse College and an M.S. and Ph.D. in network security from Georgia Tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage startups; enterprise/B2B software; cybersecurity; AI/ML; SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Cory Klippsten is the CEO and co‑founder of Swan Bitcoin and a managing partner at Bitcoiner Ventures. He is an angel investor and advisor who has worked at Google, McKinsey, Microsoft and Morgan Stanley and holds an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. He is a frequent commentator on Bitcoin and lives in Los Angeles with his family.
enrichment.career_background: Klippsten is the founder and CEO of Swan Bitcoin (founded 2019) and a managing partner at Bitcoiner Ventures (partner). Prior to founding startups he held roles at Google, McKinsey, Microsoft and Morgan Stanley and earned an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. He has served as an advisor to several crypto firms and as an angel investor in early‑stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Bitcoin‑focused infrastructure and applications; early‑stage (seed) investments; marketplaces, platforms and SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and co-founder at Courtside Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on sports, gaming, fitness and media. He leads investments across sports betting, digital media and wellness and has been involved with early bets such as Beam and The Athletic. Previously a partner at Interplay Ventures and an associate at UBS; BA from University of Maryland, College Park.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Partner at Courtside Ventures (launched 2016), previously a Partner/Venture Partner at Interplay Ventures and an Associate at UBS. Founded a CRM company for professional and college sports teams and serves/has served on boards including The Athletic and 24 Hour Fitness.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/Series A) investments in sports, gaming, fitness/wellness, sports media, collectibles and consumer-focused lifestyle startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing partner and co‑founder of Presence Capital, an early‑stage VC focused on VR/AR. Serial entrepreneur — co‑founded MyMiniLife (acquired by Zynga) and Toro (acquired by Google) and co‑created FarmVille while at Zynga. Former engineer at Epic Games; holds a B.S. in Computer Science from University of Illinois Urbana‑Champaign.
enrichment.career_background: Amitt Mahajan is a technologist‑turned‑investor. He co‑founded and is managing partner at Presence Capital (founded 2015), and has founded multiple companies including MyMiniLife and Toro (both acquired). He served as Director of Engineering / CTO roles at Zynga (co‑created FarmVille) and worked as an engineer at Epic Games; he later founded Proof of Play and Rare Bits and has invested in early‑stage startups across VR/AR and adjacent spaces.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) investments in VR/AR and immersive technologies; immersive gaming and 3D platforms; developer tools, computer vision, and consumer social/platform software

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at Mucker Capital based in Austin, Texas. Invests in pre-seed, seed, and Series A startups across the Mountain West and Southeastern U.S. Prior roles include Principal at Social Starts and Joyance Partners and Director on the Strategy & Operations team at The Advisory Board Company. Holds a BSE in Operations Research & Financial Engineering from Princeton University and an MBA from the McCombs School of Business (UT Austin).
enrichment.career_background: Joined Mucker Capital in 2020 to invest in and accelerate early-stage companies; previously spent ~3.5 years as a Principal at Social Starts and Joyance Partners focused on software investments in education, consumer and healthcare, and earlier worked in strategy & operations at The Advisory Board Company/EAB advising on revenue, product launches and M&A. Educated at Princeton (BSE) and UT Austin (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Stages: pre-seed, seed, Series A. Sectors: healthcare (distribution/healthtech), alternative education, consumer brands, AI/ML, vertical SaaS, marketplaces. Geography focus: TX, Mountain West, Southeastern U.S.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner of HCVC / Hardware Club. Former structured‑equity professional at BNP Paribas with an EM Lyon Master in Management. Leads a community‑driven VC focused on scaling hardware and hardtech startups from early stages.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in structured equity at BNP Paribas before co‑founding Hardware Club (HCVC) to build a community and venture arm supporting hardware and hardtech founders. Serves as Founder & Managing Partner at HCVC, co‑founded Elephants & Ventures, and has been active in founding/mentoring initiatives (Hello Tomorrow / Techstars) and board roles for portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage hardtech/hardware (pre‑seed to Series A); sectors include robotics, AI infrastructure, climate/energy, space, defense and tech‑bio.

enrichment.personal_bio: Matt Mullenweg is the co‑founder of WordPress and founder & CEO of Automattic. He is the founder/principal of Audrey Capital, an angel investment and research company, and an active early‑stage investor focused on web and open‑source projects. He is also an avid photographer and public speaker.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑creator of WordPress (2003) and founder of Automattic (2005), Mullenweg has led Automattic as CEO while investing and advising through Audrey Capital. He has served on boards (including GitLab) and has backed a range of developer‑focused and consumer internet companies, maintaining a public profile around open source, distributed work, and web infrastructure.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage angel investments in open‑source software, web publishing, developer tools, web infrastructure, and consumer internet platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at First Star Ventures and a technologist-investor based in the Boston/Cambridge area. Focuses on early-stage "hard" tech — AI/ML, decentralization/web3, edge/sensors and computational biotech. Former product/engineering lead at Semantic Machines, Locately (co‑founder/CTO) and Endeca. Holds an AB in Computer Science from Harvard University.
enrichment.career_background: Drew Volpe is a technologist, entrepreneur and investor. He co-founded and is Founding Partner of First Star Ventures (focused on pre-seed/seed deep‑tech investments). Previously he was founding VP of Product Development at Semantic Machines, co‑founder/CTO of Locately, and Director of Product Development at Endeca (acquired by Oracle). He holds an AB in Computer Science from Harvard University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed; deep tech (AI/ML, decentralization/web3, edge/sensors); computational biotechnology / techbio; cloud & infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor, entrepreneur, and author focused on the intersection of exponential technologies and decentralized networks. Founder and Managing Partner of Network Society Ventures and founder/trustee of Network Society Research. Active in Web3/blockchain since 2010 and involved in AI, longevity, and the future of work.
enrichment.career_background: David Orban is founder and Managing Partner of Network Society Ventures (since 2015), founder/trustee of Network Society Research and Network Society Lab, CEO of Actioneer, faculty/advisor at Singularity University, and a mentor for the Thiel Fellowship. He studied physics in Italy and has founded and led multiple technology startups while advising and investing in early-stage companies across AI, Web3 and other exponential-tech sectors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage investments at the intersection of exponential technologies and decentralized networks (AI, Web3/crypto); sectors include energy, manufacturing, healthcare, education, and finance.

enrichment.firm_name: Fab Co-Creation Studio Ventures (aka Fab Ventures)
enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and managing partner of Fab Co-Creation Studio Ventures (Fab Ventures), a seed-stage fund focused on conscious beauty, sustainable fashion and DTC consumer brands. Former CEO/President of Lancôme (L'Oréal) and former Chief Strategy & Data Officer at Orange. Based in Los Angeles, California; founder of the FaB Fashion & BeautyTech community and active as an angel investor and board advisor.
enrichment.career_background: 30+ year career across luxury, beauty and telecom: held senior marketing and P&L roles at Chanel/Yves Saint Laurent and L’Oréal (including CEO/President of Lancôme International), served as Chief Strategy & Data Officer at Orange, then transitioned to angel investing and founded the FaB community and Fab Co-Creation Studio Ventures; serves on multiple boards and advises startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / seed investments in direct-to-consumer consumer brands and platforms — primarily conscious beauty, sustainable fashion, new commerce and retail tech (U.S.-focused).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Version One Ventures, an early-stage VC based in Vancouver. Former entrepreneur (co‑founder of JustBooks; COO at AbeBooks) with a PhD in Business Economics. Focuses on seed/pre‑seed investments across SaaS, marketplaces, crypto/Web3 and climate/energy. Serves/has served on multiple startup boards and as a board partner at Andreessen Horowitz.
enrichment.career_background: Built and sold an online marketplace (JustBooks) and served as COO of AbeBooks (acquired by Amazon). Earned a PhD from WHU (Otto Beisheim School of Management). Founded Version One Ventures in 2012 to invest in mission‑driven founders; has served as a board partner at Andreessen Horowitz and sits on several company and nonprofit boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments in SaaS, marketplaces, crypto/Web3, climate/energy, fintech and enterprise software

enrichment.personal_bio: Technology entrepreneur, investor and operator; co‑founder and President of Operate (a SoCal venture studio) and Managing Director at BankTech Ventures. Focuses on building and investing in data‑centric SaaS and fintech startups; hosts the Operate podcast. MBA, UCLA Anderson; BA, Indiana University.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and operator with senior roles at Aspiration (COO), Happy Money (CMO/founding CMO), Experian Consumer Services (Chief Product & Innovation Officer) and CEO of RealPractice (acquired). Co‑founded OC4/Operate in 2019 to run an operator‑first venture studio and has served as investor, board member and advisor to multiple startups in SaaS, fintech and data/analytics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Data‑centric B2B SaaS; fintech & community/bank technology; early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) operator‑embedded investments.

name: Gil Penchina
firm: Ridge Ventures (Formerly known as IDG Ventures USA)

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Ridge Ventures (joined 2011; promoted to Managing Director in 2017). Serial entrepreneur and prolific angel investor active across crypto and early‑stage technology startups. Former member of the pre‑IPO eBay team and ex‑CEO of Wikia; holds a BS (UMass Amherst) and an MBA (Kellogg).
enrichment.career_background: Joined Ridge Ventures as a Venture Partner in 2011 and as a Managing Director in 2017. Previously served on eBay’s pre‑IPO executive team (VP/GM roles), was CEO of Wikia (Fandom), and has founded/co‑founded startups and angel syndicates (Flight.vc). Active angel investor with 100+ personal investments and multiple board/advisor roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed / Series A) enterprise and consumer software, developer infrastructure, fintech and crypto.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and co‑CEO of Odin (a platform for structuring SPVs and deploying angel/fund capital). Former Project Director – Ventures at Coca‑Cola European/Europacific Partners (CCEP) and Head of Inbound at Crowdcube. Trinity College Dublin alumnus with experience building and advising consumer and Go‑to‑Market startups.
enrichment.career_background: Patrick (often called Paddy) Ryan co‑founded Odin in 2020 to simplify deal structuring and capital deployment. Prior roles include Project Director – Ventures at Coca‑Cola European/Europacific Partners (CCEP) (2019–2020) and Head of Inbound at Crowdcube (2017–2019); he has also founded consumer ventures (e.g., Ishka Wines & Spirits) and worked on market entry for Irish trade in Russia. He studied at Trinity College Dublin and has been active as an angel/investor.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage/seed investments in sustainability & climate tech (packaging, water, emissions), consumer brands and RTM, and B2B e‑commerce/retail‑tech and supply‑chain solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial technology entrepreneur and angel investor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Founder of Archimedes (Archimedes Labs/Archimedes Accelerator), founding shareholder of TechCrunch, and founder & CEO of SignalRank. Has advised and invested in early-stage software and platform companies globally.
enrichment.career_background: Keith Teare is a long-time Silicon Valley entrepreneur and investor. He founded Archimedes (an incubator/accelerator), co-founded or led multiple companies including RealNames and Cyberia, was a founding shareholder of TechCrunch, served senior roles at Accelerated Digital Ventures, and currently leads SignalRank. His activity spans founding, advising, and early-stage investing with a focus on software platforms and emerging tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and seed investments in software/platform companies; interests in AI, blockchain/web3 and platform-enabled consumer/enterprise startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor and operator. Served as Principal, ODX and Head of the On Deck Investor Network (2021–2022). Listed as VP, Corporate Development at Merit (from 2022) and has acted as an advisor and board observer to several early-stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Worked on investor and community programs at On Deck (Principal, ODX; Head of the On Deck Investor Network, 2021–2022). Has held corporate development and partnerships roles (listed at Merit from 2022) and operates as an angel investor and advisor to early-stage companies. Education listed as a B.S. from DePaul University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage angel investments in GovTech, education, fintech and companies at the intersection of regulation and technology.

enrichment.personal_bio: Andrew Tan is a San Francisco–based entrepreneur and early-stage investor. He is founder of Nova (acquired) and a general partner at Builders (Builders VC). Tan has held AI/product and data roles at Handshake, Google, and Sequoia and writes newsletters on AI and founders.
enrichment.career_background: Founder of Nova (acquired); founder of Builders Capital (Builders syndicate) and active angel investor. Prior roles include leading generative AI/product at Handshake and data science/product roles at Sequoia and Google; involved in writing and curating AI-focused newsletters and operating/venture roles since 2018.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed–Series A); AI / generative AI, enterprise SaaS, developer tools, fintech, deep tech

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Partech (joined 2019) and founding partner of Irregular Expressions. Former CTO and engineering leader at startups including Cadre, Fountain, One Kings Lane and Mint. Focuses on early-stage investments in developer-focused infrastructure and tooling.
enrichment.career_background: Engineer-turned-investor with 20+ years in technical leadership. Held VP/CTO roles at Mint, One Kings Lane, Fountain and Cadre; earlier engineering roles at Motorola and Oracle. Began angel/advising activity in 2012, founded the Irregular Expressions syndicate in 2018 and joined Partech's venture team in 2019. Holds an M.S. in Computer Science from Telecom Paris (Télécom ParisTech).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed / Series A) technology startups, primarily business-to-developer tools: developer tooling, infrastructure, observability, ML/MLOps, data infrastructure, security; selective fintech and SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co‑founder of Seaside Ventures, focused on investing in science‑driven consumer health and wellness startups. Former co‑founder/operator of Kyoku and USC Iovine Young Academy alum; supports portfolio companies on commercialization, manufacturing, and go‑to‑market.
enrichment.career_background: Harrison Valner (known as Harry) co‑founded Seaside Ventures in 2021 and serves as Managing Partner, leading external engagement, investor relations, and portfolio operations. Earlier he co‑founded Kyoku, worked in product and operations roles at startups (including ROBO 3D during high school) and studied at USC's Iovine Young Academy. At Seaside he focuses on commercializing consumer health products and connecting founders to operational and distribution partners.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage/seed investments in science‑driven consumer health and wellness (preventive medicine/Medicine 3.0), longevity, biotech, therapeutics, and consumer health products.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Emergence Capital since 2010. Led Emergence's early investment in Zoom and serves on several public and private company boards. Former founder of AXG Tecnonexo and holds an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Emergence in 2010 and was later promoted to General Partner; has led/partnered on investments including Zoom, Chorus.ai and Crunchbase. Prior to VC he founded AXG Tecnonexo, a SaaS e-learning company operating across Latin America and the U.S. He is a Kauffman Fellow and Endeavor Entrepreneur and holds a BS in economics from Universidad de San Andrés and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Cloud and enterprise SaaS (B2B software), enterprise/go-to-market applications, digital media

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at 7percent Ventures and a serial entrepreneur turned investor focused on deeptech and frontier technologies. Co‑founder of the ICE founder community and DragonChasers; sits on the boards of Universal Quantum, AeroVolt and Greenjets. Former founder of startups including BritishPathe.com, Playtxt and Rummble.
enrichment.career_background: Andrew J Scott is a multi‑time founder who transitioned to venture investing as a founding partner of 7percent Ventures (est. 2014). He has founded and led multiple startups (notably BritishPathe.com, Playtxt and Rummble), co‑founded the ICE founder network, and invests primarily in pre‑seed/seed deeptech and transformative software companies. He serves on several portfolio boards and splits time between the UK and US.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / Seed and early stage investments in deeptech and transformative software; sectors include quantum computing, AI/future compute, spacetech/aerospace, hardware/robotics, and climate/clean technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at The Refiners, a San Francisco‑based seed fund and accelerator. Repeat entrepreneur originally from France (founder/CEO roles at Emakina/Reflect, blueKiwi, Kwarter) and founder/CEO of Uncut.fm; host of the Silicon Carne podcast. Active in pre‑seed/seed investing and mentoring international founders.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur who founded Reflect (Emakina), blueKiwi (sold to ATOS), and Kwarter; co‑founded The Refiners (2016) to run a Silicon Valley accelerator for foreign founders and later launched Diaspora Ventures (rolling fund) and Uncut.fm. Based in San Francisco after moving from France; serves as investor, mentor and advisor to early‑stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage; sector‑agnostic with emphasis on cross‑border/international founders, B2B and B2C startups (SaaS, marketplaces, consumer products), and early creator‑economy/web3 opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of PIABO, a Berlin-based communications agency serving tech and digital-economy companies. Active business angel and limited partner, invested in multiple VC funds and startups. Regular speaker, mentor and host of the "Business Class" podcast focused on technology and entrepreneurship.
enrichment.career_background: Founded PIABO in 2006 and leads the agency as CEO. Previously Head of Global Corporate Communications at Jamba; co‑founder of enable2grow and a partner in MXP Ventures / Millwright-related initiatives. Acts as an angel investor and LP across seed/early-stage funds and sits on/works with several investment committees and VC partners internationally.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to early-stage tech (SaaS, marketplaces, fintech, healthtech, AI/ML, Web3/blockchain, consumer & deep tech); strategic investments tied to international growth, brand and communications support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Commsor (community/go-to-network platform). Serial community builder who started The Chunk (a Minecraft network) and the Community Club; active angel investor in early-stage tech startups. Based primarily in Copenhagen (previously New York).
enrichment.career_background: Mac Reddin is the founder and CEO of Commsor (founded 2019), a platform that helps companies measure and activate their networks and communities. He previously built and exited The Chunk (a Minecraft gaming network) and founded the Community Club; he has participated as an angel investor in several early-stage rounds while leading Commsor as it scaled internationally.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and Series A investments; early-stage tech with emphasis on community/impact, B2B SaaS, and go-to-market/network-driven startups (typical check sizes reported $100K–$1M+).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Ravelin Capital, an early‑stage firm focused on software for critical industries. Previously an investor at Village Global and co‑founder of earlier investment vehicles; studied at the University of Minnesota. Born and raised in Brazil and later immigrated to the U.S.
enrichment.career_background: Lucas Vaz is the founder and general partner of Ravelin Capital (founded 2023), an early‑stage VC backing software‑defined companies in "Critical Industries." Before Ravelin he invested at Village Global and co‑founded prior investment initiatives; he graduated from the University of Minnesota (Carlson School of Management).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in "Critical Industries" — software for industrials, manufacturing, defense, aerospace, energy, and other mission‑critical sectors.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at 1517 Fund who focuses on pre-seed and seed investments in deep tech. Writer and career coach who maintains a personal website and runs Get Ahead Labs. Former early operator at Praxis and advisor to several startups.
enrichment.career_background: Joined 1517 Fund in a marketing role in 2017, served as Principal (2019–2022) and is listed as Partner (since 2022). Former founding-team operator at Praxis (roles included COO and Business Development Director). Runs Get Ahead Labs and has held advisor roles at startups including Quickcard and Usage AI. Attended the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments in deep tech, biotech, energy/cleantech, industrials and hardware, founder-first teams

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner of C2 Ventures with 20+ years as a founder, operator and investor. Previously led appssavvy (founder/CEO) and held commercial leadership roles at Unacast and ironSource. Hosts the Superpowers podcast and focuses on practical, hands-on support for early-stage founders.
interests: AI applied to legacy industries (dirty, dull, dangerous)
Early-stage founder support and commercial scaling
enrichment.career_background: Chris co-founded appssavvy (mobile/Facebook ad platform), later served as President at Unacast and VP at ironSource, then transitioned to angel investing and co-founded C2 Ventures (launched fund activity since 2014). At C2V he runs an early-stage fund backing AI-powered enterprise and robotics startups and participates in founder mentoring, podcasting, and portfolio commercialization efforts.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed/Seed investments in AI-powered enterprise SaaS and robotics targeting legacy "dirty, dull, and dangerous" industries (US-focused), with emphasis on measurable ROI and commercial traction.

enrichment.firm_name: Launch House (House Capital / Launch House Ventures)
enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and investor focused on community-driven startups and health. Co‑founder of Launch House and Commsor; founder & CEO of Superpower. General Partner at Launch House’s venture arm (House Capital) investing in early‑stage companies.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as a data scientist at J.P. Morgan early in his career. Co‑founded Commsor (community software) and later co‑founded Launch House; helped launch Launch House’s venture arm (House Capital / Launch House Ventures) and serves as a GP. More recently founded Superpower, a consumer health/longevity startup, while continuing to invest in pre‑seed and seed companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and Seed; community-driven consumer startups, Web3/crypto, fintech, B2B SaaS, creator tools, and health/longevity

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner of Chingona Ventures, an institutionally-backed pre-seed fund focused on tech and tech-enabled U.S. startups. Former investor at MATH Venture Partners and earlier roles at Goldman Sachs. Holds a BSE in Industrial & Operations Engineering from the University of Michigan and an MBA from Northwestern (Kellogg). Active in Chicago’s startup ecosystem and co-founder of the Latinx Founders Collective.
interests: Underrepresented/Latinx founders and diversity in VC
enrichment.career_background: Samara Mejia Hernandez founded Chingona Ventures in 2019 and serves as its sole/lead general partner, building a portfolio across fintech, health tech, future of learning and future of work. Prior to founding Chingona she was an investor/venture partner at MATH Venture Partners and spent several years at Goldman Sachs in asset management and FICC roles. She is a Kauffman Fellow, sits on multiple boards/advisory roles, and co-founded the Latinx Founders Collective.
enrichment.investment_focus: Primarily pre-seed and seed-stage U.S. tech and tech-enabled companies (FinTech, Future of Learning, Future of Work, Health/Wellness) with emphasis on underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment manager at DG Incubation (DG Ventures) based in Tokyo and founder/CEO of Off Topic, a podcast and newsletter about US tech and internet culture. Graduated from Babson College. Focuses on early-stage deals and US–Japan market localization, especially DTC, retail infrastructure and creator-economy software.
interests: US–Japan market localization and cross-border expansion
Web3 / digital-native content and virtual humans
enrichment.career_background: Has worked as an investment manager at DG Incubation (DG Ventures) and supported portfolio companies as a board observer. Founded Off Topic (podcast/newsletter) and has contributed to tech media; background includes startup operations and business development. Educated at Babson College (B.B.A.).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments across DTC/retail infrastructure, creator-economy software, consumer internet/marketplaces, and AI-enabled services; supports US–Japan localization.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Foundry Group since 2015, focused on early-stage investing and building Foundry’s partner-fund strategy. Previously managed the private investment program for the University of Texas Investment Management Company (UTIMCO). Holds an MBA from the University of Texas at Austin and a BBA from Texas Christian University; is a CPA and CFA charterholder. Based in Boulder, Colorado.
interests: Institutional LP/fund strategy and supporting emerging managers
Founder mentoring and portfolio company support
Network-building across founders, GPs, and LPs
enrichment.career_background: Lindel managed UTIMCO’s private investment program for over a decade where he developed the endowment’s venture program, then joined Foundry as a partner in 2015 to lead direct investments and Foundry’s partner-fund strategy. Earlier he worked in KPMGs M&A tax practice. He holds an MBA (UT Austin), a BBA (TCU), and is both a CPA and CFA charterholder.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology startups (seed through Series A); direct company investments and investments in/partnering with other venture funds; LP/fund strategy and emerging-manager support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and early-stage investor. Co‑founder and CEO of Autograph and co‑founder/former CEO of AbstractOps. General Partner / active angel with Autopilot Fund; focuses on products that automate work and serve as systems of record. Holds degrees from Northwestern University and Stanford University.
interests: People / HR tech and headcount tooling
enrichment.career_background: Started in management consulting (BCG), then joined the founding team and served as COO at Forge (Equidate). Co‑founded AbstractOps (CEO), became an active angel and General Partner at Autopilot Fund, and is currently co‑founder & CEO of Autograph, a people‑intelligence / HR platform. Educated at Northwestern (BA) and Stanford (MS).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed, occasionally Series A) enterprise SaaS: systems-of-record & data platforms, workflow automation / 'API for X' products, people/HR tech, and marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at RareBreed Ventures who focuses on very early-stage startups. Previously worked at Spero Ventures and Andreessen Horowitz and has co-founded startups (RepresentYou, Semantiks) and advised companies including Para. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Jonathan Kroll is a venture investor and operator. He serves as Venture Partner at RareBreed Ventures (since ~2020), previously worked as an investor at Spero Ventures and in market development at Andreessen Horowitz, and co‑founded/served as CTO at early startups (RepresentYou, Target Test Prep) and later startups (Semantiks). He has advised companies such as Para and is active in pre-seed/seed ecosystems.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups — primarily fintech, AI, marketplaces and consumer internet (also Web3/crypto); emphasis on founders outside major tech hubs.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Proteum Capital focused on blockchain/Web3 and digital-asset strategy. Board advisor and ecosystem builder involved with companies in advanced manufacturing and web3 products; co‑founder of The NFT Brewery/DataCurve. Education includes an MBA from Carnegie Mellon and engineering degrees from IIT‑BHU and UIC.
enrichment.career_background: Amanjyot S. Johar has worked in investment strategy and venture roles since the 2000s, serving as Principal for investment strategy at Proteum (since ~2017). He has held board and advisor roles (e.g., Sakuu, KeraCel, IIFX), co‑founded ventures including The NFT Brewery/DataCurve and QuikR, and holds an MBA from Carnegie Mellon (Tepper) plus technical degrees from IIT‑BHU and University of Illinois Chicago.
enrichment.investment_focus: Blockchain / Web3, digital assets & tokenization, FinTech & payments, media & entertainment, enterprise software & IoT — typically seed to early growth (seed–Series A).

enrichment.personal_bio: Clinical psychologist and entrepreneur who served as an Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Trinity Ventures. Founding team member at Omada Health, founder/CEO of Maximus, and an Assistant Clinical Professor at UCSF. Advises and angel‑invests in early‑stage health and consumer startups.
enrichment.career_background: Trained as a clinical psychologist (BA Harvard; PhD UCLA) who moved into health‑tech entrepreneurship and venture investing. He was a founding clinical leader at Omada Health, founded Actualize, served as Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Trinity Ventures (2018), has advised VCs and startups, and is the founder and CEO of Maximus while holding a part‑time clinical professor role at UCSF.
enrichment.investment_focus: Health tech and consumer health (digital therapeutics, telemedicine, consumer wellness); consumer & enterprise software; typical stages: pre‑seed/seed to Series A (angel and co‑investments).

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co‑founder of Adapt Ventures, an early‑stage VC and venture studio. Previously on the investment team at Plug and Play Ventures; focuses on transformative solutions across legacy industries (financial services, industrials, real estate). Named to Forbes 30 Under 30 (Venture Capital). Educated at New York University (BS) and Imperial College London (MSc).
