enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Adapt Ventures (since 2020). Prior experience on the investment team at Plug and Play Ventures. Holds a corporate strategy / director role at GK (corporate group) and serves as board observer/advisor roles for select portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) investments in fintech, B2B SaaS, consumer, marketplaces, real estate and industrials; global mandate with emphasis on the US, Latin America and MENA.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at First Round Capital focused on early-stage, technical founders. Previously led sales and customer success organizations at Stripe and Mixpanel and held roles at Bain and in baseball operations. Holds a BA from Princeton and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Meka began in player development and baseball operations with the Cleveland Indians, then worked as a case team leader at Bain. He joined Stripe in a series of early sales and leadership roles, later served as Head of Sales & Customer Success for Stripe’s Startup/SMB business, and was VP of Sales & Services at Mixpanel before joining First Round as a Partner in 2021, where he focuses on helping technical founders build repeatable go-to-market motion.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/Series A) B2B/SaaS and FinTech with emphasis on go-to-market/product-market-fit; also active in hardware/space and govtech investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on the consumer investing team at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), focused on AI and consumer apps. Previously an early-stage investor at CRV and an analyst on Goldman Sachs’ Alternative Investments & Manager Selection team. Stanford BA (Economics) and Stanford GSB MBA; co‑founder of the Accelerated newsletter and co‑creator of Cardinal Ventures at Stanford.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Andreessen Horowitz as a partner on the consumer/AI investing team (role from 2021). Prior to a16z she invested at CRV (2017–2021) and began her career at Goldman Sachs; while at Stanford she co‑founded the on‑campus incubator Cardinal Ventures and later co‑founded the Accelerated newsletter/community.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer & consumer AI; marketplaces; creator tools; SMB software and automation; early-stage (seed/Series A) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator focused on seed-stage startups in the MENA region and diaspora. Founding GP/Managing Partner for 500 Falcons (500 Startups' MENA fund); former Partner Lead to VCs & Startups at Google and ex-AdMob executive. Co-founded Plus Venture Capital and later served as CEO of Dubai Future District Fund.
interests: mentorship / bridging MENA and Silicon Valley
enrichment.career_background: Sharif El-Badawi is a technologist-turned-investor who led performance advertising at AdMob (acquired by Google) and then served as Partner Lead to VCs and startups at Google. He joined 500 Startups to run 500 Falcons (the firm’s MENA fund), co-founded Plus Venture Capital (+VC), and later became CEO of the Dubai Future District Fund. He holds an MBA from UC Irvine and a BS in Neuroscience from UCLA.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in the MENA region and MENA diaspora; fintech, marketplaces, SaaS, consumer internet, adtech/mobile advertising

enrichment.personal_bio: Product leader and angel investor focused on fintech and crypto. Listed as a Venture Partner / Limited Partner at rali_cap and author of the Cryptechie newsletter. Former product roles at Coinbase and Venmo and founder of MyMBACircle.
enrichment.career_background: Operator-turned-angel: product leadership roles at Coinbase and Venmo, prior consulting at BCG, founder of MyMBACircle, author of Cryptechie, and listed as a Venture Partner / Limited Partner at rali_cap; active angel investor in fintech and blockchain startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed B2B / API-first fintech and fintech infrastructure in emerging markets (Africa, Latin America, South Asia); early-stage fintech / developer-finance startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Team Ignite Ventures; former product and AI leader at AWS and Microsoft. Holds a Finance degree from University of Washington and an MBA from UC Berkeley. Based in Northern California and hosts the Ignite Podcast.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Team Ignite in 2020 and leads the firm’s rolling/YC-focused investing strategy. Previously led AI and marketplace initiatives at Amazon Web Services (including work on SageMaker/AWS Marketplace) and held product leadership roles at Microsoft and several startups. Education: BA (University of Washington), MBA (UC Berkeley Haas).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed (YC-focused) rolling fund investing in AI/ML, B2B SaaS, fintech, marketplaces with hands-on go-to-market support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Reforge and growth-focused angel investor; advisor to Long Journey Ventures. Former VP of Growth at HubSpot, he writes and teaches on product-led growth and growth strategy.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and CEO of Reforge (since 2016). Previously VP of Growth at HubSpot (2014–2016), Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Trinity Ventures, and co‑founder of startups including Viximo and Boundless. Active advisor and angel investor to early‑stage companies, focusing on product and growth.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage startups (pre‑seed, seed, Series A); SaaS, marketplaces, networks, consumer internet, AI, and product‑led business models

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder, CTO/CISO and lead business development manager at Platinum (Platinum.fund). Software architect and cryptography-focused engineer who works on Web3/DeFi products and DAO tooling. Active as an angel/venture partner in blockchain and DeFi investments.
enrichment.career_background: Anton Dziatkovskii is a co‑founder and long‑time executive at Platinum (Platinum.fund / Platinum Q DAO Engineering), serving as CTO/CISO and lead business development manager since the mid‑2010s. His background is in software architecture, blockchain engineering (Solidity, Rust, Substrate) and big‑data analytics; past roles and advisory work include positions linked to Merlion, 4finance/INFINTO, Everex Global and multiple Web3 projects (advisor/tech lead). He has also been involved in launching Platinum’s Q DAO ecosystem and related DeFi products.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3 / Blockchain, DeFi, early‑stage crypto and fintech startups (pre‑seed / seed), security and infrastructure projects

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and investor; co‑founder and CEO of Collective and co‑founder of AddThis (acquired by Oracle). Founding partner and current Venture Partner at Expa, where he helped build the studios early-stage investing program. Active angel/advisor to multiple consumer and infrastructure startups.
interests: Early-stage startup building & venture studio model
Products and platforms for founders / solopreneurs (back-office, fintech)
enrichment.career_background: Hooman Radfar studied computer science and economics (University of Pennsylvania) and earned an M.S. from Carnegie Mellon. He co-founded Clearspring/AddThis and later joined Expa (initially as EIR and then a founding/venture partner) to lead early investing and studio projects. He founded 10e9 as a personal investment/advising platform and in 2020 co‑founded Collective, where he serves as CEO, focusing on back‑office financial services for self‑employed professionals.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed stage startups; venture-studio company building; fintech and financial services for small businesses; marketplaces, logistics, consumer and B2B SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Motivate Venture Capital. Serial entrepreneur with multiple exits (InnFlux, PowerSurge, RIVS) and a prolific early‑stage investor. Holds a BA from the University of Notre Dame and an MBA from Northwestern University's Kellogg School of Management.
enrichment.career_background: Two‑time founder-operator turned investor: built and exited InnFlux and PowerSurge, founded RIVS (video hiring platform) and co‑founded the IrishAngels angel group. Co‑founded Motivate Venture Capital in 2019 to invest in pre‑seed and seed startups; serves as Founder & Managing Partner. Education: BA (Notre Dame), MBA (Northwestern Kellogg), and executive education in VC/PE at Harvard.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage startups; primary focus on fintech, enterprise/B2B SaaS, enterprise software, manufacturing & supply‑chain tech, and insurance/financial services.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and investor focused on data-driven, privacy-forward adtech and identity products. Founder & CEO of lockr and previously Chief Strategy Officer at Screen6 and Head of Platform/Identity at Samba TV. Served as a General Partner at Gambit Ventures, where he focused on early-stage companies building monetizable data assets.
enrichment.career_background: Keith has founded and led startups (iGottaGuide, CNSLT.us, lockr) and held senior commercial and strategy roles across adtech and identity (SVP Business Development at eDealya; VP Strategic Partnerships at IgnitionOne; CSO at Screen6; Head of Platform/Identity and Strategic Advisor at Samba TV). He has also invested and worked as a General Partner at Gambit Ventures, focusing on early-stage, data-centric companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed/Series A) investments in data‑driven companies — analytics, adtech/identity, marketing technology and companies that generate unique, monetizable data assets.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder, chairman, and CEO of Altimeter Capital, a technology‑focused investment firm that manages public and private portfolios. Investor and hedge‑fund manager with prior experience as a securities lawyer, a founding principal at General Catalyst, and a portfolio manager at PAR Capital. Co‑hosts the BG2Pod podcast on tech, markets and capitalism.
enrichment.career_background: Bradley Gerstner trained as a securities lawyer (JD) and later earned an MBA from Harvard Business School. He was a founding principal at General Catalyst, worked at travel startups, served as a portfolio manager at PAR Capital, and in 2008 founded Altimeter Capital, where he remains CEO and lead investor.
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology investments across public and private markets, with emphasis on enterprise software, marketplaces, growth‑stage technology and AI/data infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO/Partner of Positive Sum; founder and chairman of Colossus, the media & podcast network behind Invest Like the Best. Formerly CEO and portfolio manager at O'Shaughnessy Asset Management. Holds a B.A. in Philosophy from the University of Notre Dame and is a CFA charterholder.
interests: Deep tech / AI hardware and semiconductors
enrichment.career_background: Patrick O'Shaughnessy built a career in investment research and portfolio management at O'Shaughnessy Asset Management (later serving as CEO), hosts the podcast Invest Like the Best, and founded Colossus to scale publishing and media for founders. In 2020 he co-founded Positive Sum to invest in early-stage technology companies and serves as CEO/Partner while also participating as an investor and board observer across portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology (Seed–Series A); enterprise SaaS, developer tools and data infrastructure; fintech/financial software; deep tech and AI hardware

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and lead investor at AngelCube, a Melbourne-based venture accelerator. Serial entrepreneur and angel investor with multiple exits across Australia, the USA and New Zealand; active in mentoring early-stage founders.
enrichment.career_background: Former IBM employee turned serial entrepreneur. Co-founded AngelCube (Melbourne’s early venture accelerator) and served as its lead investor; has invested in numerous Australian and US startups and been involved in investor education initiatives (e.g., Investors' Organisation).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage technology startups; accelerator programs and mentoring; marketplaces, logistics, e‑commerce and consumer internet

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Graypes GmbH, a Swiss company that builds AI-driven tools for startup valuation and funding. Based in Switzerland, he focuses on applying algorithms and machine learning to accelerate business evaluation and matchmaking between startups and investors. Public-facing roles include speaking and podcast appearances about product and fundraising processes.
enrichment.career_background: Technology executive and entrepreneur with decades of product and engineering experience. Founder and CEO (Founder & Chairman) of Graypes GmbH; prior roles and advisory positions reported include CTO at Gameyola and advisor roles at research/technology organizations (e.g., CERTH). Educated in engineering (University of Patras reported). Active in product development, startup evaluation, and investor matchmaking.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology startups — AI/ML, SaaS, Fintech, EdTech, EnergyTech; startup valuation and funding facilitation using algorithmic/AI evaluation tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Blue Bear Ventures (BBV) focused on seed investments in deep tech emerging from research universities. Startup director/mentor at UC Berkeley Haas and active mentor in Silicon Valley accelerators. Formerly worked in venture roles at Propel and Hercules and in multiple medical startups (one exit with Cepheid). Holds a BS (Virginia Tech), MS (Virginia Commonwealth University) and an MBA (University of Chicago Booth).
enrichment.career_background: 10+ years in venture investing and startup operations. Co‑founder/partner at Blue Bear Ventures (seed fund for deep tech), startup director and lecturer/advisor at UC Berkeley Haas, prior roles at Propel Venture Partners and Hercules Capital, and operational roles at several medical startups including an exit with Cepheid.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed investments in applied biology, sustainable-economy (climate/energy) and emerging deep technology spun out of research universities

enrichment.personal_bio: Vice President at Oxonian Ventures (Oxford Angel Fund) and early-stage investor focused on Oxford‑founded startups. Former strategy consultant with experience in AI strategy and startup advising; educated at the University of Oxford.
enrichment.career_background: Serves as Vice President at Oxonian Ventures (Oxford Angel Fund) where he sources and diligences early-stage Oxford‑founded opportunities. Earlier roles include strategy and AI work at EY-Parthenon, M&A/associate work at Equiteq, and business analyst experience at HSBC. Educated at the University of Oxford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Pre-seed–Series A) investments in startups founded by University of Oxford alumni; sector-agnostic with emphasis on biotech, fintech/impact, AI/software, medtech and deep tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Auren Hoffman is a General Partner at Flex Capital and a serial entrepreneur focused on data and software. He co-founded Rapleaf/LiveRamp and SafeGraph, has been an active angel investor (100+ investments), and hosts the World of DaaS podcast. He holds a BS from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Hoffman is a serial founder and investor: he co-founded Rapleaf (and LiveRamp), later co-founded SafeGraph, and serves as a General Partner at Flex Capital. He has led and advised multiple startups, is an active angel investor with 100+ personal investments, and is known for public writing and podcasting on data topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage software (Seed–Series B); data & location data, SaaS, developer tools, advertising/marketing tech, AI/ML, marketplaces, fintech

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Managing Director Emeritus at Storm Ventures, an early-stage B2B venture firm focused on Mobile, SaaS and Cloud. Previously spent 21 years in networking and computing (ROLM, IBM, Stratacom, Cisco) and was on the founding team at Stratacom. Holds a BSEE from Stanford University and an MBA from Santa Clara University. Born in Buenos Aires, Argentina.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Director Emeritus at Storm Ventures with a focus on early-stage enterprise software and infrastructure. Prior roles include 21 years across ROLM, IBM, Stratacom (founding team) and senior leadership at Cisco; served as CEO/Chair at Sanera Systems and has held board/advisor roles at companies including Airespace, McData, Logikcull, Rafter and Restorando. Education: BSEE, Stanford; MBA, Santa Clara University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage B2B (SaaS, enterprise infrastructure, cybersecurity, cloud/AI) — seed through Series A

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Partner at SmartGateVC, a pre-seed/seed venture firm operating in Southern California and Armenia. Holds a PhD in Economics from Yerevan State University and teaches venture capital management at the American University of Armenia. Focuses on early-stage deep tech and AI investments (BCI, AI x physical world, AI in life sciences).
interests: AI applied to life sciences/drug discovery
AI for physical systems / IoT / robotics
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and partner at SmartGateVC (since 2017), leading pre‑seed and seed investments in AI and deep‑tech startups across the U.S. and Armenia. Prior roles include investment advisor at Gulf Equity Partners, associate/compliance officer at Granatus Ventures and management consulting at EV Consulting. Holds a PhD in Economics (Yerevan State University) and serves as an adjunct lecturer on venture capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in deep tech and AI: BCI, AI x physical world/IoT, AI in life sciences/drug discovery, cybersecurity and related infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing principal (general partner) at Maccabee Ventures and adjunct professor at Yeshiva University. Over 25 years as an entrepreneur, angel investor and advisor focused on early-stage technology companies. Known for work in SilverTech (aging), digital health, PropTech, FinTech and cybersecurity; holds FINRA Series 7 and 63.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and managing principal of Maccabee Ventures; former SVP at Meridian Equity Partners and Chief Innovation Officer at The Kensington Group. Managing member of family office BFI, LLC and adjunct professor teaching angel & venture capital at Yeshiva University (Sy Syms). Education: B.A. Yeshiva University; LMSW Wurzweiler School of Social Work; J.D. Fordham University School of Law.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments in SilverTech (aging), digital health, PropTech, FinTech, cybersecurity, B2B SaaS and AI/ML/converging technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Divvy Homes and former early-stage investor at DFJ. Previously led product and financing at Square and worked in private equity (TPG) and investment banking. Holds a BS from Cornell and an MBA from Stanford GSB.
enrichment.career_background: Adena Hefets is co-founder and CEO of Divvy Homes (founded 2017). She was an early-stage fintech investor at DFJ (2016–2017), before which she worked on Square Capital (product & financing), was a private equity associate at TPG and began her career in investment banking. She holds a B.S. from Cornell and an MBA from Stanford GSB.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and fintech investments; later work focused on proptech and consumer finance

enrichment.personal_bio: Atlanta-based entrepreneur and ecosystem builder. Co‑founder, Executive Chairman & CEO of Opportunity Hub (OHUB); former Partner/Senior Partner at TechSquare Labs. Active angel investor and General Partner of the 100 Black Angels + Allies Fund, focused on inclusive entrepreneurship and early‑stage tech.
enrichment.career_background: Rodney Sampson is a serial entrepreneur and investor. He co‑founded Opportunity Hub (OHUB) and served as Executive Chairman & CEO; co‑founded streaming and media startups (Multicast Media/StreamingFaith, EFactor) with exits; served as a Partner at TechSquare Labs (via an OHUB merger, c.2015–2017); and is General Partner of 100 Black Angels + Allies Fund and a Venture Partner at Draper Goren Holm. He has held adjunct/visiting roles at academic and policy institutions and is based in Atlanta, GA.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage/seed technology startups (enterprise SaaS, AI, developer/platform products); ecosystem & diversity‑focused funds and mission‑driven startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Miami-based angel investor and community builder. Co-founder of Flamingo Capital and Managing Director at Arkive; long-time operator and advisor in media‑tech and Web3. Active angel investor with public investments including Epic Games, Acorns and Caribu. Holds an MBA and BS from Binghamton University.
enrichment.career_background: Chris Adamo is a Miami‑based investor and operator who has served as Chief Business Officer at WhereBy.Us, helped scale partnerships at 1‑800‑Flowers, co‑founded Flamingo Capital (a Miami syndicate) and later joined Arkive as Managing Director. He is an active angel investor and advisor across consumer, gaming, Web3 and fintech startups and a community organizer in the Miami tech ecosystem.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed & Seed; AI and data‑driven software for foundational industries (financial services, logistics/trade, healthcare, manufacturing); US & Latin America

enrichment.personal_bio: Hacker, inventor and technology futurist; former inventor at Intellectual Ventures and early contributor at Blue Origin and MakerBot. Now a General/Managing Partner at Deep Future, backing deep‑tech founders and publishing the Deep Future podcast.
enrichment.career_background: Led invention projects at Intellectual Ventures, worked on early Blue Origin systems and early cryptocurrency/AI projects, founded startups (e.g., Bombsheller, Komposite), advised companies including Glowforge and data.world, and serves as General/Managing Partner at Deep Future where he invests in deep‑tech startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / seed deep tech: hardware, space, energy, biotech, advanced manufacturing, AI/robotics

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner & CEO of Blockchain Coinvestors and co‑founder of Fifth Era and Keiretsu. Longtime strategy consultant and former Gap executive who now focuses on blockchain, tokenization and early‑stage investing. Author and frequent industry speaker.
enrichment.career_background: Matthew Le Merle spent ~21 years as a strategy and operations advisor at firms including McKinsey, A.T. Kearney, Monitor Group and Booz; later served as SVP of strategy and corporate development at Gap. He co‑founded Fifth Era and Keiretsu, and is Managing Partner & CEO of Blockchain Coinvestors; he has held chair/advisory roles at multiple blockchain and fintech companies and is a published author on innovation and investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Blockchain & crypto (fund‑of‑funds and token investments); early‑stage venture and seed/Series A; fintech and tokenization/security‑token infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Faye Sahai is Managing Director at Vinaj Ventures and Founding Managing Partner of Telosity, a fund that invests in digital wellness and youth mental-health startups. She focuses on early-stage digital health and behavioral-health companies. Sahai previously led innovation and investment programs at Kaiser Permanente, AIG, Blue Shield of California and Schwab.
enrichment.career_background: Sahai is an innovation leader and investor with 20+ years in healthcare, insurance, financial services and consulting. She launched and managed corporate innovation labs and funds (Kaiser Permanente, AIG), held senior roles at Blue Shield and Schwab, worked at Deloitte Consulting, co-founded startups, and now manages Telosity by Vinaj Ventures while serving on several advisory boards. She holds an MBA from UCLA Anderson and a BA from Claremont McKenna College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Digital wellness and behavioral/mental-health startups (pre-seed to Seed/Series A), primarily North America, with emphasis on youth mental health and scalable, evidence-informed solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial founder, product leader, and early-stage investor. Co‑founded Mexican.vc and Drone.VC; founded PBworks and Hacker Dojo. Former product manager at Google and Facebook and founder/CEO of Medcorder. Stanford BS in Computer Science.
enrichment.career_background: David Weekly is a serial entrepreneur and angel investor who has founded multiple startups and venture vehicles (PBworks, Hacker Dojo, Medcorder, Drone.VC, Mexican.vc). He has held product leadership roles at Google and Facebook, has served as a mentor to accelerator programs, and has invested in and advised early‑stage hardware and software companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage internet/software and hardware startups targeting the Mexican/Latin American market; lightweight, scalable software and early hardware (drones/robotics) plays.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Partner at Switch Ventures, based in San Francisco. Former early executive at AppDirect and ex-consultant at McKinsey & Company. Focuses on seed and early-stage investments and partnering closely with founders.
enrichment.career_background: Paul Arnold previously worked as a consultant at McKinsey & Company and was an early senior executive at AppDirect (head of business operations). He founded Switch Ventures and serves as Founder & Partner, investing primarily at seed and early stages. Education listed in public profiles includes a J.D. from the University of Michigan Law School and a B.S. from the University of Utah.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage investments across consumer, marketplaces, fintech, healthtech and B2B SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at K50 Ventures who leads the firm’s Work & Learning focus and invests across the US and LATAM. Previously on the investment team at Flybridge Capital Partners and held operating roles at Dreamit and Offerpop; co‑founded a consumer messaging app. Cornell B.S. in Entrepreneurship; splits time between New York City, Mexico City and Istanbul.
interests: Future of work & learning (edtech, workforce platforms)
Early-stage (pre-seed & seed) investing in US & LATAM
enrichment.career_background: Founding partner at K50 Ventures (joined 2020) focused on pre-seed and seed investments in work, health and finance. Prior to K50 he was on Flybridge’s investment team (sourced/supporting deals including Imperfect Foods, Wethos, Narrator) and earlier held operator/accelerator roles at Dreamit Ventures and Offerpop and co‑founded a consumer messaging startup. Active volunteer with NYC entrepreneur programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & seed investments in Health, Finance and Work (including edtech and workforce platforms); primary geographies: United States and Latin America.

enrichment.personal_bio: Independent angel investor and operator. Former partner on the deal team at Andreessen Horowitz and later led startup/VC partnerships roles at Google and YouTube. As of 2024–2025 has worked on startup/API partnerships at OpenAI. Active in seed/pre-seed angel activity in tech sectors including Web3 and developer platforms.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in finance and product roles early in his career (including UBS and Proclivity), joined Andreessen Horowitz as a partner on the deal team (circa 2015–2018), then held startup/VC partnership roles at Google Cloud and product/Chief of Staff roles at YouTube (2018–2024). In 2024 moved to a startups/API-focused role at OpenAI and invests independently at the angel/seed stage.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel / seed-stage investments focused on AI and developer platforms, Web3/crypto, marketplaces and consumer products, enterprise SaaS and cloud infrastructure, and AR/VR.

enrichment.personal_bio: Builder and seed-stage investor based in New York City. Co‑founder of Workstreamer (acquired 2009) and Heights Media; has held roles building capital networks including Director of On Deck Angels. Partner at Intangible Ventures and active angel investor and advisor.
enrichment.career_background: Sam Huleatt is a founder-turned-investor with an MBA from Johns Hopkins and a BA from Bates College. He co‑founded Workstreamer and Heights Media, served as Director for On Deck Angels & Fund Team (2021–2023), was an EIR at Primary Venture Partners, and is a partner at Intangible Ventures, advising and investing in early-stage startups and capital-network initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage early investments; hands-on operator support for founders; sectors include B2B SaaS, marketplaces, fintech, adtech and consumer/health-adjacent startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Vice President, Unlocking Innovation at LACI, overseeing founder-facing incubation programs and LACI’s investment vehicles (LACI Impact Fund and Cleantech Debt Fund). Prior roles include VP Corporate Strategy at Groupe PSA and head of the automotive industry vertical at the World Economic Forum; earlier experience at Coda Automotive, Toyota Europe and McKinsey. Education includes a BA from Stanford University and an MBA from The Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Alex Mitchell leads LACI’s incubator and investment activities with a focus on scaling cleantech startups and deploying non-dilutive and venture capital strategies. He previously served as VP of Corporate Strategy at Groupe PSA, headed the automotive industry vertical at the World Economic Forum, and held operational roles at Coda Automotive, Toyota Europe and McKinsey. He holds undergraduate and graduate degrees from Stanford and Wharton respectively.
enrichment.investment_focus: Cleantech / climate tech (especially sustainable mobility and transportation), early-stage incubation and commercialization, and climate-focused finance (debt and impact funds).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Alloy Fund and co‑founder & CEO of Magna. Former co‑founder of Synapse (acquired) and product lead at Palantir; holds a BS in Computer Science & Engineering from MIT. Based in San Francisco / New York area.
enrichment.career_background: Bruno Faviero is an MIT‑trained technologist and early‑stage investor. He co‑founded Synapse (later acquired), led product at Palantir, founded startups including Maple and Magna, and is a founding partner at Alloy Fund and a former partner at Graduate Fund. He writes occasional angel checks and focuses on pre‑seed/seed operator investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed / seed) investments in AI, Web3/crypto, SaaS and enterprise software, fintech, govtech, and biotech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Rui Ma is an angel and early-stage investor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. She served as Greater China Partner at 500 Startups and was a Venture Partner at Synaptic Ventures (2020–2021). She founded Tech Buzz China and has a background in investment banking and cross-border investing.
enrichment.career_background: Rui Ma has worked in investment banking and investing (Merrill Lynch, Morgan Stanley, The Raine Group), served as Greater China Partner at 500 Startups, founded Tech Buzz China, led the nonprofit Rookie.Fund, and held venture partner roles including at Synaptic Ventures (2020–2021). She is based in the San Francisco Bay Area and has operated across the US and Greater China.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage companies in psychedelic medicines and related life-sciences, and early-stage technology companies preparing for North American capital markets.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Favs and former global startup pipeline lead at Techstars. Venture partner/advisor on Techstars Rising Stars and an early-stage investor and startup mentor. Background includes founding roles at Orai and CMO at Evolve (acquired by HubSpot).
enrichment.career_background: Saba Karim led global startup sourcing and pipeline efforts at Techstars (Pipeline/Head of Startup Pipeline) and served as a partner/advisor on the Techstars Rising Stars pre-seed fund. He co-founded Orai, served as CMO at Evolve (acquired by HubSpot), and is founder & CEO of consumer social startup Favs. Educated at Deakin University and Stanford (Global Management).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and early-stage startups (consumer social, marketplaces, productivity/dev tools, fintech/DeFi) with focus on founder support, accelerator-backed deals, and underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Infinita Fund. Focuses on accelerating "stranded technologies" by using startup cities, network states and legal engineering to reduce regulatory frictions. Based in Próspera (Roatán, Honduras).
interests: Regulatory and legal engineering for innovation
enrichment.career_background: Founder & General Partner at Infinita Fund (since 2022); co‑founder/CEO of Vitalia / Infinita City; former founder of MetaMeet and early-stage operator with prior roles in strategy and growth at companies including Dalia Research and consulting experience. Educated at Hertie School (MPP) and Syracuse University (MA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage investments in biotechnology (longevity), web3/crypto, hard tech/hardware, logistics and startups that leverage special jurisdictions/startup cities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and CEO of Canal (ShopCanal Inc.), a distributed commerce/ecommerce marketplace platform. Former Consumer Investment Partner at Andreessen Horowitz (2017–2021). Based in San Francisco and focused on consumer software, marketplaces and commerce infrastructure.
enrichment.career_background: Co-founded Canal in 2021 and has served as its CEO. Prior to founding Canal he was a consumer investor/partner at Andreessen Horowitz (2017–2021). Earlier roles include business development at Omniata and Heighten, fixed-income work at Jefferies, and finance/macroeconomic strategy at the Government Development Bank for Puerto Rico. Education includes a B.A. from Yale University and graduate study at the National University of Singapore.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer & marketplace startups; ecommerce and DTC brand distribution; commerce infrastructure/platforms; typically early-stage (seed to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and operator in the creator economy. Founder of Flywheel and partner/president at Yoola; serves as a scout for NFX and a strategic advisor to Spotter. Focuses on building businesses and consumer products with digital creators and on content monetization.
enrichment.career_background: Eyal Baumel co-founded Bites TV and led Yoola as CEO/partner, scaling its creator network and global distribution. He is founder of Flywheel (creator venture studio), serves as an NFX scout (early-stage sourcing) and is a strategic advisor to Spotter, working at the intersection of creators, product ventures, and media distribution.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed); creator economy and digital media; consumer & DTC brands; marketplaces and network-effect businesses

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor and advisor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Member of Sand Hill Angels since 2017 with a background as a marketing and strategy executive. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a B.Sc. from the University of Toronto. Active as an advisor to early-stage technology companies and a volunteer high‑school CS teacher.
enrichment.career_background: Over a multi‑decade career he has held senior roles at McKinsey (Senior Engagement Manager), Accenture (Managing Partner), McCaw Cellular (CMO) and NextWave (SVP Sales & Marketing), served as CEO/founder of several startups (e.g., Wifi.com, Trust.MD, Wavespot), and more recently acts as an investor/advisor to startups and organizations such as Barcelona Ventures and AlphaICs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage and early-stage technology companies (telecom/wireless, SaaS/enterprise software, healthcare & medical devices); active in marketing/GT M and product-led growth areas.

enrichment.personal_bio: Head of Bloomberg Beta, an early‑stage VC backed by Bloomberg L.P., Roy Bahat leads investments focused on the future of work and machine intelligence. He teaches at UC Berkeley’s Haas School of Business and blogs on work and career topics. Previously he served in New York City government and held executive roles in media and startups.
enrichment.career_background: Roy Bahat has led Bloomberg Beta since its 2013 launch. Before that he held senior roles in government (senior policy director in New York City), media (president of IGN Entertainment, News Corp.), and founded/chairman roles at consumer startup OUYA. He is a lecturer at UC Berkeley’s Haas School of Business and a Rhodes Scholar from Oxford (undergraduate at Harvard).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments focused on the future of work, machine intelligence/AI, developer tools, productivity and HR/EdTech for businesses

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and longtime leader of Backstage Capital, a VC firm she launched in 2015 to back underestimated founders. Built the firm while experiencing homelessness and has focused on investing in women, people of color, and LGBTQ founders. Author of It's About Damn Time and host of the podcast 'Your First Million.'
enrichment.career_background: Worked in the music and live-production industries before teaching herself venture investing and founding Backstage Capital in 2015. Under her leadership Backstage deployed capital into a large portfolio of underrepresented founders, launched accelerator programs, ran crowdfunding initiatives for the firm, and published a book (It's About Damn Time). In 2024 she announced a transition to a chair/advisory role while continuing public-facing programming and fundraising efforts.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in companies founded by women, people of color, and LGBTQ entrepreneurs; consumer and tech-enabled startups; accelerator & mission-driven programs

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Managing Partner of Plexo Capital, an investor that backs emerging seed-stage VC funds (particularly led by diverse GPs) and makes direct early-stage investments. Incubated Plexo inside GV (Google Ventures) and spun it out in 2018. Former investing and operating leader with roles at GV, Comcast Ventures (Catalyst Fund), Zynga and senior roles at eBay and Nike. Holds an MBA from UC Berkeley (Haas) and a BS from Hampton University.
enrichment.career_background: Lo Toney incubated and spun out Plexo Capital from GV and serves as its founding managing partner. Prior to Plexo he was a partner at GV, led Comcast Ventures Catalyst Fund, served as GM for Zynga (Zynga Poker), and held senior product/GM roles at Nike and eBay. He has also been a founder/CEO (LearnStreet) and worked in consulting and corporate development; he holds an MBA from UC Berkeley (Haas) and a BS from Hampton University.
enrichment.investment_focus: LP investments into emerging seed-stage venture funds (focus on diverse GPs) and direct early-stage startup investments; sectors include marketplaces, consumer internet, fintech/payments, gaming/e-sports, enterprise software and infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Lerer Hippeau; longtime media and tech investor and operator. Former Chairman & CEO of Ziff‑Davis and CEO of The Huffington Post; co‑founder of NowThis News and former partner at SoftBank Capital.
enrichment.career_background: Eric Hippeau began his career in publishing (served as President/CEO/Chairman of Ziff‑Davis), moved into venture as a Managing Partner at SoftBank Capital (early 2000s), served as CEO of The Huffington Post (2009–2011) and co‑founded NowThis News. He joined Lerer Hippeau as a managing partner around 2010 and has since led and advised media, consumer and enterprise investments. He was educated at the Lycée Français and Sorbonne (Paris).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) generalist investing across consumer and enterprise, with emphasis on digital media, D2C consumer brands, and health/AI

enrichment.personal_bio: Silicon Valley–based serial entrepreneur and investor (MIT MBA). Co‑founder/CEO of Evensi (acquired) and founder of multiple tech startups; active as a GP and fund manager. Focuses on creator economy, media/ music tech and Web3-related opportunities.
enrichment.career_background: Paolo Privitera is a serial founder and operator with over two decades in internet and media businesses. He co‑founded and led Evensi (event discovery platform) and earlier startups including Pick1, Digitix and Mestre; after Evensi's acquisition he served in corporate development at Events.com. He is a General Partner at ME Ventures and a fund manager/partner at 1521 Ventures, and serves as advisor/mentor to multiple accelerators and startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments in the creator economy: music & media technology, creator tools/platforms, Web3/blockchain for creators, fintech and distribution for creative industries

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Ludlow Ventures, a Detroit-based early-stage VC. University of Michigan graduate and Kauffman Fellow. Has invested in dozens of startups including Honey and StockX and serves as a mentor to multiple accelerators.
enrichment.career_background: Launched Ludlow Ventures in 2009 and has led the firm’s seed and early-stage investing activity from Detroit. Prior to Ludlow he was Creative Director at Discovery Productions and ran Triest Group, a UI/UX-focused design firm. He is a Kauffman Fellow and mentors at several accelerators; Ludlow’s portfolio includes a mix of consumer and B2B startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage venture investments across consumer marketplaces, enterprise SaaS/developer tools, mobility and hardware; typical check sizes in the ~$150k–$750k range.

enrichment.personal_bio: Ron Conway is the founder and a managing partner of SV Angel and a long-time Silicon Valley angel investor. Active since the mid-1990s, he has backed numerous early-stage technology companies, including early stakes in Google, Facebook and Airbnb. He is also known for civic engagement and philanthropy, including work on immigration reform and health-care giving.
interests: Civic engagement and public policy (e.g., immigration reform)
Diversity and economic inclusion for founders of color
enrichment.career_background: Conway worked in marketing at National Semiconductor (1973–1979), co‑founded and served as president/CEO of Altos Computer Systems (1979–1990) and later led Personal Training Systems (1991–1995). He began angel investing in the mid‑1990s, founded Angel Investors LP in 1998, and launched SV Angel as his investment vehicle (formalized as a firm in 2009).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage technology startups (software, AI); founder‑centric angel and seed investing.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Zigg Capital, a New York–based VC focused on real estate and construction technology. Previously co‑founder & CEO of Floored (acquired by CBRE) and an early employee at Bonobos and TellApart. Invests in early-stage companies that intersect real estate, construction, hospitality and associated financial services.
interests: Residential & commercial real-estate finance / mortgage tech
enrichment.career_background: Started his career at Bain & Company, then held early roles at Bonobos and TellApart. Co‑founded Floored in 2012 and served as CEO until its acquisition by CBRE in 2017; subsequently led CBRE’s digital/technology team. Co‑founder of Red Swan Ventures and founding partner of Zigg Capital (launched 2018/2019), where he leads early-stage investments in property, construction and related technology companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments (pre-seed to Series B) in real estate and construction technology, plus related enterprise SaaS, marketplaces and real-estate finance/insurtech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Cota Capital. Founded Saba Software and took it public; has invested in and mentored 100+ early-stage companies. Holds a B.A. in Applied Mathematics from the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and investor: worked in R&D roles at Oracle (late 1980s–1997), founded Saba Software (1997; later public), founded the family office Signatures Capital (2006), and co‑founded Cota Capital where he serves as a managing/founding partner focused on private and public enterprise technology investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Modern enterprise technology (early‑stage to growth/public): enterprise software, data & AI infrastructure, healthtech/biotech, deep tech/hardware, space and geospatial solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and investor; chairman of VaynerX and CEO of VaynerMedia. Founder/creator of VeeFriends and a prolific angel investor; co‑founder of Vayner/RSE, a New York–based early‑stage VC.
enrichment.career_background: Gary Vaynerchuk started by growing his family liquor business (Wine Library) into an e‑commerce leader, launched Wine Library TV, then co‑founded VaynerMedia (now part of VaynerX). He has co‑founded multiple companies (Resy, Empathy Wines, VaynerSports, VeeFriends) and invests across consumer tech, media, and crypto through angel rounds and Vayner/RSE.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early institutional rounds in consumer technology, media/marketing platforms, marketplaces, and web3/crypto

enrichment.personal_bio: Geoff Yang is a co‑founder and partner emeritus of Redpoint Ventures. He has invested across consumer media, digital content and network infrastructure and serves on several public and private boards. He holds a BSE from Princeton and an MBA from Stanford.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Redpoint Ventures in 1999 after serving as a General Partner at Institutional Venture Partners (IVP) from 1987–1999. Earlier roles included positions at First Century Partners and IBM. He is founder/CEO of Apeiron Life and has held board roles at Franklin Templeton, Warner Bros. Discovery and multiple Redpoint portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer media & digital content; network and infrastructure; consumer internet — primarily growth/later stages (Series C+).

enrichment.personal_bio: Writer and podcaster (Lenny’s Newsletter, Lenny’s Podcast), former Product Lead at Airbnb. Part-time angel investor and advisor; invests through AirAngels and personal checks. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Former engineer and founder (Localmind), joined Airbnb after an acquisition and rose to Product Lead for supply growth. Since 2019 he publishes Lenny’s Newsletter, hosts Lenny’s Podcast, and has been an active angel investor and advisor to early-stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology companies (pre-seed to Series A) across product-driven consumer and developer software, marketplaces, creator economy, and infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and co‑CEO of Blaze (no‑code/low‑code platform). Previously co‑founder and CEO of Enplug (digital signage software) and co‑founder of Nanoly Bioscience. Investment partner at XFactor Ventures and serves on public and nonprofit boards including CarParts.com.
enrichment.career_background: Serial founder and operator: co‑founded Nanoly Bioscience in college, led Enplug as CEO, and later co‑founded Blaze, where she is co‑CEO. She is an investment partner at XFactor Ventures (pre‑seed/seed) and holds board and advisor roles for public companies and nonprofit organizations. UC Berkeley alumnus.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed investments in B2B (SaaS), frontier tech, fintech, real estate/proptech, manufacturing, and logistics.

enrichment.personal_bio: Chris Sacca is a venture investor and founder of Lowercarbon Capital, which backs climate-focused startups. He previously founded Lowercase Capital and served as Google’s Head of Special Initiatives, and was an early backer of companies including Twitter, Uber, and Instagram. Since 2017 he shifted to climate investing and now leads Lowercarbon’s science and investment team. He is based in Jackson, Wyoming.
enrichment.career_background: Former attorney and Georgetown Law graduate, Sacca worked in corporate development at Google (Head of Special Initiatives) before founding Lowercase Capital, a prolific early-stage investor. In 2017 he pivoted away from broad VC to focus on climate and policy work, later founding Lowercarbon Capital to invest in companies reducing and removing greenhouse gases while supporting related research and philanthropy.
enrichment.investment_focus: Climate tech and decarbonization-focused venture investing (carbon removal, clean energy, industrial & materials decarbonization); primarily early-stage to growth-stage startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner of Everywhere Ventures, a global pre‑seed fund and founder collective. Former Managing Director at Techstars (7.5 years); adjunct professor at Columbia University and Cornell Tech. Active first‑check investor reported to have backed hundreds of early‑stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Jenny Fielding is a lawyer‑by‑training, two‑time founder and early‑stage investor. She was Managing Director at Techstars (led fintech/IoT cohorts), headed digital ventures at BBC Worldwide, and co‑founded Everywhere Ventures (The Fund) to run a community‑driven pre‑seed platform; she also teaches entrepreneurship at Columbia and Cornell Tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Global pre‑seed / first checks; sectors: money (fintech), health, and work (future of work); community‑driven, founder/operator LP model.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Bronze Investments, a venture firm based in East Palo Alto that invests with an Eastside/community-focused, impact-driven thesis. 20+ year Silicon Valley investor and entrepreneur, former national track-and-field champion, Marshall Scholar and Oxford MBA. Serves on boards and investment committees including Planned Parenthood and The California Endowment.
enrichment.career_background: Stephen DeBerry founded Bronze Investments in 2009 and is its Managing Partner. Previously he was a Partner at Kapor Capital and an Investment Director at Omidyar Network; he has invested in and advised dozens of startups and managed LP positions across venture and other funds. He is active on nonprofit and institutional investment committees (e.g., The California Endowment, Planned Parenthood) and is a Marshall Scholar and Aspen Institute Henry Crown Fellow.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage / seed venture investing focused on fintech and financial inclusion, health & education technology, marketplaces and community-centered impact investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and former founder. Co‑founder and CEO of Bow & Drape (sold 2019); has served as an Investment Partner at XFactor Ventures and is a General Partner at Alpaca VC. Focuses on early‑stage consumer and commerce investments and serves on multiple company boards.
enrichment.career_background: Aubrie Pagano graduated from Harvard (BA) and began her career in strategy at Fidelity. She co‑founded Bow & Drape in 2012 and led the company to retail distribution and an acquisition in 2019. Toward the end of that journey she began angel/partner investing with XFactor Ventures and joined Alpaca VC as a General Partner in 2020; she currently sits on several boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed (female‑founded); consumer & DTC; commerce enablement & supply chain; health & wellness; sustainability

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Accelerator Ventures and senior partner/communications & media practice leader with a history of founding and advising technology and digital-media startups. Co-founder of MerchantCircle and Spoke; active angel investor and board advisor in mobile, games and local-commerce companies.
enrichment.career_background: Ben T. Smith IV began his career in management consulting (A.T. Kearney), co‑founded Spoke and MerchantCircle, served in executive roles at Borland/CodeGear and Reply!/MerchantCircle, and has been a venture partner and angel investor since the 2000s. He has held board and advisor roles at multiple startups and has written and published on digital media and startup strategy.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed/Seed consumer internet, local commerce and digital media (mobile/apps, marketplaces, adtech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Coughdrop Capital, an early‑stage microfund that invests in pre‑seed and seed B2B software. Founder/CEO of Racket and previously founder of Capiche and executive at Inside.com. Active angel/pre‑seed investor and early customer/investor in several well‑known startups.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Coughdrop Capital in 2015 and serves as a General Partner. Previously founded and led startups including Racket and Capiche, and held product/growth roles (Inside.com, developer evangelist roles earlier in his career). Invests and advises early‑stage founders, focusing on product and go‑to‑market support.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed-stage B2B software (SaaS, marketplaces); founder-first microfund checks; go-to-market and growth support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & General Partner at Logos Labs and co‑founder & President of XMTP. Former CEO & co‑founder of Assist (acquired) and co‑founder of Squared Away. Early‑stage investor focused on startups in Web3, remote work, and developer tooling. Based in Nashville, TN.
enrichment.career_background: Serial founder and operator. Co‑founded XMTP (decentralized messaging protocol) and Ephemera; founded Assist (enterprise messaging/AI, later acquired) and co‑founded Squared Away. Runs Logos Labs as a studio/rolling fund to invest in early‑stage startups. Education: Western Illinois University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early‑stage startups (future of work, remote work tooling, Web3/crypto, developer tools, AI & conversational interfaces)

enrichment.personal_bio: Benjamin Todd Jealous is an American civic leader and investor, best known as the youngest-ever president & CEO of the NAACP (2008–2013) and a Rhodes Scholar. He has worked in social-impact venture investing as a partner at Kapor Capital and has served in leadership roles at People For the American Way and the Sierra Club. Jealous is a Professor of Practice at the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Jealous led the NAACP (2008–2013), joined the Kapor Center/Kapor Capital team to focus on impact investing in tech startups, and later held leadership roles at People For the American Way and the Sierra Club. He teaches as a Professor of Practice at the University of Pennsylvania. Education: BA, Columbia University; MSc (Rhodes Scholar), St Antony’s College, Oxford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage "gap-closing" tech startups (education, health, financial inclusion, justice, work); diversity-focused social-impact investing.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner and former managing partner at MiLA Capital, a seed-stage firm focused on "tech you can touch." Previously scaled NEO Tech (global contract manufacturer) and co‑founded the Make in LA accelerator and Toolbox LA. Currently works as a coach and fractional COO for scaling startups.
enrichment.career_background: Shaun Arora scaled his family manufacturing business, NEO Tech, from tens of millions to roughly $800M in revenue, earning supplier awards from Raytheon and Boeing. He co‑founded Make in LA and MiLA Capital to support early-stage hardware founders, has served on multiple boards (including Somabar and NEO Tech), and now provides fractional COO services and coaching for startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed hardware ("tech you can touch"); manufacturing & supply-chain enablement; mobility & aerospace; food & agtech; health & wellness; climate/cleantech

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & Chairman of Dale Ventures, a global investment holding group headquartered in Dubai. Veteran operator-turned-investor who has led and founded multiple internet businesses and now invests across fintech, technology, media, consumer and real estate. Holds an MBA in International Business from SMU Cox School of Business and is based in Dubai.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Dale Ventures (Dale Ventures FZE) and serves as Founder & Chairman; the firm (founded 2017) invests globally across financial & business services, technology & media, consumer/retail and real estate. Prior to investing he spent two decades founding and leading internet-based companies (roles reported include CEO/President of firms such as HealthYes and Netualize). Education includes an MBA in International Business (SMU Cox) and a BBA from Texas A&M.
enrichment.investment_focus: Invests across financial & business services, technology & media, consumer/retail and real estate; typically seed to early-growth stage, global mandate.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and managing director of O'Reilly AlphaTech Ventures (OATV). Founder and architect of the Indie.vc / INDIE strategy focused on revenue-first, bootstrapped-friendly funding. Holds a B.A. in Philosophy from Brigham Young University. citeturn5search3turn2search1turn0search1
enrichment.career_background: Co-founded OATV in 2005 and has led seed and early-stage investments there; earlier roles include work at Wasatch Venture Fund and founding/operating startups and conferences (FlipDog, Open Source Business Conference). Later founded Indie.vc and led OATV's INDIE strategy. citeturn5search3turn2search2turn0search1
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in consumer and enterprise software & services; supports revenue-first, bootstrapped business models (Indie.vc). citeturn5search3turn2search1

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and general partner at Uncorrelated Ventures, focused on early-stage infrastructure software, open source, fintech and crypto. Previously a managing director at Bain Capital Ventures and a general partner at Bay Partners. Holds a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Cornell University and an M.S. in Electrical Engineering from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Salil founded Uncorrelated Ventures (2019) and runs the firm as its solo GP, investing primarily in infrastructure and decentralized technologies. Earlier he was Managing Director at Bain Capital Ventures (2013–2020) and a partner at Bay Partners; he has invested in 100+ companies over his venture career. Education: B.S., Cornell University; M.S., Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage infrastructure software (traditional & decentralized), open source, crypto/DeFi, fintech; seed through Series A

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner of BBG Ventures, an early‑stage VC backing female and other underestimated founders. Former media and consumer executive with leadership roles at ABC/Disney, Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia, Gilt Groupe and AOL; now focuses on seed and pre‑seed investments.
enrichment.career_background: Susan Lyne began in magazine publishing (founding editor of Premiere), moved into television and studio roles at Disney/ABC (rising to President, ABC Entertainment), and later served as CEO of Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia, CEO/Chair of Gilt Groupe and head of AOL’s Brand Group. In 2014 she co‑founded BBG Ventures and serves on multiple public and private boards (including GoPro and Blade).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) consumer and health startups led by female or otherwise underestimated founders; thesis areas include healthcare transformation, future of work & learning, financial inclusion, energy resiliency, vertical AI, and overlooked consumers.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Cross Culture Ventures and Co‑Founder & President of Q&A (music & technology). USC Marshall alum who works at the intersection of technology, media and music. Advisor to nonprofit and academic programs focused on entrepreneurship and youth tech education.
enrichment.career_background: Suzy Ryoo earned a B.S. from USC Marshall. She led innovations and emerging-platform initiatives at OMD before joining Troy Carter’s Atom Factory as VP, Technology & Innovation. Since 2015 she has served as a partner/venture partner at Cross Culture Ventures (working on sourcing, diligence and portfolio support) and co‑founded Q&A/Venice Music, where she is President and Chief Strategy Officer. She is a Kauffman Fellow and serves on/advises several nonprofit and university entrepreneurial programs.
enrichment.hometown: Born in Seoul, South Korea; grew up in Southern California, United States
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage, culture-driven consumer technology (marketplaces, commerce, media/entertainment), music/creator-economy businesses, and startups led by diverse founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and full‑time General Partner at Coalition Operators, an early‑stage fund and operator network. Former communications lead at Box, partner/VP of marketing at Social Capital, and VP of Communications at Glossier. Lives in Brooklyn and focuses on backing early startups and connecting senior operators with cap tables.
enrichment.career_background: Started in communications at Hill & Knowlton, then led global communications at Box (through IPO). Moved to Social Capital as its first marketing partner, later served as VP of Communications at Glossier, then transitioned to angel and pooled-scout investing before co‑founding Coalition Operators to invest in and support early‑stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed & early stage startups (sweet spot: Seed); sectors include future of work, commerce, climate, consumer and SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Kevin Durant is a professional basketball player and co‑founder of Thirty Five Ventures (35V) and Boardroom. Through 35V he invests in technology, media and sports properties and serves as a minority owner or investor in several sports teams and leagues. He also runs the Durant Family Foundation and has executive‑producing credits on film and TV projects.
enrichment.career_background: Kevin Durant (born Sept 29, 1988) is an NBA player who co‑founded Thirty Five Ventures and the Boardroom media network with Rich Kleiman. Off the court he invests via 35V in startups across fintech, crypto, health/wellness and media, holds minority stakes in sports properties, and supports youth programs through the Durant Family Foundation; 35V has also produced award‑winning film and TV projects.
enrichment.investment_focus: Family office investing across technology, sports, media & entertainment, fintech, AI, health & wellness, and emerging sports teams/leagues.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Quiet Capital and serial entrepreneur turned early-stage investor. Co‑founded Tapjoy and Karma (Karma was acquired) and previously led e-commerce initiatives at Facebook. Focuses on seed/pre-seed technology investments.
enrichment.career_background: Serial founder and operator who moved into investing. Co‑founded Tapjoy and Karma (acquired), worked on e-commerce/ads at Facebook, and held roles at Kleiner Perkins and Microsoft. Holds an MBA from Stanford GSB and a BSE in Computer Engineering from the University of Michigan; Managing Partner at Quiet Capital since 2017.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed and early-stage technology investments (consumer, marketplaces, commerce, AI, fintech, web3)

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial Silicon Valley entrepreneur and educator known for creating the customer-development / Lean Startup methods. Author of The Four Steps to the Epiphany and The Startup Owner's Manual; adjunct professor at Stanford and senior fellow at Columbia. Co‑founder of M34 Capital and an active seed/angel investor.
enrichment.career_background: Steve Blank spent the first part of his career founding or working at multiple technology startups (including Zilog, MIPS, Convergent Technologies, Ardent, SuperMac, Rocket Science Games and E.piphany). After retiring as a CEO he became an educator and author, created the Lean LaunchPad / I‑Corps curricula and has taught at Stanford, UC Berkeley, Columbia and other institutions. He is a co‑founder of M34 Capital and serves on/has served on multiple boards and advisory panels related to entrepreneurship, conservation and national security.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage investments in technology products & services; companies applying customer‑discovery/Lean methods; sectors include enterprise software, hardware, climate/cleantech, life sciences/healthcare and defense/national‑security technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Bain Capital Ventures who leads the Bay Area offices and focuses on early-stage application software and SaaS. Named to the Forbes Midas List (2012, 2013). Holds a BS in electrical engineering from Stanford and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
interests: Big data / machine learning for business apps
enrichment.career_background: Joined Bain Capital Ventures in 2003 and is a partner focused on seed and early-stage application software investing. Previously led product and sales at Trilogy (scaling revenues to $300M) and worked as a consultant at McKinsey. Serves on multiple portfolio boards and holds a patent titled “Method and Apparatus of Configuration Solutions.”
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage application software and SaaS (commerce enablement, sales & marketing/revenue operations, supply chain/industrial software, product-led growth, and AI/ML applied to business applications)

enrichment.personal_bio: Actor-turned-investor and entrepreneur. Co‑founded A‑Grade Investments and serves as General Partner at Sound Ventures, a VC firm he launched with Guy Oseary. Active angel and partner investor in consumer internet, fintech and AI companies and co‑founder/chair of the nonprofit Thorn.
enrichment.career_background: Began as an actor and media entrepreneur; moved into tech investing as an angel and co‑founder of A‑Grade Investments (2010). In 2015 he helped launch Sound Ventures with Guy Oseary, where he is a General Partner; he is also a co‑founder/chair of Thorn, a nonprofit combating child exploitation.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- and mid-stage technology companies (consumer & enterprise software), with a particular focus on AI/foundation models, marketplaces and fintech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Byers Capital and former General Partner at Google Ventures (GV). Ph.D. in Bioengineering from Stanford; invests across technology and biotechnology with a focus on deep tech and life sciences. Cofounder of NewLimit and an active angel/family-office investor.
enrichment.career_background: Blake Byers earned a Ph.D. in Bioengineering (Stanford), spent roughly a decade as a General Partner at Google Ventures (GV) where he led early-stage life‑science and technology investments, and founded Byers Capital (a single-family office) to invest directly in technology and biotech. He has cofounded NewLimit and maintains board/advisor roles across several startups; he also has an academic publication record in biomedical research.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology and biotechnology (Seed–Series A/B; opportunistic growth); deep tech (AI, mathematical reasoning, coding agents, quantum), drug discovery and clinical development, brain–computer interfaces, longevity.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment Partner at XFactor Ventures and a Managing Director at JPMorgan Chase. Founder of fintech startup Credit Hero and earlier founder of VIXXENN. Harvard College and Harvard Business School alum; based in New York, NY.
enrichment.career_background: Nicole Sanchez is an operator-turned-investor who co-founded consumer fintech Credit Hero and earlier founded VIXXENN. She has held product and general management roles at JPMorgan Chase (Managing Director / Consumer Bank) and previously worked in consulting (Bain) and marketing (Procter & Gamble). She joined XFactor Ventures as an investment partner to focus on early-stage, female-founded companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments (focus on female founders); sectors include fintech, insuretech, mobile/messaging, and early consumer/enterprise opportunities; geographic interest includes Latin America, Africa, and the Caribbean.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at Foundry Group and former co‑founder and principal engineer of Excite. Began venture career at Mobius Venture Capital in 2000 and focuses on early‑stage technology investing, with a preference for developer‑focused products, enterprise software, and consumer internet businesses. Holds a B.S. in Symbolic Systems from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Excite in 1993 and worked there as a principal engineer; joined Mobius Venture Capital as a principal in 2000; co‑founded Foundry Group in 2007 and serves as a partner focused on early‑stage technology investments. Educated at Stanford (B.S., Symbolic Systems).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology — developer‑focused products & platforms, enterprise software/SaaS, consumer internet

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director, growth at Redpoint Ventures focused on enterprise software, cloud infrastructure and developer-facing businesses. Has a strong interest in AI and has led investments in companies including Stripe, HashiCorp and Twilio. Named to the Forbes Midas List multiple times. Holds a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Duke University and an M.B.A. from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Longtime investor at Redpoint (joined shortly after the firm’s founding around 2000) who focuses on early growth and growth-stage enterprise software and infrastructure. Prior to venture capital he was Senior Manager of New Products at NorthPoint Communications, worked as a management consultant at Bain & Company, served as Director of Engineering at VideoPort Technologies, and began his career at Andersen Consulting. Educated at Duke University (B.S.E.E.) and Harvard Business School (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software (infrastructure & applications), cloud infrastructure, developer tools/platforms, open-source and growth-stage investments with interest in AI-enabled transformation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and founder focused on early-stage startups. Former investor at BoxGroup and Bullpen Capital; co-founder and Chief Strategy Officer (CSO) of Blueprint Finance, a DeFi infrastructure startup. Holds an undergraduate degree from UCLA.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in early-stage venture roles (Bullpen Capital, ~2019–2021; BoxGroup, ~2021–2022) before co-founding Blueprint Finance (CSO/Co-founder) to build DeFi infrastructure (Concrete Protocol). Educational background includes an undergraduate degree from UCLA.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Seed; early-stage investments in fintech, DeFi/crypto infrastructure, developer tools, marketplaces, and consumer software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Tyre Angel and an early HubSpot employee (hired as employee #6). Longtime sales and GTM leader who now works as an angel investor, advisor and board member for 25+ startups with an emphasis on diverse and socially responsible founders.
enrichment.career_background: Dan Tyre was an early HubSpot hire and spent 17+ years leading sales, partner and startup programs there. He founded Tyre Angel (2014) to provide capital, mentorship and go‑to‑market guidance to startups and serves as an angel investor, advisor and board member across more than 25 companies; he is also a limited partner in Stage 2 Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) B2B and B2C startups; GTM/sales enablement and RevOps; SaaS/CRM (HubSpot ecosystem); diversity-led and socially responsible companies

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at The General Partnership focused on building and investing with an emphasis on early-stage, builder-led startups. Former VP at First Round Capital with an earlier background in research and Asia Pacific real‑estate private equity. Writes and publishes on AI and startup-building topics and leads TheGP's NYC efforts.
enrichment.career_background: Started his career publishing research for U.S. congressional and federal science bodies, then worked at Asia Pacific Land on regional real‑estate investments. Joined First Round Capital in roles including Chief of Staff, Special Projects and VP of Investments (2014–2021), then joined The General Partnership in 2022 and became a partner in 2024, focusing on building programs, discovery methods and product‑centric support for portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed to Series A) startups; focus areas include AI/ML, hardware, healthtech, fintech, consumer and enterprise software; builder‑led companies and product‑focused teams.

enrichment.personal_bio: Seasoned founder and operator turned VC; joined Redpoint in 2017 and is a Managing Director focused on early-stage enterprise software. Previously co‑founded multiple enterprise startups, served as EVP & GM of ServiceCloud at Salesforce, and was CEO of Campaign Monitor.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded four enterprise software companies (three acquired, including Assistly which was acquired by Salesforce). Served as EVP & GM of Salesforce ServiceCloud, then CEO of Campaign Monitor, and joined Redpoint Ventures in 2017 where he invests in B2B/enterprise startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑ and growth‑stage B2B/enterprise software (SaaS), customer experience/CRM, AI/automation for back‑office and operations

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of NewME (the first accelerator for minority tech founders) and founder/executive chair of Streamlytics. Entrepreneur and investor focused on diversity in tech, ethical data ownership, and early-stage company building. Known for scaling accelerator programs, advising on AI/data strategy, and founding Fruit Ventures (venture studio).
enrichment.career_background: Angela Benton founded BlackWeb 2.0 (2007), launched the NewME Accelerator in 2011 (sold/transitioned in 2018–2019), and later founded Streamlytics (ethical data company). She has served as CEO/Executive Chairman at Streamlytics, leads Fruit Ventures (venture studio), and has been a public speaker and advisor on AI, data policy, and founder development.
enrichment.investment_focus: Minority-led / underrepresented founders; early-stage and seed-stage startups; ethical data and AI; accelerator and founder development programs.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and investor — co‑founder and CEO of data.world and founder of Bazaarvoice and Coremetrics. Joined Austin Ventures as a Venture Partner in 2012 and focuses on early‑stage software investing. Native Austinite involved in seed and angel investing through Hurt Family Investments.
enrichment.career_background: Brett Hurt founded Coremetrics (acquired by IBM) and later co‑founded Bazaarvoice, leading it through IPO and follow‑on transactions. He co‑founded data.world and serves as its CEO; he joined Austin Ventures as a Venture Partner in 2012 and invests via Hurt Family Investments. Education includes an MBA from The Wharton School and a BBA in MIS from the University of Texas at Austin.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage and seed software (SaaS, enterprise IT, data platforms); primarily Texas‑focused, lead and growth investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Summer Health and a Sequoia scout/partnered founder (partnered 2022). Previously led business development at hims & hers and worked in business operations at Twitter and in investment banking at Barclays. Holds an MBA with Distinction from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment banking at Barclays, then managed a business operations unit at Twitter. After earning an MBA at Harvard Business School (partnered at Rough Draft Ventures), she led strategic partnerships at hims & hers, served as a Sequoia scout/partnered founder (2022), and founded Summer Health (CEO). She is also an active angel investor and co‑author of a book on business development.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (Seed/Series A) consumer tech and digital health, with emphasis on pediatric/consumer healthcare and consumer products

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Matrix based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Former co‑founder and CEO of Parse (acquired by Facebook) and a part‑time partner at Y Combinator. Holds a B.S. and M.Eng. in Computer Science from Cornell University.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Parse and led it until its acquisition by Facebook; subsequently led developer‑facing products at Facebook/Meta. Served as a part‑time partner at Y Combinator (2014–2016) and joined Matrix as a General Partner in 2016. Active angel investor and board director for multiple portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage software (Seed/Series A); developer tools & infra; engineering‑driven/product companies; fintech & enterprise SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor formerly on VU Venture Partners' investment team; based in San Francisco. Prior roles include Developer Strategy (Metaverse Content Apps, Reality Labs) and Partner/Business Engineer work at Meta and software engineering roles at Microsoft and Uber. Active in early-stage/seed investing and developer-focused frontier technologies.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in software engineering and developer relations (Uber, Microsoft), then at Meta in fintech partnerships and Developer Strategy for Reality Labs/Metaverse content. Transitioned into venture investing with roles including Investor at VU Venture Partners and fellow/investor positions with programs such as SomosVC and The Council.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed–Series A) startups across AR/VR, frontier/deep tech, developer tools, space & robotics, web3/blockchain, and climate/AgTech

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Next47 focused on deep tech and industrial enterprise investments (robotics, manufacturing, logistics, AI/ML). Invests across early to growth-stage rounds and works with founders building hardware-software systems and vertical enterprise platforms. Education: B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Yale and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Grew up in Bulgaria. Trained as an electrical engineer (Yale) and earned an MBA at Harvard. Worked as an engineer and project manager at Synergy Efficiency Solutions in Indonesia, then moved into VC (G2VP) focusing on industrial and mobility tech before joining Next47 in 2019 as an investor; has served as an observer on industrial/robotics boards and participates in startup mentor networks.
