enrichment.investment_focus: Deep tech and enterprise (robotics, manufacturing/industrial tech, logistics & supply‑chain software, AI/ML, vertical SaaS); early through growth stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Khosla Ventures focused on biotechnology, digital health and AI/ML applications in medicine. He holds an MD and PhD in biomedical informatics from Stanford and has postdoctoral training in biochemistry/genetics; author of 50+ scientific publications. Serves on boards and advises multiple Khosla portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Khosla Ventures in a research/venture role (scientist-in-residence) and progressed to Principal then Partner. Trained as an MD/PhD in biomedical informatics at Stanford, completed postdoctoral work with Ronald W. Davis, and previously worked in AI research (MITRE) and as co‑founder/chief scientist of Stimulomics. Publishes and licenses biomedical/computational IP and works on company boards and new investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Biotechnology, digital health/medtech, and AI/ML applied to biology and medicine (genomics, precision/individualized medicine, neurotech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Pareto Holdings. Active early-stage angel investor and company builder; co‑founded Atom Finance and several startups and serves on multiple boards. Known for high-volume seed/pre-seed investing and incubating companies through Pareto.
enrichment.career_background: Edward Lando founded Pareto Holdings in 2020 and serves as its Managing Partner. He has co‑founded companies including Atom Finance, Goody, Zamp, Link Money and Palazzo, and is a founding investor/board member at Misfits Market and other portfolio companies. He is an active angel investor with numerous early investments and holds a degree from The Wharton School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups across fintech, consumer, SaaS, developer tools, Web3 and AI

enrichment.personal_bio: Elias Torres is a partner at The Community Fund and a serial tech founder and angel investor. He co-founded Drift (served as CTO) and has since founded AI startup Novy/Agency. Torres invests at early stages with a focus on community-driven and product-led companies.
enrichment.career_background: Torres began his career as an engineer at IBM, then held senior engineering roles (Lookery) before co-founding Performable (acquired by HubSpot). He served as VP of Engineering at HubSpot, then co‑founded Drift (CTO). More recently he founded Novy/Agency, was named a Henry Crown Fellow, and acts as an angel/partner investing in seed and pre-seed startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed community-driven companies; applied AI; future of work; early-stage SaaS and consumer products

enrichment.personal_bio: Eric Schmidt is a technologist and investor who co-founded Innovation Endeavors. He led Google as CEO (2001–2011) and later served as executive chairman/technical advisor at Alphabet; he also co-founded Schmidt Futures and the Special Competitive Studies Project (SCSP).
interests: Early-stage deep tech and engineering biology
enrichment.career_background: Eric Schmidt is a longtime technology executive and investor. He served as CEO of Google from 2001–2011 and as executive chairman/technical advisor of Alphabet through 2020; he co-founded the venture firm Innovation Endeavors (2010), the philanthropic/impact organization Schmidt Futures, and founded the Special Competitive Studies Project (SCSP). He has held board and advisory roles across academia, healthcare and government innovation initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed / Series A) investments in intelligent software & AI, computing infrastructure, physical economy/robotics, engineering health/biotech, climate/clean tech, supply chain and fintech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Kickstart Fund (founded 2008), a leading seed-stage investor in Utah and the Mountain West. He leads deal diligence and portfolio board work and has served on boards of multiple portfolio companies. Holds an MBA from Kellogg and a B.A. in Economics from Brigham Young University.
interests: Building the Mountain West startup ecosystem
enrichment.career_background: Gavin founded Kickstart in 2008 and has led the firm’s seed investing and platform efforts since then. Before Kickstart he worked at vSpring Capital (now Signal Peak) in roles including analyst/associate/principal. He holds an MBA from Northwestern University (Kellogg) and a B.A. in Economics from Brigham Young University and serves on multiple portfolio company boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed, seed, seed+) startups in the Mountain West; sector focus on enterprise & SMB software (SaaS), fintech, healthtech, marketplaces, and consumer SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Jennifer Fonstad is a venture investor and co‑founder and managing partner of Owl Capital. She previously co‑founded Aspect Ventures and was a Managing Director at Draper Fisher Jurvetson. She holds a BS from Georgetown University and an MBA with Distinction from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Started career as a consultant at Bain & Company, joined DFJ as a Kauffman Fellow and served as Managing Director (1997–2014), co‑founded Aspect Ventures in 2014, and launched Owl Capital in 2019. Serves on several boards (including the Mastercard Foundation and Broadway Angels) and has focused on software, healthcare, energy and consumer investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage venture investing focused on digital health, fintech, enterprise software and climate/energy.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and investor; Co‑Founder & Entrepreneur Partner at Unusual Ventures. Founded AppDynamics (acquired by Cisco), and co‑founded Harness and Traceable. IIT Delhi alumnus and active mentor to early‑stage founders.
enrichment.career_background: Founded AppDynamics in 2008 and led it through growth and its 2017 acquisition by Cisco. After launching BIG Labs, he co‑founded Harness and Traceable and in 2018 co‑founded Unusual Ventures to mentor and invest in seed‑stage startups. Recipient of regional entrepreneur awards and inventor on multiple US patents.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage investments in enterprise software, developer tools, infrastructure, AI and cybersecurity

enrichment.personal_bio: Author and early-stage investor. Managing Partner at Evolve VC and founder/operator of rolling funds; author of Love Yourself Like Your Life Depends On It. Invests in early-stage startups with emphasis on Web3/crypto, e-commerce/marketplaces and SaaS. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Kamal Ravikant is a serial entrepreneur, author and early-stage investor. He worked in product/monetization roles during the dot-com era (Healtheon/WebMD), later founded and advised startups, and went on to found Evolve VC and operate rolling-fund investing vehicles. He is also the author of several books on self-development.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed/Series A) startups in Web3/crypto, e-commerce & marketplaces, and SaaS/developer tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & Managing Partner of Horizon 3 Venture Studio. Serial entrepreneur who co‑founded Clover (acquired) and Bix (acquired); previously led product at eBay and Yahoo. MIT S.B. in Urban Planning; based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Leonard Speiser is a serial founder and investor. He co‑founded consumer and payments companies including Bix and Clover, served as Group Product Manager at eBay and Senior Director of Product at Yahoo, co‑founded the deep‑learning fund Neuron.VC, and currently runs Horizon 3 Venture Studio (partnering with large enterprises to found startups). He holds an S.B. from MIT.
enrichment.investment_focus: Corporate venture studio model (partnering with Fortune 500 clients); seed to Series A checks; focus areas include fintech/payments, proptech/real‑estate partnerships, AI/enterprise software and developer‑facing platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor and founding partner who led SoftBank’s consumer internet and e‑commerce investing efforts. As SBIA’s head of Consumer Internet & eCommerce she led and represented the firm on boards including Coupang, Flipkart and Fanatics. Prior to SoftBank she worked at M/C Partners, Goldman Sachs and J.P. Morgan and teaches entrepreneurial finance at Stanford.
enrichment.career_background: Started investment career at J.P. Morgan and worked in Goldman Sachs’ Principal Investment Area before joining M/C Partners as a vice president. Joined SoftBank in 2015 to help build its growth equity efforts, became a founding partner at SoftBank Investment Advisers and led the firm’s global e‑commerce and consumer internet investments; has served on multiple public and private boards and acted as a visiting lecturer at Stanford Graduate School of Business.
enrichment.investment_focus: E‑commerce, consumer internet and marketplaces; logistics/fulfillment and last‑mile; robotics & automation; fintech and growth/late‑stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CEO of Similarweb, a public digital intelligence company. Former founding partner at AfterDownload (acquired by ironSource) and an active angel investor. Listed as an NFX Scout (small/angel check sizes). Based in Israel with global activity.
enrichment.career_background: Or Offer founded Similarweb (digital market intelligence) and has served as its CEO since the company’s founding. He was a founding partner at AfterDownload (later acquired) and is an active angel investor in Israeli and global startups. He holds a B.A. in Information Technology and Marketing from Reichman University (IDC Herzliya).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed (angel scout checks ~$25k–$100k); sectors include AI, consumer internet, enterprise software and digital/data platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Patrick McKenna is a partner at Comeback Capital and co‑founder/executive chairman of Facet Wealth. He is an entrepreneur and early‑stage investor who co‑founded LiveOps and NexRep and has invested in 40+ startups. He previously served as a lieutenant in the U.S. Army and worked in M&A at Morgan Stanley; he holds an MBA from Georgetown and a BS from the University of Southern California.
enrichment.career_background: McKenna began his career as a technology officer in the U.S. Army, moved into M&A at Morgan Stanley, then joined Silicon Valley startups. He co‑founded LiveOps and NexRep, later co‑founded Facet Wealth and HighRidge Ventures, and now invests through Comeback Capital focusing on pre‑seed/seed opportunities outside traditional tech hubs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed‑stage technology startups (particularly in the American Heartland/Midwest); key sectors include FinTech, marketplaces, automation/robotics and future‑of‑work platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Partner at NextView Ventures who focuses on seed investments in software that improves everyday end‑user experiences. Former investor at Spark Capital and product lead at eBay; holds a BS from Duke and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Rob co‑founded NextView Ventures in 2010 and leads seed‑stage investing focused on companies that redesign the everyday economy. Previously he invested at Spark Capital and held product roles at eBay (Business Product Lead for Finding), Fidelity Investments, and BzzAgent; he has also served as an Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Harvard Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed‑stage investments in consumer software, vertical SaaS, marketplaces, digital health and everyday‑economy startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and scout active in early-stage deals. Stanford BS (Symbolic Systems); early product hire at Cometeer. Public profiles record angel investments including Marriage Pact and TuMeke, and list roles as a scout for early-stage funds (including Sequoia and OVO) and an investing role at True Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Stanford graduate (BS Symbolic Systems). Worked as a product hire at Cometeer, served as a scout for Sequoia and other early-stage funds, and has held investing/fellow roles at True Ventures; has participated in angel/pre-seed investments (e.g., TuMeke, Marriage Pact).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups; AI/ML, developer tools, consumer, fintech, and decentralized science (DeSci).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at AngelPad who invests in and mentors early-stage technology startups. Former Google product leader and co-author of patents related to search and advertising. Based in San Francisco.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded AngelPad in 2010 and runs its accelerator/investment program, acting as an early (often first) investor and hands‑on mentor to portfolio founders. Prior to AngelPad he spent ~7 years at Google in product roles (including international product marketing and product evangelism) and is listed as co‑author on patents for online advertising and local search.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage / early-stage technology startups (marketplaces, mobile, adtech, SaaS, data/AI)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and operator active in developer tooling and AI. Co‑founder of Blossom and Lemmings; listed as a partner/angel at Magic. Based between San Francisco and Vienna and active as an early‑stage investor and technologist.
enrichment.career_background: Serial founder and engineer — founded Blossom (project management/developer tooling), ran the Lemmings incubator and other projects, and has served as an angel investor and partner at Magic. More recently named co‑founder/CTO of Rakun; regularly speaks and mentors in the Vienna and San Francisco startup communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI/LLMs, developer‑facing tooling and SaaS; pre‑seed and seed stage startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-Founder and Managing Director at ForgePoint Capital, a sector-focused VC investing in cybersecurity and infrastructure software. Serial entrepreneur and early cybersecurity pioneer with multiple leadership roles and exits. Focuses on backing early-stage cybersecurity companies and helping them scale to exit.
enrichment.career_background: Alberto Yépez is a serial entrepreneur and investor who founded and led enCommerce (acquired by Entrust), served as Co-CEO and President of Entrust, and was Chairman & CEO of Thor Technologies (acquired by Oracle). He held senior roles at Apple and Oracle, served as Entrepreneur in Residence at Warburg Pincus, was a Managing Director at Trident Capital, and co-founded ForgePoint Capital. He holds a BS from the University of San Francisco and attended programs at Northwestern University's Kellogg School and the Universidad Nacional de Ingenieria in Lima, Perú.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture investments in cybersecurity, infrastructure software, AI/ML for security, identity, cloud security, application security, and cyber risk management.

enrichment.personal_bio: Andy Dunn is an entrepreneur and angel investor best known as co‑founder and long‑time CEO of Bonobos. He co‑founded Red Swan Ventures and has backed 100+ startups. He is founder/CEO of Pie and author of the memoir Burn Rate. He chairs the board of Monica + Andy.
enrichment.career_background: Dunn earned a B.A. from Northwestern and an MBA from Stanford. He worked at Bain & Company and Wind Point Partners before co‑founding Bonobos in 2007 (served ~10+ years as CEO; Bonobos sold to Walmart in 2017). He co‑founded Red Swan Ventures (seed/angel investing) and has backed many consumer and marketplace startups; he is founder/CEO of Pie and authored Burn Rate.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) consumer & consumer‑internet investments, DTC brands, marketplaces and platform businesses

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on the consumer investing team at Andreessen Horowitz, focused on Gen‑Z consumer trends, retail and commerce infrastructure, and the future of cities. Prior to a16z she was a seed‑stage investor at Floodgate and worked in product and engineering roles at startups including Solv Health and FundersClub. She began her career as a consultant at McKinsey & Company and graduated from Princeton University, magna cum laude. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
interests: Future of cities / real estate & construction
enrichment.career_background: Began as a management consultant at McKinsey in San Francisco, then worked in product and engineering roles at early startups (FundersClub, Solv Health). Moved into VC as a seed investor at Floodgate before joining Andreessen Horowitz as a partner on the consumer team, investing in early‑stage consumer, commerce, and education companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer (seed–Series A); marketplaces and social commerce; commerce & retail infrastructure; education/edtech; creator economy; future of cities / real estate.

enrichment.personal_bio: Annie Kadavy is an early-stage investor at Redpoint Ventures (joined 2018) who focuses on consumer and enterprise startups. She was an operator and investor at Charles River Ventures and Uber Freight and is an early backer of ClassPass, DoorDash and Patreon. She holds a B.A. and M.A. from Stanford and an MBA from Stanford GSB and is based in the Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Kadavy began her career at Bain & Company and worked at Warby Parker before moving into VC at Charles River Ventures, where she sourced or led early investments including ClassPass, DoorDash and Patreon. She later served as Head of Strategic Operations at Uber Freight and joined Redpoint in 2018 to lead early-stage consumer and enterprise investing; she serves on boards of several Redpoint portfolio companies (e.g., Guild Education, Tend, Bravado).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed/Series A) — consumer technology & marketplaces; enterprise/SaaS; AI; education (EdTech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Managing Partner at Founders' Co-op, a Seattle-based seed-stage venture fund. Early backer or lead seed investor in companies including Remitly, Outreach and Auth0. Former Techstars Seattle managing director and serial founder/operator with prior roles at Patagonia, Adjacency and Sapient.
enrichment.career_background: Co-founded Founders' Co-op in 2008 and serves as its Managing Partner, leading or participating in 100+ first-round financings in the region. Co-founded Adjacency (acquired), created Patagonia's first online retail channel, and held product/strategy roles at Sapient, AT&T and McCaw Cellular. Co-founded and led Techstars Seattle (2010–2019); serves on regional economic and nonprofit boards. Holds a BA from Yale and attended Stanford GSB (MBA program).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage software and SaaS startups in the Pacific Northwest

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor formerly a Director at SoftBank Investment Advisers (SBIA); currently a Partner at Gradient Ventures. Has invested across fintech, logistics, enterprise security and marketplace businesses and began her career at Morgan Stanley. Holds a BA in Economics and Mathematics from Columbia University.
enrichment.career_background: Started as an analyst at Morgan Stanley, was an associate at New Enterprise Associates (NEA), served as a Director at SoftBank Investment Advisers (2018–2023) where she backed companies such as Brex and Flexport, and joined Gradient Ventures as a Partner (2024–present). Educated at Columbia University (BA, Economics & Mathematics).
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise and consumer technology; fintech; logistics & transportation; healthtech; real estate/proptech; growth-stage and late-stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and angel investor; Venture Partner at Acequia Capital and CEO of Playlist (the parent brand uniting Mindbody, ClassPass, and Booker). Former CEO and longtime leader at ClassPass; early Microsoft corporate strategy executive. Has led or seeded investments in notable consumer and wellness technology companies.
enrichment.career_background: Started in product and corporate strategy at Microsoft, then founded Livestar (acquired by Pinterest). Cofounded Doppler Labs and other startups, served as executive chairman/CEO at ClassPass, and led ClassPass through its acquisition by Mindbody; has been a venture/angel investor and served as a venture partner at Acequia Capital. Currently leads Playlist (Mindbody/ClassPass/Booker) as CEO while continuing active angel investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in consumer internet, marketplaces, health & wellness (digital health), consumer hardware/wearables, and SaaS/marketplace businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Wocstar Capital and co‑founder/General Partner of the WOCstar Fund. Former JPMorgan M&A and philanthropy executive with 30+ years of experience; Wharton and University of Michigan graduate. Focuses on early‑stage investments in women‑of‑color founders and diverse teams.
interests: Women‑of‑color founders / diversity & inclusion in VC
enrichment.career_background: Began at Sun Microsystems; held senior roles at JPMorgan (Mergers & Acquisitions, International Government Relations, Global Philanthropy). Later founded Harriet Capital / Prometheus Exchange and launched the WOCstar Fund and Wocstar Media/Academy. Serves on nonprofit and cultural boards and is active in media and storytelling initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage venture capital focused on women‑of‑color founders and diverse, inclusive teams; tech areas including media & data, consumption, fintech and sustainability; impact investing.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Runkeeper (acquired by ASICS in 2016) who launched the My Climate Journey podcast in 2019 and subsequently founded MCJ Collective to invest in climate startups. Holds a BA from Wesleyan University and an MBA from Babson College. Focuses on early-stage climate and energy investments and community-driven climate media.
enrichment.career_background: Jason founded and served as CEO of Runkeeper from ~2008 until its acquisition by ASICS in March 2016, then served as ASICS’s Global Head of Digital. In 2019 he launched the My Climate Journey podcast and built MCJ Collective (MCJ) as a community-backed early‑stage climate fund and media platform where he is founder / venture partner.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage climate and energy tech (pre-seed to Series A) focused on energy transition, industrial decarbonization, carbon removal, and software/hardware that enables electrification and resilience.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Foresite Capital, a U.S.-focused healthcare and life‑sciences investment firm. Physician and entrepreneur with an MD and MBA from Harvard and BS/BSEE from Yale; co‑founder of GelTex and Theravance and an investor in companies such as 10x Genomics and Jazz Pharmaceuticals. citeturn2view1turn1search1
interests: Data science / AI applied to biotech
enrichment.career_background: Physician‑turned‑investor who co‑founded GelTex Pharmaceuticals and Theravance, served in venture roles including partner at Sierra Ventures and co‑founder of Prospect Ventures, and founded Foresite Capital in 2011 to back data‑driven healthcare companies. citeturn2view1turn3search6
enrichment.investment_focus: Multi‑stage healthcare and life‑sciences investing with emphasis on therapeutics, genomics and life‑science infrastructure, and data/AI‑enabled biotech. citeturn2view1turn5search5

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Tribe Capital. Ph.D. in physics from Stanford University. Known for applying data science and quantitative methods to early‑ and growth‑stage venture investing.
interests: Data‑driven venture investing / quantifying product‑market fit
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Tribe Capital in 2018 and serves as a General Partner. Previously Partner & SVP of Quantitative Investing and Data Science at Social Capital, and led data science & analytics teams at Facebook. Earlier work includes analytics at Slide and product management at Microsoft; holds a Ph.D. in theoretical physics from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Data‑driven investments across seed to growth‑stage technology companies — emphasis on FinTech, enterprise software, consumer internet and Web3/crypto.

enrichment.personal_bio: Joseph Lubin is a co‑founder of Ethereum and the founder of ConsenSys. He serves as Chairman & Managing Partner at Ethereal Ventures and is a long‑time builder and investor in the Ethereum/Web3 ecosystem.
interests: Permissionless blockchain networks and protocol infrastructure
enrichment.career_background: Lubin studied Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at Princeton. He worked in software and finance roles (including Goldman Sachs) before co‑founding the Ethereum project and founding ConsenSys in 2014; he later cofounded Ethereal Ventures to invest in early‑stage blockchain and Web3 startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) investments in blockchain/Web3: decentralized protocols, infrastructure, DeFi, NFTs, and developer tooling

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor and technologist based in Menlo Park, CA. Member of Astia Angels and Chief Data Technologist at Got‑It AI. Holds an MS in Computer Science from Stanford and a BS in Computer Engineering from UC San Diego. Active as an angel in seed/pre‑seed rounds across health, AI, games and consumer/enterprise startups.
enrichment.career_background: Joyo Wijaya is a technologist-turned-angel investor with senior engineering and product roles at Oracle, Webvan and Entrust, founding/leadership experience at Business Signatures and Tandem Entrepreneurs, and VP roles in analytics/monetization at gaming/media companies. He is Chief Data Technologist at Got‑It AI and a member of angel networks including Astia Angels and Stanford Angels.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and pre-seed angel investments in AI/ML, health/medtech, consumer internet & marketplaces, games, enterprise software and FinTech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Interlock Capital and founder of Fresh Brewed Tech. Co‑founder of edtech startup Portfolium (acquired by Instructure) with a background in mechanical engineering (UC San Diego) and early aerospace work on Space Shuttle main engines. Active in building startup ecosystems and angel investing in early‑stage companies.
enrichment.career_background: Neal Bloom is an engineer-turned-founder and investor. He began his career working on large aerospace systems (Space Shuttle main engines), co‑founded Portfolium (acquired by Instructure), and later founded Fresh Brewed Tech. He is Managing Partner at Interlock Capital, serves on boards/volunteer organizations in the San Diego startup ecosystem, and holds a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering (UC San Diego) and an MBA (Pepperdine).

Prior to FundersClub he founded Innova Dynamics (touchscreen hardware; acquired) and was founding CTO of Crederity. He holds dual degrees from the University of Pennsylvania (Wharton School and Penn Engineering, M&T program), has participated in Y Combinator, and has been active in scientific research and startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments across consumer and enterprise software, hardware/robotics, marketplaces, fintech, and developer/infrastructure tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: Allison Kopf is an agtech entrepreneur and investor: founder of Artemis (formerly Agrilyst) and an Investment Partner at XFactor Ventures. She has held senior roles at iUNU and BrightFarms and currently serves as CEO of TRACT. Kopf holds a BS in Physics from Santa Clara University and was named to Forbes 30 Under 30 (Food & Drink).
enrichment.career_background: Kopf began in real estate and government relations at BrightFarms before founding Agrilyst/Artemis in 2015, which won TechCrunch Disrupt and was later acquired by iUNU. She served in senior product/growth roles at iUNU, joined XFactor Ventures as an Investment Partner in 2018, and is CEO of TRACT; she also sits on academic and industry advisory boards related to controlled-environment agriculture.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & seed investments in companies with female founders or mixed-gender founding teams; sector focus on future of work, enterprise SaaS, agtech, and deep tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Stillmark, an institutional venture firm focused on the bitcoin ecosystem. Early institutional investor in bitcoin technologies and a board director at Blockstream. Has spoken and written on blockchain, payments, and crypto infrastructure.
enrichment.career_background: Alyse founded Stillmark (firm launched publicly 2019) and serves as its Managing Partner. Prior to Stillmark she was on the investment teams at March Capital and Clearstone, has held board and advisory roles (including Blockstream and Casa/BitGive), and has served as a fintech/crypto fellow and mentor at multiple accelerators and universities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed, seed, Series A) investments in bitcoin, bitcoin blockchain infrastructure (including Lightning Network), Web3/blockchain, and adjacent fintech and marketplace companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: CEO of AngelList (since 2019). Two-time founder — founded Fastbite (acquired by Square) and Fairy — and an active angel investor. Holds a Bachelor of Software Engineering from the University of Waterloo.
enrichment.career_background: Avlok Kohli is CEO of AngelList (appointed 2019). He previously founded Fastbite (acquired by Square) and Fairy (acquired), worked as a product lead at Square, and began his career as a software engineer. He studied Software Engineering at the University of Waterloo and invests as an angel across early-stage technology companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage investments across consumer internet, enterprise SaaS, developer tools/infrastructure, fintech, and marketplaces; also leads AngelList syndicates.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Postmates and current founder/CEO of TipTop; angel investor listed as an investor at YLEM. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area and originally from Germany. Active as an angel seed-stage investor in consumer apps, marketplaces, robotics and productivity SaaS.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and former CEO of Postmates (acquired by Uber). After Postmates he founded TipTop (consumer finance/resale). Earlier roles include co‑founder of curated.by and product/marketing roles at European startups; currently invests as an angel and is listed as an investor with YLEM.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre‑seed and early‑stage startups; consumer marketplaces & logistics; fintech / consumer finance; robotics & mobility; SaaS/productivity

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Managing/General Partner at Charge Ventures, a NYC-based pre-seed/seed fund. Co-founder and President of Kumospace and an Adjunct Professor at Columbia Business School. 2x founder and serial investor with prior roles as EIR at PrimaryVC, Director of Investments at AppFund, and an early-career equity research analyst. Dartmouth graduate and Fulbright Scholar; hails from Ocean City, MD.
enrichment.career_background: Brett Martin co-founded Charge Ventures in 2015 and leads its pre-seed/seed investing activity. He co-founded Kumospace (virtual workspaces) and teaches data analytics/technology strategy as an adjunct at Columbia Business School. Earlier he co-founded startups including Sonar and Switch, served as an EIR at PrimaryVC, was Director of Investments at AppFund, and began his career in equity research after graduating from Dartmouth and completing a Fulbright.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / seed-stage investments in AI/ML, data-driven software, developer tools/APIs, marketplaces, creator economy, D2C healthcare, and future-of-work technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Calvin Cordozar Broadus Jr., known professionally as Snoop Dogg, is a multi‑platinum recording artist and entrepreneur. He is a co‑founder and general partner of Casa Verde Capital, a Los Angeles‑based VC that focuses on the cannabis sector and ancillary technologies. Broadus is also a founder/co‑founder of consumer and media ventures (including Merry Jane) and has taken early stakes in companies such as Reddit, Robinhood, and Klarna.
enrichment.career_background: Broadus rose to fame as the recording artist Snoop Dogg and later expanded into entrepreneurship and investing. He co‑founded Casa Verde Capital in 2015 to back cannabis‑related startups and ancillary businesses, and has founded or co‑founded companies including Merry Jane and Leafs by Snoop. Broadus has participated in angel and VC investments across consumer, tech, fintech and web3 sectors and is based in the Los Angeles area.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage investments focused on the cannabis industry and ancillary tech, plus consumer brands, fintech and web3/crypto.

enrichment.personal_bio: Former NBA All-Star and entrepreneur who co-founded Melo7 Tech Partners to invest in early-stage digital media, consumer internet and technology ventures. Active as an angel/strategic investor and founder of consumer and media businesses (Creative 7, STAYME7O).
enrichment.career_background: Carmelo Anthony co-founded Melo7 Tech Partners with Stuart Goldfarb (launched publicly in 2014) to make early-stage investments in digital media, consumer internet and technology. In addition to Melo7, Anthony has founded or co-founded other consumer and media ventures (including Creative 7 and STAYME7O) and has made multiple personal investments in consumer and sports-related startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments in digital media, consumer internet and technology (including wearables, fan-engagement products and consumer brands)

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor, founder and writer who builds media, education and small-business holding companies. Venture Partner at Magma Partners and founder of Contrarian Thinking/Contrarian Capital; former institutional roles at Vanguard, Goldman Sachs, State Street and First Trust. Active board member and investor in cannabis, early-stage startups and Main Street businesses.
interests: Main Street / small-business ownership and acquisitions
Early-stage venture and Latin America startups
Cannabis industry investing and growth equity
enrichment.career_background: Codie Sanchez began as an investigative journalist, then moved into finance with roles at Vanguard, Goldman Sachs and State Street before leading Latin America investments at First Trust. She served as a partner/MD at Entourage Effect Capital (cannabis growth equity), founded Contrarian Thinking and related holding/fund vehicles focused on small businesses, and is a Venture Partner / board member at Magma Partners.
enrichment.investment_focus: Main Street small-business acquisitions (service-based, cashflow businesses); early-stage venture (seed–Series A) including Latin America; cannabis/growth equity; founder-led startups and creator-driven education.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner & Lead Mentor at XX and managing partner at Antigravity Capital. Cofounder and former CEO of Disqus. Early-stage investor and mentor focused on product-led software startups and AI-enabled businesses.
enrichment.career_background: Cofounded and led Disqus as CEO before its acquisition, then moved into investing and mentoring. Served as Partner & Lead Mentor at XX and is a managing partner at Antigravity Capital; also advises startups and sits on advisory boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / true-seed; early-stage software startups; AI-enabled product companies; product-market fit and hands-on founder support

enrichment.personal_bio: David Rosenthal is an investor and co‑host of the Acquired podcast. He co‑founded Wave Capital (seed fund focused on marketplaces) and previously worked as a principal at Madrona Venture Group. He holds an MBA from Stanford GSB and a BA from Princeton University, and runs an AngelList fund called Kindergarten Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Rosenthal spent over a decade in venture and finance: analyst roles at UBS and The Wall Street Journal, followed by positions at Meritech and StartX, then principal at Madrona Venture Group (joined 2010). He co‑founded Wave Capital in 2017 and later launched Kindergarten Ventures (an AngelList fund). He is co‑host of the Acquired podcast and serves/has served on boards including Icebrg.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage marketplaces and consumer/enterprise technology; angel and growth‑stage tech via personal/AngelList fund (Kindergarten Ventures)

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture capital investor and recording artist; co‑founder and General Partner at Time BioVentures. Harvard alumnus who shifted from a music career and Spotify artist-in-residence role into early-stage investing, focusing on life sciences and healthcare.
enrichment.career_background: Graduated from Harvard; frontman of Chester French and later Artist‑in‑Residence at Spotify (2011–2015). Transitioned to investing, co‑founding Inevitable Ventures and, in 2020, Time BioVentures, where he leads investments in therapeutics, diagnostics, research tools, and healthcare delivery companies and serves on several boards/advisory roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage life sciences and healthcare (therapeutics, diagnostics, research tools, and healthcare delivery)

enrichment.personal_bio: Dídac Lee is a Spanish entrepreneur and business angel. He is co‑founder and Managing Partner at Galdana Ventures and co‑founder of TradeInn (Scubastore). He served on FC Barcelona's board as Head of Digital (2010–2020) and has invested in several Spanish and international startups including Glovo and Badi.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Galdana Ventures in 2015. Previously founded and led multiple tech companies (including TradeInn/Scubastore, Inspirit and Fhios). Served on FC Barcelona's board leading digital transformation (2010–2020). Active angel investor, mentor and board/advisor to portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fund-of-funds investing in venture capital with exposure to early-stage technology sectors (consumer internet, e‑commerce, marketplaces, sports tech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of White Star Capital. Over two decades of experience in investment banking and venture capital, focused on helping technology companies scale internationally. Has led investments and exits across consumer, fintech, mobility and digital health sectors.
interests: Partnering with founders and global scale-ups
enrichment.career_background: Founded White Star Capital in 2007 and serves as Founder & Managing Partner. Previously co‑founded a transatlantic M&A advisory firm (media & technology) and worked in M&A and corporate finance at Merrill Lynch and ABN AMRO. Educated at HEC Montréal (B.Com) and holds an M.Sc. in Finance from ESSEC.
enrichment.investment_focus: A.I., Digital Health, Fintech, Foodtech, Future of Work, Industrial Technologies, Mobility and Wellbeing; primarily Series A/B and early growth for globally ambitious tech companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Fei-Fei Li is a Stanford computer science professor, co‑founder and chairperson of the nonprofit AI4ALL, and creator of the ImageNet dataset. She co‑founded World Labs (spatial‑intelligence AI) and has served in industry roles including Chief Scientist of AI/ML at Google Cloud.
enrichment.career_background: BA in Physics (Princeton) and PhD in Electrical Engineering (Caltech). In academia she is the Sequoia Professor and co‑director of Stanford’s Human‑Centered AI Institute; she served as Director of Stanford’s AI Lab and was Chief Scientist of AI/ML at Google Cloud (2017–2018). She co‑founded AI4ALL (co‑chair) and later co‑founded World Labs; she also participates in advisory and board roles for AI companies and organizations.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI / machine learning, computer vision, robotics & spatial intelligence, deep tech, AI‑enabled healthcare and education (angel / early‑stage)

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on a16z crypto who focuses on crypto infrastructure and application‑layer investments. Works on cryptonetworks and advocates for decentralized networks and internet infrastructure. Holds a B.S. in Computer Science from Stanford University and previously did independent research with Protocol Labs.
enrichment.career_background: Guy Wuollet is a partner on the a16z crypto investment team, concentrating on infrastructure and application‑layer crypto investments. Prior to joining a16z he performed independent research in collaboration with Protocol Labs focused on decentralized networking protocols and internet infrastructure. He earned a B.S. in Computer Science from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Crypto infrastructure and application‑layer startups (DePIN, scaling/rollups, zero‑knowledge, decentralized networks)

enrichment.personal_bio: Hakeem Temidayo Seriki (aka Chamillionaire) is a Grammy-winning rapper turned entrepreneur and angel investor. He is the founder and CEO of Convoz and has served as an Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Upfront Ventures. He has participated in multiple early-stage tech investments and runs investing initiatives focused on underrepresented founders.
enrichment.career_background: Chamillionaire rose to prominence as a recording artist and founded Chamillitary Entertainment before shifting into tech investing. He invested early in companies such as Maker Studios and Cruise, served as an Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Upfront Ventures (from 2015), and founded the video social app Convoz. He also participates in syndicates and initiatives targeting investments in founders from underrepresented backgrounds.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/series A) consumer tech with emphasis on social/video platforms, creator economy, entertainment/media, and select deep-tech/mobility opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Executive Chair of FIGS (healthcare apparel); former Co‑CEO until August 2022. Investment partner at XFactor Ventures where she evaluates early-stage startups. Areas of interest listed on her XFactor profile include healthcare, e‑commerce and technology. She holds a B.A. from the University of Wisconsin–Madison.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded FIGS in 2013 and led product and marketing; served as Co‑CEO until August 2022 and currently serves as Executive Chair. Prior to FIGS she ran a high‑end handbag business (Heather Hasson bags) and related consumer ventures. Serves on nonprofit and corporate boards (e.g., RxArt) and is listed as an investing partner at XFactor Ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage checks into female‑founded or mixed‑gender founding teams; sectors highlighted include healthcare, e‑commerce/consumer and early‑stage technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at LifeX Ventures, investing where software meets science (AI + health/longevity). Serial entrepreneur — co‑founder/CEO of CoverWallet, Pixable and Contactive — and cofounder of iPronics. Educated at Cambridge (MEng/PhD) and MIT (MBA).
enrichment.career_background: Scientist‑turned‑entrepreneur and investor. Built and led three startups in New York (Pixable, Contactive, CoverWallet) with multiple exits, worked at McKinsey and Microsoft Corporate Strategy, and later co‑founded iPronics and LifeX Ventures; holds a PhD from Cambridge and an MBA from MIT.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/pre‑seed) investments in longevity, AI applied to health and life sciences, biotechnology and genomics, and deep‑tech commercialization of scientific research.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner of #ANGELS and an active angel investor focused on early-stage technology companies. Former VP of Global Business Development & Platform at Twitter and former Director of Business Development at Netflix. Joined Lightspeed Venture Partners as a partner in 2018 (served there 2018–2021).
interests: Diversity and female founder / cap-table advocacy
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of the #ANGELS investment collective (2015) and investor in 50+ early-stage companies. Previously led global business development and platform teams at Twitter (VP) after business development at Netflix; later joined Lightspeed Venture Partners as a partner focused on early-stage deals. Educated in computer engineering at the University of Illinois Urbana‑Champaign.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series A investments in consumer and enterprise technology, marketplaces, fintech, proptech, and developer/platform companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner and general partner at Overlooked Ventures. Former founder and CEO of legal‑tech startup NextChapter (acquired by Fastcase in 2019). Based in Columbus, Ohio; focuses on investing in historically overlooked founders at pre‑seed/seed stages.
interests: FinTech and other industries lacking innovation
enrichment.career_background: Janine Sickmeyer began as a bankruptcy paralegal, taught herself to build software and founded NextChapter (a cloud bankruptcy platform), which was acquired by Fastcase in 2019. After the exit she became an angel investor and co‑founded Overlooked Ventures (2021) to invest in pre‑seed/seed tech and tech‑enabled startups led by historically ignored founders; she has also built founder tools such as Cobble and run founder education initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in tech and tech‑enabled startups led by historically overlooked founders; sector focus includes wellness (femtech, mental health), humanity (age tech, death tech), and industries lacking innovation (fintech, proptech, agtech).

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and angel investor best known for co-founding GroupMe and Fundera. Co-founder/partner at Magellan where he helped build companies and seed investments; later listed as a venture partner at Union Square Ventures. Based in Brooklyn, NY.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded GroupMe (launched 2010, acquired 2011) and later founded Fundera (launched 2013/2014, acquired by NerdWallet in 2020). Has been an active angel investor and operator, served on Splice’s board, and was a principal at Magellan (magellan.ventures) building companies and making early investments; holds a BA from Columbia University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage / seed investments; fintech and small‑business finance; consumer marketplaces and social apps; developer tools and creator/music technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Jeff Cherry is the founder and Executive Director of Conscious Venture Lab and Managing General Partner of Conscious Venture Partners. He leads an early-stage accelerator and fund focused on purpose-driven, impact-oriented startups and inclusive entrepreneurship. Cherry has helped launch dozens of venture-backed companies and serves on boards including Hungry Harvest. citeturn0search0turn5search0turn0search3
interests: Diversity & support for female and minority founders
Urban economic development and equitable entrepreneurship
Sustainable food systems and food access
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur, operator and investor with 30+ years building companies in engineering, design, consulting and investment management; founded Conscious Venture Lab in 2013 and serves as Managing General Partner of Conscious Venture Partners. He advises boards (e.g., Hungry Harvest, McKean Defense), has led accelerator cohorts and fund investments focused on seed/pre-seed companies, and has received awards for social-impact entrepreneurship. citeturn3search2turn0search0
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed and early-stage investments in purpose-driven and impact companies, U.S.-focused with an emphasis on Baltimore and underserved founders. citeturn5search0turn4search2

enrichment.personal_bio: Joanne Wilson is an American entrepreneur, early-stage angel investor and founder of Gotham Gal Ventures. She runs the blog Gotham Gal and invests primarily in consumer, media and real-estate related startups, with a long-standing emphasis on backing female founders. She is active in New York–based philanthropy and nonprofit boards.
enrichment.career_background: Wilson began her career in retail (Macy’s) and wholesale, moved into media and sales at Silicon Alley Reporter, and has blogged as “Gotham Gal” since the 1990s. She began angel investing in the late 2000s, founded Gotham Gal Ventures (2008), and has served on multiple nonprofit and company boards (e.g., Hot Bread Kitchen, Friends of the High Line).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage / seed investments in consumer (food & retail), media & marketplaces, real estate and hospitality — with an emphasis on female-founded startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder, CEO and CIO of Asymmetric, a digital-assets investment firm. Previously Senior Director (Cloud & AI) at Microsoft, founder & CEO of NodeSource, and head of quantitative crypto trading at Passport Capital. Active investor and advisor in web3/crypto and developer infrastructure since 2016.
enrichment.career_background: Over 20 years across Wall Street and Silicon Valley: founded NodeSource (enterprise Node.js company), ran quantitative/systematic crypto trading at Passport Capital, served as Senior Director at Microsoft (Cloud + AI) on incubations and M&A, and founded Asymmetric in 2022 as founder/solo GP running venture and digital-asset funds.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage web3/crypto (protocols, DeFi, dApps) and Bitcoin DeFi/L2s; developer infrastructure and open-source tooling; quantitative crypto trading and digital-asset investment strategies (seed to early growth).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Shutterstock (founded 2003) and its Executive Chairman since 2020; serial entrepreneur and active angel investor. Co‑founder/managing member of Pareto Holdings, an early‑stage investment vehicle/venture studio. Based in Miami; focuses on early software, marketplaces and media startups.
enrichment.career_background: Jon Oringer founded Shutterstock in 2003, served as CEO until 2020 and became Executive Chairman. He holds a B.S. in computer science and mathematics from SUNY Stony Brook and an M.S. in computer science from Columbia University. After transitioning to Executive Chairman he began investing and co‑founding Pareto Holdings to back and build early‑stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed-stage software (SaaS), marketplaces, media/content, Web3/blockchain, network-effect businesses

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of DoNotPay and solo General Partner of Browder Capital. Active angel and seed investor who backs early-stage technology startups, often focusing on young founders and technical founders. Thiel Fellow and Stanford alumnus (attended).
enrichment.career_background: Started DoNotPay in 2015 and has served as its CEO since; left Stanford to take a Thiel Fellowship. Worked as an EIR/intern at Greylock (2017–2018) and launched Browder Capital (2020) as his primary investment vehicle; has made dozens of pre-seed and seed investments across consumer and enterprise software.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed / Early-stage technology startups — AI, SaaS, developer tools, fintech and consumer/enterprise software

enrichment.personal_bio: Jyri Engeström is an entrepreneur‑turned‑investor who co‑founded Jaiku and Ditto. He is a co‑founder and partner at Yes VC and an early investor in companies including Unity, Ōura and ICEYE. He has held product roles at Google and Groupon and has invested across deep tech, climate, space, health and consumer sectors.
enrichment.career_background: Engeström co‑founded Jaiku (acquired by Google) and Ditto (acquired by Groupon), worked as a product manager at Google and as Director of Product at Groupon, and served on the investing team at True Ventures. He co‑founded Yes VC (2018) with Caterina Fake, has been involved with Lifeline Ventures, and founded Primary Diagnostics in 2020. He sits on/has held advisory roles for multiple startups and boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed & Seed; deep tech (space, climate, carbon removal), AI, health/biotech, and consumer/mobile startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Brainchild (his personal investment vehicle) and founder/CEO of Hero. Longtime angel investor active in pre-seed and seed deals across healthcare, consumer and infrastructure startups. Based in the U.S.; trained at Duke University and previously worked at Bain & Company.
enrichment.career_background: Kal Vepuri founded Brainchild in 2009 as a holding company for his personal investments and later co-founded Hero, where he serves as founder and CEO. He trained at Bain & Company, worked in late-stage healthcare private equity, and has been an active angel investor and operator across dozens of early-stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed investments in healthcare, consumer/DTC, marketplaces & networks, hardware/IoT, fintech and enterprise SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Pantera Capital who focuses on venture and early-stage token investments. Former software developer and trader with a B.A. in Computer Science from Columbia University. Has held board/board-observer roles at companies including Pinata, VALR, BitOasis, and Staked.
enrichment.career_background: Started as a software developer (trading platforms), moved into trading roles at Deutsche Bank and Bank of America, and joined Pantera in 2018. Progressed through investment associate and principal roles to partner/general partner, leading diligence and investments across infrastructure, DeFi, and token projects and spearheading internal staking and data initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Venture and early-stage token investments in blockchain/Web3 infrastructure, DeFi, developer tools, and staking.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Director of Scalar Capital, a crypto investment firm. Former product manager at Coinbase who worked on internal compliance, fraud, and finance systems. Known for early crypto/token investments and listed on Forbes 30 Under 30 (Finance). Holds a B.A. in Economics from UC San Diego.
enrichment.career_background: Started in risk analysis at AIG, joined Coinbase in 2014 as a product manager focused on internal tools and compliance, then co‑founded Scalar Capital (2017) to invest in crypto assets and tokens; has served as an advisor to projects such as 0x and has been involved in crypto ecosystem initiatives and media (e.g., co‑producing an Ethereum documentary).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and token investments in blockchain projects: privacy tech, DeFi, layer‑2/infrastructure, NFTs, and developer/protocol tooling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and investor based in San Francisco. Founder and Managing Partner of Heretic Ventures; founder of Minted and co‑founder of Eve.com and Arcade. Sits on several boards including Victoria’s Secret & Co. and Every Mother Counts.
interests: Consumer generative AI and AI-enabled product creation
Digital art / NFTs and generative art
enrichment.career_background: Started as an analyst at Goldman Sachs, co‑founded Eve.com (sold in 2000), led product at Movielink, and launched Minted in 2007 (founder/CEO, later executive chairman). In 2021 she founded Heretic Ventures, and she is co‑founder/CEO of Arcade; she also serves on multiple corporate and nonprofit boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Building and funding consumer-facing companies at the intersection of culture, commerce, and creators — e.g., marketplaces, creator economy businesses, consumer generative AI, and blockchain/NFT-enabled digital art.

enrichment.personal_bio: Michael Girdley is a San Antonio–based entrepreneur and investor; he is a co‑founder and managing director at Geekdom Fund and chairs Girdley Enterprises. He co‑founded Dura Software and Codeup and previously led the family business Alamo Fireworks. He focuses on early‑stage tech investing and building the San Antonio startup ecosystem.
enrichment.career_background: Girdley began in product and engineering roles at RSA Security and BEA/WebLogic, later ran Alamo Fireworks as CEO, and co‑founded/acquired software businesses through Dura Software. He co‑founded Codeup, helped launch Geekdom Fund (managing director), and holds leadership/board roles across Dry Line Partners, CyberFortress, Scalepath and other San Antonio tech initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in early‑stage tech startups, with sector focus on SaaS/enterprise applications, AI, robotics/autonomy, SMB software and Web3.

enrichment.personal_bio: Michael E. Novogratz is the founder and CEO of Galaxy Digital, a New York–based investment firm focused on digital assets and blockchain. He previously was a partner at Goldman Sachs and a senior executive at Fortress Investment Group. He is active in philanthropy, including criminal-justice reform initiatives.
enrichment.career_background: Novogratz began his career at Goldman Sachs (elected partner in 1998), later joined Fortress Investment Group as a senior executive, and founded Galaxy Digital to provide institutional financial services, trading, asset management and venture investing for the digital-asset ecosystem (Galaxy launched publicly from 2018-era activity and has since expanded into multiple business lines).
enrichment.investment_focus: Digital assets and cryptocurrencies; blockchain infrastructure and protocols; institutional trading and asset management; venture investments and token/economic-layer projects; data center and mining infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Michael Peres (aka Mikey Peres) is a serial entrepreneur, software engineer, journalist and angel investor who invests at pre-seed and seed stages. He hosts the Michael Peres Podcast and has founded media and tech ventures including Breaking 9 To 5, Her Forward and Hexa PR Wire. He focuses on Web3, software, consumer tech, blockchain, fintech and martech.
enrichment.career_background: Peres has founded multiple tech and media startups, works as a journalist and podcast host, and provides early-stage capital and operational/engineering support to founders. He holds degrees in computer science, mathematics and Jewish studies and describes typical initial checks in the $50k–$250k range for pre-seed/seed opportunities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage companies in Web3/crypto, software, consumer tech, blockchain, fintech and martech; typical check size $50k–$250k.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at First Star Ventures focused on early-stage deep-technology investments. Advises MIT CSAIL and mentors startup programs; previously co‑founded an MIT machine‑learning startup and worked at Applied Predictive Technologies. Holds an MIT Master of Finance and a B.S. in Mathematics from the University of Toronto.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and managing/founding partner at First Star Ventures (early‑stage, deep tech). Prior roles include co‑founder of an MIT startup (early work that contributed to Infervision), business consultant at Applied Predictive Technologies (APT), and private‑equity/growth investing experience; active mentor/advisor to programs such as MassChallenge and accelerator communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage; deep‑tech / frontier computing (AI/ML, computational biotech, edge/sensors, robotics, decentralization); primarily US (Boston/Cambridge) early‑stage startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner of 1confirmation, an early-stage crypto and Web3 venture firm he launched in 2017. Previously worked in business development at Coinbase and as a principal at Runa Capital. Early investor in NFT and crypto-native projects including OpenSea and dYdX.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment roles at North Atlantic Capital, moved into business development at Coinbase (early employee), then worked at Runa Capital before founding 1confirmation in 2017. 1confirmation focuses on early-stage equity and token investments across crypto, NFTs and blockchain infrastructure.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage crypto & Web3 (NFTs, DeFi, blockchain protocols, developer tooling and token-native marketplaces).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and CEO of B12; angel investor active in early-stage software and internet companies. Former VC at General Catalyst and co-founder of student-focused Rough Draft Ventures; founding-team advisor at Getaround. Based in the U.S.
interests: AI and automation for small businesses
enrichment.career_background: Nitesh Banta is the co-founder and CEO of B12, a company that builds automated front-office products for small businesses. He previously worked as a venture investor at General Catalyst, co-founded Rough Draft Ventures, and was part of the founding team/advisor at Getaround. Outside of B12 he performs angel investing through a personal vehicle (listed as Angel Investor at Stellar Capital).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage software, internet and technology companies (AI/automation, marketplaces)

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director (early) at Redpoint Ventures focused on AI and machine learning. Former senior software engineer on LinkedIn’s machine learning team. Holds a B.S. in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science from Yale and an M.S. (CS, AI concentration) and MBA from Stanford.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Redpoint in 2018 (initially as an intern), worked previously as a senior software engineer on LinkedIn’s machine learning team, and has led investments across AI, infrastructure, and SaaS. Promoted to Managing Director at Redpoint in May 2025.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI, Infrastructure, SaaS; stages: Seed to Series A; enterprise and developer-facing startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at FPV Ventures. Former COO of Cisco Collaboration and former COO/CIO roles at Morgan Stanley. Serves as an investor/advisor and board member across tech and biotech companies; holds a B.S. from MIT.
enrichment.career_background: Pegah Ebrahimi is co‑founder and Managing Partner of FPV Ventures (launched 2022). Prior to VC she served as COO of Cisco Collaboration, held senior COO/CIO roles at Morgan Stanley’s technology and investment banking groups, and cofounded Spark Box Toys. She sits on public and private company boards and advises companies including Canva and Snyk.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments in enterprise software, developer platforms, biotech/drug discovery, and frontier technologies, with emphasis on mission-driven founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Director at Science, a Santa Monica–based venture studio and fund. Former operator (VP, Photobucket; co‑founder & CEO of BillShrink) and angel/advisor to companies including Ring and Nextdoor. Leads fundraising and studio efforts for brand‑driven consumer and consumer‑internet companies such as Liquid Death and PlayVS.
enrichment.career_background: Peter Pham co‑founded Science in 2011 and serves as a Managing Director and head of fundraising for Science’s incubated companies. Prior to Science he was an early employee and VP of Business Development at Photobucket and co‑founder/CEO of BillShrink (acquired by Mastercard). He has advised and invested in numerous consumer internet and gaming businesses and sits on boards including Liquid Death.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer internet and brand‑driven DTC; marketplaces and social software; gaming/eSports; blockchain/Web3.

enrichment.personal_bio: R "Ray" Wang is Founder, Chairman, and Principal Analyst of Constellation Research and a Venture Partner at Mindful Venture Capital. He co-hosts the webcast DisrupTV and is the author of books on digital transformation, including Disrupting Digital Business (HBR Press) and Everybody Wants to Rule The World. He is a frequent keynote speaker and advisor to enterprise and startup leaders on AI, Web3, and digital strategy.
enrichment.career_background: Ray Wang founded Constellation Research (principal analyst, chairman) and previously held roles at Forrester Research, Oracle, PeopleSoft and consulting firms such as Deloitte and Ernst & Young. He co-hosts DisrupTV, has authored books on digital transformation, serves on advisory boards, and is listed as a Venture Partner at Mindful Venture Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Pre-seed, Seed, Series A); enterprise software & SaaS; AI and Web3/metaverse; behavior-design informed technology; healthcare and fintech

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at SRB Ventures and founder of SRB Holdings; author and creator who publishes The Curiosity Chronicle. Former private-equity investor (Altamont Capital Partners) with seven years of buyout experience. Stanford BA/MA; active angel/early-stage investor in 40+ startups.
enrichment.career_background: Bloom spent seven years on the investment team at Altamont Capital Partners (private equity), served on several portfolio company boards, then launched SRB Ventures (Fund I ~$10M) in January 2022 as Managing Partner. He also operates SRB Holdings (personal holding company), publishes The Curiosity Chronicle, and wrote The 5 Types of Wealth.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture (seed–Series A); ~$100K–$250K checks; sector-agnostic technology focus including fintech, SaaS, consumer, and Web3.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of NOEMIS Ventures, an early‑stage VC based in New York. Former investment banker at JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo; holds an MBA from Cornell and a BS from Brooklyn College. Focuses on pre‑seed and seed investments in fintech, AI/ML and marketplaces.
enrichment.career_background: Simeon worked in corporate finance and market risk at JPMorgan Chase and later in leveraged finance at Wells Fargo before founding NOEMIS Ventures in 2017. He built a pilot portfolio with personal capital and later closed a debut institutional fund focused on pre‑seed and seed fintech, AI/ML and marketplace companies. Education: BS (Brooklyn College); MBA (Cornell Johnson).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed‑stage startups in fintech, AI/ML and marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment Partner at Multicoin Capital focused on crypto, tokens, and Web3. Joined Multicoin in 2018 and was promoted to Investment Partner in 2023. Previously interned at Bitspark and worked in Deloitte’s multistate tax division. Studied Accounting and Economics at Miami University and co‑founded the Miami University Blockchain Club.
enrichment.career_background: Spencer Applebaum began at Multicoin as an analyst (2018), progressing through associate/principal roles and was promoted to Investment Partner in 2023. Prior experience includes an internship at Bitspark (blockchain remittances) and a multistate tax role at Deloitte. He studied Accounting and Economics at Miami University and helped found the university’s blockchain club.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3 / Crypto — tokens & protocols, DeFi, blockchain infrastructure and Web3 applications; seed and early-stage investing

enrichment.personal_bio: Tim O'Reilly is the founder, CEO and chairman of O'Reilly Media and a partner at early-stage venture firm O'Reilly AlphaTech Ventures (OATV). He helped popularize concepts such as "open source" and "Web 2.0" and convenes conferences and publications on technology trends. He serves on multiple nonprofit and company boards and is the author of WTF? What's the Future and Why It's Up to Us.
interests: Open source software and developer communities
Web platforms and internet business models
enrichment.career_background: Founded O'Reilly Media in the 1980s and grew it into a publishing, conference and learning business focused on technology; co‑founded and serves as partner at O'Reilly AlphaTech Ventures (OATV) to invest in early-stage technology companies. Active in public conversation about tech policy, open source, and the future of platforms; serves on boards including Code for America and PeerJ and has authored books on technology and society.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage / institutional-seed investments in developer tools, infrastructure, enterprise and consumer software, web platforms; support for revenue-focused Indie.VC-style financing.

enrichment.personal_bio: Tina Sharkey is an entrepreneur, investor, board member and educator best known for co-founding Brandless and co-founding iVillage. She served as CEO of Sherpa Foundry and as a venture partner at Sherpa Capital, and has held senior roles at BabyCenter (Johnson & Johnson), AOL and the Sesame Street Digital Group. Sharkey sits on several public and private boards and teaches business innovation; she is based in Northern California.
enrichment.career_background: Sharkey began her career co-founding iVillage, later led programming and community businesses at AOL, and served as Chairman & Global President of BabyCenter. In 2013 she became CEO of Sherpa Foundry and later a venture partner at Sherpa Capital before co-founding Brandless (where she served as CEO and chair). She has held board and advisory roles at companies including Ipsy, Brit + Co, Havenly and PBS, and is active as an angel and early-stage investor and lecturer.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer brands, direct-to-consumer e-commerce, marketplaces and media/community-driven startups (early stage)

enrichment.personal_bio: Travis Kalanick is an American entrepreneur, best known as the co‑founder and former CEO of Uber. In 2018 he launched the investment vehicle 10100 to oversee his for‑profit and nonprofit work focused on job creation and emerging markets. Through 10100 he took a controlling stake in City Storage Systems and is associated with CloudKitchens. Earlier in his career he co‑founded Scour and Red Swoosh.
enrichment.career_background: Kalanick co‑founded Uber and served as its CEO until 2017; he remained a significant shareholder and left the board in 2019. In March 2018 he announced the creation of 10100 to manage his investments and philanthropic work, and that fund made a controlling investment in City Storage Systems (parent of CloudKitchens), where he has taken an active leadership role. Earlier ventures include Scour and Red Swoosh; he has also made multiple angel and seed investments in startups across software, logistics and consumer tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Real‑estate redevelopment (parking/retail/industrial), e‑commerce and marketplace businesses, emerging‑market technology in China and India; direct investments and co‑investments with emphasis on job creation and urban/future‑of‑cities initiatives.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Executive Director of Angel Labs, an investor accelerator that trains and connects angel investors and emerging GPs. Formerly worked in investment banking and at Startup Labs; educated at Université Paris‑Sorbonne and Bocconi University. Active speaker and advisor on entrepreneurship, investor education and international tech ecosystems.
enrichment.career_background: Tugce Ergul co‑founded Angel Labs in 2013 to build investor education programs and global angel networks. She began her career in investment banking (Rothschild), worked at Startup Labs managing seed‑stage activity, and has advised governments and organizations on entrepreneurship and venture finance. She holds an undergraduate degree from Université Paris‑Sorbonne and a master's from Bocconi University and is regularly featured as a speaker on international startup and VC topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel & early‑stage investing; investor education and accelerator programs; building LP/GP networks; international and emerging markets; inclusive/diverse entrepreneurship

enrichment.personal_bio: Actor, producer and musician who is a co‑founder of Dreamers VC. Active as an angel and fund-backed investor through Dreamers VC, participating in early‑stage technology and consumer rounds. Publicly associated with Dreamers VC since its 2018 founding.
enrichment.career_background: Will Smith built a public career as an actor and musician and has expanded into entrepreneurship and investing. He co‑founded Overbrook (production) earlier in his career, launched Westbrook as a media/commerce holding, and co‑founded Dreamers VC (with Keisuke Honda and others) to invest in early‑stage companies and partner with institutional investors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (Seed–Series A/B) investments in consumer (CPG), fintech, health/biotech, entertainment & media, marketplaces and web3/crypto.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Trust Ventures and founder/managing partner of Freehouse Capital Partners. Former managing partner at VTF Capital and Head of Product at Zappos; later CEO of Pilotworks and involved in the Downtown Project with Tony Hsieh. Lives between Austin and northwest Montana and invests in early-stage startups and real‑estate growth opportunities.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced operator and investor: Venture Partner at Trust Ventures (advises startups on regulatory strategy), Founder/Managing Partner at Freehouse Capital Partners (real estate & growth investing), former Managing Partner at VTF Capital (seed-stage ecommerce/retail tech), Head of Product at Zappos (led product and campus development), and CEO/COO roles at Pilotworks.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) startups in retail/commerce technology, consumer & food/hospitality, precision health; real‑estate and growth investments; companies facing regulatory/public‑policy barriers.

enrichment.personal_bio: Zak Williams is the co‑founder and CEO of PYM, a company focused on mental‑wellness products, and a mental‑health advocate. He is a venture partner at Social Impact Capital and an active angel investor in early‑stage tech and consumer companies. He holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BA from New York University.
enrichment.career_background: Zak Williams founded and leads PYM (mental‑wellness products). He previously served as COO of Crossing Minds and held business development and marketing roles at Condé Nast and N3TWORK. He is active on nonprofit boards and advocacy groups focused on mental health and holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BA from NYU.
enrichment.investment_focus: Impact-focused early‑stage investments across essentials of human need (health, food, environment, education, housing) and mission-driven consumer/health startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Software engineer and early-stage investor/advisor who served as a Venture Partner / campus lead for Contrary at the University of Maryland (2017–2018). Worked on infrastructure teams at Segment and Airplane and lists current work on scripting infrastructure; authored UMD course 'Practical Cloud Computing with AWS'.
enrichment.career_background: Colin King holds BS and MS degrees in Computer Science from the University of Maryland (focused on distributed systems). He founded and taught a UMD course on cloud computing, served as a Venture Partner/Advisor for Contrary at UMD (2017–2018), and has worked at Segment and Airplane (and lists work on scripting infrastructure).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / university-founded founders; cloud infrastructure and developer tools; early-stage technical founders

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of BRAVA Investments; impact investor focused on high-growth companies that deliver measurable economic benefits to women. Technologist and serial entrepreneur; author of LEAPFROG: The New Revolution for Women Entrepreneurs.
interests: Board & advisory work for mission-driven organizations
enrichment.career_background: Nathalie Molina Niño is the founder and CEO of BRAVA Investments. She has served as interim Chief Revenue Officer of PowerToFly and led the launch of SELF MADE. She co-founded Entrepreneurs@Athena at Barnard College and has advised and held board/advisory roles with organizations including Accion Opportunity Fund, WOCstar, FullCycle and Cadence Health. She is the author of LEAPFROG and invests via her family office and BRAVA.
enrichment.investment_focus: Gender-lens and impact investments in high-growth technology, consumer, healthcare and education companies — typically seed to growth-stage businesses that demonstrably improve the economic well-being of women.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing/General Partner at Devland, a venture studio and fund. Product leader, former software engineer and author who has led technology development and helped form multiple startups. Holds a B.S. in Audio Electrical Engineering from the University of Miami and served as a visiting researcher at the University of Rochester with NSF support.
enrichment.career_background: Over a decade-plus operator background as a software engineer and product manager (including product roles at major tech firms), startup founder/operator and research advocate. Co-founded and runs Devland as a studio/fund, has served as a research advisor to private equity firms and in private-investment roles (including a director-level private investments role at CG Capital).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) deep tech and industrial innovation: hardware, automation, advanced manufacturing & materials, robotics/computer vision, AR/VR and applied R&D.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor, pitch coach, and founder consultant focused on helping underrepresented founders prepare for fundraising. Formerly on the Backstage Capital deal‑flow and accelerator teams, she now runs Sheppard Consulting Group and leads entrepreneurial programming at USC’s Greif Center.
enrichment.career_background: Worked on deal flow and accelerator programs at Backstage Capital (Director/Analyst roles), led the Backstage LA accelerator cohort, and has run Sheppard Consulting Group as a pitch coach and funding consultant. Also serves in entrepreneurial programming and student engagement roles at USC’s Greif Center / Blackstone LaunchPad.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) startups in beauty tech, wellness tech, e‑commerce and consumer health; founders from underrepresented backgrounds (women, people of color, LGBTQ+)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Remi (direct-to-consumer sleep and dental wellness products). Former analyst and associate at Sinai Ventures (2018–2019) and BMW i Ventures (2017–2018). NYU Stern alumnus; based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an analyst at BMW i Ventures, then as an analyst and associate at Sinai Ventures where he sourced and led diligence on multiple deals. In December 2019 he founded Remi and serves as its CEO; has also served as a venture scout and remains active in VC networks and DTC entrepreneurship.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage software and internet companies; mobility & transportation; consumer DTC and health/wellness
