enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz, focused on consumer investing and AI-native products. Former founder (SocialDeck, Snowball) and product leader at Google and Credit Karma; joined a16z in 2019 and serves on multiple portfolio company boards.
interests: AI-native and generative AI consumer tools
enrichment.career_background: Anish graduated from the University of Waterloo and worked as a software engineer at Amazon before co-founding SocialDeck (acquired by Google). He led mobile product efforts at Google, founded Snowball (acquired by Credit Karma), held senior product and GM roles at Credit Karma, and joined Andreessen Horowitz as a General Partner in 2019; he serves on several a16z portfolio boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer technology (mobile/creator apps), fintech/consumer finance, AI/GenAI consumer products

enrichment.personal_bio: Retired professional tennis player and entrepreneur. Founder and managing partner of Serena Ventures, a venture firm that backs businesses led by women and underrepresented founders. Founder/co‑founder of consumer brands (Will Perform, WYN Beauty) and a multimedia production company (926 Productions).
interests: Investing in women and underrepresented founders
enrichment.career_background: Serena Williams rose to global prominence as a professional tennis player (turned pro 1995; 23 Grand Slam singles titles) and retired from regular tour play in 2022. Off court she founded Serena Ventures to invest in early‑stage companies focused on consumer, health, e‑commerce and tech, and has launched consumer businesses including Will Perform and WYN Beauty and a production company (926 Productions). Serena Ventures raised an inaugural outside fund (reported ~$111M) to scale the firm’s investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer, healthcare/wellness, e‑commerce and tech (SaaS/TMT), media and Web3; emphasis on female and underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) focused on crypto and Web3. Previously a software engineer and researcher at Google X and Google Brain and holds BS/MS degrees in Computer Science from Stanford. Technical background in distributed systems, machine learning, and security; works closely with portfolio companies on protocol and infrastructure strategy.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Andreessen Horowitz in 2017 as the first full-time member of the crypto team and was promoted to General Partner in April 2021. Prior to VC, he worked on robotics at Google X and as a core developer on TensorFlow at Google Brain after completing BS and MS degrees in Computer Science at Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Crypto / Web3, blockchain infrastructure, privacy/zk tech, developer platforms, AI/ML (seed through growth stages)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Venture Partner at Homeroom Fund and co‑founder & CEO of thnkrAI. Active in early‑stage/seed investing with a focus on technology and pricing analytics. Based in Vienna, Virginia; studied at the University of Virginia.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and CEO of thnkrAI (pricing/analytics SaaS) and co‑founder & Venture Partner at Homeroom Fund. Previously listed as a Venture Associate at 1435 Capital; involved in student and university startup/venture networks and early‑stage fund formation. Educational background includes the University of Virginia.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage and seed technology investments (SaaS/AI, pricing & analytics, FinTech, Retail/DTC/CPG, B2B/B2C)

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and Head of the Cultural Leadership Fund (CLF) at Andreessen Horowitz, where she connects cultural leaders to technology companies and advances Black participation and wealth-generation in tech. Formerly worked in venture roles at Unusual Ventures and as an MBA investment fellow; holds an MBA from Stanford GSB.
interests: Black wealth generation & diversity in tech
Talent pipeline / HBCU and nonprofit partnerships
enrichment.career_background: Megan Holston-Alexander leads a16z’s Cultural Leadership Fund, a vehicle that coinvests across a16z portfolio companies and donates management fees/carry to nonprofits focused on advancing Black talent into tech. She previously held investor roles at Unusual Ventures, was an MBA investment fellow at Foundation Capital, interned at Lightspeed and Omidyar Network, and earlier worked in nonprofit operations and as a lecturer. She holds a BA from Clark Atlanta University, an MA from the University of Houston, and an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer and creator-economy startups, crypto, fintech, enterprise, bio/health; primarily early-stage (seed/Series A) while participating across a16z fund stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Pillar VC with over two decades in venture capital. Primarily a seed-stage investor who often backs university spinouts and scientific founders. Early investor in Algorand and lead/backer in companies across AI, biotech, enterprise software and crypto.
enrichment.career_background: Jamie Goldstein is a founding partner of Pillar VC. He spent 18 years as an investing partner at North Bridge Venture Partners and prior to that co-founded PureSpeech, a speech-recognition company. He holds a BS from MIT and an MBA from Harvard Business School and has led investments in companies such as Algorand, PathAI, Desktop Metal and PillPack.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and pre-seed investments in deep tech and scientific founders, including biotech/synbio, AI/ML, enterprise software, crypto/blockchain, hardware and vertical SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Actor, producer and investor Robert Downey Jr. is the founder of FootPrint Coalition, a media/nonprofit/venture group that backs sustainable technologies. He is an active angel investor in climate, food and materials startups and is based in Los Angeles.
enrichment.career_background: Robert Downey Jr. built a career as an actor and producer (co‑founder of Team Downey) and launched FootPrint Coalition (founder, 2019) to pair media, grants and venture capital in support of environmental technologies; FootPrint Coalition Ventures (rolling funds) opened to outside investors in 2021. He also participates in angel investments across early-to-growth stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Sustainable / climate technologies across food & agriculture, new materials and bioplastics, energy & transport; robotics and AI for environmental applications; media & nonprofit grantmaking; investment stages: seed through Series B (early-to-growth stage).

enrichment.personal_bio: HealthTech investor at Insight Partners based in New York. Previously worked in growth/software investing and investor relations roles. Educated at the University of Pennsylvania (Wharton).
enrichment.career_background: Joined Insight Partners as a HealthTech/Software investor (listed at Insight/NFX/The Network profiles). Prior roles include a software investing role at General Atlantic and investor relations / analyst roles at firms including iAngels and PGIM; also participated in Girls Who Invest and research work with Character Lab. Educated at the University of Pennsylvania (Wharton).
enrichment.investment_focus: HealthTech, digital health, health IT and population health; B2B SaaS and enterprise software; mid-stage to growth-stage investments (Series A–B and growth equity).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and managing partner at Aperture Venture Capital, a Philadelphia‑based seed-stage firm that backs diverse founders leveraging financial innovation. Previously led Comcast Ventures' Catalyst Fund and was a partner at Dreamit; worked with Morgan Stanley’s Multicultural Innovation Lab. Adjunct Assistant Professor of Venture Capital at Duke University’s Fuqua School of Business (2024–present).
enrichment.career_background: Experienced early‑stage investor and operator who co‑founded Aperture VC in 2021 to back diverse founders in fintech and enterprise software. Earlier roles include lead investor for Comcast Ventures’ Catalyst Fund (diversity‑focused), partner at Dreamit Ventures, Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence with Morgan Stanley’s Multicultural Innovation Lab, and founding partner roles in earlier VC efforts. Education: MBA, Duke University (Fuqua); MS and BS, Computer Science, North Carolina State University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) fintech, financial infrastructure and enterprise software; emphasis on insurance, lending/banking, payments, security & identity; backing diverse and multicultural founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Director of Allied Venture Partners, an angel syndicate headquartered in Calgary. Ex-founder and angel investor since 2012 who launched Allied in 2020 to scale early-stage investment access in Western Canada. He focuses on sourcing and syndicating Seed–Series A software and technology deals across Canada and the U.S.
enrichment.career_background: Exited a Toronto-based CPG startup (circa 2012), worked in sales and marketing roles, began angel investing in 2012, and served as a VC scout and advisor before founding Allied Venture Partners in 2020. At Allied he manages a large angel network that deploys Seed and Series A capital into software and technology startups across North America.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to Series A software & technology companies (primarily North America); emphasis on enterprise SaaS, FinTech/payments, marketplaces, AR/immersive, logistics and health tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Responsibly Ventures who backs pre‑seed startups focused on sustainability and social good. Background in environmental economics and data science; active angel investor since 2019. Runs the posi2ive community/podcast and is based in Huntington Beach, CA.
enrichment.career_background: Former environmental economist, data scientist, and co‑founder who began angel investing in 2019 and became General Partner at Responsibly Ventures (a PreSeed impact VC) in 2021. Hosts the posi2ive community/podcast and has led community roundtables focused on venture-scale positive impacts. Education includes Environmental Economics (Western Washington University) and a data science specialization from Johns Hopkins University.
enrichment.hometown: San Juan Islands, Pacific Northwest, USA
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed; Sustainability & Social Good (ClimateTech/CleanTech, Food/AgTech); Smart Cities/UrbanTech; Digital Health; Consumer/DTC

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CTO of Rain, a payments/crypto-focused card platform. Previously served as an investment scout at Lightspeed Venture Partners and was a principal software engineer at Intuit after an exit of his prior startup (Playbook HR). Stanford University computer science graduate active in early‑stage investing and founder communities.
enrichment.career_background: Charles Naut co‑founded Rain (co‑founder & CTO, 2021–present). He was an Investment Scout at Lightspeed Venture Partners (circa 2020–2022), earlier co‑founded Playbook HR (acquired by Intuit) and served as a Principal Software Engineer at Intuit (2015–2019). He studied computer science at Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) startups; fintech/payments and crypto infrastructure; future‑of‑work and SMB software; developer tools / SaaS.

enrichment.firm_name: Capital Region AR/VR Accelerator (Capital Region XR Accelerator)
enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of EndeavorXR (formerly EndeavorVR), an XR strategy and consulting firm. Known as an XR/Metaverse futurist who advises Fortune 500s, government bodies and startups. Angel investor and listed as a Venture Partner with the Capital Region AR/VR (XR) Accelerator; serves on multiple advisory boards.
enrichment.career_background: Amy Peck is the founder and CEO of EndeavorXR, with two decades of experience in enterprise strategy, immersive technologies and commercial production. Her background includes enterprise roles at Leap Motion and HTC VIVE and corporate experience at J.P. Morgan Chase and LivingSocial. She holds advisory roles with government and corporate entities (including the Royal Commission for Riyadh City and Booz Allen-related engagements), chairs/participates in multiple industry boards, and has been publicly listed as a Venture Partner at the Capital Region AR/VR (XR) Accelerator.
enrichment.hometown: Palm Beach, FL and New York City, NY
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage/seed focus on immersive technology (XR/AR/VR), digital twins and spatial computing, metaverse/Web3 and applied AI for enterprise.

enrichment.personal_bio: Vice President on the investment team at BIP Ventures. Joined BIP Ventures in 2020 and focuses on early-stage investing across software, marketplaces, media, and esports. Former competitive esports athlete and streamer; holds a B.S. in Business and Computer Science from Franklin & Marshall College.
enrichment.career_background: Joined BIP Ventures in 2020 and is a Vice President on the investment team. Previously an early-stage investor at Candela Partners and Ulysses Diversified Holdings and co‑founder/CEO of SimplyStow. Writes about startups and VC and holds a B.S. in Business & Computer Science from Franklin & Marshall College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture investments in software, marketplaces, media & entertainment (including gaming/esports and AR/VR), tech-enabled marketplaces, enterprise SaaS, and healthtech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Valia Ventures who sources and evaluates early-stage opportunities with a focus on health, AI-powered vertical applications, and fintech. Mentor in Techstars New York; prior experience includes operational roles at startups and consulting at PwC. Graduated Summa Cum Laude from Boston University (B.S. in Business Administration).
enrichment.career_background: Currently a Principal at Valia Ventures supporting the firm’s portfolio and sourcing deals. Previously held operational roles at startups and worked as a consultant at PwC. Serves as a mentor for Techstars New York and contributes to Valia’s portfolio communications and diligence.
enrichment.hometown: Grew up in Los Angeles, CA; originally from Aleppo, Syria.
enrichment.investment_focus: Health, AI-powered vertical applications, FinTech; early-stage (pre-seed to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Design leader and mentor based in San Francisco. Principal Product Designer at Eventbrite (formerly design leads at Google and Uber). Operates Sridesign to make small, early-stage investments into design‑led startups.
enrichment.career_background: Holds a master’s degree from Georgia Institute of Technology and a BE from Anna University. Over a decade of product design leadership with roles at Eventbrite, Google (Search), Uber (inclusive design, Uber Lite) and founding designer work at AWAKE; focuses on building products, systems and teams at the intersection of design and AI.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in design‑led startups; emphasis on product design, design systems, accessibility and consumer/marketplace/hardware/transportation tech sectors.

enrichment.firm_name: Launch House (House Capital / Launch House Ventures)
enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder of Launch House and a managing partner at its venture arm (House Capital / Launch House Ventures). Former product/analytics roles at Airbnb and Uber; writes Houck’s Newsletter. Active angel/early-stage investor focused on founders building in creator, crypto, and fintech spaces.
enrichment.career_background: Michael Houck co-founded Launch House in 2020 and helped launch its venture arm (House Capital / Launch House Ventures). He previously worked on product and analytics teams at Uber Eats and Airbnb, and runs Houck’s Newsletter and other founder-focused projects. He has been active as an early-stage investor and board member in several startups and leads investing efforts tied to the Launch House community.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed & seed) startups; Web3/Crypto; FinTech; Creator economy & newsletters; community/coliving-driven founders

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of WhatsApp and co‑founder/executive chairman of the Signal Technology Foundation. Donated an initial $50M (structured as a loan) to launch the Signal Foundation and has led its nonprofit effort to build privacy‑focused messaging. Former software engineer and engineering leader with past roles at Apple, Adobe and Yahoo. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Brian Acton is a software engineer and entrepreneur who co‑founded WhatsApp (2009) and helped grow it through its acquisition by Facebook in 2014. He left WhatsApp in 2017 and in February 2018 co‑founded the Signal Technology Foundation with Moxie Marlinspike, providing initial funding and serving as executive chairman (and later interim CEO of Signal Messenger LLC). Earlier in his career he worked at Apple, Adobe and Yahoo in engineering roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Privacy‑focused technology and secure messaging; open‑source software; early‑stage/seed investments in developer tools and cybersecurity.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and former managing partner of Master Ventures Investment Management (MVIM). Crypto VC fund manager and advisor to blockchain projects across Layer‑1, DeFi, infrastructure and gaming. Previously worked in equity analysis and management consulting roles.
enrichment.career_background: Orion Depp co‑founded and served as a managing partner at Master Ventures Investment Management (MVIM), leading institutional crypto investments and a Polkadot-focused fund. He also works as an advisor to multiple blockchain projects across Solana, SUI and Ethereum ecosystems. Prior to crypto, he held roles in equity analysis for a hedge fund and in management consulting.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage blockchain and crypto startups (Layer‑1, DeFi, infrastructure, NFTs & gaming); tokenomics, exchange listings and crypto capital markets.

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage angel investor and operator who led AngelList India and launched micro-funds including iSeed. Founder of Offline (a members' community for founders) and a partner in funds such as Galaxy and iSeed. Active investor in Indian startups across fintech, consumer, enterprise and crypto/web3.
enrichment.career_background: Somani helped bring AngelList to India and served as its India lead/partner before leaving in 2023 to start Offline. He launched the iSeed micro‑VC vehicle in 2020 (announced iSeed II in 2021) and is a partner in other early‑stage funds (including Galaxy); he has been an angel investor and board participant across multiple Indian startups since the mid‑2010s.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments across fintech, consumer (D2C/marketplaces), SaaS & enterprise, health & wellness, and web3/crypto

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner & COO at Third Kind Venture Capital based in New York. Former corporate attorney at WilmerHale and co‑founder/CEO of Funding Community. Holds a JD from Boston University School of Law and an AB from Harvard University. Focuses on early‑stage investments across consumer internet, enterprise and financial services.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Third Kind (formerly High Line Venture Partners) as Principal in 2014 and became Partner & COO; prior roles include co‑founder and CEO of Funding Community, Inc. and associate/senior associate at WilmerHale. Educated at Harvard (AB) and Boston University School of Law (JD).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed & Series A) investments in consumer internet, enterprise software and fintech/financial services; active in web3/crypto.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Avila VC, an early-stage firm investing at the intersection of hardware and software to rebuild foundational industries for a sustainable economy. Previously a principal at Elevation Partners and a co‑founder of Starlight Ventures; holds an MBA (Baker Scholar) from Harvard Business School and an engineering degree from Universidad Simón Bolívar.
enrichment.career_background: Patricia (Patty) Wexler is an investor focused on early‑stage, mission‑driven companies. Her early career included roles at BCG, DLJ, and The Walt Disney Company’s strategic planning group; she later worked at Elevation Partners, managed Tembo Capital (a family office), co‑founded Starlight Ventures, and in 2022 founded Avila VC. She mentors at Unreasonable and serves on/advises multiple startup boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage deep tech; energy & climate tech; advanced manufacturing; infrastructure & grid software; applied AI for physical systems

enrichment.personal_bio: Kingsley Advani is an investor, founder and operator — a co‑founder/partner at 305 Ventures and founder/CEO of Allocations and Allo. He is an active angel and early‑stage investor with a history of investing in crypto, fintech, biotech and space startups.
enrichment.career_background: Advani is founder and CEO of Allocations and Allo, a founding partner at Chainfund Capital, and a co‑founder/partner of 305 Ventures. Earlier in his career he worked in M&A/investment banking and has been an active angel investor since the 2010s.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed; FinTech, Web3/Blockchain, Biotech/Longevity, Space, Consumer & Entertainment

enrichment.firm_name: Earnest Capital (rebranded to Calm Company Fund)
enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and investor. Founder of Storemapper and co‑founder of SolarList; launched Earnest Capital (now Calm Company Fund) to fund bootstrapped and profit‑focused software businesses. Serves/served as General Partner at Earnest/Calm Company Fund and writes about building micro‑SaaS businesses.
enrichment.career_background: Tyler Tringas is an entrepreneur and investor who built and exited Storemapper after bootstrapping it, co‑founded SolarList, and worked in energy economics at Bloomberg New Energy Finance. In 2018/2019 he launched Earnest Capital (now Calm Company Fund) to provide founder‑aligned capital and mentorship to profitable software companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage, revenue‑generating SaaS and software‑enabled businesses (founder/bootstrapped focus); founder‑aligned financings (Shared Earnings Agreements); seed/early rounds

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor focused on pre-seed and seed opportunities. Previously a Partner at Expa and an investor at Norwest Venture Partners; earlier experience in business operations at Udemy and investment banking at Morgan Stanley. Active in consumer, marketplaces, and health-focused startups.
enrichment.career_background: Graduated from Stanford (B.S., Management Science & Engineering). Began in investment banking at Morgan Stanley, moved to business operations at Udemy, then venture investing at Norwest Venture Partners (2017–2020). Joined Expa’s ventures team in 2020 and was later a Partner there, sourcing and advising early-stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed; consumer marketplaces, marketplaces-enabled SaaS, digital health (including women's health), fintech, future-of-work and proptech.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Alpaca VC and a two-time co‑founder focused on PropTech and Construction Tech. Previously worked in real estate private equity, investment banking and J.P. Morgan Private Bank; co‑founded Soil Connect. Holds a BBA from the University of Michigan and an MBA from Wharton.
enrichment.career_background: Began his career in real estate private equity and investment banking, then ran a book of clients at J.P. Morgan Private Bank. Co‑founded Soil Connect (a marketplace for soil and aggregates) and now invests as a General Partner at Alpaca VC with a focus on real estate and construction technology. Educational background includes a BBA (University of Michigan) and an MBA (Wharton).
enrichment.investment_focus: PropTech and Construction Tech; early‑stage/seed investments in built‑world marketplaces, real estate and construction technology.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at OpenView; joined the firm in 2009 and was promoted to Partner in 2015. Oversees the firm’s platform work for portfolio companies (growth, sales & marketing enablement) and leads people/talent initiatives; manages OpenView’s ecosystem and sits on the investment committee.
enrichment.career_background: Joined OpenView in 2009 as Director of Growth Strategy, built and led the Growth/Sales & Marketing support functions (OpenView Labs), and was promoted to Partner. At OpenView she manages the firm’s ecosystem, supports portfolio scaling (sales, marketing, recruiting) and leads internal people initiatives. Prior roles include sales/marketing/recruiting positions at Michael Page International and Reality Digital; educated at Colgate University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Expansion-stage B2B software (SaaS); go-to-market and revenue scaling; talent and organizational development for growth-stage companies

enrichment.personal_bio: Operator-turned-investor focused on go-to-market and scaling revenue teams. Former AVP of Worldwide Business Development at NetSuite; joined OpenView in 2016 to lead its Expansion Platform and was promoted to partner in 2018. Now a partner at Stage 2 Capital, advising and investing in early-stage B2B software founders.
interests: Supporting female founders & diversity in VC
enrichment.career_background: Started in ops and sales at OpenAir/NetSuite (launched and scaled NetSuite's BDR organization), joined OpenView in 2016 to build its Expansion Platform, promoted to General Partner and member of the investment committee in 2018, and later joined Stage 2 Capital as a partner (joined Stage 2 around 2021) where she focuses on early-stage B2B software and GTM advisory.
enrichment.investment_focus: Expansion-stage and early-stage B2B software (SaaS); go-to-market, sales/marketing scaling and post-investment operational support.

name: Minn Kim
firm: Ridge Ventures (Formerly known as IDG Ventures USA)

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and founder focused on early-stage enterprise software and the future of work. Former Principal at Bloomberg Beta and Partner at On Deck; served as an Advisor/Venture Partner at Ridge Ventures. Founder and CEO of Lighthouse, a company focused on speeding skilled immigration for tech talent.
enrichment.career_background: Minn Kim invested at Bloomberg Beta (Principal) with a focus on machine intelligence and future-of-work companies, later served as a Partner at On Deck and as a Venture Partner / Advisor at Ridge Ventures. She is the founder and CEO of Lighthouse (focused on US skilled-immigration services) and has advised/seed-invested across enterprise and AI-focused startups.
enrichment.hometown: New York / New Jersey, United States
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed / Series A) enterprise software and SaaS; developer tools and infrastructure; AI/ML and future-of-work technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and co‑founder of Silvertech Ventures and a long‑time investor focused on early‑stage technology companies. Previously led U.S. activities at BRM and served as Managing Partner at Crossbar Capital. Seed investor and former board member in Payoneer. Based in New York and holds a B.S. in Economics from Wharton.
enrichment.career_background: Charlie Federman spent 15 years (culminating as Chairman) at Broadview, then joined BRM as its first U.S. managing director and co‑founded BRM Capital. He later co‑founded Silvertech Ventures and has served as Managing Partner at Crossbar Capital. He has been an investor and board member/advisor across multiple enterprise, security and fintech companies and holds a B.S. in Economics from the Wharton School.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Matrix (matrix.vc) who focuses on early-stage fintech, vertical software and adjacent payments businesses. Former founder/operator (Bonsai, Seiza) and Head of Product at Afterpay. Based in San Francisco and writes about payments, embedded finance and vertical SaaS.
enrichment.career_background: Former founder and product leader who co-founded Bonsai and Seiza, served as Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Matrix, led product at Afterpay during its U.S. expansion, and joined Matrix as a partner investing at seed through Series A. Educated at UC Berkeley and Oxford (PPE) and participated in Y Combinator.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed–Series A) investments in fintech, payments/embedded finance, vertical SaaS and enterprise B2B software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Simon Chan, PhD, is a General Partner at FirstHand Alliance and a serial founder-turned-investor. He co-founded PredictionIO (acquired by Salesforce) and later led product for Salesforce Einstein. He invests in early-stage B2B and AI-focused startups and is based in New York, USA.
enrichment.career_background: Simon Chan is a 4x founder and investor. He co-founded and served as CEO of PredictionIO (acquired by Salesforce), joined Salesforce to work on the Einstein platform, and later held venture roles including Venture Partner at Shasta Ventures and Executive‑in‑Residence at Sierra Ventures. He is currently a General/Managing Partner at FirstHand Alliance. Education: B.S.E. in Computer Science (University of Michigan, Ann Arbor) and Ph.D. in Machine Learning (University College London).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed B2B startups (SaaS, AI/ML, developer-first tools, enterprise software)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Symbolic Capital. Ecosystem advisor to Polygon and contributor to Beacon Accelerator; former VP/GM at Huobi US and founder of Traction Labs. Early‑stage investor focused on web3 and frontier technology; has backed 100+ founders.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Traction Labs (acquired), served as Vice President and General Manager at Huobi (Huobi US), was a partner/advisor at Borderless Capital and other crypto funds, and co‑founded Symbolic Capital where he invests in early‑stage web3 and AI projects. He also serves as an ecosystem advisor to Polygon and contributes to Beacon Accelerator.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in web3/blockchain (infrastructure, DeFi), decentralized scalability, and AI/frontier technologies

enrichment.personal_bio: Operator-turned-investor based in Seattle. Longtime leader of Madrona Venture Labs (managing director/CEO for ~2016–2025) and currently a Venture Partner at Madrona; transitioned to COO of Rover in 2025 while remaining a part-time Madrona venture partner. Serial entrepreneur with prior roles leading Farecast and Decide; holds degrees from the University of Washington and Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Mike Fridgen is a serial entrepreneur and operator who led multiple Seattle startups (co‑founder/CEO of TripHub; founding product lead at Farecast; founding CEO of Decide) before joining Madrona Venture Labs as CEO/managing director in 2015 and running the studio for nine years. Under his leadership MVL incubated and invested in 30+ companies. In 2025 he moved into an operating role as COO of Rover and continues as a part‑time venture partner at Madrona. He holds degrees from the University of Washington and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and sole general partner of Unruly Capital (launched 2022). Long-time angel investor focused on climate and deep tech; previously co‑founded Mission and Market and Semantic Ventures and has advised startups including Stripe. Based in Italy.
enrichment.career_background: Stefano Bernardi began in venture and startups (dPixel, Betable; co‑founder of Kickpay and Mission and Market), wrote for TechCrunch, served in Atomico’s angel programme and co‑founded Semantic Ventures. He ran a period of angel investing via his vehicle Smallholding before launching Unruly Capital in late 2022 as a solo GP to consolidate those activities; he also holds advisory and board roles (e.g., Renaissance Fusion advisory committee, Marble).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed-stage investments in frontier technologies (climate tech, deep tech, energy, advanced materials, bio); typical check ~€250k.

enrichment.personal_bio: Joanna McFarland is co‑founder and CEO of HopSkipDrive and an Investment Partner at XFactor Ventures. She leads pre‑seed and seed investments in female‑founded companies and serves on boards including Sidecar Health and LA‑Tech.org. She holds an MBA from Stanford and a BS from Wharton and is based in Los Angeles.
enrichment.career_background: McFarland began her career in investment banking and private equity, then spent 15+ years in product management and business development at companies including WeddingChannel, Green Dot and YP.com. In 2014 she co‑founded HopSkipDrive (CEO) and later joined XFactor Ventures as an investment partner focusing on pre‑seed and seed female‑founded startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage investments in female‑founded companies; sectors of interest include marketplaces, consumer, working‑parent focused products and social impact.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Venture Partner at Corazon Capital and founder/CEO of Inventables, a company that builds digital fabrication machines and software for makers. Regular speaker on product development and the maker movement; named a “Modern Leonardo” by Chicago’s Museum of Science and Industry and a Crain’s 40 Under 40. Holds a BS in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and long‑time CEO of Inventables (digital fabrication machines and Easel software); previously CEO of Lever Works. Co‑founded ORD Camp; serves/has served on boards including mHUB. Joined Corazon Capital as a founding venture partner in 2014, where he has led investments in physical‑product and early‑stage technology companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed, Seed and Series A startups across consumer internet, e-commerce, marketplaces, B2B SaaS, and physical‑product/hardware (IoT/manufacturing)

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at W Fund and CEO of SWITCH (formerly Women 2.0). Focuses on early-stage, tech-enabled startups led by women and other underrepresented founders. Long-time Techstars mentor and Entrepreneur-in-Residence at LaunchNY.
enrichment.career_background: Kate Brodock is an operator-turned-investor with ~20 years in the startup ecosystem. She is CEO of SWITCH and a founding/general partner of W Fund. Prior roles include CMO of untapt, COO of Atribute, adjunct professor at Syracuse University, founder of Other Side Group, and long-time mentor/EIR roles with Techstars and LaunchNY. She holds degrees from the University of Rochester, Emory (MBA) and The Fletcher School at Tufts (MA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed/Series A) tech-enabled startups led by women and underrepresented founders; sector focus includes fintech, B2B/SaaS, health & well-being, legal tech and media/content.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator focused at the intersection of media and financial services. Senior investment lead at Anthemis Group and Venture Partner / executive at Archer Gray, with a background as a film producer and former McKinsey consultant. Concentrates on embedded finance, payments in media, and creator-economy opportunities.
enrichment.career_background: Started at McKinsey, then led corporate advisory at Cinetic Media and co‑founded Small Coup Films. Joined Archer Gray in 2015 (partner/COO/CEO roles, vice‑chair) and serves on its venture side. Joined Anthemis' investment team as a senior/management-level investor, leading seed and Series A fintech and embedded finance investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Embedded finance and fintech; seed and Series A stage; media, payments, creator-economy and e-commerce integrations

enrichment.personal_bio: CEO & General Partner at StratMinds, a San Francisco–based venture capital and advisory firm focused on applied AI. Active angel/early-stage investor and advisor with a focus on AI, automation and UX/CX. Previously served in senior roles at IBM (Chief Innovation Officer) and Strategy& (Senior Partner).
enrichment.career_background: Founder and CEO of StratMinds (founded 2018), investor and advisor to early‑stage startups; prior senior roles include Chief Innovation Officer, IBM (applied AI) and Senior Partner at Strategy&. Acts as an advisor/associate with Creative Destruction Lab and has participated in fund and SPV investments across pre‑seed to Series A.
enrichment.investment_focus: Applied AI, automation, UX/CX, next‑gen commerce & computing; early‑stage (pre‑seed to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Product operator, founder and angel investor. Former product roles at Facebook, FiscalNote and Beam; co‑founder of HeadsUp (acquired by Hightouch). Served as a Sequoia Capital scout (2021–2023) and invests in early‑stage SaaS, Web3/crypto and developer-focused startups.
enrichment.career_background: Momo Ong is a product leader and founder who has held product roles at Facebook and product leadership roles at FiscalNote and Beam. He co‑founded HeadsUp (acquired by Hightouch in 2023), has acted as a Sequoia Capital scout (2021–2023), and is an active angel investor focused on early‑stage companies. He studied at Princeton University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre-seed/seed) startups; sectors include SaaS, Web3/crypto, sales & CRM, marketplaces and developer tools. As a Sequoia scout his typical check size was reported around $10K–$25K.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & General Partner at Cybernetix Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on robotics, automation and industrial AI. Co‑founder of MassRobotics and former telecom/regional manager with graduate study at MIT and a BS from the American University in Cairo. Active board member and frequent speaker on robotics investing and commercialization.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of MassRobotics where he led fundraising and corporate partnerships; served in strategy and research roles in robotics companies (including Vecna Robotics) after earlier regional leadership roles at Nokia Siemens Networks. In 2021–2022 he co‑founded Cybernetix Ventures to invest in pre‑seed to Series A robotics, automation and industrial AI startups and serves on several portfolio boards (e.g., Cambrian, Bionomous, Crgo).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed, seed and Series A investments in robotics, automation and industrial/physical AI; vertical focus on advanced manufacturing, logistics/warehousing, construction (AEC), healthcare/medical devices, agriculture and climate infrastructure; interest in enabling technologies (autonomy, machine vision, sensors/edge computing, cloud robotics, robot cybersecurity).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and managing partner of Base Case Capital, an early-stage VC based in San Francisco. Former product manager at Samsara with earlier roles at Rough Draft Ventures, Sequoia (scout), and Greylock. Focuses on first checks into pre-product and early product teams (seed to Series A).
enrichment.career_background: Alana founded Base Case Capital in 2021 to write early checks ($100K–$5M) into builders pre-product and pre-traction. Prior to founding the firm she was a product manager at Samsara (2019–2021) and held venture roles including Rough Draft Ventures (venture fellow), Sequoia (campus scout) and an investor internship at Greylock. She studied at Columbia University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and Series A investments in SMB/enterprise SaaS, developer tools, platform/infrastructure and product-led companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Alpine VC (alpine.vc). Previously a principal at Goodwater Capital and an associate at Redpoint Ventures; prior roles include Head of Business Operations at Stitcher and tech/finance roles earlier in his career. Holds MS and BS degrees in Computer Science from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Ed Suh founded Alpine VC in 2022 and leads the firm’s seed and Series A investing activity focused on product-led consumer and SMB software. Before founding Alpine, he spent multiple years at Goodwater Capital and Redpoint Ventures conducting seed-to-growth investments, and earlier worked in business operations at Stitcher and in technology M&A at Merrill Lynch. He holds MS and BS degrees in Computer Science from Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & Series A; consumer tech, prosumer software (creator & dev tools), SMB software; product-led growth (primarily US, with activity in Southeast Asia and other regions)

enrichment.personal_bio: Aravind “Avi” Bharadwaj is a venture investor who served as a Principal at Innovation Endeavors focused on enterprise software, data and AI/ML. He joined Intel Capital in 2022 as an Investment Director and leads investments in data/AI infrastructure and application companies.
enrichment.career_background: Avi holds an MS in Information Systems from Carnegie Mellon University. He began his career as a software engineer at Goldman Sachs, worked as a data scientist/consultant at IBM, was Principal at Innovation Endeavors (2017–2022) where he led and served as director/observer on multiple enterprise and data-focused investments, and joined Intel Capital in 2022 as an Investment Director.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software; data & analytics; AI/ML platforms; early-stage (seed–Series A) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Nobuhiro “Nob” Seki is a serial tech entrepreneur and investor; he is Founding Partner / Chief Investment Officer at Monozukuri Ventures. He previously served as an executive and CEO at Six Apart and cofounded FabFoundry. He holds an MBA from Carnegie Mellon University and a B.S. in Engineering from the University of Tokyo.
enrichment.career_background: Nobuhiro Seki has worked at the intersection of media, engineering and product startups for decades. He served as Executive Vice President and later President & CEO at Six Apart, cofounded FabFoundry (a hardware startup platform) and helped found the Maker Bootcamp/Shisaku fund initiatives; he is a founding partner and CIO of Monozukuri Ventures, focusing on early-stage hard‑tech and manufacturing-related investments. He holds an MBA from Carnegie Mellon and a BS from the University of Tokyo.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) hardware and deep tech: manufacturing, IoT/embedded, robotics, semiconductors/edge AI, medical devices

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner of Predictive VC, an early-stage firm that backs and builds applied‑AI companies with proprietary data moats. Former co‑founder and Chief Product Officer at Mural; earlier product roles at Digits and Kensho. Based between New York City and Latin America; Yale alumnus.
enrichment.career_background: Kevin founded Predictive VC (Predictive) to back and incubate Pre‑seed and Seed startups focused on applied AI and foundational industries. He previously co‑founded Mural and served as its CPO, and held early product roles at Digits and Kensho. He is an active angel investor and advisor to multiple startups across fintech, proptech, and AI.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and Seed investments in applied AI, fintech/payments, and product‑led software platforms with scalable data moats; emphasis on US–Latin America cross‑border go‑to‑market.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Maveron focused on early-stage consumer companies. Previously worked at Susa Ventures, Goldman Sachs, and Silicon Valley Bank. San Francisco native who studies consumer trends and supports D2C and consumer marketplace founders.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Maveron (team announced 2018) after roles at Susa Ventures (investor), Goldman Sachs (financial analyst) and Silicon Valley Bank (research associate). Stanford University alumnus. Serves on or advises boards including Sage and has acted as a board observer for Parade.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage consumer companies (seed/Series A); direct-to-consumer brands, consumer marketplaces, health & wellness, food/CPG, community platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Emergence Capital (2003) and long‑time investor focused on enterprise SaaS and cloud business software. Founder of seed firm Moai Capital and a Lecturer at Stanford GSB on angel & venture capital financing. Experienced board member who has backed and advised dozens of software companies.
interests: Early‑stage & seed investing (including consumer & IoT via Moai)
Impact investing focused on autism employment and inclusive hiring
enrichment.career_background: Originally an engineer (Raychem, RCA, Westinghouse, Polaroid) with MS and BS in mechanical engineering from MIT and an MBA from Stanford. Early general partner at St. Paul Venture Capital, co‑founded Emergence Capital in 2003, later launched Moai Capital (seed/impact focus). Serves or has served on multiple public and private boards and teaches at Stanford GSB.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage enterprise SaaS / cloud business software (primary); personal seed investments via Moai Capital in consumer, IoT and impact (autism employment).

enrichment.firm_name: Shift One (Sh1ft; later rebranded as Movo)
enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and operator focused on frontline workforce and logistics marketplaces. Former regional GM at Uber and COO at 99 (Brazil); founder/CEO of Shift One (now Movo). Active angel investor and growth advisor in Latin American and logistics startups.
interests: Upskilling and training for hourly workers
enrichment.career_background: Jason Radisson began at McKinsey, scaled operations at Uber as a regional GM, and served as COO of 99 in Brazil. He founded Shift One (Sh1ft), which later became Movo, and has been an angel investor and advisor to startups in logistics, recommerce and labor marketplaces.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/angel) investments in frontline workforce, logistics and HR/marketplace startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of TriNet and managing partner of UpVentures Capital. Active angel/seed investor and ecosystem builder focused on Upstate New York startups. Founder of several nonprofit initiatives (Upstate Venture Connect, Entrepreneurs Across Borders) and author of More Good Jobs.
interests: Community economic development and job creation
enrichment.career_background: Martin Babinec founded TriNet in 1988, served as the company’s CEO for its first 20 years and as chairman thereafter. He later founded and manages UpVentures Capital (an early-stage investment portfolio), cofounded StartFast and Upstate Venture Connect, and chairs multiple nonprofit and community-focused organizations. He invests primarily in seed and early-stage technology companies, often in Upstate New York.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage technology (SaaS, enterprise/HR tech), regional (Upstate NY) startups and community-oriented, impact-focused investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and investor focused on compounding technologies, human performance, and consumer products. Co‑founder of Ketone‑IQ (H.V.M.N.), Archive, and Anti Fund (with Jake Paul). Stanford computer science graduate and inventor with peer‑reviewed publications and patents.
enrichment.career_background: Geoffrey Woo studied computer science at Stanford and co‑founded Glassmap (acquired by Groupon). He later co‑founded H.V.M.N. (Ketone‑IQ), Archive, and the venture firm Anti Fund, and serves as a founding partner/board director at Betr and a board director at Simplebet. He is active as an angel and early‑stage investor across AI, robotics, web3, and consumer startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in AI, robotics, software infrastructure, web3/crypto, and high‑growth consumer brands (creator/consumer distribution).

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor with experience across early-stage VC and crypto. Has held investing roles at Alumni Ventures, Truffle Ventures and (later) Hivemind; formerly co‑founder of RestEasy and an EIR at Columbia Build Lab. MBA from Columbia Business School and bachelor’s from Virginia Tech.

Background in B2B software investing and early-stage deal work; began her investing career at Microsoft’s Accelerator.
