enrichment.career_background: Joined Primary Venture Partners as an Associate after working on the investment team at Insight Partners (prior to 2021). Early experience includes an Associate role at Microsoft’s Accelerator in Tel Aviv. Pursued an MBA at Wharton (class of 2024) after several years in B2B software investing and operator-facing roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage enterprise / B2B software (Seed–Series A); generalist on enterprise applications

enrichment.personal_bio: Product-focused investor and operator. Former Sequoia Capital scout (2021–2023), product lead at OpenSea, and co-founder of YC-backed Laguna; currently a Principal on Bain Capital Crypto’s team. Educated in the Jerome Fisher Program at the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Parth studied in Penn’s Jerome Fisher M&T program. He co-founded Laguna (YC W20), worked as a product manager at Uber and OpenSea (product lead), served as a Sequoia Capital scout (investing/advising in pre-seed–Series A), and joined Bain Capital Crypto as a Principal in 2023. His work spans fintech, payments, marketplaces and crypto.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and seed investments in crypto/web3, fintech (payments, neobanking), marketplaces and consumer product-led startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Student at Indiana University Bloomington and Venture Scout at LvlUp Ventures. Active in early-stage scouting with sector interests in Education, MarTech, Web3/Crypto and FinTech. President of INgineering at IU and founder of ConTracker; publishes a Substack on venture and tech topics.
enrichment.career_background: Venture Scout at LvlUp Ventures (since 2022). President of INgineering at Indiana University (since 2023). Founder of ConTracker (2020–2021) and contributor to campus VC and engineering programs; has held software engineering and product-management fellow roles and maintains an active GitHub and personal portfolio.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed to Series A); sector focus includes Education, MarketingTech, Web3/Crypto and FinTech; scout-driven deal sourcing and evaluation.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at 1confirmation, an early-stage crypto-focused venture fund. Data-driven investor known for building Dune dashboards and tools (including cryptoart-related projects) used to analyze NFT and DeFi activity. Writes on web3 product and market trends and publishes a Substack.
enrichment.career_background: Richard Chen is a partner at 1confirmation who focuses on early-stage crypto and web3 investments. He has built public on-chain analytics dashboards and tools to inform investment decisions, has written about product trends in crypto, and has been publicly involved in the NFT and DeFi communities. He has spoken and published about web3 investing and product strategy.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage Web3 / crypto: NFTs, DeFi, blockchain infrastructure, wallets and token-native startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Stage 2 Capital focused on infrastructure software and developer-facing platforms. Previously a vice president at Bessemer Venture Partners where he worked on developer platforms, data infrastructure and ML tooling. Holds dual bachelor’s degrees and a master’s in Materials Science & Engineering and a B.S. in Economics from the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Started in engineering and technical roles before moving into tech investment banking at Morgan Stanley and product management at Viagogo. Joined Bessemer Venture Partners in 2015 and was promoted to vice president (profiled by Bessemer in 2021); in September 2023 he joined Stage 2 Capital as a partner. Educated at the University of Pennsylvania (summa cum laude; MS and BS in Materials Science & Engineering; BS in Economics/Wharton).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage B2B software with emphasis on infrastructure software, developer platforms, data/ML infrastructure and developer tools (Seed–Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Operator-turned-investor focused on consumer product and marketplace startups. Cofounded Bib + Tuck (fashion marketplace), served in strategy roles at Rokk3r Labs and has acted as an investor/advisor/partner at Level Ventures. Founder of Sublime/Startupy and an active angel investor and writer on product, design and founder-focused topics.
enrichment.career_background: Studied at Brown University (BA); began career in consumer/retail investment banking (Barclays), then cofounded Bib + Tuck (sold in 2015). Later served as Head of Strategy at Rokk3r Labs, has been an investor/advisor/partner at Level Ventures, and more recently founded Sublime/Startupy while continuing angel investing and writing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed — Series A) consumer and marketplace startups; e-commerce/DTC, marketplaces and re-commerce, proptech, insurtech, wellness/family tech, and founder-led consumer products

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Ubiquity Ventures, a seed-stage firm investing in “software beyond the screen” (smart hardware and machine-learning-enabled physical systems). Former investor at Bessemer Venture Partners and founder/CEO of Triangulate. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BS in Computer Science from UNC Chapel Hill.
enrichment.career_background: Sunil Nagaraj founded Ubiquity Ventures in 2017 and leads the firm's seed-stage investments in companies that apply software and ML outside traditional screens. Earlier he spent several years at Bessemer Venture Partners (leading early investments including Auth0 and Zapier), founded Triangulate (VC-backed startup), and has held roles at Bain & Company, Cisco, and Microsoft. He holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BS in Computer Science from UNC Chapel Hill.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage investments in "software beyond the screen" — smart hardware, machine learning, developer platforms; B2B enterprise and physical-world software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Timothy Wolf Starr is a partner at LOUD Capital and a managing partner for the Pride Fund, a LOUD joint venture focused on LGBTQ+ founders. He has led regional community-building initiatives in Columbus (founder of Small Business Beanstalk / Connects Columbus) and runs venture programs through Atlas/Venture Atlas. His investing work emphasizes early-stage deals with an impact and inclusion lens.
enrichment.career_background: Starr founded Small Business Beanstalk (later rebranded to Connects Columbus), has led community and venture programs through Atlas/Venture Atlas, and serves as a partner at LOUD Capital. He is a managing partner of the Pride Fund (a LOUD-linked fund focused on LGBTQ+ founders) and has advised/served on boards and angel groups in the Columbus ecosystem.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture (seed–Series A); healthcare / digital health; lodging/hospitality and mobility; impact-focused funds (LGBTQ+ founders, DEI)

enrichment.personal_bio: Tomas Barreto is an engineering leader and angel investor who served as a scout for Sequoia Capital. He co‑founded Okay (CTO), which was acquired by Stripe, and previously served as VP of engineering at Box and Checkr. He advises and has invested in early‑stage developer tools, fintech, and health startups.
enrichment.career_background: Tomas spent over a decade at Box in multiple engineering leadership roles, later served as VP of Product & Engineering at Checkr, co‑founded Okay (acquired by Stripe in 2023) and served as a scout for Sequoia Capital. He has advised 20+ startups (including Loom, Modern Treasury and Oura) and works with early‑stage founding teams on engineering, hiring and operational scaling.
enrichment.investment_focus: Developer tools & engineering productivity; Enterprise SaaS; FinTech infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: William “whurley” Hurley is a technology entrepreneur and investor based in Austin, Texas. He is founder & CEO of Strangeworks and co‑founder & General Partner at Ecliptic Capital. He previously founded Chaotic Moon and Honest Dollar (each acquired) and served at Goldman Sachs; he is active in quantum computing standards work at IEEE and is a CERN & Society ambassador.
enrichment.career_background: Whurley has over two decades in technology and startups: early R&D roles at Apple and IBM; co‑founder of Symbiot and Chaotic Moon (acquired by Accenture); founder of Honest Dollar (acquired by Goldman Sachs) and later Managing Director at Goldman Sachs; founder & CEO of Strangeworks (quantum computing); and co‑founder/General Partner at Ecliptic Capital. He also serves in IEEE standards roles, is an Eisenhower Fellow and a CERN & Society ambassador.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A); sectors: quantum computing/deep tech, fintech, enterprise software, cybersecurity, climate/energy & advanced materials, life sciences/medtech

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Lofty Ventures and a longtime Chicago-based angel investor. Focuses on first-check to seed investments, often in Chicago and in companies led by underrepresented founders. Re-founder and board director at teaBOT; holds a BA from Vassar College.
interests: Underrepresented founders and diversity in startups
enrichment.career_background: Founded Lofty Ventures in 2014 to provide first-check and seed capital and build a community of founders; previously VP of Business Development at Loft Development Corporation and founder of WeCasa. Active as a board director/advisor (notably teaBOT) and an angel investor across software, consumer and hardware startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: First-check to seed (pre-seed/seed) investments in early-stage, primarily Chicago-based startups; sectors include software (SaaS), e-commerce/consumer products and hardware/robotics.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial founder turned operator and early-stage investor. Founded Polis/Knoq (acquired Dec 2020) and Fan Rewards/Squads (acquired Oct 2023), serves as a Founder Partner at 186 Ventures, and has participated in angel/pre-seed rounds such as Ability.ai. Also listed as leading creative experimentation at Ramp in public bios.
enrichment.career_background: Kendall Hope Tucker founded Polis (later Knoq) and led it through acquisition in 2020, then co‑founded Fan Rewards (aka Squads), which was acquired in 2023. She joined 186 Ventures as a Founder Partner and has been active as an angel/investor and advisor to consumer startups; public bios also list a product/creative role at Ramp. Tucker holds undergraduate study at Columbia University and has spent time studying at Oxford (visiting).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed stage; consumer internet and creator-economy products; AI & marketing automation; product-led growth startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Page One Ventures based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Founder and former CEO of Skymind and Pathmind, and previously a journalist at The New York Times and Bloomberg. Focuses on early-stage deals in B2B SaaS, data/AI, deep tech and life sciences.
enrichment.career_background: Former journalist (The New York Times, Bloomberg), later head of communications/recruiting at FutureAdvisor. Co‑founded Skymind (YC W16) and later founded Pathmind; held operational roles including at Clipboard Health. Joined Page One Ventures as a Venture Partner in 2022.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/pre-seed) investments in deep tech, life sciences and B2B software—particularly data/infra and AI.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Launch House and a general partner / managing partner at Launch House Ventures (House Capital). Founder & CEO of Micro (an email/CRM/productivity startup); previously a product manager at Google and Clearbit. Writes and runs the tech newsletter Homescreen and is an active angel investor at pre‑seed/seed stages.
enrichment.career_background: Brett co‑founded Launch House (a membership community and venture arm House Capital) and serves as a GP / managing partner for its venture activity. He founded and leads Micro (an email/CRM/productivity startup), previously held product roles at Google and Clearbit, and helped create Accenture Ventures. He publishes the Homescreen newsletter and is active as an angel investor focused on pre‑seed and seed deals.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage; sectors include Web3/Crypto, B2B SaaS & enterprise, AR/VR, social & messaging, and creator/founder communities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and managing director of gener8tor, a nationally scaled startup accelerator. He runs gener8tor’s accelerator and skills programs, focusing on early‑stage companies and community-driven startup ecosystems. Trained as an attorney (J.D., University of Wisconsin) and previously served as a federal law clerk and an associate at Quarles & Brady.
enrichment.career_background: Joe Kirgues co‑founded gener8tor (2011/2012) and serves as its managing director. Before gener8tor he clerked for the U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Wisconsin and worked as an associate at Quarles & Brady. At gener8tor he has scaled nationwide accelerator, gBETA and Skills programs and serves on regional economic and entrepreneurship boards (e.g., WEDC roles reported).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early stage via accelerator programs; sector‑agnostic with activity in SaaS, marketplaces, fintech, healthtech/medtech, edtech, food & beverage, cleantech and workforce/skills initiatives.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Metagrove Ventures, an early-stage fund linking Silicon Valley and ANZ/SEA. Former operator and engineering/product leader with experience across startups and corporates; hosts The Prompt podcast and founded Argon Labs. Holds dual degrees (BEng Hons; BBus) from University of Technology Sydney.
interests: Early‑stage (pre‑seed / seed) startups scaling between US and ANZ
enrichment.career_background: Barry has worked in engineering, product and growth roles at organisations including CSIRO, BAE Systems, Cochlear, Sensity Systems (acquired by Verizon), Skylo (SoftBank‑backed) and Verizon. He founded Metagrove Ventures (2022) to invest across Australia, New Zealand and the US, and later founded Argon Labs (technical content agency). He also hosts The Prompt podcast and mentors startups (including Techstars).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed to seed investments in industrial and enterprise technology across Australia/New Zealand, Southeast Asia and the US — sectors include industrial/logistics/supply‑chain, construction, digital health and foundational software; technology enablers include AI/ML, robotics, automation, and IoT.

enrichment.personal_bio: Technologist and entrepreneur with 25+ years in startups and infrastructure software. Founding Partner at Next Wave Partners and portfolio manager of a private/family investment vehicle; frequently serves as interim CTO or VP Product for portfolio companies. Writes and publishes analysis on AI, edge computing, and venture strategy.
enrichment.career_background: James Thomason is a founding partner of Next Wave Partners and a portfolio manager/analyst who combines hands‑on product engineering experience with securities research. He co‑founded EDJX and has served in senior technical leadership roles (including CTO at HyperGrid and senior roles at Dell), holds patents in cloud/edge and distributed systems, and contributes technology and industry analysis to outlets such as VentureBeat.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software, digital infrastructure, edge computing, AI, industrial robotics, IoT, and sustainable / infrastructure tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator focused on early-stage hard-tech and climate companies. Former Principal at Bleu Capital where he led investments across manufacturing, energy and systems-of-production sectors; earlier growth roles at Ara Labs. Educated at Wharton; based in Miami.
enrichment.career_background: Wharton-educated investor and operator. Early career growth and operations roles at Ara Labs (formerly Cargo). Served as Investment Associate then Principal at Bleu Capital, leading early-stage investments in climate and production-focused companies; later joined ImmuneCo (MoldCo) as Head of Growth while continuing angel/deal activity.
enrichment.hometown: Grew up in France; born in Singapore
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed to Series A); sectors include systems of production, climate/energy, manufacturing & materials, and supply-chain; typical check $150K–$500K.

enrichment.personal_bio: Gregory J. Blotnick is an investor, entrepreneur and author based in West Palm Beach, Florida. He founded Valiant Research LLC in 2025 after earlier founding and managing Brattle Street Capital and working at hedge funds including Citadel and Schonfeld. He publishes research focused on consumer equities and investor psychology and is the author of the memoir Blind Spots (2025).
enrichment.career_background: Blotnick began his investment career in 2009 at Doubloon Capital and later worked at Exis Capital, North Elm Capital, Citadel LLC and Schonfeld Strategic Advisors. He founded Brattle Street Capital (2019) and in 2025 launched Valiant Research LLC to provide market research and analytics to individual investors. He holds a B.S. in Finance from Lehigh University, an MBA from Columbia Business School and became a CFA charterholder in 2012. In 2022 he pleaded guilty to wire fraud and money laundering in connection with fraudulent PPP loans and was sentenced to a term in federal custody; he has since resumed public-facing research and publishing activities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Professional-grade market intelligence and analytics for retail investors; Consumer & retail sector long/short equity research; small- and mid-cap mispricing and turnaround opportunities, with emphasis on behavioral finance-informed risk management.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and community builder formerly on the investment team at Republic. Founded the Z-List (a curated startup roundup) and has served in roles focused on founder community, events, and early-stage consumer deal flow. Based in New York; studied at Columbia University.
enrichment.career_background: Columbia University graduate who joined Republic in 2020 and held roles including Investment Associate, Senior Investment Associate and Head of Founder Community (tenure at Republic reported through 2024). Founder of The Z List; active angel investor and organizer of founder events; has participated in All Raise (NYC steering committee) and venture fellowship programs.
enrichment.hometown: Born in Singapore; raised in Hong Kong
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer & retail startups; consumer internet; early-stage (pre-seed/seed/Series A); angel and scout investments; community-driven/crowdfunded financings

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Contrary. Joined Contrary in 2017 and publishes research and investment write-ups for the firm. Leads and sources early-stage investments across multiple sectors and runs talent/research programs affiliated with Contrary.
enrichment.career_background: General Partner at Contrary (joined 2017). Writes investment memos and research, runs talent and research initiatives for the firm, and is active in sourcing and leading early-stage deals across enterprise, fintech, consumer, and defense sectors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed–Series B) investments across enterprise software, fintech/capital markets, marketplaces & consumer commerce, defense/national security, and developer/infrastructure tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Fractal Capital based in San Francisco. Early‑stage, founder‑first investor focused on longevity and deep tech. Serial founder — co‑founded VocalEyes and Transcend (both had small exits/acqui‑hires) — and also a musician.
enrichment.career_background: Serial founder turned investor. Co‑founded VocalEyes (computer‑vision product for the visually impaired; IP/exits reported) and Transcend (acqui‑hire reported), served in operator roles at small startups/agencies, and launched Fractal Capital to make early checks and back founders. Active as an angel/scout in pre‑seed and seed stages and publishes occasional posts about investing and founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Longevity and deep tech; early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) founder‑first investments, with interest in AI/ML and biotech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Los Angeles–based investor and operator who builds and advises early-stage startups. Founder and executive producer of Rodeo Show and founder/managing partner of Nomadic Ventures; also listed as a partner at Coolwater Capital and (per investor directories) a managing partner at 01 Ventures. Background in brand strategy, production and media with prior agency experience.
enrichment.career_background: Raphael Leopold is a serial entrepreneur and creative executive turned angel/seed investor. He founded Rodeo Show (content development & production) after roles at agencies including Team One and TBWA/Chiat/Day, launched Nomadic Ventures to invest in early-stage companies, and is listed in industry directories as a partner at Coolwater Capital and as a managing partner at 01 Ventures. He is based in Los Angeles and participates in local venture events and mentorship programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed); MarketingTech; Media & Content; Wellness & Fitness; Web3/Blockchain; SaaS/FinTech

enrichment.personal_bio: Rebecca Danta is an investor and operator based in Miami. She served as Managing Director of Miami Angels (2018–2022) and is Head of Partnerships at OnChain Studios (since 2022). Her background includes operations roles at General Assembly and early-career work with Macy’s and Teach For America.
enrichment.career_background: Rebecca led Miami Angels as Managing Director (2018–2022) after joining as a Venture Associate in 2017; she transitioned to Head of Partnerships at OnChain Studios in 2022. Earlier roles include Global Outcomes Lead/Operations at General Assembly and Macy’s Executive Development Program; she began her career with Teach For America.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed (post-product, post-revenue early-stage technology); sectors: EdTech, HealthTech/medical devices, FinTech, Data Services, Web3/NFTs

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at The 81 Collection and co‑founder of Pressbox (rebranded Tide Cleaners after acquisition by Procter & Gamble). Former CEO of Tide Cleaners; previously worked in private equity and management consulting. Based in Chicago and a University of Notre Dame alumnus.
interests: Hard / underserved industries (manufacturing, construction, retail, services)
Automation, AI and smart hardware for operational businesses
enrichment.career_background: Started in finance and consulting (Goldman Sachs summer analyst; McKinsey business analyst), then worked in private equity (Friedman Fleischer & Lowe). Co‑founded Pressbox in 2013; Pressbox was acquired by Procter & Gamble in 2018 and rebranded Tide Cleaners, where he served as CEO and transitioned to an advisory role in 2020. Launched The 81 Collection as a founders‑led VC fund backing early-stage companies in "hard" industries (fund active from 2022).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed investments in "hard" or underserved industries (low-margin, capital‑intensive, operational sectors) including manufacturing, construction, retail, home & auto services; emphasis on automation, AI, smart hardware and operator-founder support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Former Principal at Floodgate and co-founder/GP of Formation VC. Previously worked in corporate strategy at Noble Energy and co-founded Digital Stairway and the GSB 20|20 Fund. MBA from Stanford GSB; BBA/BA from the University of Texas at Austin.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in strategic planning and finance at Noble Energy (corporate strategy), co-founded Digital Stairway (digital marketing), co-founded the GSB 20|20 Fund while at Stanford, served as a Principal at Floodgate (early-stage VC), and co-founded Formation VC (co‑founder/GP).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups; marketing/advertising technologies; consumer and education technology; space/technical startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Former investment associate/principal at iSelect Fund focused on agtech, food and health startups. Graduated Cal Poly (BS Environmental Management, 2015) and was a Venture for America fellow. Left iSelect in May 2023 and joined EarthOptics as Director of Strategy. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: David Yocom earned a BS in Environmental Management from California Polytechnic State University (2015), completed a Venture for America fellowship and joined iSelect Fund’s investment team as an analyst/associate (later principal). At iSelect he evaluated and led early-stage investments in agriculture, food and health startups. He left iSelect in May 2023 and took on a Director of Strategy role at EarthOptics, working on business development, product strategy and fundraising.
enrichment.investment_focus: AgTech, food & nutrition, and healthtech; early-stage venture investments (seed–Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & Managing Partner at TipTop VC, an operator-led pre-seed/seed fund focused on vertical AI and vertical SaaS. Former founding head of marketing and CMO at Greenlight Guru, where he helped scale the company and participate in a $120M+ growth equity raise. Based in Austin, Texas, and active as an angel investor and LP.
enrichment.career_background: Marketing and operator background: founding head of marketing and CMO at Greenlight Guru (helped scale the company and through a significant PE growth round), earlier founded and exited a media business, and since 2023–2024 has been an active angel/LP and launched TipTop VC to focus on vertical market AI investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed; Vertical AI and Vertical SaaS; B2B enterprise software across GovTech, ConstructionTech, AgTech, HealthTech, LegalTech, FinTech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Chief of Staff at Inventus Capital Partners (since 2022), supporting the firm’s seed and early-stage investments and operations across the US–India corridor. Previously served as a senior analyst at Everest Group and founded a campus chapter of 180 Degrees Consulting. Educated at BITS Pilani and completed a PGPM at MDI Gurgaon.
enrichment.career_background: Shikhin Garg is Chief of Staff / Senior Associate at Inventus Capital Partners (joined 2022), where he supports deal sourcing, portfolio operations and the firm’s SVQ co-investor syndicate. Prior roles include Senior Analyst at Everest Group (2021–2022) and founder/president of a 180 Degrees Consulting chapter; education includes BITS Pilani and a PGPM from MDI Gurgaon.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage technology (US–India), with emphasis on AI/data, enterprise SaaS, marketplaces, fintech and developer tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: Operator and startup-community builder who co-founded Startup Genome and served as an early hire/COO at Startup Weekend. Has run marketing roles at Dwolla and Kohort, supports founders through Startups.com and works with University of Arizona tech-transfer (Tech Launch Arizona). Co-runs the No Deposit No Return syndicate focused on solutions to the plastic crisis and sustainability.
enrichment.career_background: Shane Reiser is an operator and ecosystem-builder: early hire and COO at Startup Weekend, co-founder of Startup Genome, marketing roles at Dwolla and Kohort, Founder Group moderator at Startups.com, and a venture-development/tech-transfer role at the University of Arizona (Tech Launch Arizona). He co-manages the No Deposit No Return syndicate focused on investing in solutions to the plastic crisis.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / seed climate-tech and circular-economy investments (consumer & DTC products that reduce single-use plastics; compostable/bio-based materials; refillable/reusable/returnable packaging platforms; materials science and tracking/measurement tech for EPR).

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Brand New Matter (with BNM since October 2015) and co‑founder & President of Internet Game. Focuses on early‑stage technology companies and has worked on product, go‑to‑market and business strategy. Based in Brooklyn; raised in New Jersey.
enrichment.career_background: Krish joined Brand New Matter in 2015 and has served in roles from Associate/Vice President to Venture Partner. He co‑founded Internet Game (president) in 2021 and previously worked in new business and strategy roles at Dom & Tom. He studied Finance and Film at Rutgers University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage venture capital (pre‑seed to Series A); enterprise software/SaaS, travel & hospitality tech, marketplaces/e‑commerce, consumer

enrichment.personal_bio: Limited Partner / Venture Partner affiliated with Interlock Capital and active as an angel investor and advisor. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, he focuses on early-stage deals and supports underrepresented founders through mentoring and community funds.
enrichment.career_background: Operator and consultant background with roles in digital transformation and advisory; active as an angel investor, limited partner in multiple community/rolling funds, and mentor (including Techstars and On Deck). Participates as a venture fellow/scout and advises startups across product, go-to-market, and capital-raising topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups across Web3/Blockchain, Creator Economy, FinTech, SaaS, and Real Estate/PropTech

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner of HF Scale (the late-stage/growth arm affiliated with Hustle Fund). Former high-yield research analyst and investor at Bank of America and Brigade Capital. Founder and former CEO of CPG brand Watermelon Road (asset sold in 2020).
enrichment.career_background: Jamie began her career in high-yield research and investment banking (Bank of America Merrill Lynch), later worked as a research analyst at Brigade Capital, then founded CPG company Watermelon Road (2017–2020, later sold). Since 2021 she has managed HF Scale (Hustle Fund’s Series B–pre-IPO platform), focusing on growth investments and secondary opportunities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Series B through pre-IPO / growth-stage technology and consumer companies; minority growth equity and secondary transactions; consumer (CPG) and digital health sectors.

enrichment.personal_bio: Sportstech Venture Associate at Plug and Play Tech Center based in Frisco, TX, focused on early-stage sports and esports startups and partnerships with teams and corporations. USC alumnus; co‑founder of Alma Mater Angels and founder/owner of Let’s Bivy.
enrichment.career_background: Venture associate focused on Plug and Play's Sportstech vertical (based in Frisco). Previously worked with Techstars (Blackstone LaunchPad), served as a senior venture analyst at Astralabs, and co‑founded Alma Mater Angels; founder/owner of Let’s Bivy. Educated at the University of Southern California.
enrichment.investment_focus: Sportstech (human performance, wearables, esports, fan engagement, smart stadiums); early‑stage investments (pre‑seed to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Dave Nemetz is a media entrepreneur and angel investor who founded Bleacher Report and later launched Inverse. He runs Reverb Ventures, a syndicate that writes $150k–$250k checks into early-stage startups at the intersection of Web3 and the creator economy. He is based in Brooklyn, New York and advises founders on audience-driven growth and media strategy.
enrichment.career_background: Nemetz co‑founded Bleacher Report and later founded Inverse; both became notable media exits. After running and advising media businesses (including roles with Bustle Digital Group), he started Reverb Ventures to invest in early-stage companies that leverage media, creators and community—applying his operator experience to portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed—Series A) startups in the creator economy, Web3 projects, and community-driven media businesses; emphasis on companies using content/audience strategies to grow.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Tofino Capital, an early‑stage VC focused on frontier markets and frontier technology. Previously led international growth at Anduril and held commercial roles at Cambium and Osmo; earlier a senior director at McLarty Associates. Member of the USTR Advisory Committee on Africa and a Council on Foreign Relations international affairs fellow. Educated at Yale (M.A.) and the University of Victoria (B.A.).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and General Partner at Tofino Capital (investing in frontier markets and frontier tech). Held senior commercial and growth roles at Anduril Industries (led international expansion), Cambium (Chief Commercial Officer, 2022–2024), and Osmo (Chief Business Officer). Former senior director at McLarty Associates; member of the U.S. Trade Representative’s Advisory Committee on Africa, Yale President’s Council on International Activities, and a 2021–2022 Canada Fellow at the Council on Foreign Relations. Holds an M.A. from Yale and a B.A. from the University of Victoria.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed to seed) investments in B2B enterprise technology across frontier and emerging markets; themes include fintech, marketplaces, logistics, enterprise SaaS and frontier/deep tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Los Angeles–based venture investor and former Starburst Aerospace dealflow lead. Served as Global Dealflow Manager at Starburst Aerospace and as an investor at Starburst Ventures; later co‑founded/partnered at Generational Partners. Holds a BA in Economics from UCLA.
enrichment.career_background: Worked at Starburst Aerospace (Global Dealflow Manager / Analyst), invested through Starburst Ventures (pre-seed to Series A), and is a founder/partner at Generational Partners; background includes startup scouting, accelerator operations, and sourcing/diligence for aerospace and industrial tech deals. Educated at UCLA (BA, Economics).
enrichment.investment_focus: Aerospace & defense, space technology; deeptech/industrial tech; early-stage (pre-seed to Series A).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and general partner at Tofino Capital, an early-stage VC focused on emerging and frontier markets. Senior advisor/senior fellow at the Atlantic Council’s Africa Center, adjunct faculty at Georgetown, and co-author of The Next Africa. Holds an MBA from Wharton and an MA from Georgetown University.
enrichment.career_background: Aubrey Hruby co-founded Tofino Capital (2018) after a career advising and facilitating investment into Africa, including serving as Managing Director at the Whitaker Group and co-founding InsiderPR and the Africa Expert Network. She advises investors and corporates on Africa market strategy, teaches at Georgetown, and serves as a senior advisor/fellow at the Atlantic Council and a transaction lead at the Palladium Group.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/pre-seed) technology companies in emerging/frontier markets (sub‑Saharan Africa focus); B2B SaaS, fintech, logistics and marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and CEO of Witz Ventures; finance content creator and podcast host who builds media and creator-led fintech products. Former strategic financial analyst at Amedisys and an active angel/seed investor and advisor to fintech and creator-economy startups.
enrichment.career_background: Austin studied finance at the University of Tennessee and began his career as a Strategic Financial Analyst at Amedisys. In 2020 he co‑founded Witz Ventures to combine media, growth marketing and early‑stage investing. He has co‑hosted multiple finance podcasts and served in creator partnerships and advisory roles for fintech and creator-focused companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed) startups in fintech, social commerce and creator/consumer finance; media-driven distribution and growth marketing

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner / Partner at Hashed focused on global web3 investments. Former software engineer at Amazon Web Services (IoT & Robotics), founder of a last-mile logistics startup, Carnegie Mellon alumnus. Active in investing and ecosystem-building for blockchain protocols, gaming/metaverse, and infra projects.
enrichment.career_background: Baek Kyoum Kim is a Partner (General Partner-level) at Hashed where he leads and sources investments in metaverse, gaming, protocol infrastructure, and broader web3 adoption. Prior to Hashed he was a software engineer at Amazon Web Services (IoT & Robotics), founded a last-mile logistics startup, and has participated in programs including the Google Lunar XPrize; he holds degrees from Carnegie Mellon and has written Hashed’s public investment posts and blog entries.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth-stage web3/blockchain: protocol infrastructure (Layer-1/Layer-2, ZK), DeFi and infrastructure tooling, NFT/gaming & metaverse studios, developer platforms and crypto-native consumer apps.

enrichment.personal_bio: Barbara Corcoran is an American entrepreneur, author and investor who founded The Corcoran Group (1973) and sold it to NRT in 2001. She is an original "Shark" investor on ABC’s Shark Tank and runs investment activity via syndicates and angel deals. Corcoran is also a columnist, podcast host and public speaker.
interests: Entrepreneurship mentoring and small business growth
enrichment.career_background: Started in real estate after borrowing $1,000 to co-found Corcoran-Simoné in the 1970s, later founding The Corcoran Group and building it into a leading NYC brokerage she sold for $66 million in 2001. Since then she has written books, hosted podcasts, been a syndicated columnist, appeared as an investor on Shark Tank and led angel/ syndicate investing under Barbara Corcoran Venture Partners (later activity tied to Forefront/related syndicates).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage, revenue-generating consumer brands (DTC/food), real-estate related services and media/content startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and investor (CFA) focused on early‑stage Web3. General Partner at Bankless Ventures and co‑founder of NFT protocol Charged Particles. Active angel investor and advisor in crypto, DeFi and NFT projects.
enrichment.career_background: Ben Lakoff is a CFA and startup operator turned investor. He co‑founded Charged Particles, served as CEO of Intelligent Trading Foundation, and has been an active angel investor since 2016. Since 2023 he has served as a General Partner at Bankless Ventures, focusing on deploying capital and supporting early Web3 teams.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage Web3 and crypto (DeFi, blockchain infrastructure, NFTs), seed and pre‑seed investments, protocol and developer tooling

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at A* Capital, an early‑stage venture firm based in San Francisco. Former Partner at Coatue Management and previously worked in private equity and management consulting. Stanford BA (History).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and General Partner at A* Capital. Prior to A*, Siegel was a partner at Coatue Management (investing in companies including DoorDash, Instacart and Ramp), earlier worked in private equity at Altamont Capital Partners and began his career as a consultant at Boston Consulting Group. He holds a B.A. in History from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology (marketplaces, enterprise SaaS, consumer internet, AI, fintech); Seed to Series A

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Convective Capital, a VC focused on wildfire (Firetech) solutions. Previously co‑founder & CEO of WePay (acquired by J.P. Morgan Chase) and a part‑time partner at Y Combinator. Based in San Francisco and Mendocino County; holds a B.S. in Computer Science from Boston College.
enrichment.career_background: Bill co‑founded WePay and led it through growth and acquisition by J.P. Morgan Chase in 2017, then ran Chase’s small business merchant services. He later served as a part‑time partner at Y Combinator and founded Convective Capital to invest in technology addressing extreme wildfires; he also serves on industry boards and advises startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Firetech and wildfire resilience technologies; early‑stage (pre‑seed to Series A) investments in startups addressing prevention, detection, suppression, grid and insurance resilience.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder of EquipmentShare and co-founder of Appreciate; Venture Partner at Pioneer Fund. University of Missouri graduate based in Columbia, Missouri. Angel investor and advisor (recorded investment in CharlieMike).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded EquipmentShare (construction equipment marketplace/telemetrics) and later co‑founded Appreciate. Serves as a Venture Partner at Pioneer Fund and has acted as an angel investor and advisor to early‑stage startups. Educated at the University of Missouri.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage startups (pre‑seed to Series A); sectors: construction technology, marketplaces, transportation technology, digital health.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at PTC Crypto (Palm Tree Crew’s crypto/creator-economy arm). Co‑founder of Fleek and an early team member of Balanc3 at ConsenSys. Focuses on consumer Web3, NFTs and creator-economy projects and is a long‑time NFT collector.
interests: NFTs and crypto art (music & content NFTs)
enrichment.career_background: Brett Shear is a crypto founder and investor. He co‑founded Balanc3 (a ConsenSys project), later co‑founded Fleek (web3 developer platform) and since 2021 has served as Managing Partner of PTC Crypto / Palm Tree Crew’s crypto investment practice. Education listed on public profiles includes a Master of Taxation (Fordham Gabelli School of Business) and a bachelor’s degree in accounting (Florida State University).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer, entertainment and crypto/Web3 — especially creator economy, NFTs, NFT infrastructure, web3 social and decentralized web tooling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder of Propeller, an ocean-focused climate-tech venture fund, and co‑founder of HubSpot. Senior lecturer at MIT Sloan and a senior advisor to Sequoia; active in early‑stage ocean and climate investments. Public speaker and author on marketing and startup scaling.
enrichment.career_background: Brian Halligan co‑founded HubSpot in 2006 and served as its CEO before transitioning to chairperson and board roles; earlier he held sales leadership roles at PTC and Groove Networks. He is a senior lecturer at MIT Sloan, a senior advisor at Sequoia Capital, and in 2022/2023 helped launch Propeller to invest in ocean‑climate startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed to Series A) ocean‑climate technology: marine carbon removal, maritime decarbonization, marine robotics/sensing, mariculture/organics; typical checks ~$500K–$2M.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at Next Play Ventures who coaches and invests in early‑stage founders alongside Jeff Weiner. Former VP and Chief of Staff at LinkedIn, where he helped run strategy, operations, and the Microsoft integration. Holds BSE and MSE in Industrial & Operations Engineering from the University of Michigan.
enrichment.career_background: Began his career as a consultant at McKinsey & Company, joined LinkedIn in 2012 in Business Operations and served for years as Chief of Staff (VP) to the CEO and Executive Chairman, leading strategic initiatives and the post‑Microsoft integration. Since 2020 he is Managing Director at Next Play Ventures; he has served on the board of Boys & Girls Clubs of the Peninsula and is a Fellow of the Aspen Institute.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) startups in enterprise/SaaS, consumer internet, marketing technology and Web3/crypto; emphasis on founder coaching and operational scaling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director and Head of Strategic Partnerships at Closed Loop Partners. Leads investor partnerships, industry partnerships, partner communications and special projects. 20+ years working on sustainability from the local food movement to the circular economy. Holds a BA in Sustainable Development from the University of Wisconsin–Madison.
enrichment.career_background: Bridget has spent two decades building movements and partnerships to advance sustainable consumption and circular systems. Prior to joining Closed Loop Partners in 2014 she held leadership roles at RecycleBank, Purpose PBC, myActions and Fair Food; at Closed Loop she helps build the firm’s investment, innovation and infrastructure work while leading external affairs and partnerships.
enrichment.investment_focus: Invests across venture, growth equity, private equity and catalytic capital in circular-economy solutions — sustainable consumer goods, reuse/refill and packaging, advanced recycling and recovery infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at XEIA Venture Partners and founder of Empath Ventures. CFA charterholder with a background in quantitative portfolio management and machine learning; hosts podcasts on psychedelics and Human 3 topics.
interests: AI/ML for drug discovery and health
enrichment.career_background: Brom Rector is a founding partner of XEIA Venture Partners and the founder of Empath Ventures. He previously worked as a portfolio manager and quantitative researcher (including at Crabel Capital Management) and was an early hire at Turning Wheel Capital. He is a CFA charterholder and holds a Master’s degree in Computer Science with an emphasis on machine learning from Georgia Tech; he also hosts industry-focused podcasts on psychedelics and neurotech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) life sciences and healthtech: psychedelic medicine, neurotech/BCIs, AI/ML-enabled drug discovery, genetic medicine and longevity.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at AU21 Capital, a blockchain‑focused venture firm. Former bitcoin miner and early investor in multiple cryptocurrency projects and exchanges. Active advisor and investor across Web3, DeFi and blockchain infrastructure.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded AU21 Capital (2017) with Kenzi Wang to invest in blockchain and Web3 startups. Prior to AU21, ran large‑scale bitcoin mining operations and made early angel investments in blockchain projects and crypto exchanges; also serves in advisor roles to crypto projects.
enrichment.investment_focus: Blockchain / Web3 / Crypto (pre‑seed to Series A); DeFi, NFTs/GameFi, blockchain infrastructure, mining and exchange partnerships.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at S3 Ventures since 2010. Focuses on early-stage enterprise software and healthcare technology investments and serves on multiple portfolio company boards. Holds an MBA from the McCombs School of Business (UT Austin) and a BS in Finance from the University of Mississippi.
enrichment.career_background: Joined S3 Ventures in 2010 and is a General Partner. Previously worked at Harbert Private Equity Funds (Harbert Management Corporation) analyzing and structuring LBOs, and earlier was a commercial portfolio manager at Regions Bank. Education: MBA, McCombs School of Business (UT Austin); BS in Finance, University of Mississippi.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to Series B; Business Technology (enterprise software), Digital Experiences, Healthcare Technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Partner at Color Capital, a consumer and commerce fund. Former CMO and partner at Schmidt's Naturals; co‑founder of Supermaker and Club CPG. Invests in consumer, ecommerce/marketplaces and emerging commerce/web3 startups.
enrichment.career_background: Chris Cantino co‑founded Color Capital (2018) and invests across consumer, commerce and web3. Prior to investing he served as CMO and partner at Schmidt’s Naturals and has led product/marketing roles and creative work for brands and agencies; he is also a co‑founder of Supermaker and Club CPG.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer goods, direct‑to‑consumer (DTC), ecommerce & marketplaces, emerging commerce platforms and web3/crypto

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and partner at Placeholder, a New York‑based venture firm focused on cryptoassets and decentralized information networks. Former Blockchain Products Lead at ARK Investment Management. Co‑author of the book "Cryptoassets: The Innovative Investor’s Guide to Bitcoin and Beyond" (2017). Based in New York City.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Placeholder in 2017 to invest in early‑stage tokenized networks and protocol infrastructure. Before Placeholder he led ARK Invest’s Next Generation Internet / blockchain efforts and later focused on blockchain products. He is a published author on crypto investing and has engaged in board/advisory roles for protocol teams and projects.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in decentralized information networks and token‑based protocols — cryptoassets, protocol infrastructure, Layer‑1/Layer‑2 and Web3 developer tooling; emphasis on tokenomics and long‑term network value accrual.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner and Managing Director at Trammell Venture Partners, based in Austin, Texas. Focuses on early-stage, Bitcoin-native infrastructure, security/privacy technologies, and applied AI. Holds an MBA (IE Business School) and has served as a board observer and board member for several Bitcoin infrastructure firms.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Director of Trammell Venture Partners (TVP) since 2016, where he helped launch the TVP Bitcoin Venture Fund series. Active in the Texas blockchain policy community (Texas Blockchain Council), has served as board observer for Kraken and Unchained Capital and as a board member of Voltage; mentors at Techstars and Capital Factory. Educational background includes an International MBA from IE Business School and undergraduate study at the University of Nevada.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in Bitcoin-native protocol stack, Lightning/Bitcoin infrastructure, security & privacy technologies, and applied AI

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Figment Capital and Head of Business Development at Babylon. Previously served as Director of Protocol Strategy at Figment and Head of Strategy at Rio Foundation. Works on protocol strategy, staking/validator infrastructure, and early-stage Web3 investments.
enrichment.career_background: Clayton Menzel is a business development and protocol strategy leader in crypto. He has held roles across Figment and Figment Capital (protocol strategy, partnerships, and venture), led strategy at Rio Foundation, worked on growth at Eigen Labs, and joined Babylon as Head of Business Development. He has a BS from Florida State University and has authored Figment staking/protocol content.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage blockchain infrastructure and protocol-level projects (staking/validator infrastructure, Web3 developer tooling, protocol security and primitives; seed to early venture)

enrichment.personal_bio: Former OpenView investment VP/Partner who supported expansion-stage B2B software investments (notably Highspot, optimize.health, Postscript, project44 and Zipwhip). University of Chicago alum (ABs and an MBA). Prior experience includes Touchdown Ventures, Hyde Park Angels and roles at Target; later joined Stage 2 Capital as a partner.
enrichment.career_background: Daniel Heck earned undergraduate degrees in History and Economics and an MBA from the University of Chicago. He worked in merchandising/analytics roles at Target, moved into venture with Hyde Park Angels and Touchdown Ventures, joined OpenView (VP → Partner) where he focused on expansion-stage enterprise software, and later became a partner at Stage 2 Capital. He has served on/led investments in go‑to‑market and logistics-oriented software companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Expansion-stage B2B software (SaaS); product-led growth, go-to-market and enterprise/vertical software (logistics, digital health, fintech).

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Madrona Venture Group and AI researcher; Professor Emeritus at the University of Washington and General Manager & Chief Scientist for Semantic Scholar at the Allen Institute for AI. Co‑founded Netbot, AdRelevance, and Nimble Technology; works at the intersection of applied AI, ML and human‑centered computing.
enrichment.career_background: Daniel S. Weld is a long‑time AI researcher and entrepreneur. He served as a professor at the University of Washington (Thomas J. Cable/WRF Professor), co‑founded multiple companies (Netbot, AdRelevance, Nimble Technology), joined Madrona as a Venture Partner in 2001, and leads Semantic Scholar as General Manager & Chief Scientist at the Allen Institute for AI.
enrichment.investment_focus: Applied AI and machine learning; human-centered AI / HCI; early‑stage technology startups (seed & Series A), intelligent applications

enrichment.personal_bio: David A. Johnston is an investor and technologist active in Web3 and the commercial space sector. He has served in operating and investment roles including General Partner/Venture Partner at SpaceFund, Managing Director of his family office Yeoman's Capital, and COO/advisor roles at DLTx. He has also served as chairman of Factom and is an active writer/speaker on decentralized applications and smart agents.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and investor focused on blockchain and space. Verified roles include Managing Director at Yeoman's Capital (since 2016), General Partner / Partner at SpaceFund (served in that capacity starting 2018 per public profiles), Chairman of Factom (past), and Chief Operating Officer / advisor roles at DLTx (listed in public profiles).
enrichment.investment_focus: Space technology and the space economy; seed and early-stage venture investments; space transportation and related frontier infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Co‑Head of Venture Capital at 10X Capital. Founder of Growth Technology Partners (acquired by 10X) and former partner at Flight Ventures; earlier co‑founder of isocket and RoomHunt. Has led 10X investments including Robinhood, Headspace and DraftKings; holds a BS from Indiana University and an MBA from Dartmouth (Tuck) and is reported to be pursuing a master’s in psychology at Harvard.
enrichment.career_background: Venture investor and entrepreneur — founded Growth Technology Partners (general partner), served as partner at Flight Ventures, and joined 10X Capital via the GTP acquisition to become General Partner / Co‑Head of Venture Capital and COO/Head of Origination on certain 10X vehicles. Prior to VC he co‑founded startups isocket and RoomHunt. Education: BS (Indiana University — Kelley) and MBA (Dartmouth — Tuck).
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer‑oriented software and technology (FinTech, consumer internet, SaaS/EdTech, healthcare/life sciences); early‑to‑growth stage venture investments and partnerships with institutional capital.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Rogue Capital Collective and an early-stage (seed) investor focused on the "future of income" and real-estate software. Former founder of a Manhattan commercial real estate company; frequent speaker on entrepreneurship and technology ethics. Active as an angel/seed investor and advisor to startups.
interests: Future of income / alternative income platforms
Personal finance & financial literacy for mass market
enrichment.career_background: Diane Henry founded Rogue Capital Collective to make seed investments in tech-enabled startups. Prior to Rogue she bootstrapped and ran a Manhattan commercial real estate company; she has served as a TED Resident and works as an advisor and seed investor supporting founders on product, go-to-market and ethical/impact considerations.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage investments in startups focused on the "future of income" (recreational/alternative income, retail investor products), real-estate technology (data-driven proptech), and personal-finance fintech aimed at mass-market financial empowerment.

enrichment.personal_bio: Donna Harris is a serial entrepreneur and early-stage investor. She is founder & CEO of Builders + Backers and a co‑founder / General Partner of 1776 Ventures, and has served as Managing Director of the Startup America Partnership. Harris is active on boards and in ecosystem development work focused on expanding access to entrepreneurship.
enrichment.career_background: Donna Harris co‑founded 1776 in 2013 and has served as a General Partner at 1776 Ventures. She founded Builders + Backers (venture studio and investment vehicle) and previously served as Managing Director of the Startup America Partnership. Harris sits on multiple advisory boards and is an active angel investor; she holds a B.S. from Central Michigan University, an MBA from the University of Michigan Ross School of Business, and an honorary Doctor of Laws from American University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage investments in govtech, fintech, smart cities/transportation, education, health and energy; global focus with emphasis on regulated or impact-driven sectors.

enrichment.personal_bio: Doug Burgum is a founding partner of Arthur Ventures and a technology entrepreneur who founded Great Plains Software and later served as a senior vice president at Microsoft. He has served on boards of Atlassian, SuccessFactors and Avalara and has been active in early‑growth B2B software investing. Burgum was raised in Arthur, North Dakota and has also led real‑estate and regional economic development efforts in Fargo, ND.
enrichment.career_background: Mortgaged family farmland in 1983 to help fund Great Plains Software, led the company through an IPO and its 2001 sale to Microsoft, then served as a Microsoft senior vice president. In 2008 he co‑founded Arthur Ventures to back B2B software companies and has served on multiple corporate boards (Atlassian, SuccessFactors, Avalara) and as executive chair or director at healthcare and software firms. He has also led Kilbourne Group (real estate development) and served in public office.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑growth and growth capital for B2B enterprise software (enterprise SaaS), with emphasis on companies based outside Silicon Valley; healthcare tech and related vertical SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Hartmann Capital and founder/operator of a crypto-AI fund. Former Product Manager at Coinbase (worked on staking and Coinbase NFT) and former token-architecture lead at ConsenSys. Public speaker and contributor on crypto × AI topics.
enrichment.career_background: Ejaaz Ahamadeen has built products and token models across crypto platforms. He previously led token architecture at ConsenSys and served as a Product Manager at Coinbase (notably on staking and Coinbase NFT), and now runs a thesis-driven crypto/AI fund while serving as a Venture Partner at Hartmann Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Frontier tech (AI, Spatial Computing/AR–VR, gaming/metaverse) and Web3/digital assets

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and former Chief Experience Officer (CXO) of Meebo; advisor/venture partner at Long Journey Ventures and an active angel investor. Currently involved with Dandelion Chocolate (bean‑to‑bar chocolate) and early‑stage investing/advising. Holds a BS in Symbolic Systems (HCI) from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Meebo in 2005 and led web, product management and UX/engineering teams until its acquisition by Google in 2012. Earlier worked as Manager of Usability & Design at Synaptics. After Meebo she advised startups, co‑founded Edelweiss Ventures and became involved in building Dandelion Chocolate; she serves as an advisor/venture partner at Long Journey Ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (angel/seed/Series A); consumer internet and product‑driven startups; user experience and design‑led companies; food & beverage / D2C.

enrichment.personal_bio: Emily Man is a venture investor focused on fintech and B2B/enterprise software. She was Vice President on Redpoint’s early-growth team and has invested in companies including Ramp and FloQast. In August 2023 she joined Primary Venture Partners as a fintech-focused partner.
enrichment.career_background: Emily Man earned a B.A. in Financial Economics from Columbia University. She began her career as a public-markets analyst at Point72, helped build Point72 Ventures, then served as Vice President on Redpoint Ventures’ early-growth team where she led fintech and growth investments. She joined Primary Venture Partners as a fintech partner in August 2023.
enrichment.hometown: Grew up across Indiana (USA), Shanghai, and Beijing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech and financial infrastructure; B2B / enterprise & vertical SaaS; payments and embedded finance; early-growth stages (Series A–B)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Undertone and an early investor in adtech/martech startups. Now a General Partner at Aperiam (originally MathCapital), he invests in early‑stage advertising and marketing technology companies and co‑hosts the Marketecture podcast. Educated at Penn State University.
enrichment.career_background: Eric Franchi co‑founded Undertone (grew to $100M+ revenue; acquired by Perion in 2015) and moved into investing and advising startups. In 2018 he helped launch MathCapital (now Aperiam/AperiamVentures) and serves as a General Partner focused on early‑stage adtech and martech companies. He has been publicly active as an investor, podcaster (Marketecture), and industry commentator; he holds a BS in Marketing from Penn State University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage advertising & marketing technology (adtech/martech), CTV, identity & privacy, analytics & measurement, AI/ML for marketing, commerce/retail media

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at INBlockchain and a founding partner of Primitive Ventures. Writes the "Proof of Work" newsletter and is active in the trans‑Pacific crypto and Web3 ecosystems. Background in product design and studied at Peking University.
enrichment.career_background: Product designer turned investor — served as a partner/venture partner at INBlockchain (U.S. office) and co‑founded Primitive Ventures; contributor/author of the Proof of Work newsletter and involved in early crypto projects and exchanges.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in blockchain/Web3, crypto infrastructure and cryptoassets, payments and fintech, and media/content

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Contrary, a San Francisco–based venture firm that focuses on identifying and investing in early-career talent and early-stage technology companies. Contrary has been an early backer of companies including Ramp, Anduril, DoorDash and Vise. Tarczynski was named to Forbes 30 Under 30 (Venture Capital).
interests: Research and publishing on tech trends
enrichment.career_background: Eric Tarczynski founded Contrary (launched 2016/2017) and serves as its Managing Partner; the firm combines a scouting/talent network, in-house research, and seed/early-stage investing. Before Contrary he was an early employee at Kamcord and co‑founded a student payments startup; he also publishes Contrary Research and related publications.
enrichment.investment_focus: Talent-driven, early-stage technology investing (pre-seed/seed through Series A); sectors include fintech, enterprise software, consumer internet, and frontier/defense tech; primary geographies North America and India.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at gumi Cryptos Capital (gCC). Joined gCC in 2018 and focuses on sourcing and supporting investments—designing product and token models, finding product–market fit, and structuring partnerships and governance. Prior to gCC he worked in investment banking in San Francisco and holds a BS in Finance (minor in Cinematic Arts) from the University of Southern California.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in investment banking in San Francisco before joining gumi Cryptos Capital in 2018. At gCC he manages sourcing, executing, and supporting new investments with emphasis on token/product design, go-to-market, partnerships and governance; he has authored multiple gCC investment posts explaining lead/co-led rounds.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed to Series A) blockchain & crypto startups — DeFi, protocol & infrastructure, NFTs/metaverse, web3 gaming; token models and governance.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Pantera Capital focused on early-stage venture and token investing in blockchain and crypto. Former founding member of J.P. Morgan’s blockchain team (Onyx) and co‑founder of Scale8 Partners. Wharton School graduate.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Pantera Capital in 2019 and promoted to General Partner; leads investments across DeFi, infrastructure, and web3 gaming and supports portfolio development. Previously a founding member of J.P. Morgan’s blockchain group (Onyx), co‑founded Scale8 Partners (blockchain strategy/advisory), and worked in early‑stage venture at ff Venture Capital. Holds a B.S. in Economics from The Wharton School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage Web3/blockchain and token investments (DeFi, infrastructure, web3 gaming); portfolio development and founder support

enrichment.personal_bio: Former city transportation commissioner and urban mobility entrepreneur. Co‑founder of CityFi and author of Start‑Up City; served as a Special/Venture Partner at Fontinalis and as Executive Director of the U.S. Joint Office of Energy & Transportation (2022–2025). Advises and boards multiple mobility and urban tech startups.
enrichment.career_background: Started in the cycling and shared‑mobility sector (Bikes USA, Zipcar), founded On The Fly and CityFi, served as Director of DDOT (Washington, D.C.) and Commissioner of CDOT (Chicago), then moved to the private/venture sector as a Special/Venture Partner at Fontinalis Partners and advisor/board member to mobility startups; served as Executive Director of the U.S. Joint Office of Energy & Transportation (2022–2025).
enrichment.investment_focus: Next‑generation mobility and transportation technology; urban mobility, micromobility, shared mobility; typically seed–Series A and early‑stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Quona Capital, where he leads the firm’s India and Southeast Asia investment strategy. Experienced investor focused on fintech and financial inclusion with prior roles at Accion Frontier Investments, Lok Capital and Unitus; co‑founded Travelguru. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and engineering/management degrees from IIT‑BHU and IIM Calcutta.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Quona (since 2014), previously led Accion Frontier Investments in Asia, was a General Partner at Lok Capital and Asia Director at Unitus; helped lead Greylock Partners’ entry into India, co‑founded Travelguru, and began his career at Infosys.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech and fintech adjacencies in emerging markets (India, Southeast Asia, Latin America, Africa, MENA); payments, lending, SME finance, insurtech and embedded finance; growth and growth‑stage venture investments (Series A–B and follow‑on).

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Pioneer Fund based in Seattle. Former co‑founder of Edusight (education analytics), which sold technology assets to NELSON. Harvard Business School MBA; works in enterprise sales / sales strategy at Amazon Web Services.
interests: Enterprise SaaS / go‑to‑market and tech sales
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and CRO/President of Edusight (acquired technology assets by NELSON), MBA from Harvard Business School, MBA associate on Madrona Venture Group’s investment team, management consultant at Monitor Deloitte, and later worked in sales strategy / enterprise sales at Amazon Web Services. Serves as a venture partner at Pioneer Fund supporting YC‑aligned startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early‑stage investments (YC‑aligned); emphasis on enterprise software, SaaS, EdTech, health tech, fintech, marketplaces, and analytics.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and angel investor. Founder & Chief Investment Officer at 1/1 Capital; founder and CEO of Raise; co‑founder and managing partner at Protagonist. Focuses on payments, marketplaces, web3/crypto and consumer technology.
enrichment.career_background: Built and led multiple startups and investment vehicles. Founded Raise (digital gift‑card marketplace) and later launched 1/1 Capital (aka 1 of a Kind Capital) as a founder‑led family office (focusing on seed to pre‑IPO) and co‑founded Protagonist, a venture firm. Serves as an advisor to early‑stage firms and invests across fintech, crypto, marketplaces and consumer tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to pre‑IPO; sectors include payments, crypto/web3, marketplaces, AI/emerging tech, life sciences, space, enterprise software and consumer.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founding partner at Divergence Ventures, a San Francisco–based crypto/operator VC. Active angel investor focused on early‑stage Web3 and blockchain startups. Listed on public investor profiles with ~15–20 investments across DeFi, NFT and infrastructure projects.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑Founder & Partner at Divergence Ventures (div.vc). Works as an angel investor and has served as an advisor to blockchain startups (PitchBook/industry profiles list an advisory role at Saddle). Education entries on commercial profiles include Columbia University and University of Michigan. Based in San Francisco, CA.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage Web3/Crypto (blockchain infrastructure, DeFi, NFTs); pre‑seed and seed investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at OpenView Venture Partners (joined 2007). Former Executive Vice President of North American Sales at Oracle (1990–2003). Advises expansion-stage SaaS and enterprise software companies on go-to-market, scaling and operational execution.
enrichment.career_background: George Roberts spent 13 years at Oracle, most recently as Executive Vice President of North American Sales, and earlier held executive roles at System 5 and Applied Data Research. Since 2003 he has made private investments and served on multiple software company boards; he joined OpenView as a Venture Partner in 2007 to focus on expansion-stage, go-to-market heavy investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Expansion-stage B2B software (SaaS/cloud), go-to-market and sales-led scaling, product-led growth, enterprise software and vertical/digital health

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Chairman of Capital Factory, Gordon Daugherty is a bestselling author, startup advisor and longtime angel/VC investor. He has served on multiple company boards and advisory teams and is active teaching founders (Founders Academy) and mentoring via his Shockwave Innovations practice. He is a native Texan and holds a B.S. in Computer Science from Baylor University.
enrichment.career_background: Gordon co‑founded Capital Factory (Austin) and leads investments, mentorship and founder education there. He runs Shockwave Innovations (advisory/content), has held executive roles at companies including NetQoS and VCON, and has served on boards or as advisor to firms such as Apptronik, SwimTopia and Riskpulse. He has authored a book on startup fundraising and has been involved in hundreds of early‑stage investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology startups (seed–Series A); fundraising and go‑to‑market/customer acquisition; technology‑agnostic accelerator investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and managing partner at Phenomenal Ventures. Former head of marketing/communications at AngelList, Plaid, Quora and early marketing leader at Dropbox and Facebook. Angel investor and advisor to dozens of startups; based in San Francisco.
enrichment.career_background: 14+ years leading marketing at product‑first technology companies (Facebook, Dropbox, Quora, Plaid, AngelList) after starting in advertising; co‑founded Phenomenal Ventures in 2022 and serves as managing partner while also acting as an angel investor and advisor. Holds an MBA from UC Berkeley and MS/BS in Communications from University of Illinois Urbana‑Champaign.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed to Series A) enterprise software, fintech, and commerce; go‑to‑market/marketing‑driven startups; U.S.‑focused

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and angel investor; co‑founded Yext (served as CEO until March 2022) and later founded Roam. Also co‑founded Confide and has made multiple angel investments in early‑stage startups. Based in Miami Beach, Florida.
interests: AI / machine learning for product and search
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of Yext (2006) and led the company through growth and IPO before stepping down as CEO in March 2022. Co‑founder and chairman of Confide (confidential messaging) and founder/CEO of Roam (virtual office/Cloud HQ). Earlier ventures include JustATip and Intwine; graduate of Duke University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel investments (pre‑seed to seed/early stage) with emphasis on enterprise applications/SaaS, AI/ML, consumer internet/media, and remote‑work tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: Howard Wu is a co‑founder and managing partner at Dekrypt Capital. He is also a co‑founder of Aleo and co‑founder & CEO of Provable, with a research background in cryptography and verifiable computing from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Dekrypt Capital (focused on privacy and blockchain infrastructure). Co‑founder of Aleo and co‑founder & CEO of Provable (privacy/zk developer tooling). Research background at UC Berkeley in cryptography and verifiable computing; previously held engineering roles at Google and Meta.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage blockchain infrastructure, privacy‑preserving technologies, zero‑knowledge proofs, and developer tooling for private applications

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of NEAR Protocol and General Partner at SID Venture Partners. Former engineering manager and AI researcher at Google Research; co‑author of the 2017 "Attention Is All You Need" (Transformer) paper. Active angel/strategic investor in AI and Web3 infrastructure startups.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of NEAR Protocol (2017–present) and later appointed NEAR Foundation CEO; previously an engineering manager and researcher at Google Research working on TensorFlow and natural language understanding. Serves as a General Partner at SID Venture Partners and is an active investor in early‑stage AI and blockchain startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) software startups — AI/ML, deep tech, Web3/blockchain infrastructure, B2B SaaS and FinTech; primary geographies CEE & global.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at DBL Partners, an impact-focused venture capital firm. Longtime investor in cleantech, energy innovation and advanced technology; serves on Tesla’s board and has backed companies such as SpaceX and Mapbox. Holds a JD/MBA from Stanford and a BA from UCLA.
enrichment.career_background: Ira Ehrenpreis co-founded DBL Partners and leads the firm’s investment strategy in climate, energy innovation, sustainable products and technology. He previously led Technology Partners’ venture practice investing in energy innovation, has held leadership roles in NVCA and other industry organizations, serves on multiple corporate and academic advisory boards (including Stanford programs), and has been a board member at Tesla since 2007.
enrichment.investment_focus: Impact-driven venture capital: climate/clean energy and energy innovation, sustainable products & agriculture, health/food systems, information technology and advanced mobility/space; typically Series A/B and later-stage investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Conexo Ventures based in Silicon Valley. Technology executive and investor with a background in FinTech, data science and AI. Sloan Fellow (MIT Sloan) and former CTO/co‑founder of product and finance technology companies.
enrichment.career_background: Isaac de la Peña is a partner at Conexo Ventures (Silicon Valley hub). He has held senior technology and investment roles including co‑founder/CTO of Playrific, partner at Inveready First Capital, partner & CTO at Ágora Asesores Financieros, and senior technology positions at MicroStrategy and Pentagon Federal. He trained as a Sloan Fellow at MIT Sloan and serves as an investor and board member in multiple startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed / Series A) software investing; AI/ML, FinTech & payments, enterprise SaaS, marketplaces and cross‑border scale (Europe / LATAM / US)

enrichment.personal_bio: Former NFL linebacker and Harvard MBA who co-founded and is Managing Partner at Will Ventures. Background in wearables and sports technology with prior roles at MC10 and Sports Innovation Lab. Investor and advisor to numerous startups across sports, health, consumer and media sectors.
enrichment.career_background: Kacyvenski played in the NFL for eight seasons before moving into entrepreneurship and investing. He served as Global Head of Business Development at MC10, co-founded Sports Innovation Lab, led sports-tech investing at Blue Star Innovation Partners, and co-founded Will Ventures. He holds a cum laude BA (pre‑medicine) from Harvard and an MBA from Harvard Business School and serves on multiple industry advisory boards (USC Center for Body Computing, Northwestern Center for Bio-Integrated Electronics Sports Advisory Board, NFLPA Health & Safety Committee, Positive Coaching Alliance).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series A) consumer, health and sports-technology startups; media & entertainment; sports-adjacent businesses

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CEO of Protégé and a Sequoia‑affiliated scout/partner on Protégé. Former CFO and SVP of Strategy at Cameo; earlier worked at Chicago Ventures. Based in Chicago, IL.
enrichment.career_background: Jackson Jhin co‑founded Protégé (CEO, 2021–present). He previously served as Cameo’s CFO and SVP of Strategy, worked at Chicago Ventures as an analyst, and co‑founded Float Tickets. He has acted as a scout/affiliate for Sequoia and as a venture partner for early‑stage funds.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre‑seed and early stage startups focused on AI, consumer apps and marketplaces, creator/entertainment products, and talent/music platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director (growth) at Redpoint Ventures who focuses on AI, enterprise software and healthcare. Joined Redpoint in 2020; previously worked in product at Flatiron Health and held roles at Off Grid Electric and McKinsey. Holds a B.A. from Yale and an MBA from Wharton.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Redpoint in 2020 and works on growth-stage investments in AI, enterprise software and healthcare.
