Prior roles include Product at Flatiron Health and work at Off Grid Electric and McKinsey. Education: B.A. in Economics & History from Yale; MBA from The Wharton School (Palmer Scholar).
enrichment.investment_focus: AI, enterprise software (SaaS), healthcare; primarily growth-stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Jake Paul is an American social-media creator, actor and professional boxer who co-founded the venture firm Anti Fund. He has expanded into startups and consumer brands (including co-founding Betr and incubating the W personal-care brand). Paul is publicly active as an investor in early-stage consumer, crypto/Web3 and sports/gambling businesses.
enrichment.career_background: Began as a Vine and YouTube creator, moved into acting and then professional boxing, and in 2021 co-founded the rolling venture fund Anti Fund with Geoffrey Woo. Since then he has been involved in founding and incubating businesses (Betr, W) and participating in Anti Fund investments across consumer, crypto, gaming and sports-tech sectors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture investments in consumer & DTC brands, creator-economy businesses, crypto/Web3, gaming and sports/gambling; also opportunistic allocations to AI/robotics and defense-related startups.

enrichment.firm_name: Starbloom Capital (also known as Starbloom Ventures)
enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Director of Starbloom; investor focused on frontier technologies. Early investor in Ethereum and founder of the Amaranth Foundation, which funds neuroscience and longevity research. Backs companies and research across longevity biotech, neuroAI, AI, and crypto.
enrichment.career_background: James Fickel is the founder and managing director of Starbloom (Starbloom Capital/Starbloom Ventures). He is described on the firm website as an investor and futurist who invested early in Ethereum and has used his capital to support projects in longevity, neuroscience, AI and crypto. He also founded the Amaranth Foundation to accelerate neuroscience and longevity research and has backed initiatives such as the Enigma Project, E11 Bio and Forest Neurotech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments (Seed, Series A) in longevity biotech, neuroAI/neurotechnology, deep-tech AI, and Web3/crypto.

enrichment.personal_bio: Technology executive and angel investor based in San Francisco. Former Head of Engineering and later CTO at Plaid, and previously Director of Engineering at Dropbox. Active angel/co-investor (ASDF Ventures) with a focus on fintech infrastructure and enterprise/SaaS.
enrichment.career_background: Jean-Denis Greze is a technology leader and investor who joined Plaid as Head of Engineering in 2017 and was promoted to CTO in 2021; he previously served as Director of Engineering at Dropbox (2013	32017). He has been an active angel/co-investor through ASDF Ventures and publicly listed investments across fintech, developer tooling, and enterprise SaaS. In 2024 he co-founded Town, an AI-driven tax/services startup. Public bios list CS degrees from Columbia and a JD from Harvard Law.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech infrastructure and payments; developer APIs and tools; enterprise/SaaS (SMB-focused); angel and early-stage (seed to Series A) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Chapter One Ventures. Former VP of Product, Revenue at Tinder, where he led monetization efforts including Tinder Gold and Boost and managed the revenue team through the company’s IPO. Active angel investor since 2016 and a seed-stage backer or scout of multiple startups that became unicorns.
enrichment.career_background: Jeff Morris Jr. began investing in 2016 as an angel and scout for Index Ventures. He was an early team member and served as VP of Product, Revenue at Tinder, leading revenue/product teams and major monetization launches. He founded Chapter One (2017) to invest in and operate with product-first seed-stage companies. Education: BA and MBA, University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) product-first startups across web3/crypto, fintech, consumer/mobile (subscriptions/monetization), developer tools/infrastructure, AI/ML, and SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder, CEO and General Partner at Embedded Ventures based in Los Angeles. Former deep‑tech recruiter turned VC who invests in early‑stage hardware and space startups. Attended Auburn University and California State University, Northridge.
enrichment.career_background: Began her career in technical recruiting in Los Angeles, later served as a partner at Riot Ventures and co‑founded Embedded Ventures (2020). She has co‑founded and incubated hardware/design startups (Zoo/KittyCAD) and leads investments in early‑stage space and hardware companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage deep tech: space systems/operations, digital engineering and design tooling, advanced manufacturing & hardware; pre‑seed/seed through Series A; commercial and dual‑use (defense/commercial) opportunities.

enrichment.firm_name: Climate Capital (Climate Capital Bio — now Juniper)
enrichment.personal_bio: Jennifer Kan, PhD, is a scientist‑turned‑investor who leads technical due diligence for Climate Capital’s bio practice (now spun out as Juniper). She holds a PhD in Chemistry from the University of Cambridge and was a postdoctoral protein engineer at Caltech in Frances H. Arnold’s lab. Kan is a founding partner of Juniper/Climate Capital Bio and a former co‑founder of Simpl.Care.
enrichment.career_background: PhD (Chemistry) from the University of Cambridge; postdoctoral scholar in synthetic biology/protein engineering at Caltech (lab of Frances H. Arnold). Worked as a scientific/technical consultant (including projects with L'Oréal), co‑founded the venture‑backed startup Simpl.Care, and is a founding partner/managing partner of Climate Capital Bio (now Juniper) where she leads technical due diligence and invests in early‑stage climate biotech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / Seed climate biotech and bioindustrial startups; synthetic biology, materials & chemicals, food & agriculture, and deep‑tech solutions that reduce greenhouse gas emissions

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture partner and limited partner at rali_cap with a background in fintech and financial inclusion. Works in GTM at OpenAI (since 2023) and contributes writing on fintech topics. Holds an MBA from Stanford and a BS in Economics from Middlebury College.
interests: Emerging markets (Africa, Latin America, South/Southeast Asia)
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment banking (Goldman Sachs), moved into impact/financial-inclusion investing with Omidyar Network and Flourish Ventures, worked on bank partnerships at Modern Treasury, served as venture partner at Better Tomorrow Ventures, and is a venture partner/LP at rali_cap while working in GTM at OpenAI. Education includes an MBA from Stanford GSB and a BS from Middlebury College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage fintech (B2B / API-first) in emerging markets (Africa, LatAm, South Asia); selective early-stage climate tech exposure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Sweater (aka Sweater Ventures), a Boulder-based fintech/VC platform that opened retail access to venture capital via the Cashmere Fund. Leads product and fund strategy to democratize venture investing; holds an MBA from Thunderbird School of Global Management. Public-facing operator active on LinkedIn and industry podcasts.
interests: Democratizing access to venture capital/retail investing
Fintech platforms and fund infrastructure (interval/public VC funds)
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Sweater (launched 2019; Cashmere Fund launched 2022) and serves as CEO. Prior founder/executive roles include Raveil (co‑founder/CEO) and consulting/operations roles referenced at firms such as Deviant Strategy, Guidely and ClearVoice. Education listed includes an MBA from Thunderbird School of Global Management.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech-enabled venture funds that open VC to retail investors; consumer-facing early-stage startups; seed to growth-stage investments; fund-as-a-service and partner fund launches

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner (Strategic Investment) at Echo Health Ventures who sources and invests in emerging and growth-stage health care companies focused on tech-enabled services, insurtech, and digital health. She is a seasoned venture capitalist and board leader with two decades of experience across independent, corporate, and university funds. Based in Boston, MA.
enrichment.career_background: Jessica previously served as Director of Healthcare Investments at GE Ventures and as a Principal at Lemhi Ventures. Earlier roles include work on university spin-outs and company formation at University of Minnesota and Oregon Health & Science University, and investment/strategy roles at Greenspring Advisors. She holds a BA from Stanford University, an MHS and PhD from Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health, and an MBA from Regis University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Tech-enabled services, digital health, insurtech and health IT; early and growth-stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator focused on early-stage companies. Formerly VP of Corporate Development & Strategy at Twitter (employee #34) and a General Partner at GV; co‑founder of the #ANGELS investing collective. Co‑founder and Managing Director of Adverb Ventures, based in the Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Jessica Verrilli began her career in venture and corporate roles, spent ~8–9 years at Twitter rising to VP of Corporate Development & Strategy (led acquisitions including Vine and Periscope), co‑founded the #ANGELS angel collective, served as a General Partner at GV, and in 2023 co‑founded Adverb Ventures where she is Managing Director. She holds a B.A. in Human Biology from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed through Series A); sector interests include enterprise SaaS, developer tools, fintech/financial infrastructure, marketplaces/labor platforms, healthcare/diagnostics, and crypto infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Lobby Capital and a senior engineering leader (VP of Engineering at Meta). Co‑founder and former SVP of Engineering at Lightspark and founder/CEO of Luminate, with prior senior engineering roles at Instagram/Facebook, Yahoo, LiveOps, Tellme and Netscape. Lives in Marin County, California.
enrichment.career_background: Four‑decade engineering and founder career: founded Luminate (CEO/CTO), co‑founded Lightspark (SVP Engineering), held senior engineering leadership roles at LiveOps, Tellme, Netscape and Borland, served as VP of Engineering for Yahoo properties and for Novi/Instagram at Facebook/Meta, and is a Venture Partner at Lobby Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage venture capital (Seed–Series A); enterprise infrastructure & applications; consumer internet & marketplaces; FinTech/payments & Web3.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur, angel investor and educator based in San Francisco. Co‑founder/chairman of M34 Capital and co‑founder or chairman of Zignal Labs, Triporati and LaunchPad Central (GLIDR). Has taught Lean LaunchPad/I‑Corps at Berkeley, Stanford and Princeton; holds an MBA from Harvard and an AB from Princeton.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Preview Travel (later merged into Travelocity, where he served as founding Vice Chairman), then co‑founded Triporati, Zignal Labs and LaunchPad Central (GLIDR). Co‑founder and chairman at M34 Capital. Longstanding angel investor through a family fund (Hornthal Investment Partners) and a lecturer/fellow in entrepreneurship at UC Berkeley and other universities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology products and services; early‑stage / seed investments; commercializing technologies spun out of research.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Manicode Security, Jim Manico is an application-security educator, OWASP project lead and Java Champion. He is an angel/advisor to multiple security startups and is listed as a fund-limited investor with Aviso Ventures. He is the author of "Iron‑Clad Java: Building Secure Web Applications."
enrichment.career_background: Jim Manico founded Manicode Security to provide secure-coding training and serves as a frequent speaker and advisor in application security. He volunteers with OWASP (former global board member and project co-lead for ASVS and the Cheatsheet Series), holds Java Champion recognition, and advises/invests in multiple security startups while acting as a fund-limited investor with Aviso Ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage enterprise software with emphasis on cybersecurity, infrastructure, data and AI; developer/security tooling and application security

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of O'Shaughnessy Ventures and the founder of O'Shaughnessy Asset Management (OSAM). Known for quantitative equity research and author of What Works on Wall Street and other investing books. Active investor in early-stage technology and creator-focused ventures; publicly involved with Stability AI and multiple seed investments.
enrichment.career_background: Jim O'Shaughnessy built a career in quantitative investing: he founded O'Shaughnessy Capital Management, served as Director of Systematic Equity at Bear Stearns, then founded O'Shaughnessy Asset Management (OSAM), which was acquired by Franklin Templeton. After retiring from OSAM leadership, he launched O'Shaughnessy Ventures (OSV) to invest in early-stage startups and creative projects; he is also the author of several books on investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and pre-seed / early-stage technology (AI, creator-focused media and film, education/edtech); creative projects and fellowships.

enrichment.personal_bio: Multiple startup founder and angel investor based in Brooklyn. Co‑founded Bison Trails (acquired by Coinbase) and Grand St. Former product leader at Coinbase and Etsy; currently a partner at Ambush Capital, investing at angel/seed stage.
enrichment.career_background: Joe Lallouz is a serial entrepreneur and operator turned angel investor. He co‑founded Grand St. (acquired by Etsy) and Bison Trails (acquired by Coinbase), served in product leadership roles at Etsy and later at Coinbase (Coinbase Cloud), and is a founding partner at Ambush Capital. He holds dual B.S. degrees from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (angel/seed) investments in blockchain/crypto infrastructure, developer tooling, and product/SaaS consumer startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co‑founder of Placeholder, a thesis‑driven VC focused on decentralized networks and crypto protocols. He invests in token‑native projects, network governance, and Web3 infrastructure. Previously on the Union Square Ventures investment team and author of the "Fat Protocols" thesis.
enrichment.career_background: Started in VC at Union Square Ventures (joined the investment team in 2014), where he developed USV's early blockchain thesis and portfolio. In 2017 he co‑founded Placeholder with Chris Burniske (with Brad Burnham as venture partner) to invest in decentralized information networks. Earlier in his career he co‑founded startups, ran a software development shop and worked on digital economy/public policy in the Dominican Republic.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in decentralized networks, token‑native protocols, Web3 infrastructure, governance/tokenomics, and on‑chain financial systems.

enrichment.personal_bio: Author and investor; founder and General Partner of Wild Ventures. Led early investments and pre-launch advising for consumer health brands including Thrive Market, Primal Kitchen, Magic Spoon and LMNT. Author of The Paleo Manifesto and co-author of Spartan Fit. Based in Austin, Texas.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and General Partner at Wild Ventures (seed/early-stage fund focused on consumer health). Previously authored The Paleo Manifesto and co‑authored Spartan Fit; has served as advisor or board member to multiple consumer health companies (including pre-launch advising for Thrive Market, Primal Kitchen, Kettle & Fire, Magic Spoon) and studied history at Harvard.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage consumer health: food & beverage and wellness CPG, consumer health tech, D2C/influencer-driven distribution

enrichment.personal_bio: Jonah Goodhart is a New York–based entrepreneur and angel investor. He co-founded WGI Group and co-founded and served as CEO of Moat (acquired by Oracle). He currently co-runs Montauk Labs and invests in early-stage technology companies, particularly in adtech and media.
enrichment.career_background: Jonah began building internet businesses at Cornell (Colonize.com), was a founding investor in Right Media, co-founded Smarter Ad Group, and co-founded Moat (served as CEO; acquired by Oracle). He is a founding partner of WGI Group (seed/early-stage fund) and co-founder of Montauk Labs; he sits on several boards and advises adtech/media startups. He studied at Cornell University (B.A.).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage technology investments (adtech, enterprise SaaS, consumer internet, media/publisher tech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Product and operations leader focused on applied AI in healthcare. Vice President, Generative AI and Head of Tempus One at Tempus; also a venture partner/advisor and angel investor. Educated at the University of Michigan (BA) and Northwestern University (MS).
enrichment.career_background: Early Tempus team member who built and led product and clinical data programs (Director of Product → Senior Director Operations → VP, Generative AI / Head of Tempus One). Co-founder of WÜF (IoT consumer product), adjunct lecturer at Northwestern, inventor on issued patents, and active advisor/angel investor and venture partner (including Good Growth Capital and Great North Ventures).
enrichment.investment_focus: Stage: Seed–Series A; Sectors: digital health and precision medicine, generative AI / ML, enterprise SaaS, XR/consumer tech, IoT & hardware.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Managing Partner at Quona Capital, where he leads the firm’s Latin America investment strategy. He is a seasoned investor and entrepreneur with 25+ years of experience in Latin America, previously co-founding Acesso (prepaid financial services) and managing Darby Technology Ventures. His work focuses on fintech solutions serving underserved consumers and small businesses.
enrichment.career_background: Jonathan Whittle co-founded Quona Capital in 2015 and serves as a Managing Partner leading Latin America investments. Prior roles include Managing Director, Frontier Investments Group at Accion (2014–2015), co‑founder & CEO of Acesso Soluções de Pagamentos (2010–2013), and Head of Darby Technology Ventures (2002–2011). Earlier in his career he was part of the founding teams of Diveo and Optiglobe (now Tivit).
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech for financial inclusion in emerging markets — payments, lending, embedded finance; early to growth-stage venture investments (Seed through Series A/B).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder and General Partner at Embedded Ventures. Co‑founder and Executive Chairman of Zoo (formerly KittyCAD) and founding CTO of Relativity Space. BS in Aerospace Engineering from the University of Southern California; based in the greater Los Angeles area.
enrichment.career_background: Jordan Noone co‑founded Relativity Space (served as founding CTO) and later co‑founded Embedded Ventures in 2020 to invest in early‑stage deep tech startups. He also co‑founded Zoo (hardware design tools) and has engineering experience at SpaceX, Blue Origin and Hughes Research Laboratories. He holds a BS in Aerospace Engineering from USC and remains active with USC’s Rocket Propulsion Lab.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage deep tech focused on space operations, digital engineering, and advanced manufacturing (including dual‑use/national‑security‑capable technologies).

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on Redpoint’s early-stage team; joined Redpoint in 2021 and focuses on enterprise software including developer tools, AI, security, and cloud infrastructure. Holds a BS and MS from Stanford University and previously worked at early-stage roles across startups and at C3.ai, Palantir and RelateIQ. Active as a board observer / seed investor across multiple infrastructure and AI startups.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Redpoint in 2021 (Principal, later promoted to Partner in 2023) to invest in Seed/Series A enterprise companies. Prior roles include forward‑deployed solutions and engineering/product positions at C3.ai, Palantir and RelateIQ, and operating/investor roles at small startups; holds BS and MS from Stanford (Computer Science and Management Science & Engineering).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and Series A enterprise software (developer tools, infrastructure, AI, security, and SaaS)

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and angel investor based in Austin, TX. Co‑founder and former CMO of GigKloud and has worked in product marketing and business development roles. Served as Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Starta Ventures (Feb 2019–Mar 2020) and has angel investments including Equally and effa.
enrichment.career_background: Marketing and operator-turned-angel: co‑founded GigKloud (CMO), held product marketing and business development roles (including Kargo), served as Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Starta Ventures, and acts as an angel investor and advisor to consumer and marketplace startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) startups; marketplaces, consumer/e-commerce, SaaS/enterprise; diversity & underrepresented founders

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and former CEO of The Grommet; Investing Partner at XFactor Ventures focused on early consumer and marketplace startups. Background in industrial design and senior product roles at brands including Keds, Stride Rite and Playskool. Education: BFA, University of Michigan; MBA, Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Jules Pieri built a career as an industrial designer and product executive (roles at Design Continuum, Keds, Stride Rite, Playskool), co‑founded The Grommet (product launch platform) and later became an Investing Partner at XFactor Ventures; she has served as an Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Harvard Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed/seed investments in consumer and marketplace businesses (marketplaces, D2C, consumer products), product/marketing platforms and social networks; centers on companies with female founders or mixed‑gender founding teams.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of On Deck and an active angel investor based in San Francisco. Serves as an investor/partner supporting founders through Kepler Operator’s Fund and related Kepler Ventures efforts. Focuses on early‑stage, operator‑led deals and founder network building.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and leader at On Deck (founder fellowship and founder support programs). Earlier roles include growth at Virta Health and co‑founder of Within Health. Runs founder support and angel investing activities through Kepler Ventures / Kepler Operator’s Fund and a personal syndicate, backing many early‑stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & pre‑seed; AI and enterprise software; digital health; web3/DAOs; operator‑led, founder‑support investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Partner at Adjuvant Capital based in New York. Previously worked at the Global Health Investment Fund, Metalmark Capital, and Greenhill & Co. Graduated with honors from NYU Stern.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Adjuvant Capital to invest in life‑science technologies addressing high‑burden public health challenges. At the Global Health Investment Fund he led/co‑managed investments including Themis (acquired by Merck), Univercells, Atomo Diagnostics and Access Bio. Earlier roles include Metalmark Capital (healthcare investing) and Greenhill & Co. (biopharma M&A). Serves on/has supported several portfolio company boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Life sciences / global public health — vaccines, infectious-disease therapeutics, diagnostics and medical devices; typically Series A–C and growth investments with emphasis on access in emerging markets.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at i2i Ventures and founder of Invest2Innovate. Kauffman Fellow and nonresident Senior Fellow at the Atlantic Council. Focuses on early-stage investing and supporting startup ecosystems in Pakistan and other emerging markets.
interests: Early-stage VC in Pakistan and emerging markets
enrichment.career_background: Founded Invest2Innovate in 2011 to support entrepreneurs in growth markets and co-founded i2i Ventures (opened 2019) as an early‑stage VC for Pakistan. Has spoken at venues including the World Economic Forum, SXSW and Aspen Ideas Festival, and serves in fellowships and advisory roles (Kauffman Fellows, Atlantic Council).
enrichment.hometown: Grew up in Bangladesh and Pakistan; born in Dubai.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage, technology-enabled startups in Pakistan (sector-agnostic; emphasis on fintech, e‑commerce, logistics, education/edtech and consumer/sustainable fashion).

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage investor who was part of Octopus Ventures’ investing team (New York). Focuses on seed–Series B opportunities across consumer and enterprise tech, including AR/VR, marketplaces and future-of-work companies. Based in New York; previously worked in product/operations and financial analysis and is active in product/design communities.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an early-stage investor at Octopus Ventures (joined 2018; listed with the firm in multiple public profiles). Prior to VC he held roles in product and operations and worked in financial analysis (including J.P. Morgan) and early-stage product/retail businesses; education and profile listings include Fordham University and the University of Sydney.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to Series B; sectors: consumer & consumerized enterprise, marketplaces/e‑commerce, AR/VR, future of work, enterprise SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Maven Clinic, a digital clinic for women and families. Investment partner at XFactor Ventures; former early‑stage investor at Index Ventures and former journalist (The Economist, The New Yorker). Educated at the University of Michigan (BA) and the London School of Economics (MSc). Based in New York City.
interests: Supporting female founders / gender equity in VC
enrichment.career_background: Kate (Katherine) Ryder founded Maven Clinic in 2014 and serves as its CEO. Prior to Maven she worked as an early‑stage investor at Index Ventures and as a journalist for The Economist and The New Yorker; in 2009 she assisted Hank Paulson on his memoir. She holds a B.A. from the University of Michigan and an MSc from the London School of Economics and is based in New York.
enrichment.investment_focus: Women’s & family health; digital / telehealth; early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed); female‑founder-led startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner (Partner Emeritus) at Wildcat Venture Partners. Early-stage investor focused on AI/ML-enabled platforms for retail, marketplaces and workforce automation. Formerly at Mohr Davidow Ventures and Vantage Partners.
enrichment.career_background: Katherine Barr is a founding partner of Wildcat Venture Partners. She previously served as a general partner at Mohr Davidow Ventures and began her career as a senior negotiator at Vantage Partners; earlier roles include product and marketing management at HSA and ACCESS. She has served on multiple boards and advisory councils and holds degrees from McGill University and Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage B2B and B2B2C technology (digital health, enterprise SaaS, retail/e‑commerce, marketplaces); AI/ML and workforce automation (robotics).

enrichment.personal_bio: Kevin A. Mayer is a co‑founder and managing partner at Smash Capital and co‑CEO of Candle Media. He is a former senior executive at The Walt Disney Company who led Direct‑to‑Consumer strategy (including the launch of Disney+) and briefly served as CEO of TikTok and COO of ByteDance. Mayer invests in and advises companies in consumer internet, media, gaming, and the creator economy.
enrichment.career_background: Longtime media and strategy executive who ran Disney's Direct‑to‑Consumer and international businesses, led major M&A and the launch of Disney+, then served briefly as CEO of TikTok/COO of ByteDance. He co‑founded Candle Media and Smash Capital and sits on/has advised multiple boards in media and tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer internet, software & technology (growth/later‑stage); media & streaming; gaming & esports; creator economy

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Selva Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on consumer health & wellness brands. Previously a partner on CircleUp Growth Partners and a private equity investor at TPG; began his career in investment banking at Barclays. Serves on/observes multiple portfolio company boards.
enrichment.career_background: Kiva Dickinson founded Selva Ventures in 2019 and leads deal sourcing and execution for the firm. Prior to Selva he was a Partner at CircleUp Growth Partners (led Series B investments including Nutpods and Liquid I.V.), before which he worked in private equity at TPG in San Francisco and began his career in consumer-focused investment banking at Barclays in Los Angeles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & Series A consumer brands (health, wellness, beauty, branded CPG); primarily US & Canada.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Master Ventures (MV Global) and founder/CEO of PAID Network. Active crypto investor and advisor since ~2012 focused on tokenomics, protocols and web3 infrastructure. Frequently speaks at industry events and hosts crypto Twitter Spaces.
enrichment.career_background: Early Bitcoin investor (since 2012) who built and advised multiple blockchain projects. Founded World Super Lotto (Bitcoin lottery) and served operational roles in blockchain companies before launching Master Ventures (MV Global) in 2018 and later PAID Network; runs a venture studio/VC that invests in and incubates web3 projects and provides advisory services.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3 / blockchain (protocols, DeFi, NFTs), early-stage equity and token investments, venture studio incubation and tokenomics advisory

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Contrary (joined 2022), where he leads seed-to-growth investing and helped build the firm’s later-stage practice. Previously a growth investor at TCV and held investing roles at Coatue and Index Ventures. Publishes the Investing 101 newsletter and frequently speaks on AI and venture topics.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in growth and venture roles at TCV, Coatue, and Index/Index Ventures before joining Contrary as a General Partner in 2022 to lead later-stage and Series A investing. Educational background includes Brigham Young University and the University of Cambridge.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- to growth-stage technology investments (AI, cybersecurity, enterprise software, fintech).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Paradox Capital and chief marketing officer at Wander. Former Head of Brand Marketing at Opendoor and Head of Marketing at Fast. Hosts the Paradox Podcast and invests at seed/pre-seed in consumer and developer-focused startups.
enrichment.career_background: Kyle Tibbitts is a marketer‑turned‑investor who co-founded Paradox Capital to back founders outside Silicon Valley. He was the second marketing hire and Head of Brand Marketing at Opendoor, later led marketing at Fast, and joined Wander as CMO. He runs the Paradox Podcast and leverages his operator background to advise portfolio founders on product, marketing and go‑to‑market.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage checks into consumer marketplaces, travel/hospitality, proptech, marketplaces/SaaS, and founder-led growth/marketing teams.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at New Age Capital, a seed‑stage VC focused on tech and tech‑enabled startups led by Black and Latinx founders. Background in communications and filmmaking; transitioned from creative/marketing work to venture investing. Based in Dallas, Texas, and active as a scout/partner working seed rounds.
enrichment.career_background: Studied communications at Boston College and began his career in video production and creative services (founder/principal of LDM Film Perspective). Co‑founded New Age Capital in 2016 with Ivan Alo to invest in underfunded Black and Latinx founders; has served as a Lightspeed scout/ambassador and leads seed investments while helping portfolio companies with storytelling, go‑to‑market, and fundraising.
enrichment.investment_focus: Lead seed rounds (typical checks $100K–$1M; lead up to $3M). U.S.-based C‑Corp startups; industry‑agnostic software and tech‑enabled products with exclusions for fashion/fashion tech, media, crypto/web3, and medical devices; mission focus on founders who are Black or Latinx.

enrichment.personal_bio: Laura Deming is a New Zealand–born venture capitalist who founded The Longevity Fund to back early-stage companies working on aging and life-extension. She began laboratory work in biogerontology as a child, attended MIT as a teenager, and was a Thiel Fellow before launching the fund. She has led an accelerator and later initiatives (age1) focused on founder-led longevity companies.
enrichment.career_background: Deming moved from New Zealand to the U.S. to pursue aging research, worked in academic labs (including Cynthia Kenyon's), enrolled at MIT at a young age, accepted a Thiel Fellowship, and founded The Longevity Fund in 2011 to invest in longevity-focused startups. She has run an accelerator (AGE1), helped launch successor fund efforts (age1), and holds founder/board/advisor roles in several portfolio companies and ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to early-stage biotechnology and therapeutics targeting aging and age-related disease (geroscience, senolytics, gene editing, translational longevity platforms).

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and Chief Financial Officer at Fontinalis Partners, a venture firm focused on next‑generation mobility. Previously served as Executive Vice President & CFO of Booth American Company and held finance roles at Maclean Hunter. Holds a bachelor’s degree from the University of Michigan. At Fontinalis she oversees financial reporting, governance, compliance, transaction diligence and investor relations for the firm and its portfolio.
enrichment.career_background: Laura Petterle has worked in senior finance and operations roles for over three decades. She was Controller, Michigan Operations at Maclean Hunter, then became CFO/Executive VP at Booth American Company where she managed significant divestitures. She joined Fontinalis Partners in 2009 and serves as Managing Partner & CFO, responsible for the firm’s accounting, financial reporting, compliance, transaction diligence and shareholder relations. She earned a BA from the University of Michigan.
enrichment.investment_focus: Next‑generation mobility (transportation, logistics, autonomy, mobility enabling software and sensors); early‑stage to growth investments (seed through Series B).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Mischief, an early‑stage VC based in San Francisco. Previously founded Dote (Gen‑Z shopping app) and has been an active angel investor in companies such as Faire and Modern Fertility. Early career roles include Product Manager at Pocket Gems and Associate Consultant at Bain & Company. Graduated from Dartmouth College and grew up in Alaska.
enrichment.career_background: Lauren co‑founded Mischief (launched 2021) and invests at seed/Series A primarily in software startups. She was founder & CEO of Dote (2014–2020), earlier worked as a product manager at Pocket Gems and as an associate consultant at Bain & Company, and has angel investments dating back to 2017. She is based in San Francisco and holds a BA from Dartmouth College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage software (seed & Series A); consumer products and marketplaces; fintech & payments; SaaS; crypto/web3; healthcare

enrichment.personal_bio: Healthcare investor and advisor with 30+ years in venture and operating roles. Listed as a Venture Partner at Aphelion Capital and serves in senior roles including Managing Partner at American Heart Association Ventures and founder of Venture Valkyrie Consulting. Former general partner roles include Psilos Group and healthcare lead at GE Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Lisa Suennen has worked across healthcare investing, operations and consulting for over three decades. She has held GP/partner roles at Psilos Group and GE Ventures, has led or advised multiple venture funds, served in executive roles at healthcare companies (e.g., Canary Medical, Merit Behavioral Care), founded Venture Valkyrie Consulting and co-founded CSweetener, and holds board/advisory roles with several health-tech organizations and programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- and mid-stage medical devices and digital health; capital-efficient products and services that improve patient outcomes and lower system cost.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at First Round Capital (San Francisco) since 2023. Former co-founder & CEO of WayUp (launched 2014; raised >$40M; exited/merged in 2021) and Visiting Group Partner at Y Combinator. Angel investor since 2016 with early-stage bets in Ramp, Scale AI and Ro.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in product marketing at Google before co-founding WayUp, where she served as CEO for seven years, raised venture capital and led the company through an exit in 2021. Began angel investing in 2016, later served as a Visiting Group Partner at Y Combinator (supporting 100+ startups) and joined First Round Capital as a Partner in 2023 focused on hands-on support for early-stage founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and pre-seed investments across enterprise/B2B SaaS, AI, fintech and healthtech; founder-first, GTM-heavy, hands-on early-stage partnering

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director on Redpoint’s growth / early‑growth team. Joined Redpoint in 2020 after several years at Battery Ventures and focuses primarily on enterprise software at the application and infrastructure layers, partnering with companies mostly at the Series B–C stage. Hosts a technology podcast and has been named to Forbes 30 Under 30 and the Midas Brink lists.
enrichment.career_background: Previously an investor at Battery Ventures (focused on enterprise software growth investments). Earlier experience in investment banking at Spurrier Capital Partners and Deutsche Bank. Holds a BS from Washington and Lee University, where he played varsity men’s lacrosse.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software (applications and infrastructure); growth‑stage investments (Series B and Series C).

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor focused on Web3 and the crypto-economy. Joined Multicoin Capital in 2019 to lead the firm's China/Asia investment efforts and served as Principal and later Partner on the investment team. Previously worked at Nirvana Capital, Didi (strategy), and Citi; later moved into growth/operating roles in the FSL/STEPN ecosystem.
interests: Go-to-market & community growth for crypto products
enrichment.career_background: Joined Multicoin Capital in December 2019 as Principal and led the firm's Asia/China investment efforts; later held Partner-level responsibility for sourcing and diligence across equity and token investments. Prior to Multicoin she was a Partner at Nirvana Capital, worked in corporate strategy at Didi, and began her career in investment banking at Citi. She holds a B.A. (Art History & Statistics) from Columbia University and has since moved into growth and operator roles in the FSL/STEPN ecosystem.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3/crypto protocols and tokens; early-stage venture (seed to Series A); Asia-focused opportunities (China & APAC); consumer and infrastructure blockchain projects

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Kaya Ventures, an early-stage firm focused on health and wellness. Harvard MBA with a BA from The University of Texas at Austin. Active angel and VC investor in consumer, digital health, and women’s-health focused startups (portfolio/angel activity noted at 30+ companies).
enrichment.career_background: Relationship-driven investor and operator with prior roles including Managing Director/General Partner at CircleUp, VP at Victress/Visible-type consumer VC roles, and management consulting at Oliver Wyman; began her career in operations at Apple and The Walt Disney Company. As a GP and early team member at consumer funds she has managed institutional capital (sources state she has overseen >$150M in AUM).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed); women’s health, digital health, consumer wellness, care economy; future of work

enrichment.personal_bio: Ex-founder turned VC investor who worked at Lakestar as a senior associate focused on fintech and crypto/Web3. Based in London and fluent in multiple languages. Previously invested at Speedinvest and worked on growth at Fru.pl; founded and exited language‑school businesses in Poland (acquired 2016).
enrichment.career_background: Founded and ran language‑school businesses in Poland (acquired 2016), then held growth and operational roles (including Fru.pl). Transitioned to VC with roles at Seedrs and Speedinvest, and worked at Lakestar as an early & growth‑stage investor (focused on fintech and crypto/Web3, seed–Series B).
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech; Web3 / blockchain; marketplaces and network‑effects businesses; early through growth stages (seed–Series B).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Founder Gym and former Kapor Capital portfolio services director; active angel investor and member of First Round’s Angel Track and a Sequoia scout. Works on training and funding underrepresented founders and early-stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur and operator turned investor and operator. Co‑founded Tioki and later founded Founder Gym (an accelerator for underrepresented founders). Served as Global Director for Startup Weekend Education and Founding Portfolio Services Director at Kapor Capital. Member of First Round’s Angel Track and a Sequoia scout/angel investor; served as CEO of All Raise (2022–2023) and holds board/advisory roles in nonprofit and startup communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel and scout investments in seed / early-stage startups, with emphasis on education, impact and consumer internet; supporting underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and Head of Portfolio Development at Mechanism Capital focused on Web3 and crypto. Active angel and platform operator who writes and publishes research on DeFi, NFTs, and crypto gaming. Hosts The Look Up! podcast and has a background in investment banking and entrepreneurship.
enrichment.career_background: Wharton graduate who began in investment banking and later became Principal at Wave Financial. Co-founded/joined Mechanism Capital in 2020 and serves as a partner and head of portfolio development; previously founded Satya Management and 90sFest, and is the host of The Look Up! podcast. Combines investing, operational support, and public research/writing in Web3.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage Web3/crypto with emphasis on DeFi, token-native infrastructure, crypto gaming/NFTs, and mechanism design

enrichment.personal_bio: Marketing and communications executive and investor. Cofounder of The OutCast Agency (1997) and operating partner / head of marketing at Andreessen Horowitz (joined 2010; partner emeritus). Member of the Broadway Angels angel group and active as an adviser to early-stage technology founders.
enrichment.career_background: Margit co‑founded The OutCast Agency in 1997 and led its growth before joining Andreessen Horowitz in 2010 to build the firm’s marketing and communications function. She advises portfolio founders on PR, brand and go‑to‑market strategy; serves on several boards and trustee bodies; and is a member of the Broadway Angels angel investing group.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage / angel investments in information technology and software; advising founders on marketing, communications and brand strategy.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding and Managing Partner of SteelSky Ventures, a venture fund focused on improving access, care, and outcomes in women’s health. Serial entrepreneur and investor who speaks regularly on health innovation and equity. Holds a B.S. in Information Systems from Wake Forest University and an MBA (Finance & Entrepreneurship) from NYU Stern.
enrichment.career_background: Founded and leads SteelSky Ventures, which invests across consumer health, digital health, medical devices and healthcare infrastructure to improve women’s health outcomes. Previously held product and marketing leadership roles (including at Schweiger Dermatology Group) and founded consumer-facing startups during college. Active as a speaker, advisor, and fellow in healthcare and venture communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed & Series A) investments across women’s healthcare and related infrastructure: consumer health, digital health/telemedicine, diagnostics and medical devices, retail therapeutics and health delivery models focused on access and outcomes.

enrichment.personal_bio: Markus Warmuth, M.D., is CEO of Monte Rosa Therapeutics and a physician-scientist with a background in oncology drug discovery. He previously led drug-discovery teams at Novartis and was CEO of H3 Biomedicine; he has served as a Venture Partner affiliated with Versant Ventures and has held board seats at several biotech companies.
enrichment.career_background: MD from Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität München. Held senior discovery roles at the Genomics Institute of the Novartis Research Foundation and Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research, served as CEO of H3 Biomedicine, was an Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Third Rock Ventures, and is CEO of Monte Rosa Therapeutics; has served as a Venture Partner associated with Versant Ventures and holds multiple biotech board positions.
enrichment.investment_focus: Biotechnology; drug discovery platforms (molecular glues/protein degraders); oncology and precision medicine; early-stage company creation

enrichment.personal_bio: Operator-turned-investor and advisor focused on B2B SaaS and developer-led products. Former SVP, Marketing & Growth at Auth0 and interim CMO/advisor roles at Vercel and others. Serves as a GP/co-founder at HyperGrowth Partners and as a scout for Madrona; based in the Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Martin began as a software engineer and developer advocate, rose through growth/marketing leadership at Auth0 (SVP, Marketing & Growth), co‑founded HyperGrowth Partners (GP/GTM advisor) and has held interim CMO/advisor roles (e.g., Vercel, Deepgram). He is listed as a Madrona scout (2023) and makes angel/seed investments, focusing on marketing‑tech, developer platforms and SaaS.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage technology: B2B SaaS, developer tools, cloud & infra, applied AI, marketplaces

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Torch Capital and former President & Chief Operating Officer of Uniswap Labs (stepped down July 15, 2025; moved to an advisory role). Previously a Managing Director at BlackRock where she led digital wealth and founded Aladdin Sustainability; began her career as an investment analyst at Goldman Sachs.
enrichment.career_background: Began as an investment analyst in Goldman Sachs’ Special Situations Group. Joined BlackRock in senior roles, serving as Managing Director, global head of Aladdin Sustainability and COO of BlackRock Digital Wealth, where she led strategic fintech and climate-tech investments. Joined Uniswap Labs as President & COO in 2021, transitioned to an advisory role in July 2025, and serves as a Venture Partner at Torch Capital (since 2021). Holds degrees from Brown and Harvard (JD, MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed–Series A) consumer technology; fintech / digital wealth; crypto / DeFi; climate tech and sustainability.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and Head of Investor Relations at Multicoin Capital and a member of the firm’s investment team. Specializes in investor relations, fundraising, and structured investments. Former investment banker with extensive experience structuring large financings. Based in the New York area.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Multicoin Capital as an investment team member and was promoted to Partner and Head of Investor Relations; prior roles include investment banking positions (including Vice President at Teneo) and ~15 years of experience in capital markets and transaction structuring. He holds a degree in Finance and International Business from the University of Maryland.
enrichment.investment_focus: Cryptocurrencies, tokens, and blockchain companies (public and private); early-stage Web3 infrastructure, protocols, and applications; structured and venture investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Bungalow Capital, an early‑stage VC focused on pre‑seed/seed software. Former procurement and sales leader at Genentech, Box and Airbnb. Based in Los Angeles and a Boston College alumnus.
enrichment.career_background: Matthew Ziskie began in procurement and supply‑chain consulting, held procurement roles at Genentech and Onyx, then led global procurement at Box and worldwide sales & partnerships for Airbnb for Work. In early 2020 he co‑founded Bungalow Capital to invest in pre‑seed/seed software, leveraging his operator experience to source and evaluate deals.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed software startups (SMB software, marketplaces, fintech, enterprise tools with procurement/operations relevance)

enrichment.personal_bio: Matt Sechrest is a venture partner at Sky9 Capital and the founder/managing partner of North Equity. He previously founded multiple SaaS companies and was a founding member of E*TRADE Venture Capital after starting his career in tech M&A at Goldman Sachs. He is an advisor to the conservation nonprofit Re:wild and holds a BA from Dartmouth College.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and Managing Partner of North Equity (AI-focused investment firm); Venture Partner at Sky9 Capital. Prior roles include founding/leading multiple SaaS companies, founding member of E*TRADE Venture Capital (corporate VC), and earlier tech M&A work at Goldman Sachs. Serves as an advisor/on the global council for Re:wild.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI (vertical AI, seed-stage); Enterprise SaaS; early-stage/seed investments; acquisition capital and AI-powered rollups

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Baukunst, a pre‑seed venture collective. Former Vice President on the investment team at Allied Minds and early partner at Bolt. Holds an MS from MIT and a BS from Tufts; based in Somerville, Massachusetts.
enrichment.career_background: Matt Thoms is a co‑founder and General Partner at Baukunst (fund I launched 2022). He spent multiple years as VP of investments at Allied Minds, was a partner at Bolt, and has been a founding‑team operator/CEO at several early tech startups. He focuses on leading first checks for design‑and‑engineering‑led founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in design‑driven hardware/physical‑digital products, enterprise & B2B software, and climate/energy technology.

enrichment.personal_bio: Meena Harris is co-founder and General Partner at Phenomenal Ventures and the founder & CEO of Phenomenal Media. She is a Stanford and Harvard Law graduate, a #1 New York Times bestselling children’s author, and a Tony Award-winning producer. Harris previously worked at Facebook, Slack, Uber and practiced law at Covington & Burling.
interests: Early-stage enterprise, fintech and commerce startups
enrichment.career_background: Meena Harris began her career in community operations and tech roles at Facebook and Slack, practiced data/privacy law at Covington & Burling, and led strategy and leadership at Uber. In 2017 she founded Phenomenal (a media/consumer brand) and expanded into publishing, production and investment; in 2022 she co‑founded Phenomenal Ventures to back early-stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series A (typical check size $100K–$500K); enterprise software, fintech, commerce, media/content and consumer startups; helping companies reach underserved or underrepresented audiences.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Threshold Ventures based in New York who leads new investments and supports the firm’s portfolio companies. Previously an investor at First Round Capital and Chief of Staff at Thrive Global; began her career at J.P. Morgan. Holds a BA in Economics from the College of the Holy Cross and lives in New York City.
enrichment.career_background: Megan joined Threshold (initially as a principal) to expand the firm’s New York presence and now serves as a partner focused on early-stage deals and portfolio support. Before Threshold she invested at First Round Capital, served as Chief of Staff at Thrive Global, and held business management and investor roles at J.P. Morgan. She graduated from the College of the Holy Cross with a BA in economics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series A); digital health and healthcare; enterprise and vertical SaaS; developer tools and productivity software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co‑founder of Krillion Ventures, a Miami‑based seed-stage VC. Focuses on Health & Wellness, PropTech/Real Estate and FinTech investing with a ‘Miami‑first’ approach. Appointed City of Miami Venture Capitalist in Residence (2021).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Krillion Ventures in 2014 and serves as Managing Partner. Previously founded Venture Architects (1998), a business‑planning firm that worked with over 1,000 companies which raised more than $1 billion. Active in local ecosystem building (Venture Miami, Miami Angels) and serves on several boards and advisory roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed‑stage technology companies in Health & Wellness, PropTech/Real Estate, and FinTech (Miami‑first geographic focus)

enrichment.personal_bio: Canadian-born entrepreneur and investor based in Vancouver. Venture partner / strategic advisor at Voyager Capital with a background building marketplaces and brand businesses; co-founder of youth accelerator The Next Big Thing. Focuses on sourcing and supporting Pacific Northwest and Western Canada B2B software founders.
enrichment.career_background: Meredith Powell is a serial entrepreneur-turned-investor who co-founded Powell & Company and the youth accelerator The Next Big Thing. She joined Voyager Capital as the firm’s Canadian venture partner (announced 2018) and has served as a strategic advisor and board member for regional ecosystem organizations; she also held a role with Microsoft for Startups (Global CMO role reported 2019–2020) and advises/angel-invests in early-stage tech companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: B2B software (SaaS, cloud infrastructure), AI/ML; stages: seed to growth; geography: Pacific Northwest & Western Canada (WA, OR, BC, AB)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Framework Ventures, a crypto‑native venture firm focused on DeFi and Web3. Previously co‑founded Hashletes and worked as a product manager at Dropbox and Snap. Attended Yale University.
enrichment.career_background: Michael Anderson co‑founded Framework Ventures in 2019 with Vance Spencer. Before Framework he co‑founded Hashletes (an NFL‑licensed digital collectibles startup) and was a product manager at Dropbox and Snap; he studied at Yale University and moved into crypto investing and protocol support thereafter.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in DeFi and Web3 protocols, blockchain infrastructure, web3 gaming, and token‑based networks (tokenomics, governance).

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and early-stage investor. Founder and Managing Partner of Heroic Ventures, founder and executive chairman of Reputation.com, and CEO/founder of Modelcode.ai. Known for work on online reputation management, digital privacy, and applied AI; author and occasional Harvard Law lecturer.
interests: Applied AI in Israel and Silicon Valley
enrichment.career_background: Michael Fertik is a founder‑operator turned VC: he co‑founded Reputation.com (now executive chairman), launched Heroic Ventures (managing partner) to lead formation and first‑money investments, and founded/operates Modelcode.ai. He holds a J.D. from Harvard Law School, is named on multiple patents, and has written and appeared widely on privacy, tech, and business topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Formation / first‑money and early‑stage investments; software, AI, hardware, and life‑sciences startups (primarily Silicon Valley and Israel)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Skillshare and Otis (Otis was acquired by Public). Founder/partner at Turing Capital, a crypto-focused angel fund. Angel investor with public-listed and early-stage positions in companies such as Notion and Polkadot; former early employee at Behance and Hot Potato.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and angel investor. Co‑founded Skillshare (education platform) and Otis (fractional alternative-assets marketplace); Otis was acquired by Public in 2022. Early product roles at Behance and Hot Potato. Runs Turing Capital (crypto angel fund) and publishes on startup/strategy topics. Education: B.A. in Economics (University of Virginia) and M.S. in Advertising (VCU Brandcenter).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage / angel investments focused on crypto/Web3 and founder-led startups; also interested in hard tech, AI, consumer marketplaces, creators, and longevity/biotech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Northpond Ventures, a science‑driven venture capital firm. Physician‑scientist and investor (M.D., Ph.D., CFA) with prior role as co‑founder and managing partner at Sands Capital Ventures. Holds degrees from UCLA (BS), University of Chicago (MD/PhD) and an MBA from UMass Amherst.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and CEO of Northpond Ventures (founded 2018). Previously co‑founded and served as managing partner at Sands Capital Ventures. Serves on multiple company boards and holds academic appointments as a visiting scholar/adjunct professor at institutions including Harvard, MIT and Stanford. Trained as a physician and surgeon with fellowship training at Harvard Medical School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Biotechnology, diagnostics, digital health, deep‑science platforms and life‑science tools

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and CEO of PandaDoc, a document‑automation SaaS company founded from Quote Roller. Born in Minsk, Belarus, he relocated PandaDoc to Silicon Valley and led growth that included a $1B valuation in 2021; he is also an active angel investor in early‑stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Quote Roller (2011) which evolved into PandaDoc; moved company headquarters to San Francisco and raised multiple rounds including Series A (2015), Series B (2017–2018) and Series C at a $1B valuation in 2021. Serves as PandaDoc CEO and has participated in angel and seed/Series A investments and advisory roles for several startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: SaaS and enterprise software (document automation/e-signature), developer tools and enterprise applications; typically early‑stage to Series A investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Managing Partner at Quona Capital, where she leads Africa, MENA and cross-border investment strategy. Investor and entrepreneur focused on fintech for financial inclusion in emerging markets. Holds an MBA and MA Ed from Stanford University and a BA in economics from Williams College.
enrichment.career_background: Monica began her career in Silicon Valley helping launch a $50M multi-bank lending intermediary, and worked at Calvert Ventures and Anthuri Ventures. While in South Africa she founded Anthuri Catalysts to prepare startups for investment; she later joined Accion to lead product innovation and was founding managing director of Accion’s Frontier Investments Group (predecessor to Quona). She co-founded Quona Capital in 2013 and serves on multiple portfolio company boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech for inclusion in emerging markets (early to growth stage); embedded finance, payments, SME finance, cross-border solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at RiverVest Venture Partners (joined 2016) focused on early-stage biopharmaceutical and medical device investments. Trained in immunology and oncology, she holds a B.S. in Biology from Caltech and a Ph.D. in Molecular & Cell Biology from UC Berkeley and completed postdoctoral training at UCSF. She serves on boards of several RiverVest portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Joined RiverVest in 2016 as Managing Director and helped establish the firm’s San Diego presence. Previously a principal at BioMed Ventures and an investment professional at Forward Ventures; began her career as a scientist at Phenomix and completed postdoctoral fellowships at UCSF (Leukemia & Lymphoma Society fellow).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage biopharmaceuticals and medical devices; therapeutics (immunology/oncology); diagnostics.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Infinite Capital. Former co‑founder/CEO of Qualified.io and Codewars (both later acquired). Active angel and early-stage investor focused on crypto-native protocols and deep‑tech startups.
enrichment.career_background: Nathan Doctor is the founder and managing partner of Infinite Capital, a thesis‑driven investor in decentralized networks and deep tech. He co‑founded Qualified.io and Codewars (acquired by Andela), has served as a board member of H3X Technologies, and is an active angel investor across fintech, education, and resilient systems.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3/crypto (DeFi, decentralized networks) and deep tech (aerospace, electric propulsion, autonomy, AI/compute); stage‑agnostic with checks from seed to growth (up to ~$10M).

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and CEO of Keiretsu Capital; co‑founder and longtime Chair/President of Keiretsu Forum Northwest. Experienced organizer of investor events and angel syndicates with a background in venture finance and entrepreneurial leadership. Holds a BA in Business Administration & Finance from the University of Washington Foster School of Business.
interests: Building regional entrepreneurial ecosystems & investor events
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded and leads the Keiretsu Forum Northwest chapter and has served as region chair/president since the mid‑2000s. Became CEO/Managing Partner of Keiretsu Capital (co‑investment fund partner to Keiretsu Forum) in 2014; has organized large investor forums and managed co‑investment activity across multiple funds. Graduated from the University of Washington (BA, Business Administration & Finance).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed to Series A) co‑investments across healthtech/medical devices, biotechnology, cleantech/impact, fintech and information technology; co‑investment & blockchain funds and real estate access.

enrichment.personal_bio: Dr. Navin Goyal, MD is Co‑Founder and Managing Partner at LOUD Capital and a former practicing anesthesiologist. He co‑founded healthcare companies including SmileMD/OFFOR Health and focuses on healthcare investments and purpose‑driven venture. He holds an MD from the University of Cincinnati and completed anesthesiology training at the University of Chicago.
enrichment.career_background: Navin Goyal trained as an anesthesiologist (MD, University of Cincinnati; residency at University of Chicago) and served as a Medical Director in a community hospital. He co‑founded mobile anesthesia and healthcare ventures (SmileMD/OFFOR Health), then co‑founded LOUD Capital in 2015 where he serves as Managing Partner, focusing on healthcare and early‑stage venture investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare (MedTech, Health IT, alternative care models); Early‑stage venture (seed to Series A); operator‑led, people‑centered investments and post‑investment services

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Bowery Capital and founder of Sailthru. Currently CEO of Solve, a company focused on e‑commerce data and insights. Experienced in building large-scale web systems and personalization/marketing-technology products.
enrichment.career_background: Neil Capel founded Sailthru (a personalization and marketing technology company) and served in senior leadership there. He held senior technical roles earlier in his career (including CTO positions) before joining Bowery Capital as a Venture Partner in 2013. Since 2018 he has been CEO of Solve, working on e‑commerce data solutions. He holds a BS and MS in Computer Science from the University of Portsmouth.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed & Seed stage; B2B SaaS and marketplaces with emphasis on martech/personalization, e‑commerce data, and supply‑chain/transportation technologies

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Lever VC, an early-stage VC focused on alternative proteins, FoodTech and AgTech. Co‑founder of the Good Food Institute and New Crop Capital; founder of The Humane League. Active investor and board/observer in multiple alternative-protein startups globally.
enrichment.career_background: Nick Cooney has led investments and sector work in alternative proteins and food policy for over a decade. He founded Lever VC to invest in early‑stage plant‑based, cultivated and fermentation‑derived protein companies, and previously co‑founded New Crop Capital and the Good Food Institute; he also founded the nonprofit The Humane League.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage alternative proteins and food/agritech: plant‑based foods, cultivated/cell‑based meat & dairy, precision fermentation/novel proteins, crop/seed genetics, animal‑ag inputs and pet food.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founding Managing Partner of H/L Ventures, based in New York City. Chairs and co‑founded The Resolution Project and serves on boards of several portfolio companies. Focuses on impact-driven, company-building venture work with an emphasis on diverse founding teams. Graduate of Harvard College (magna cum laude).
enrichment.career_background: Oliver B. Libby co‑founded Hatzimemos / Libby (H/L Ventures) in 2009 and is a managing partner focused on sourcing, building, and scaling mission‑driven companies. He co‑founded and chairs The Resolution Project, has served as a venture partner at SineWave Ventures, and earlier worked in U.S. government and global management consulting. Libby has held board and advisory roles at multiple portfolio companies and is active in industry organizations (e.g., Tech:NYC).
enrichment.investment_focus: Impact-focused early-stage company building (Pre‑Series A / Seed through Series A and later) across climate & sustainability, health & wellness, fintech/financial inclusion, consumer, and enterprise software — preference for diverse founding teams; active venture‑studio support model.

enrichment.personal_bio: Pat Kinsel is the founder and CEO of Proof (formerly Notarize), a company that pioneered remote online notarization and online real-estate closings. He served as an entrepreneur‑in‑residence and later a venture partner at Polaris Partners, focusing on early‑stage technology investments. Earlier he co‑founded Spindle (acquired by Twitter) and worked on Docs.com and Bing Social Search at Microsoft.
enrichment.career_background: Kinsel began his career in product roles at Microsoft (Docs.com, Bing Social Search), co‑founded Spindle (acquired by Twitter in 2013), then joined Polaris Partners as an EIR and venture partner to lead early‑stage tech investments. In 2015 he co‑founded Notarize (rebranded as Proof) and has served as its CEO while participating in board and investing roles (notably Lob and Drizly).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology (Series A); SaaS and enterprise platforms; marketplaces and proptech; digital identity and trust solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Newtopia VC. Former CTO and co‑founder of MURAL (Argentine unicorn) and earlier co‑founder of Three Melons (sold to Playdom/Disney). Active angel investor in Latin America.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and technologist: co‑founded Three Melons (video‑game studio; acquired by Playdom/Disney), co‑founded MURAL and served as CTO as it scaled to a global SaaS company, and transitioned to investing — serving as an angel investor in 30+ startups and as Co‑Founder & General Partner at Newtopia VC focused on early‑stage Latin American tech companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed to Seed (select Series A follow‑ons) in Latin America; sectors include SaaS, fintech, healthtech, edtech, marketplaces/commerce, web3/crypto, and future‑of‑work solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Matrix focusing on infrastructure and developer tooling investments. Former VP of Product / GM Messaging at Twilio and earlier program manager at Microsoft. Invests with product-led founders across pre-seed to Series A. Based in San Francisco.
enrichment.career_background: Product and operator background: program manager at Microsoft (2007–2011), VP of Product / GM Messaging at Twilio (2011–2018), joined Matrix as a partner in 2019 where he leads infrastructure and developer-focused investments. Educated in Human-Computer Interaction and Cognitive Science at Carnegie Mellon University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Infrastructure, developer tooling & APIs, B2B/SaaS; stages: pre-seed through Series A

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Director of VentureSouth who helps create angel groups, source and evaluate deals, and serves as General Partner of the VentureSouth Angel Funds. Previously worked in M&A and private equity at CertusBank, BC Partners and NM Rothschild & Sons. Frequently comments on and leads investments in early‑stage companies across the Southeast.
enrichment.career_background: Paul Clark co‑founded VentureSouth and is a Managing Director and GP of its angel fund vehicles. He began his career in M&A at NM Rothschild & Sons, was a Principal at BC Partners (London/New York), and served as Senior VP of M&A at CertusBank before launching VentureSouth. He holds a MA from Fordham University and a BA from Durham University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) startups in the Southeastern U.S.; industry‑agnostic but frequent investments in digital health, medical devices, pharmaceuticals and enterprise/SaaS; co‑investments via angel groups and committed angel funds.

enrichment.personal_bio: P. Bart Stephens is co‑founder and Managing Partner of Blockchain Capital, a venture firm focused on blockchain and crypto. He is a three‑time founder who previously founded Stephens Investment Management and was a founding investor at Oncology.com; he began his career at E*TRADE. He holds a B.A. in Political Science from Princeton University.
enrichment.career_background: Started his career at E*TRADE, was a founding investor and Head of Corporate & Business Development at Oncology.com, then founded Stephens Investment Management (a nanocap hedge/VC-style firm). In 2013 he co‑founded Blockchain Capital and serves as its Founder & Managing Partner; he has served on boards including Anchorage Digital and Tierion.
enrichment.investment_focus: Blockchain and crypto startups (equity and token investments); multi‑stage investing from seed to growth; infrastructure, DeFi, protocols, marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at RA Capital Management. Biotechnology investor and scientist with a Ph.D. in virology from Harvard; author of The Great American Drug Deal and The Entrepreneur’s Guide to a Biotech Startup. Serves on multiple public and private biotech boards and leads RA Capital’s engagement and publishing efforts.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded RA Capital (Boston) and has served as Managing Partner since the firm’s early years; invests across public and private healthcare and life‑science companies, serves on multiple corporate boards, and founded the advocacy group No Patient Left Behind. Education: BA (Cornell University) and PhD in Virology (Harvard University).
enrichment.investment_focus: Multi‑stage investments in healthcare and life sciences (drugs, medical devices, diagnostics, research tools); public and private company investing, company formation and incubator activity.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Solana and a senior operator at Solana Labs, where he has led operations, product, and ecosystem growth. Active angel and strategic investor through Solana Ventures, focused on projects building on the Solana blockchain. Educational background includes the Wharton School (University of Pennsylvania).
enrichment.career_background: Raj Gokal co‑founded Solana and has served in senior operational and product roles at Solana Labs and the Solana Foundation. Earlier career experience includes venture investing at General Catalyst, co‑founding Sano (a consumer medical device startup), Director of Product at Omada Health, and an Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Rock Health. He studied economics/finance at the Wharton School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage and seed investments in teams building on Solana and the broader Web3/crypto ecosystem (DeFi, NFTs, gaming, infrastructure, on‑chain payments)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & Managing Partner at Daybreak Ventures. Former partner at Index Ventures who writes the newsletter "Digital Native." Focuses on early-stage consumer and creator-focused technology.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment roles at TPG Growth and The Rise Fund, worked on growth/marketing at Airtable and Calm, joined Index Ventures as a principal/partner (consumer & creator-focused investing), and in 2023–2024 founded Daybreak Ventures to lead an early-stage fund. He is a Knight‑Hennessy scholar with graduate study at Stanford and holds a BA from Dartmouth.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series A in consumer technology, creator/creator-led commerce, marketplaces, Gen Z-facing social products, and enterprise tooling that serves consumer behavior

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CEO of Quantstamp, a blockchain security and smart‑contract audit firm. Listed as a Venture Partner / Portfolio Founder at Pioneer Fund. Previously worked as an algorithmic/quantitative software engineer at Tower Research Capital; holds a BS from Cornell University.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Quantstamp and serves as its CEO, leading product and security strategy for smart‑contract audits and Web3 security services. Prior to Quantstamp he worked in algorithmic/high‑frequency trading (Tower Research Capital). Active angel/seed investor and board/advisor for multiple crypto and Web3 startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) investments in Web3/crypto and blockchain security, plus consumer SaaS, gaming, AI and fintech (frequently invests in YC‑backed founders).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Penny Jar Capital and a former investment partner at SC30 Inc. (Stephen Curry’s off-court business). He previously worked at TPG and Morgan Stanley, co-founded a creator-economy SMB software company, holds an MBA from Stanford GSB and a BS in Electrical Engineering from Yale. Early investor in companies including Ethic, KikOff, and Squire.
enrichment.career_background: Rich Scudellari is a founding/ managing partner at Penny Jar Capital (founded 2021). Prior to Penny Jar he was Investment Partner at SC30 Inc., spent several years at TPG (growth/TPG Growth) and Morgan Stanley (technology investment banking), and co-founded a creator-economy SMB software company. He holds a BS in Electrical Engineering from Yale and an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & Series A; technology, consumer, and B2B startups (focus areas include creator-economy infrastructure and applied AI)

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Third Point Ventures since June 2000. Longtime board director with portfolio experience across semiconductors, enterprise software, security, and data companies. Holds a multi-discipline engineering degree from the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Robert Schwartz has served as Managing Partner of Third Point Ventures (the VC arm of Third Point LLC) since June 2000. He previously spent 23 years as President of RF Associates North, a communications semiconductor manufacturer’s representative firm. At Third Point Ventures he leads and sits on boards for multiple investments across enterprise software, networking, security, and semiconductor companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage through growth-stage investments in enterprise and infrastructure software, cloud-native and observability tools, cybersecurity, semiconductors and hardware, data & analytics/AI, fintech and mobility/cleantech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and partner at Avalancha Ventures and founder/chairman of Kuspit (Mexico's first fully online brokerage). Longstanding background in finance and venture investing, with prior roles in investment banking and alternative-asset management. Holds an MS in Operations Research from Stanford University and an undergraduate engineering degree from Universidad de las Américas Puebla.
enrichment.career_background: Co-founded Avalancha Ventures (2015) and Kuspit Casa de Bolsa (2010); serves as managing/operating partner at Avalancha and founder/chairman at Kuspit. Background includes roles in investment banking and alternative investments and board/advisor positions at portfolio companies; educated at Universidad de las Américas Puebla (BS) and Stanford University (MS).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) fintech, payments and financial services; technology-driven software startups in Latin America (primary) and select U.S./Brazil opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Rumi Morales is a partner and board member at Outlier Ventures and an investor focused on the convergence of Web3, blockchain, and advanced computing. She previously led CME Ventures (CME Group) and held senior roles at Goldman Sachs and Digital Currency Group. Morales is based in Chicago and holds a BA from Wellesley College and an MBA from NYU Stern.
enrichment.career_background: Morales has worked in venture and corporate investing across North America, Europe and Asia.
