She led CME Ventures (the strategic investment arm of CME Group), served in senior roles at Goldman Sachs, worked on venture and growth investing at Digital Currency Group, and joined Outlier Ventures as a Partner and Board Member. She also serves as an operating/advising partner to enterprise technology funds and sits on several nonprofit and industry boards. Morales received her undergraduate degree from Wellesley College and an MBA from NYU Stern.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth investments in Web3/blockchain, digital assets, AI/ML, quantum and next‑generation computing, and enterprise financial infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and software developer; co‑founder of Codecademy and a co‑founder/CTO of Decrypt. Active angel investor and venture partner at Pioneer Fund, focused on early-stage deals. Attended Columbia University.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of Codecademy (education platform) and of Decrypt (crypto/media); has served as Decrypt's CTO and later co‑founder roles in other startups. Works as a venture partner / angel investor (Pioneer Fund) focusing on seed and pre‑seed opportunities; educated at Columbia University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed / pre‑seed); education technology, Web3/blockchain, developer tools, media & publishing, AI/ML

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and investor; co‑founder of Omnisio (acquired by Google) and Parsable. Managing Partner at Electric Ant, an early‑stage operator fund, and former part‑time partner at Y Combinator. Holds an M.S. in Electrical Engineering from Stanford and undergraduate degrees from the University of Sydney.
enrichment.career_background: Ryan Junee is a founder‑operator and investor who has started multiple technology companies (including Omnisio, Inporia, Parsable, RxDefine/Ostro) and served as a part‑time partner at Y Combinator. He is Managing Partner at Electric Ant (founded 2021), has advised accelerator programs (Startmate, 500 Startups, StartX), and holds an M.S. in Electrical Engineering from Stanford and bachelor’s degrees from the University of Sydney.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology and crypto (web3) investments; operator‑led/founder‑friendly seed and pre‑seed deals.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Lowercarbon Capital who leads the firm’s work on carbon removal. Previously led Stripe’s carbon removal procurement program and helped build Stripe Climate’s partnerships. Former founder/product designer (Finish) and co‑founder of education startup Volley. Grew up in Boulder, Colorado and is currently based in New York City.
enrichment.career_background: Ryan Orbuch is a Partner at Lowercarbon Capital focusing on carbon removal. Before Lowercarbon he led procurement for Stripe Climate, building partnerships and expert review processes for carbon removal purchases. Earlier in his career he co‑founded the education app Finish (Apple Design Award winner) and the startup Volley, and worked as a product manager and software engineer.
enrichment.investment_focus: Climate tech — carbon removal and emissions reduction; energy and industrial decarbonization; early-stage (Seed–Series A) deep‑tech startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor focused on data infrastructure, developer tooling and AI/ML who was part of Dell Technologies Capital's investment team. After DTC he moved to Unusual Ventures and later joined SignalFire. Holds a BA from Northwestern University.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as a data engineer at Magnetar Capital (~2016–2018), joined Dell Technologies Capital as an investor (2018–2023), then moved to Unusual Ventures (joined 2023) and later became a Principal at SignalFire (joined 2024).
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise & cloud infrastructure, data & analytics, developer tools, AI/ML, cybersecurity

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Partner at Jump Capital, based in Chicago. Former operating partner at Tarsus and head of consumer moving at SIRVA, with early career roles in GE management programs. Holds a BS in Chemical Engineering (University of Rochester) and an MBA from Northwestern Kellogg. Focuses on RegTech, compliance/risk, data governance and modernizing legacy enterprise functions.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Jump Capital in 2012 and invests in early‑stage companies across fintech, application software and infrastructure. Prior to Jump he held operating and investment roles including operating partner at Tarsus and head of consumer moving at SIRVA; began his career in GE management programs. Educational background: BS Chemical Engineering (University of Rochester) and MBA (Northwestern Kellogg).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage fintech, B2B application software (SaaS), infrastructure software; emphasis on RegTech, compliance, data governance and modernizing enterprise operations.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director and CTO at Sutter Hill Ventures. Former senior infrastructure engineer and advisor at Twitter (joined via Bagcheck acquisition) and former Chief Technologist at Yahoo. Early engineer at WebLogic/BEA and co‑founder/CEO of Bagcheck and Gauntlet Systems. Holds an MS in Physics from Northwestern University and a BS from Worcester Polytechnic Institute.
enrichment.career_background: Long‑time technologist turned investor: early server engineer at WebLogic/BEA, co‑founder/CEO of Gauntlet Systems and Bagcheck (acquired by Twitter), later Chief Technologist at Yahoo and senior infrastructure engineer/advisor at Twitter, then joined Sutter Hill Ventures where he invests in and advises infrastructure, developer tooling and cloud companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise infrastructure, observability, developer tools/platforms, databases and cloud security

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Astor Perkins and a serial entrepreneur and keynote speaker. Focuses on deep‑tech investments related to human survival, including space, climate/sustainability, longevity and advanced computing. Author of "Strive" and has over 20 years of product, strategy and startup experience.
enrichment.career_background: Over 20 years as an operator, founder and investor. Former CEO of Amyx+ and founder/co‑founder of several startups; has held senior product and strategy roles in corporate settings and serves as a public speaker and author. Currently chairs and manages investments at Astor Perkins.
enrichment.investment_focus: Deep tech and "human survival" sectors — space, defense, climate & sustainability, longevity/biotech, AI/autonomy and quantum computing; invests across stages from pre‑seed to later rounds.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner of Manifold Group (Chicago) and an early-stage investor involved in Manifold’s portfolio (~25+ companies while at the firm). Former adjunct instructor at Northwestern University’s Kellogg School (taught digital marketing); currently CEO of Madison, a marketing firm for professional services. Background spans product, growth, venture incubation and founder-facing advisory.
enrichment.career_background: Sean Johnson was a founding partner at Manifold Group, a venture holding company that combines advisory, venture investing and an incubation studio. He has also served as a partner at Founder Equity, taught digital marketing at Northwestern’s Kellogg School, and now leads Madison, focusing on marketing for professional services. During his time at Manifold he helped build an incubation practice and participated in the firm’s early-stage investments and exits.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in enterprise & SMB software, AI/data platforms, fintech and tech-enabled services; plus venture studio/incubation-led company building

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Lobby Capital and founder/operator with a background scaling consumer and SaaS products. Co‑founder of Evite, former President & CTO of SurveyMonkey, and co‑founder & CEO of Gixo (acquired by Openfit). Currently CEO & co‑founder of HomeBoost and serves on the boards of Redfin and Voltus.
enrichment.career_background: Selina co‑founded Evite, served in senior product/engineering roles at Ticketmaster Europe, and was President & CTO of SurveyMonkey (2009–2016). She co‑founded Gixo (acquired by Openfit), served as Openfit’s Chief Digital Officer, and is currently CEO & co‑founder of HomeBoost. She is a venture partner at Lobby Capital and holds board seats at Redfin and Voltus. She earned a BS in Computer Science from Stanford University and is based in San Francisco.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer & small‑business services; SaaS and marketplaces; early‑stage/seed; climate/home energy

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at 6th Man Ventures and co‑founder & CEO of StayTuned. Former Global Head of Media Apps, Android / Google Play. Stanford-trained engineer with an MBA from Harvard; active angel and web3 investor focused on early-stage crypto and developer infrastructure.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment banking, worked in venture at Globespan, corporate development at Sony Music, then led media partnerships for Android/Google Play. Co‑founded StayTuned (CEO) and 6th Man Ventures (Co‑founder & GP), and serves on/has advised multiple startups in media, healthcare and crypto. Education: Stanford (BS/MS engineering) and Harvard Business School (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage Web3/crypto (pre-seed to Seed/Series A); DAOs & DeFi primitives; metaverse / AR‑VR; developer infrastructure and consumer/web3 applications.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment Partner at Multicoin Capital; joined the firm’s investment team in 2020 and was promoted to Investment Partner in March 2023. Leads and authors research on Web3 infrastructure (oracles, DePIN, distributed compute) and has led investments in protocol and infrastructure companies. Previously a Product Manager at Abodewell and worked in Strategy & Business Development at SAP; holds a BA from the University of Chicago.
enrichment.career_background: Began at Multicoin Capital as an analyst/associate in 2020 and was promoted to Investment Partner in 2023, where he leads deals and publishes firm research. enrichment.investment_focus: Founder-first, early-stage (prototype → early revenue) technology ventures; sector work includes AI/generative tech, AR/VR, healthcare, B2B SaaS, FinTech and consumer tech; equity-free accelerator & investor introductions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Terrance Orr is a venture partner at NextGen Venture Partners and a venture builder/advisor focused on early-stage startups. He has served as an Operating Partner-in-Residence at Mach49 and held EIR/advisory roles with SAP.iO, Techstars, Republic and others. Orr advises startups on product, go-to-market, and fundraising and is active in founder mentorship and ecosystem development.
enrichment.career_background: Orr is an operator-turned-investor with experience at Dell Technologies (intrapreneurship and post-merger integration), entrepreneur-in-residence roles (SAP.iO, Republic), accelerator experience with Techstars, and venture-building/operating roles at Mach49. He works as an advisor and mentor to early-stage companies and participates in investor networks and initiatives supporting underrepresented founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed) investments in enterprise and B2B software: vertical AI, SMB/enterprise SaaS, B2B marketplaces, and supply chain & logistics technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Mythos Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on prosocial AI and "AGI‑proof" companies. Previously co‑led AGI deployment strategy and worked in strategic communications at DeepMind, and led growth at Upstart. Yale University graduate.
enrichment.career_background: Vishal Maini is the founder and managing partner of Mythos Ventures (founded 2023), which writes pre-seed and seed checks into AI‑native, prosocial technologies. Prior to Mythos he held growth roles at Upstart and served in strategic communications and as co‑lead for AGI deployment strategy at DeepMind. He studied at Yale University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups focused on AI/ML (AGI‑proof companies), prosocial technologies, robotics/automation, and frontier biotech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of XIFAQ, a startup incubator and innovation hub launched in 2017. Serial entrepreneur and early-stage angel investor based in Atlanta, Georgia, with experience mentoring and advising founders across deep-tech and frontier sectors.
enrichment.career_background: Affaque Ahmed founded XIFAQ in 2017 after over 15 years building companies across automobile, IT, food and tech sectors. He runs XIFAQ as an incubator/co‑work space and mentors founders, offering acceleration, go‑to‑market and fundraising support while also participating in angel investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage startups (incubation/acceleration); deep‑tech (AI, robotics, space‑tech), climate tech; Web3 and frontier technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Bryan Kim ("BK") is a partner at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) who invests primarily in consumer and app‑layer AI. He focuses on how AI reshapes productivity, creation, consumer health, and social experiences. Previously he held leadership roles at Snap and was CFO at Bungalow; he was also a founding GP at operator-led seed fund Uncommon Projects. He holds a BA from Carleton College and an MBA from Columbia Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment banking at Credit Suisse, moved into product/growth and finance leadership at Snap during its hyper-growth and IPO, served as CFO of Bungalow, was a founding general partner at Uncommon Projects, and joined Andreessen Horowitz as a partner (investing in consumer & app-layer AI).
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer and app-layer AI; early-stage consumer apps (seed through Series A/B), creator tools, social/connection products, and consumer health

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at GGW Ventures and founder/CEO of Go Global World. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, he builds startup communities, mentors founders, and invests in software startups. Background includes roles at GSD Venture Studios and Philip Morris International.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and operator now focused on connecting founders and investors: founder & CEO of Go Global World (a platform and community for startups and VCs), managing partner at GGW Ventures (the venture arm), former Partner & VP of Global Business Intelligence at GSD Venture Studios, and previously held global roles at Philip Morris International; adjunct lecturer and mentor at business schools (e.g., Skolkovo).
enrichment.investment_focus: Software companies (late seed / Series A), post-revenue (targeting teams with traction and ~$1M+ ARR); typical check ~ $300K; prefers US-incorporated startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner and founder of DataPower Ventures, investing in early-stage data and AI startups. Former product and data leader with roles at Google and SingleStore; host of the HumAIn podcast and active community builder in the data + AI ecosystem.
enrichment.career_background: David Yakobovitch founded DataPower Ventures and serves as its General Partner. He previously led product and data initiatives at Google (Global Product Lead) and SingleStore (Senior Manager, Technical Enablement), and has worked as a data science instructor and principal data scientist at organizations including General Assembly and Galvanize. He also hosts the HumAIn podcast and runs community programs for the data/AI ecosystem.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments in applied AI, machine learning, data infrastructure/analytics, AI-driven SaaS, and deep technology startups.

enrichment.firm_name: Black Ops Ventures (Black Operator Ventures, LLC)
enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and managing/general partner at Black Ops Ventures, a seed fund that backs Black‑led tech startups. Founder & CEO of Pilotly, a market‑research platform for media and content, and co‑founder of Transparent Collective. Serial entrepreneur with prior ventures including Ubi Video and GroupFlix; holds a BSE in Electrical Engineering from the University of Michigan.
enrichment.career_background: James Norman is a serial founder turned investor. He founded early media/OTT companies (Ubi Video, GroupFlix), later launched Pilotly (consumer insights for content) and co‑founded Transparent Collective to support underrepresented founders. In 2020–2021 he co‑founded Black Operator Ventures (Black Ops) to lead seed investments in Black‑led technology companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed‑stage investments in Black‑led tech startups (focus includes media/OTT, consumer tech, fintech and enterprise software)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder‑turned‑investor and Managing Partner at Chaotic Capital. Focuses on seed and early‑stage startups that help people and organizations adapt to complexity and chaos. Previously co‑founded Coutorture Media and playAPI and was co‑founder & CEO of Stowaway Cosmetics (acquired).
enrichment.career_background: Julie Fredrickson is a New York–based entrepreneur and investor. She co‑founded Coutorture Media (acquired), founded playAPI, and was co‑founder & CEO of Stowaway Cosmetics (now part of WIN Brands Group). She is the managing partner of Chaotic Capital, a seed‑stage fund that invests in companies addressing personal flexibility, organizational agility, systemic arbitrage (crypto/finance), and climate/planetary risk. Education: University of Chicago.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & early‑stage startups that increase resilience and optionality in chaotic systems — personal flexibility, organizational agility (SaaS/dev tools), crypto/compute infrastructure & systemic arbitrage, and climate adaptation.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner on a16z’s Bio + Health team who leads investments in companies modernizing healthcare access, payment, and delivery. Previously co‑founder and Chief Product Officer at Kyruus; earlier product and engineering roles at Generation Health, Knome, and Endeca. Holds an MS in genomics (Harvard‑MIT HST) and an MBA (MIT Sloan).
interests: AI/ML applied to clinical and administrative workflows
enrichment.career_background: Julie Yoo is a General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) focusing on Bio + Health investments. She co‑founded Kyruus and served as its Chief Product Officer, scaling the company’s provider matching platform; prior roles include VP of Product at Generation Health, Product Manager at Knome, and early software engineer at Endeca. She holds degrees from MIT and Harvard‑MIT HST and is a World Economic Forum Young Global Leader.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare technology (access, payment, and delivery); healthtech infrastructure and enterprise clinical/admin tools; AI/ML for healthcare workflows. Stages: Seed through Series B.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Singular based in London with a background in scaling consumer and fintech businesses. Former senior leader at Deliveroo and NerdWallet; joined Papier's board after Singular led its Series C.
enrichment.career_background: Worked at Bain & Company early in her career, then held product and GM roles at NerdWallet (insurance), moved to Deliveroo as Senior Director of Strategy & Transformation, and joined Singular as a Partner (London) where she focuses on supporting high-growth consumer and software companies. Joined the board of Papier following Singular's Series C investment.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage European technology: consumer & marketplaces, B2B/SaaS, fintech/insurance (Seed to Series A/B)

enrichment.personal_bio: Peter H. Diamandis is an American entrepreneur, physician and engineer. He is a co‑founder/partner at BOLD Capital Partners and the founder and executive chairman of the XPRIZE Foundation. He has co‑founded or helped start 20+ companies across space, longevity and exponential technologies.
enrichment.career_background: Diamandis trained as an engineer and physician (degrees from MIT and an M.D. from Harvard Medical School). He founded the XPRIZE Foundation and co‑founded Singularity University and BOLD Capital Partners, and has co‑founded and led multiple companies in space, health and longevity; he focuses on building and funding ventures that leverage exponential technologies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage and growth investments in exponential technologies: longevity/biotech, healthtech, AI/software, space/aerospace and frontier physical technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Former Partner at Index Ventures (joined 2018), Sarah Cannon focused on productivity, future-of-work and enterprise software investing. She led or supported Index investments in companies such as Notion, Instabase and Lightning AI and served as a board observer at Slack. Prior to venture she worked at CapitalG and as a policy advisor at the White House.
enrichment.career_background: Sarah Cannon was a Partner at Index Ventures (2018–2022). Before Index she was a principal at CapitalG (Alphabet’s growth fund) and earlier served as a policy advisor on the National Economic Council in the Obama administration. Her early career included McKinsey and a Fulbright; she holds a BA from Yale and graduate degrees from Harvard (MPA and MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early and growth-stage investments in productivity/collaboration, future-of-work platforms, enterprise software, developer tools and AI

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner on the a16z Growth investing team focused on AI and enterprise technology. Previously a vice president at TA Associates and an early-stage investor at DCM Ventures and Radicle Impact; began her career at BCG and Morgan Stanley. Holds a BA in Economics from Harvard and an MBA from Stanford GSB.
interests: Generative AI / AI for the enterprise
enrichment.career_background: Sarah Wang is a General Partner on Andreessen Horowitz's Growth team, where she leads and partners with growth-stage enterprise and AI companies. Prior to a16z she was VP at TA Associates (served on the ZoomInfo board), and earlier worked in venture at DCM Ventures and Radicle Impact and in consulting and capital markets at BCG and Morgan Stanley. She holds a BA from Harvard and an MBA from Stanford GSB.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI and enterprise technology; growth-stage investments across enterprise, fintech, consumer internet, crypto/web3, and bio+healthcare

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and early-stage angel investor. Co‑founder of Eventjoy (YC W14), which was acquired by Ticketmaster, and co‑founder of the Todd & Rahul angel fund with Rahul Vohra. Active investor in many startups and co‑founder of the crypto fund Curated.
enrichment.career_background: Todd Goldberg is a San Francisco–area entrepreneur and angel investor. He co‑founded Eventjoy (acquired by Ticketmaster), founded Mailjoy, co‑founded the cryptonative fund Curated, and invests through Todd & Rahul's Angel Fund alongside Rahul Vohra. He focuses on helping founders with product, distribution and fundraising.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed (occasionally post-seed/Series A); generalist across SaaS, productivity, creator tools, health & wellness and business infrastructure. Typical check size ~$300k–$500k.

enrichment.personal_bio: Engineer, product designer and investor. Led development of the iPod and early iPhone hardware, founded Nest, and now runs an investment/advisory practice (Future Shape / Build Collective). Focuses on deep‑tech and climate‑oriented hardware and biomanufacturing startups.
enrichment.career_background: Tony Fadell is a computer engineer and entrepreneur who led Apple’s iPod organization and contributed to early iPhone hardware before founding Nest (CEO, 2010–2016). After Nest he launched Future Shape (now Build Collective) to invest in and advise deep‑tech startups; he serves on industry boards (including Arm) and is the author of BUILD. He holds a BS in Computer Engineering from the University of Michigan and is named on hundreds of patents.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage deep tech and hardware (climate tech, biomanufacturing, semiconductors, robotics, mobility and industrial/consumer hardware).

enrichment.personal_bio: Engineer, entrepreneur and early-stage investor; President & General Partner at Olima Ventures and founder of Ephla Bio. Adjunct professor at Stanford (teaches Software Engineering for Scientists) and a sector-agnostic angel/seed investor focused on biotech, B2B, distributed systems and enterprise software. Former engineer at Google and leader of Twitter's New York engineering office.
enrichment.career_background: Built large distributed systems at Google (early 2000s), co‑founded and led startups (including Mitro, acquired by Twitter), and subsequently led Twitter’s New York engineering office. Served as entrepreneur‑in‑residence at Benchmark, advises/startups via Olima Ventures, and teaches a Stanford course on software engineering for scientists; currently founder of a biotech company (Ephla Bio) while investing in early‑stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (angel/seed) investments in biotech, B2B/enterprise software, distributed systems and developer/scientific tooling

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner / Venture Partner (US) at Woodstock Fund focused on infrastructure, DeFi and gaming applications. Former IBM digital assets and blockchain lead with prior roles in Watson AI and Walmart integration. Advises Outerlands Capital and operates projects in the crypto/Web3 space.
enrichment.career_background: Adam Mastrelli is a Venture Partner (US) at Woodstock Fund and has ~10 years of experience at IBM leading digital assets, blockchain and Watson AI initiatives (including IBM Digital Assets & Banking Solutions and IBM Blockchain Ventures). He advises Outerlands Capital and has founded/operated crypto-focused projects and collectives supporting fundraising, deal sourcing and portfolio support.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early and growth-stage Web3 (Infrastructure, DeFi, gaming/NFTs, tokenization and protocol layers)

enrichment.personal_bio: Product leader, founder and early-stage investor associated with Interplay Ventures' Foundry. Former GM of Product & Growth for Amazon Business/Industrial and an engagement manager at McKinsey; founder of startups including Tribe, KarmaBox and Tantive. Holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BA from the American University in Cairo.
enrichment.career_background: Adham has worked in product and growth leadership roles at Amazon (GM of Product, Business & Industrial) and at McKinsey (engagement manager). He has founded multiple startups (KarmaBox, Tribe, Tantive) and served as Partner / Foundry lead at Interplay Ventures. He holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BA from the American University in Cairo.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology-enabled companies with emphasis on marketplaces, e-commerce, marketing tech and vertical/B2B software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor focused on the Digital Asset Ecosystem (DAE). Previously an Investment Analyst, Crypto at Republic Capital; now principal at 1RoundTable Partners / 10T. Graduated from Emory University (B.A. Economics, 2020).
enrichment.career_background: Worked in blockchain research and GTM at ConsenSys and Chainalysis before joining Republic Capital as an Investment Analyst (crypto), where he focused on deal sourcing, diligence and portfolio strategy for DAE investments. Listed as Principal/Associate at 1RoundTable Partners and 10T after Republic Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Digital assets / Web3 and FinTech; primarily seed to growth-stage (DAE-focused)

enrichment.personal_bio: Director / Head of Corporate Development & Ventures at Coinbase. Leads M&A and strategic investments for Coinbase’s corporate and Ventures activity. Previously a product manager at LinkedIn and worked in investment banking at Deutsche Bank. Educated at Santa Clara University.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Coinbase’s corporate development & ventures function as an early hire and now leads corporate development, acquisitions, and strategic investments for the company. Prior roles include product management at LinkedIn and investment banking at Deutsche Bank. Serves on nonprofit boards and participates in the crypto startup ecosystem.
enrichment.investment_focus: Crypto / Web3, token infrastructure, developer platforms, FinTech; primarily early-stage (pre-seed to Series A) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CTO of Meaningful (a growth & product studio); former lead engineer at Akorda and research engineer at AiFi. Based in Miami and San Francisco; serves as a limited partner/partner at 500 LatAm and participates as an angel/advisor to early-stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Alberto Sadde is a software engineer and entrepreneur who co‑founded Meaningful (growth, SEO, martech, low-code). He previously worked on compiler research at Oxford, engineering at BAE Systems, was an early engineer at AiFi, and served as lead engineer/tech lead at Akorda. He is active as a fractional CTO, startup advisor, and a limited partner/partner with 500 LatAm.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed to Series A) Latin America startups; developer tools, SaaS, and growth/marketing technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Aleksija Vujicic is an investor and entrepreneur who served as an Investment Associate at Multicoin Capital and is the founder & CEO of TATA Bazaar. She holds an MBA from NYU Stern and is based in New York. Her focus areas include Web3, consumer marketplaces, and gaming.
enrichment.career_background: Previously an Investment Associate at Multicoin Capital (2022–2023) and an MBA Associate at Female Founders Fund (2021–2022), Aleksija has a background in creative strategy and consumer marketing; she founded Zenzy and later launched TATA Bazaar. She holds a BA from UCLA and an MBA from NYU Stern.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3/blockchain and crypto projects; consumer marketplaces and social commerce; gaming/eSports — primarily seed and pre-seed stage.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor/analyst with experience in Web3 and developer tooling. Previously a product analyst at Alchemy and a fellow at Celestia and Floodgate; currently a growth engineer at Browserbase. Focuses on early-stage Web3 and consumer-internet opportunities.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in product and early-stage investing roles: product analyst (first hired analyst) at Alchemy; Modular Fellow at Celestia; Outlier Fellow at Floodgate; later joined Browserbase as a growth engineer. Active in early-stage Web3 and developer-infrastructure communities and participates in fellowship programs and operator roles supporting startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3 / blockchain, developer tooling & infrastructure, consumer internet (post‑seed / Series B)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Hometeam Ventures, a seed/early-stage fund focused on construction and housing technology. Former co‑founder and COO of New Story, where she led operations on large-scale affordable housing and early 3D‑printed home projects. Raised an ~$18M fund to back startups that cut housing costs and improve the built environment.
enrichment.career_background: After Teach For America and operations work at McMaster‑Carr, Lafci co‑founded New Story (YC S15) and served as COO, leading field operations, R&D pilots and large fundraising efforts for global affordable housing. In 2021 she launched Hometeam Ventures to invest in startups that reduce cost, speed construction, and improve quality across the construction value chain.
enrichment.investment_focus: Construction & housing technology; seed to early growth stages; industrialized construction (3D printing, modular), BIM/digital twins, project & jobsite management, supply‑chain and construction finance.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and product lead at Efficient App (based in Austin, TX) and operator of the Efficient VC angel vehicle. Active angel investor focused on product, automation, and efficiency in B2B SaaS. Associated with Orange Fund / Orange DAO and participates in early-stage investments.
enrichment.career_background: Alex Bass founded Efficient App (formerly CyberBytes) and serves as Founder & Head of Product. He began angel investing publicly in 2021 through Efficient VC and has built a portfolio of early-stage investments, advising on product and operations for founders. He is based in Austin, Texas and is active in both SaaS and crypto communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments in Web3/Crypto and FinTech; B2B SaaS focused on efficiency/productivity; founder-led, product-first startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director of BrightEdge, the American Cancer Society’s impact venture fund, and Vice President of Innovation & Impact Investing at the American Cancer Society. Impact investor and patient advocate focused on cancer therapeutics, diagnostics, and patient-centered innovation. Former industry and policy roles include positions at Radius Health, AstraZeneca, Sanofi Genzyme, and advisory work with Red Sky Partners; faculty at MIT HST/ Sloan Healthcare Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: More than 25 years in life sciences, public policy, and innovation. Currently leads BrightEdge (ACS) and ACS innovation/impact investing; previously founded Accendo (2018) and advised companies at Red Sky Partners. Held R&D/commercial and global policy roles at Radius Health, AstraZeneca, and Sanofi Genzyme, and served in public-sector roles including at the UK government and the U.S. OMB. Teaches biomedical innovation and healthcare entrepreneurship at MIT/Harvard-MIT programs. Holds a B.S. (MIT) and an M.P.P. (Harvard).
enrichment.investment_focus: Mission-driven, early-stage investments in cancer-focused therapeutics, diagnostics, devices and technologies; seed/early-stage impact venture investing with emphasis on health equity and patient access.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Earl Grey Capital and co‑founder of Clearbit. Based in Austin, Texas, he runs Earl Grey full‑time and focuses on early‑stage investments in developer infrastructure. Studied engineering at Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Clearbit (served as Chief Business Officer) before transitioning to venture; since 2020 he has been Managing Partner at Earl Grey Capital, leading the fund’s strategy, investment decisions, and founder support. He studied engineering at Stanford and is based in Austin, TX.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed, seed, Series A) investments in developer‑focused infrastructure: APIs, protocols, developer tools, cloud/infra, web3/crypto, and AI-enabled B2B platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Senior Analyst at Blockchain Capital (joined 2022; promoted in January 2024). Based in New York (Brooklyn) and focused on the intersection of consumer products and crypto. Active writer on Web3 topics and a co-host on the RabbitHole "DAOn the Rabbit Hole" podcast.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Blockchain Capital in 2022 as an Analyst and promoted to Senior Analyst in January 2024; conducts investment diligence and develops theses with a focus on consumer × crypto. Prior roles include work with Alumni Ventures (Deputy Chief of Staff), Boost Studios (contributor), and strategy/operations roles in early-stage organizations. Publishes web3 commentary (mirror.eth) and co-hosts a RabbitHole podcast.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer-facing crypto, NFTs, DAOs, and Web3 infrastructure; primarily seed and Series A-stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at NGC Ventures focused on early-stage web3 and blockchain infrastructure. Previously an investment research analyst at Goldman Sachs in Singapore and at the Trans-Pacific Technology Fund. Holds an MBA from UC Berkeley (Haas) and a bachelor's in finance from National Taiwan University. Interests include infrastructure, DeFi and the metaverse.
enrichment.career_background: Joined NGC Ventures' investment team and is listed as a Venture Partner. Earlier roles include investment research analyst at Goldman Sachs (Singapore) and analyst at Trans-Pacific Technology Fund. Education: MBA, UC Berkeley (Haas); BBA/Bachelor's in Finance, National Taiwan University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage web3 and blockchain infrastructure, DeFi, metaverse

enrichment.personal_bio: Marketing and partnerships executive and startup advisor based in New York City. Former VP of Global Partnerships and head of marketing at Sprout Social; founder of AC3 Ventures. Serves as a limited partner/partner at MKT1 Capital, an early-stage B2B fund focused on go-to-market and marketing support for startups.
enrichment.career_background: More than 20 years in agency, brand and startup environments. Roles include VP, Global Partnerships and head of marketing at Sprout Social (supported the company through its IPO), senior marketing roles at Performics and DoubleClick, and advisory/fractional work for early-stage companies. Holds a master's in Integrated Marketing Communications from Northwestern University and a BA from the University of Wisconsin–Madison.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series A B2B startups with emphasis on go-to-market, marketing/marketing-tech, and enterprise SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Curated, a cryptonative fund that collects NFT and digital art. Focuses on generative art, blue‑chip NFT collections, and long‑term cultural stewardship of crypto art. Former entrepreneur and operator with background in startups and nonprofit building.
enrichment.career_background: Andrew Jiang is co‑founder and GP of Curated (launched 2021/2022), a fund that acquires and steward cryptonative art. Prior roles and ventures documented in public profiles include founding/leading tech startups and a YC‑backed nonprofit (Bayes Impact), plus operating roles at early companies and experience in consulting/private equity.
enrichment.investment_focus: NFTs & digital art (blue‑chip and generative); Web3/blockchain startups (seed/early stage); long‑term cultural stewardship of digital art

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and partner at Mechanism Capital, a crypto‑focused investment firm founded in 2020. Publicly active as a crypto commentator and trader (Twitter: @Rewkang) and known for work in DeFi, NFTs and Web3. Previously worked in portfolio management and venture at Digital Capital Management.
enrichment.career_background: Andrew Kang co‑founded Mechanism Capital in 2020 and leads the firm’s venture and trading activity across crypto and adjacent deep‑tech sectors. He has a public presence as a market commentator and researcher, participates in decentralized governance and NFT communities, and earlier worked in portfolio management and venture investing at Digital Capital Management.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage and growth investments in cryptocurrency and Web3 (DeFi, infrastructure, gaming, NFTs), plus selective deep‑tech/AI investments; also active trading in liquid tokens.

enrichment.personal_bio: Andy Volk is a Silicon Valley product and ecosystem leader and an active early-stage investor focused on African startups. He is a Founding Limited Partner & Global Advisor at Microtraction and has led Google’s developer/startup ecosystem work for Sub‑Saharan Africa. He publishes the Africa Notes newsletter and has made 30+ angel investments and LP commitments into Africa‑focused funds.
enrichment.career_background: Andy Volk has worked across product, developer relations, and ecosystem roles in Silicon Valley and Africa. His background includes leadership roles at Google (developer & startup ecosystem for Sub‑Saharan Africa), prior product/engineering work and startups (including Live365 and Downtempo), and advisory/LP roles at funds such as Microtraction and Future.Africa. He also runs an AngelList syndicate focused on African deal flow.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed African technology startups (fintech, SaaS, healthtech, crypto/Web3); early-stage check sizes in the $100K range; community & developer ecosystem support

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Venture Partner at Seed Club Ventures, focused on early-stage Web3 and DAO-backed startups. Previously co‑founded Anteo Health and has a background in investment banking. Invests primarily at pre-seed and seed stages and writes/advises on crypto, creator-economy, and community-native protocols. Educated at the University of York (BSc) and Imperial College London (MSc).
enrichment.career_background: Co-founded Seed Club Ventures (venture arm of Seed Club) and serves as a partner/venture partner. Co‑founder and COO of Anteo Health (healthtech). Prior experience in investment banking and analysis at Standard Chartered, Amber Capital and related advisory roles; has run consulting projects via Django Digital and provided early-stage advisory to crypto and deep‑tech founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3/Crypto (DAOs, creator economies); early-stage (pre-seed/seed); community-owned protocols and DAO tooling; selective healthcare & deep‑tech investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Accolade Partners focused on fund-of-funds and blockchain strategies. Previously worked on the investment team at Andreessen Horowitz and held roles at Aviatrix and Deloitte. He holds an M.B.A. from Stanford Graduate School of Business and a B.S. from The George Washington University.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Accolade Partners (partner-level) after earlier roles on the investment team at Andreessen Horowitz and business development/marketing at Aviatrix; began his career in consulting at Deloitte. At Accolade he works on venture, growth equity and dedicated blockchain fund-of-funds strategies and has spoken publicly about Accolade’s blockchain fund efforts.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fund-of-funds (venture & growth equity); blockchain/crypto fund investments; healthcare and health-tech; selective direct co-investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Analyst at Wave Financial focused on digital-asset and Web3 investing. Previously an investment consultant at Aves Lair and compliance consultant at Aspect Advisors; holds Series 7, 24, and 63 licenses and a BA in Political Science & Asian Studies from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Aric Chang is a Venture Analyst at Wave Financial. His background includes roles as an investment consultant (Aves Lair) and compliance consultant (Aspect Advisors); he holds multiple FINRA licenses (Series 7, 24, 63) and a BA from UC Berkeley. He has written about rollups, Celestia, and NFT use-cases, indicating a focus on crypto infrastructure and digital-asset applications.
enrichment.investment_focus: Digital assets / crypto (Web3), DeFi, NFTs and blockchain infrastructure; early-stage (seed) and fintech investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Head of Acceleration Investments at CV VC (CV Labs), responsible for sourcing and evaluating early-stage Web3 startups and supporting accelerator cohorts. Writes and researches crypto investment themes (DeFi, infrastructure, programmable cryptography). Education referenced as University of St. Gallen (HSG) and UC Berkeley Haas on public profiles.
enrichment.career_background: Leads acceleration-side investing at CV VC / CV Labs (Head of Acceleration Investments). Prior experience includes strategy/consulting work on digital assets and CBDC research and earlier roles as a venture capital analyst; active in speaker and accelerator panels for CV Summit and CV Labs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed & seed blockchain startups via CV Labs accelerator and direct VC; Web3 infrastructure, DeFi, tokenization and accelerator-led seed investing.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding/Managing Partner at Blacktop Capital (since 2016). Former owner of Brasher's Auto Auctions and member of ServNet Auction Group leadership. Holds a BS from Brigham Young University and an Executive/EMBA from UC Berkeley Haas. Based in the Rocklin/Sacramento, California area.
enrichment.career_background: Ben Brasher co‑founded Blacktop Capital in 2016 and serves as a founding partner. Prior to venture investing he owned and operated Brasher's Auto Auctions (2004–2016), served on the ServNet Auction Group executive team, and held roles at Auction Management Services. He studied Business Management at Brigham Young University and completed an executive MBA at UC Berkeley Haas.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage investments with a preference for software over hardware; targets post-revenue or growing software companies across AI/ML, consumer internet, enterprise SaaS, fintech and transportation/mobility.

enrichment.personal_bio: Ben McCann is an investor and advisor at C3 Ventures and a technologist. He co‑founded Connectifier (CTO), which was acquired by LinkedIn, and later worked on hire‑matching at LinkedIn. He holds a B.S. in Computer Science and an MBA from Carnegie Mellon University.
enrichment.career_background: Ben co‑founded Connectifier and served as its CTO; Connectifier was acquired by LinkedIn in 2016. After the acquisition he worked on hire‑matching products at LinkedIn. Earlier he was a software engineer at Google. He is currently an investor and advisor at C3 Ventures and is active in open‑source developer communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to early‑stage investments in enterprise SaaS, healthcare/healthtech, space tech, green energy, autonomous transportation and consumer startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: PhD-trained human geneticist (Broad/Harvard) who contributed to gnomAD and transcript-expression-aware variant annotation. Worked in industry as a human genetics data scientist (Maze Therapeutics) and served as a Senior Associate at Third Rock Ventures focused on company creation. More recently listed as Head of Genetics and Program Team Lead at Marea Therapeutics.
enrichment.career_background: Beryl Cummings earned a PhD in human/medical genetics (Broad Institute/Harvard), co-authored papers on variant interpretation and gnomAD, and transitioned to industry roles at Maze Therapeutics. She joined Third Rock Ventures as a Senior Associate involved in building new biotech companies and later took an industry role as Head of Genetics and Program Team Lead at Marea Therapeutics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Applying human genetics and transcriptomics to create early-stage biotechnology companies and rare-disease therapeutics

enrichment.personal_bio: Academic researcher and Professor of Human Centered Design & Engineering at the University of Washington who founded medical-device company Shift Labs and later became a venture investor. Senior Venture Partner at Pioneer Fund and a Venture Partner at Pack Ventures; Y Combinator alum (Shift Labs went through YC).
interests: Equitable access to capital / inclusive venture investing
enrichment.career_background: Beth E. Kolko holds a Ph.D. (The University of Texas at Austin) and is a long‑time professor at the University of Washington (HCDE). She co‑founded Shift Labs (medical devices), participated in Y Combinator, and moved into venture roles — Senior Venture Partner at Pioneer Fund (listed since 2019) and Founding/Venture Partner at Pack Ventures (listed since 2022).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed to Series A/B) investments in Y Combinator startups; medical devices, digital health/Health IT, consumer health, and health & hospital services.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-CEO of Mission North with 25+ years in strategic communications advising technology companies. Listed as an LP/partner with MKT1 Capital on public profiles (2021–2024). Publishes and comments on technology, media and communications topics.
enrichment.career_background: Co-CEO and former President & Partner at Mission North (formerly Bateman Group), where he leads corporate communications, go-to-market and enterprise practice work; earlier roles include VP of Marketing at a media startup and Special Assistant/Deputy Policy Advisor to the Mayor of San Francisco. Public-profile listings show he served as an LP/partner at MKT1 Capital (listed 2021–2024). He graduated from St. Lawrence University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series A B2B startups (MarTech, enterprise software) with hands-on go-to-market and marketing support; typical check sizes ~$100k–$300k.

enrichment.personal_bio: Blake Masters is an American venture capitalist and author best known for co‑writing Zero to One with Peter Thiel. He served as chief operating officer of Thiel Capital and president of the Thiel Foundation before resigning in 2022 to run for the U.S. Senate in Arizona. He has co‑founded Judicata and held board roles at public companies such as PSQ Holdings (PublicSquare).
enrichment.career_background: Masters earned a B.A. and a J.D. from Stanford University. He posted detailed notes from Peter Thiel’s Stanford class that became the basis for the bestseller Zero to One (2014), co‑founded legal research startup Judicata, and later worked as COO of Thiel Capital and president of the Thiel Foundation. He resigned from Thiel organizations in March 2022 to run for U.S. Senate (Arizona) and subsequently has served on several public company boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology startups (software), legaltech, crypto and policy‑adjacent investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at CreatorLed Ventures, a VC for influencers. Creator‑economy executive and former child actor who has built creator-facing businesses and advised startups. Founder/CEO of Fourteen Media Group and previously served as Chief Evangelist at Lumanu; contributor to Forbes.
enrichment.career_background: Began as a child actor (hosted Cartoon Network shows; acted in Disney projects including Lemonade Mouth and Dog with a Blog) and transitioned into creator‑economy entrepreneurship. Since 2009 he has led Fourteen Media Group, served as Chief Evangelist at Lumanu (2020–2023), written for Forbes, and in 2022 co‑founded CreatorLed Ventures where he invests in creator‑led consumer and creator‑economy startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed to Seed; creator economy, social commerce, consumer crypto/web3, fintech, marketplaces, vertical SaaS, EdTech, gaming, health & wellness

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture analyst and early-stage investor affiliated with Winning Together Fund. Undergraduate background in immunology and human biology at the University of Toronto; Laidlaw Scholar and founder of student biotech initiatives. Works at the intersection of biotech/healthcare and early-stage technology, and has also been involved with Biogenesis and innovation consulting.
enrichment.career_background: Undergraduate training in immunology (University of Toronto) with research experience in B‑cell immunology. Co‑founded student biotech initiatives (e.g., Nucleate Dojo, iAscend), served as an innovation consultant and product/operations roles, and has worked as a venture analyst at Winning Together Fund while joining the founding team at Biogenesis (clinical‑trials tooling).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed early-stage tech across SaaS, remote work, edtech, fintech/insurtech, web3/crypto, and biotech/healthcare.

enrichment.personal_bio: CEO and co‑founder of New Story and co‑founder/advisor at Hometeam Ventures. Focuses on construction and housing innovation and impact-driven solutions to affordable housing. Y Combinator alum and Forbes 30 Under 30 recognized entrepreneur.
interests: AEC digitization and sustainable building materials
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded New Story in 2014 and serves as its CEO, leading market‑based solutions for affordable housing and pioneering projects such as 3D‑printed homes. Co‑founded Hometeam Ventures (2020/2021) to invest in early‑stage construction and housing startups; has served on advisory boards including DocuSign Impact and on the board of Garden City Companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed/Series A) investments in construction and housing technology, AEC software and hardware, and double‑bottom‑line startups that reduce cost, increase speed, and improve quality in the built environment.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur, investor and former professional musician. Technology Partner at LOUD Capital and Managing Partner of Legacy Entertainment Ventures, focused on music & entertainment ventures and technology-enabled startups. Co‑founder of Soundstr and Musicians' Desk Reference; regular conference speaker and contributor to industry publications.
enrichment.career_background: Spent over a decade as a professional musician before founding multiple music- and education-focused startups (including The Counter Rhythm Group and Musicians' Desk Reference). Co‑founded Soundstr (acquired by VNUE in 2018) and later served in marketing/strategic roles; has consulted for companies such as LiveNation and Kobalt. Joined LOUD Capital in a partner/marketing/technology role and leads LOUD’s Legacy Entertainment Ventures unit, advising portfolio companies on growth, marketing and business development.
enrichment.investment_focus: Music & entertainment technology; early-stage technology startups (seed–Series A); marketing/growth and creator-economy ventures

enrichment.personal_bio: PhD geneticist, entrepreneur, and investor focused on women’s health. Founder & CEO of FemHealth Insights and host of the FemTech Focus podcast; previously a venture associate at Capital Factory and founder of Pheramor.
enrichment.career_background: Holds a PhD in Molecular & Human Genetics from Baylor College of Medicine. Co-founded Pheramor (DNA-based dating app), served as a senior venture associate at Capital Factory (launched the Gulf Coast/Houston branch), founded FemHealth Insights (market research & consulting) and FemTech Focus (podcast/community), and is listed in press and startup directories as a co-founder/advisor for Coyote Ventures (seed-stage FemTech fund).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage investments in women’s health (FemTech), digital health, consumer health and diagnostics

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Principal at Prefix Capital based in San Francisco. Focuses on early-stage, deep‑tech investments and works on diligence, portfolio support and firm operations. Previously an associate at 415 Investments and holds a BS in Management Science & Engineering from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Calvin Ling co‑founded and served as a principal at Prefix Capital (an early‑stage deep‑tech VC). He previously worked as an associate at 415 Investments, held operations/strategic roles including an internship at Honda Silicon Valley Lab, has served as a board observer for portfolio companies (e.g., SwiftComply), and earned a BS in Management Science & Engineering from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to early‑stage; deep‑tech/foundational technologies across software, information security, AI/ML, biotech, semiconductors, and hardware.

enrichment.personal_bio: New York–based finance professional, content creator (YouTube) and early-stage scout. Public profiles list roles at KPMG and J.P. Morgan (Director, Advisory Services) and show affiliation as a venture scout with LvlUp Ventures. Active in seed–Series A deal sourcing and creator-focused VC networks.
enrichment.career_background: University of Florida graduate who began as a consultant (KPMG), has served in J.P. Morgan’s Director, Advisory Services (Private Equity & Venture Capital) practice, creates finance/startup content on YouTube, and is listed on industry platforms as a venture scout affiliated with LvlUp Ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Pre-seed–Series A); sectors: FinTech, Web3/Blockchain, MarketingTech, Education; primary geographies: U.S. (New York / Los Angeles)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Loyal (Cellular Longevity), a clinical‑stage company developing drugs to extend dogs' healthy lifespan. Previously Chief of Staff and Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at The Longevity Fund; trained in neuroscience and health economics (University of Texas; DPhil studies at Oxford). Based in San Francisco.
enrichment.career_background: Served as Chief of Staff and Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at The Longevity Fund before founding Loyal (aka Cellular Longevity) in 2019/2020, where she is CEO. Academic and research background includes neuroscience (BSc, University of Texas at Austin), DPhil studies at University of Oxford (health economics of gene therapy), and research roles at Sanford Burnham Prebys and scientific consulting at Oisín Biotechnologies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage longevity and aging therapeutics; seed–Series A biotech and life‑science companies; translational therapeutics and veterinary applications.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at Symbolic Capital focused on web3 and blockchain. Co‑founder and former CEO of Tidal Finance (a DeFi insurance protocol). Background spans mathematics, petroleum engineering and an MBA from Wharton; works on early‑stage crypto/fintech deals and research.
enrichment.career_background: Chad studied mathematics at Peking University, earned an M.S. in Petroleum Engineering from Texas A&M and an MBA (Wharton). He previously worked in engineering and product roles (including Schlumberger and QRI), served as Principal at AU21 Capital, co‑founded Tidal Finance in 2020, and joined Symbolic Capital as an investor partner in 2022.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3/blockchain (protocols & infrastructure), DeFi and decentralized insurance, fintech; primarily early‑stage (seed to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture capital research associate at ARK Invest supporting the ARK Venture Fund. Previously an early employee and VC analyst at Sweater Ventures. Has interned at Techbuzz and Alta Ventures and holds a Certificate in Entrepreneurship from the University of Utah.
enrichment.career_background: Joined ARK Invest in November 2023 as a Venture Capital Research Associate supporting ARK Venture. Prior to ARK, Prather was an early employee and analyst at Sweater Ventures. He has internship experience at Techbuzz and Alta Ventures and has worked with startups on fundraising and go-to-market strategy. Education includes a Certificate in Entrepreneurship from the University of Utah.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed–Series A venture investments across fintech, consumer, SaaS, digital health and AI; focused on retail/democratized VC platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor who worked at Index Ventures (joined from GitHub) and has focused on community-led products and crypto. Previously held roles in strategic finance and business operations at GitHub and worked in finance at Hellman & Friedman and Morgan Stanley. Educated at Georgetown University (B.S., Foreign Service).
enrichment.career_background: Chris began his career in investment banking at Morgan Stanley, moved to Hellman & Friedman in private equity, then joined GitHub (Director, Strategic Finance & Business Operations) where he helped scale operations and supported the Microsoft acquisition. He joined Index Ventures (Principal/Partner, 2018–2022), sponsoring investments in community-focused products and crypto, and later joined Haun Ventures as a partner focused on crypto investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Community-led consumer products, developer tools/open source, crypto/Web3 infrastructure, enterprise SaaS (bottoms-up growth)

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage investor formerly on the investing team at Struck Capital (2020–2022). Focuses on seed/pre-seed opportunities across interactive media, games/AR‑VR, web3/blockchain and enterprise SaaS. Previously worked in product/growth and CIO/CTO advisory; Claremont McKenna College graduate.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in growth/product at Highspot, served in CIO/CTO advisory at Infosys Consulting, joined Struck Capital as an investor (circa 2020–2022), and joined Galaxy Interactive as VP, Investor & Chief of Staff (since 2022). Serves in advisory/board roles for CMC’s Center for Innovation & Entrepreneurship, LA‑Tech.org and Count On Me Family Foundation.
enrichment.hometown: Grew up in Seattle, Washington; born in New Orleans, Louisiana.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre‑seed; sectors: games & interactive media, AR/VR, web3/blockchain, AI, enterprise SaaS, marketplaces and e‑commerce

enrichment.personal_bio: Biomedical and electrical engineer, co‑founder and CEO/CTO of Bodyport (digital hemodynamic monitoring). Previously founded Atreo Medical (acquired by Medtronic). Serves as a Venture Partner at Pioneer Fund and holds multiple patents and peer‑reviewed publications in cardio/biomedical sensing.
enrichment.career_background: Corey Centen is an engineer‑entrepreneur focused on medical sensing and digital health. He co‑founded Bodyport (YC S15) developing a cardiac monitoring scale and led Atreo Medical through acquisition by Medtronic; after the acquisition he worked on TrueCPR device technology transfer. He has authored patents and academic publications on cardiovascular sensing and monitoring.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed/Series A); digital health, diagnostics, medical devices, biotechnology; enterprise & consumer software; leverages Y Combinator alumni network.

enrichment.personal_bio: Former Analyst/Venture Fellow at Scout Ventures (joined Scout's team while a Penn undergraduate). BA, Science, Technology & Society (University of Pennsylvania). Later worked in crypto and product-growth roles (including BlockTower Capital and dYdX) and has held advisor/scout roles in early-stage crypto startups.
enrichment.career_background: Corey Miller worked at Scout Ventures as a Venture Fellow and Analyst (posted on Scout's blog and university alumni pages linking him to Scout, class of ’15 at Penn). After Scout he worked in crypto investing (BlockTower Capital) and later in product and growth roles at dYdX; he has since taken advisor and scout roles in early-stage crypto projects. Education: BA, Science, Technology & Society, University of Pennsylvania (cum laude noted on mentor/bio pages).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage investing in frontier and dual‑use technologies (AI/ML, quantum, robotics, advanced materials, space/aerospace, security/defense); Scout leads seed rounds and follows through Series B.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and co-founder at Energy Transition Ventures based in Austin, Texas. 25+ years in energy technology, product and VC; previously led cleantech investing at Accel and held product/GM roles at SunEdison and SolarBridge (SunPower). Holds a B.S. in engineering from UT Austin and an M.S./Ph.D. from Stanford.
enrichment.career_background: Craig Lawrence has worked across venture capital, engineering, product and executive roles. He led energy investing at Accel Partners, was Vice President / General Manager roles at SunEdison and SolarBridge (acquired by SunPower), served as VP of Products at Treverity, and earlier created IDEO’s energy practice. He holds a B.S. from the University of Texas at Austin and an M.S. and Ph.D. from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Distributed energy, electrification, mobility, resource efficiency; invests primarily Seed through Series B in energy transition and enabling technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture partner and operator focused on climate and regenerative agriculture. Co‑founder of The Crop Project and founding CEO of the Climate Collective; has held leadership roles at NYU Tandon Future Labs and worked with Collaborative Fund. Based in Brooklyn, NY.
enrichment.career_background: Craig Wilson is an investor and operator who has served as a venture partner (Allegory, Collaborative Fund), led NYU Tandon Future Labs and its innovation programs, and founded climate‑focused initiatives including the Climate Collective and The Crop Project. He holds a BA from Middlebury College and an MBA from NYU Stern.
enrichment.investment_focus: Climate tech, regenerative agriculture/seaweed, Web3/blockchain applied to carbon/finance, early‑stage venture (seed–Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner & Coach‑in‑Residence at Avalanche VC and founder of Dalglish.Coach. Former Associate Partner at McKinsey & Company; holds a PhD in English from Stanford and undergraduate degrees from the University of Pennsylvania/Wharton. Works as an executive and leadership coach for founders and startup teams. Grew up in Singapore.
enrichment.career_background: Leads coaching and founder support at Avalanche VC while operating an independent executive‑coaching practice (Dalglish.Coach). Previously served as an Associate Partner at McKinsey & Company (healthcare/growth work), worked in education program design, and completed a PhD in English at Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (Seed–Series A) investments in learning/EdTech, future of work, ownership economy (Web3/crypto), and govtech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Work-Bench focused on early-stage enterprise software. Research-driven investor covering Machine Learning & AI, developer tools, and the future of work. Former Product Manager and GTM strategy lead at Hyperscience; author of the More Intelligent (formerly Startupon) newsletter.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Work-Bench in 2022 as an Associate and was promoted to Principal in 2024. Prior roles include Product Manager (Machine Learning) and Go-to-Market Strategy Lead at Hyperscience and strategy consulting at IBM. He authors the More Intelligent newsletter and helps run cofounders.nyc. Educated at Pennsylvania State University (BS).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed) enterprise software; Machine Learning & AI; Developer tools; Future of Work; Enterprise applications

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and CMO at Spacecadet Ventures, a marketing‑focused early‑stage VC based in New York. 2x‑exited founder (EveryGuyed, Piccsy) and former consultant to brands including Netflix, Nike, Lego and Spotify. Focuses on pre‑seed/seed investments and marketing support for portfolio companies.
interests: AI / AR / VR and emerging tech
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and marketer. Founded EveryGuyed (acquired 2011) and Piccsy (acquired 2014), later launched Mylo and worked on digital/innovation projects for agencies and brands before co‑founding Spacecadet in 2020 to combine venture investing with integrated marketing support.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed-stage investments; marketing-first support for early-stage startups; sectors include AI/AR/VR, web3/crypto, consumer, education, deeptech/biotech and hardware.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at rali_cap (Rally Cap VC) focused on early-stage fintech and open finance for emerging markets. Previously worked in Global Open Finance at Plaid and in partnerships/strategy roles at Capital One and BCG. Active as an angel and fund investor in emerging-market fintech and related areas.
enrichment.career_background: Investor at rali_cap since the fund/collective launched (Rally Cap/RaliCap). Prior roles include Global Open Finance at Plaid (role publicly listed), digital partnerships at Capital One and consulting at BCG; earlier work includes Kiva and international development fellowships. Education and professional profiles list Harvard Kennedy School and Tufts University on public aggregator profiles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) B2B/API-first fintech in emerging markets (Africa, Latin America, South Asia); open finance; expanding mandate into climate tech and software-first climate adaptation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor focused on crypto, fintech and frontier tech. Co‑founder and managing partner at 99 Capital; previously led crypto investments for the SoftBank Latin America Fund. Harvard BA in Statistics; active in AI/ML research and teaching roles.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder & managing partner at 99 Capital (digital assets / Web3 fund). Previously Head of Crypto Investments / Investment Director at SoftBank Latin America Fund and earlier worked in M&A and strategy at Morgan Stanley. Holds a BA in Statistics from Harvard and is an AI research fellow/lecturer at Harvard-affiliated programs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Crypto / Web3; FinTech & payments; Emerging markets (Latin America); AI / ML

enrichment.personal_bio: Product leader and early-stage angel investor. Former founder (Latent Space) and product manager at Google/YouTube; led AI product work at Coda and now leads AI product at Figma. Active in the South Park Commons community and serves as a scout/advisor for early-stage funds and startups.
enrichment.career_background: David Kossnick is a founder-turned-product-leader and angel investor. He founded Latent Space (2015–2020), held PM roles at Google and YouTube, led Coda’s AI product efforts, and moved to lead AI product at Figma. He is an alum/angel of South Park Commons, serves as a Greylock scout, and has advised startups (e.g., Skyryse).
enrichment.investment_focus: AI and generative AI; developer tools and prototyping; games and media/content; deep tech — primarily pre-seed/seed stage (typical angel checks ~$25K–$100K).

enrichment.personal_bio: Tenured Professor of Genetics at Harvard Medical School and Co-Director of the Paul F. Glenn Center for Biology of Aging. Venture Partner at Catalio Capital Management. Author of the bestseller "Lifespan" and a researcher focused on the biology of aging, including sirtuins, NAD+ metabolism and epigenetic reprogramming.
enrichment.career_background: David A. Sinclair earned a B.S. and Ph.D. from the University of New South Wales, completed postdoctoral work at MIT, and joined Harvard Medical School in 1999. He served as founding director/co‑director of the Paul F. Glenn Center for Biology of Aging, has co‑founded multiple biotech and consumer companies, holds numerous patents, and serves as a venture partner/advisor to several investment firms including Catalio.
enrichment.hometown: St Ives, New South Wales, Australia
enrichment.investment_focus: Life sciences / biomedical technology (drugs, devices, diagnostics, tools); invests across stages from seed to growth and across private, public and credit strategies.

enrichment.personal_bio: David Ticzon is a Web3 investor and operator focused on crypto, DeFi, and blockchain infrastructure. He served as VC Crypto Research Analyst at Reciprocal Ventures and has held subsequent investment and partnerships roles at Matrixport, Mysten Labs, and the Sui Foundation.
enrichment.career_background: Education includes a B.S. from Cornell University (ILR) and a master's degree from the University of Pennsylvania. Professional roles (publicly listed): VC Crypto Research Analyst at Reciprocal Ventures (May 2021–Jun 2022); Venture Capital Investments Director at Matrixport (Jun 2022–Aug 2023); Head of DeFi & Infra Deals / Early Investor at Mysten Labs (Aug 2023–Jul 2024); and ecosystem/partnership roles at the Sui Foundation (from Jul 2024 onward).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage Web3/blockchain (seed–Series A); DeFi and tokenomics; infrastructure and developer tooling; NFTs, gaming, and payments/fintech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Core Innovation Capital focused on early-stage fintech and financial inclusion. Former interest-rate trader on Wall Street with operating roles at an early-stage fintech in Nigeria and a marketplace startup in New York. Holds a BS in Management Science & Engineering from Stanford and an MBA from Harvard. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Started as an interest-rate trader (Morgan Stanley), held operating roles at an early-stage fintech in Nigeria and a marketplace startup in New York, joined Core Innovation Capital (joined Core in a VP role and is now listed as Partner). Education: BS in Management Science & Engineering (Stanford) and an MBA (Harvard).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage fintech (financial inclusion), insurtech, crypto/web3; Seed to Series A

enrichment.personal_bio: Former NFL defensive tackle and 2014 first-round pick who transitioned into entrepreneurship and investing after retiring. Active in real estate, licensed micro-cultivation (cannabis), fintech/edutech projects and athlete-focused ventures. Public speaker and mental-health advocate working on athlete wellness and addiction recovery initiatives.
enrichment.career_background: Dominique Easley played college football at the University of Florida and was selected in the first round of the 2014 NFL Draft; he played for the New England Patriots and Los Angeles Rams and is a Super Bowl XLIX champion. Since retiring he has built businesses and investments spanning real estate, consumer retail (party/store operations), cannabis cultivation/licensing and athlete-focused platforms; he is listed as an investor/member at The Players' Impact and has publicly discussed founding/leading several ventures and a mental-health-focused foundation.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel/venture platform enabling professional athletes to access curated startup and secondary opportunities; sectors include sports & entertainment, consumer, fintech, education, and early- to growth-stage startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at Figment Capital based in New York. Focuses on Web3 infrastructure topics including MEV, transaction supply-chain, privacy, modularity and data availability. Background in research and consulting; studied at Babson College.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Figment Capital in 2022; prior roles include Associate at Dragonfly (2021–2022), researcher at Babson College (2017–2020) and student consultant at Fuld + Company (2018–2019). Holds a Bachelor of Science from Babson College and works on early-stage blockchain infrastructure investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) Web3 and blockchain infrastructure — L1/L2 tooling, modular stacks, MEV/tx-supply-chain, privacy, data availability, and staking infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and early-stage investor. Founder of Cardinia Ventures (2016) and co‑founder of Omny Studio (acquired by Triton Digital). Investor/advisor in software and hardware startups across Australia, the US and Southeast Asia.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Cardinia Ventures in 2016 and has been investing in pre‑seed to Series A companies. Co‑founder and former CEO of Omny Studio (acquired 2019); first employee at Rome2rio; held roles at Funding Circle, Groupon, ANZ and Microsoft. Currently co‑founder/CEO at GXE and active as an investor and advisor to portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed to Series A investments in software and hardware companies across Australia, the United States and Southeast Asia.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Berkeley Frontier Fund and Director/Sr. Director of Cloud Security Product Management at Netskope. Co‑founder and former CEO of Kloudless (acquired by Netskope in Jan 2021). UC Berkeley graduate with a background in product management and developer platforms. Active across the San Francisco Bay Area and Taiwan markets.
enrichment.career_background: Eliot Sun is a founder‑operator turned investor and product leader. He co‑founded Kloudless (SaaS API integration platform) and served as its CEO until the company was acquired by Netskope in January 2021. Post‑acquisition he joined Netskope in product leadership (cloud security APIs) and serves as Country Manager for Netskope Taiwan. He is a venture partner at Berkeley Frontier Fund (and has been listed as a venture partner at other cross‑border funds).
enrichment.investment_focus: Developer platforms / APIs, cloud security and enterprise SaaS; stages: Seed–Series B; geographies: US (Bay Area) and APAC (Taiwan)

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner / investor at Reciprocal Ventures focused on early-stage Web3 and fintech. Previously a VC associate at Miami Angels and an investment banking analyst at Credit Suisse. Graduated magna cum laude from Duke University (Political Science, Economics, Philosophy).
enrichment.career_background: Started in venture as a summer analyst on the Greenspring/StepStone fund-of-funds team, then worked as an Investment Banking Analyst at Credit Suisse (NYC). Joined Miami Angels as a Venture Capital Associate (managing sourcing and diligence) before moving to Reciprocal Ventures (joined 2022) as an investor on the firm’s crypto/FinTech team. Graduated magna cum laude from Duke University and attended Girls Who Invest programming.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage Web3/crypto and FinTech (payments, infrastructure, protocols); primarily seed to Series A investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at CitizenX, a thesis‑driven crypto/ Web3 venture firm. Early‑stage investor focused on Web3, DeFi, NFTs and token economics. Based in New York; previously worked in business development at Jumio and co‑founded Citizen VC.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and General Partner at CitizenX (founded 2021). Previously VP/Business Development & Partnerships at Jumio and co‑founder/President of Citizen VC; active in crypto investing since the mid‑2010s and has advised family offices and early‑stage projects on token launches and secondary investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) investments in Web3: protocols, token projects, DeFi, NFT/gaming infrastructure and token economics

enrichment.career_background: Erik Dietrich is the founder of DaedTech LLC and has worked as a software engineer and IT leader (including serving as CIO at CHC Wellness). enrichment.personal_bio: Software engineer and entrepreneur based in Mountain View, CA. Co‑founder of Veryfi (YC W17) and former CTO/co‑founder of Medlert (VectorCare); founder of Purpleblue Pty Ltd (web agency). Holds a B.Sc. in Computer Science and an Executive MBA (AGSM).
enrichment.career_background: Australian‑trained software engineer who founded Purpleblue Pty Ltd (web development/analytics), served as CTO at Couponstar (later part of Quotient/ Coupons.com) and Head of International Engineering at Coupons/Quotient, co‑founded Medlert (VectorCare) and co‑founded Veryfi (YC W17). enrichment.personal_bio: Graphic designer, publisher, and educator. Founder and editor of the Turkish-language online journal Manifold (co‑founded 2016). enrichment.career_background: Esen Karol is a graphic designer and publisher who co‑founded Manifold in 2016 and runs a single‑person design studio. enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and founder of Kredit Academy (formerly Kiddie Kredit), focused on credit education and financial literacy for youth. Based in Miami, he serves as a Scout at Florida Funders and has acted as a mentor at Techstars and leader in Miami EdTech initiatives.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Kiddie Kredit (now Kredit Academy) in 2018 to teach credit and financial skills to young people. Active in the Miami startup ecosystem as Vice Chair of Miami EdTech, co‑founder of Black Men Talk Tech, a Techstars mentor, and (since 2021) a Scout for Florida Funders; has participated in accelerator and fundraising programs for Kredit Academy.
