enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and former CTO of Teespring (founded 2011). Currently a venture partner at Pioneer Fund and a general partner at HF0 (startup residency/fund). Based in the San Francisco Bay Area; AB from Brown University.
enrichment.career_background: Evan co‑founded Teespring (also known as Spring) and served as its CTO through 2018. enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and publisher of the long-running "Week in Ethereum News" and co-founder/investor at Starbloom Ventures. Active angel investor focused on early-stage Web3 and Ethereum infrastructure. Based in Houston, TX.

He is based in Houston, Texas.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and former CEO of Set Protocol / Set Labs; active angel/investor listed with Turing Capital. Background spans crypto product and protocol work and prior engineering/operations roles. Educated at UC Berkeley (B.S.).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and CEO of Set Protocol / Set Labs (focused on tokenized/strategy‑enabled crypto assets). Prior roles include software engineering at Radius and finance & operations at 21.co; currently active as an angel investor (associated with Turing Capital) and public writer on crypto topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3 / Crypto, DeFi, tokenized asset management; early‑stage (seed / pre‑seed) investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and writer with technical training in aerospace engineering. Served as a Pre‑MBA Associate Intern at UP.Partners (2021–2022) and has worked in product and engineering roles at Boeing and Pavemint. MBA candidate at Harvard Business School and founder of the Founder to Founder newsletter.
enrichment.career_background: Frederick Daso holds a B.S. and M.S. in Aerospace Engineering from MIT and is an MBA candidate at Harvard Business School (class of 2025). enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in mobility and transportation technologies (air, land, sea, space), logistics and last‑mile delivery, autonomy and sensing hardware, and adjacent energy/manufacturing systems.

enrichment.personal_bio: Garry Cooper Jr., Ph.D., is co‑founder and CEO of Rheaply and a founding General Partner at LongJump, a Chicago‑based pre‑seed fund. He is a climate‑tech and circular‑economy entrepreneur with an academic background in neuroscience and experience in supply‑chain consulting.
interests: circular economy / reuse and resource recovery
founder support & diversity in early‑stage investing
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Cooper co‑founded Rheaply (enterprise asset‑management for reuse) and serves as its CEO and board chair. He is a founding GP at LongJump, has been an adjunct assistant professor at Northwestern University, and earlier worked on supply‑chain and performance improvement at Ernst & Young. enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed, first‑check founder‑led investments; industry‑agnostic with an intentional focus on underrepresented founders and startups outside traditional coastal hubs.

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage investor and former Vice President at PJC with a background in product and growth at Google. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and has worked on investments and sourcing across consumer, enterprise, and AI sectors. More recently affiliated with firms focused on immersive/web3 and AI investing.

enrichment.personal_bio: Author of Crossing the Chasm and several other books on technology markets. Venture Partner at Mohr Davidow Ventures who advises the firm’s portfolio companies; founder of The Chasm Group and managing director of Geoffrey Moore Consulting. Known for work on market development, technology adoption and go-to-market strategy for disruptive technologies.

He has advised and served on boards of multiple technology firms.
enrichment.investment_focus: Advising and investing in early-stage technology companies with emphasis on market development, go-to-market strategy, enterprise/software and disruptive technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Technologist and entrepreneur based in San Diego. Founder of BL3NDlabs and co‑founder/CTO of HOTELbeat; serves as a Venture Partner at Greatscale Ventures and has held CTO/CDO roles at several startups (EV AI, GoFor Delivers, etc.). Focuses on building scalable product and technology strategy for early‑stage companies.
enrichment.career_background: Over 20 years in technology and startups. Founded BL3NDlabs (2015) and previously founded/ran GJE Consulting; co‑founded HOTELbeat (CTO). Held senior technology roles at Agentology, Benefyts, MiaMia Beauty, GoFor Delivers and EV AI. Joined Greatscale Ventures as a Venture Partner in 2021; studied Computer Information Systems at San Diego State University.

interests: Science & public policy related to space and climate resilience

enrichment.career_background: Grady Teske is a founder and fractional CMO who runs Rising Tides (a growth agency) and serves as a partner at Contango Digital Assets. enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Hyphen Capital based in San Francisco. Previously held customer success and operations leadership roles at Canary Technologies and TINT and hosted The Autonomous Vehicles Podcast. Wharton MBA candidate (Class of 2025).
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an adaptive systems engineer early in his career, moved into customer success and operations (TINT → Sourceress → Canary Technologies), founded/hosted The Autonomous Vehicles Podcast, and serves as a partner at Hyphen Capital; listed as a Wharton MBA candidate (Class of 2025).

enrichment.personal_bio: Harlan M. Krumholz, MD, SM, is the Harold H. Hines, Jr. Professor of Medicine at Yale School of Medicine and Director of the Yale New Haven Hospital Center for Outcomes Research and Evaluation. He is a cardiologist and outcomes researcher, co‑founder of Hugo Health and Refactor Health and co‑founder of medRxiv, and serves as a Venture Partner at F‑Prime Capital Partners. interests: Digital health and patient data portability
Real‑world data, AI and healthcare analytics
enrichment.career_background: Longtime Yale faculty member and clinician‑scientist focused on improving healthcare quality, equity, and the use of digital and real‑world data. Founded the Yale New Haven Hospital Center for Outcomes Research and Evaluation, co‑founded Hugo Health and Refactor Health, co‑founded medRxiv, has advised multiple health technology companies, and serves as a Venture Partner at F‑Prime Capital Partners.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare and technology: life sciences, digital health, health IT and enterprise software; seed through late‑stage venture investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Media entrepreneur and operator — founder of Wondery (acquired by Amazon in 2021) and co‑founder of Danvas. Founder of Owl & Co and the Hernan Lopez Family Foundation. Active as an angel investor, listed as an angel affiliated with 01 Advisors; based in Los Angeles.
enrichment.career_background: Former President & CEO of Fox International Channels (led international expansion), founded podcast network Wondery in 2016 and led its sale to Amazon in 2021. enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Vol. 1 Ventures and founder of Fintech Today. Former finance reporter (Quartz and others) and product manager at Acorns and Tasting Room/Lot18. Active in early‑stage fintech and crypto investing and involved with AI/compliance startups.
enrichment.career_background: Ian Kar began as a finance reporter covering fintech and crypto, then moved into product roles (notably at Acorns and Tasting Room). enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of Retroplay; served as an Investment Partner at Dorm Room Fund (student‑led VC) and has worked in product and media roles. enrichment.career_background: Longtime Silicon Valley entrepreneur and investor. enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and former partner at Harpoon Ventures with a background in investment banking. Worked in debt and equity capital markets at Citi and Bank of America Merrill Lynch before moving into VC. Focuses on enterprise software and frontier technologies (AI, space, security). enrichment.personal_bio: Associate Director on Emerson Collective’s early-stage venture team based in San Francisco. Focuses on impact-driven, early-stage companies across sustainability, healthcare, and financial inclusion. Holds an MBA from MIT Sloan and a BA from Duke University.

enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed1 Series A) companies in sustainability/climate tech, digital health & health IT, financial inclusion/fintech, and consumer (food & beverage, retail).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at Manifold Group and a serial entrepreneur who helps build and invest in early-stage technology companies. (Northwestern); undergraduate degree from Georgetown University.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Manifold (formerly Digital Intent) and has led and exited multiple technology businesses. enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage startups across enterprise software, data & AI, marketplaces, and tech-enabled services (including healthcare and privacy-focused companies).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of CrenVentures (Crenshaw Ventures), based in Austin, Texas. Active angel investor with reported investing activity through CREN Capital and a track record of early-stage, DTC/e‑commerce and local real‑estate investments.
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur-operator who founded and runs CrenVentures (Crenshaw Ventures) and earlier companies including Console Pros, Green Delights and HELLO! Marketing. Public profiles and interviews describe activity in e‑commerce, brand acquisitions and residential real‑estate flips around Austin; also listed on investor platforms as an angel investor with CREN Capital.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Aurum Capital Ventures and MiningStore. Active in cryptocurrency mining, Web3/blockchain investing, and runs the "Digital Gold" podcast. Based in the United States (profiles list Austin, Texas).
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur and investor focused on digital-currency mining and Web3. Founder/CEO of MiningStore (hardware and mining operations) and CEO of Aurum Capital Ventures; has founded multiple crypto-related ventures and studied at North Carolina State University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage Web3/Blockchain and crypto (digital currency mining infrastructure, renewable-energy-backed mining, staking and yield products)

Writer and researcher on MEV, execution auctions, protocol economics, and blockchain value capture. Summa Cum Laude graduate of the University of Pennsylvania (NETS & Economics).

Graduated Summa Cum Laude from the University of Pennsylvania (NETS & Economics).

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal and investor based in Las Vegas who works at Dream Ventures. Background spans business development, brand management and creative direction; also active as an angel/advisor in consumer and fintech startups.
enrichment.career_background: Serves as Principal / Chief of Staff at Dream Ventures (listed on the firm's team page). Previously held roles in business development, brand management and creative direction and has acted as an investor or advisor to multiple early-stage companies. Educated at the University of Malta and Northumbria University.

enrichment.personal_bio: Onchain investor and GP / Fund Manager on Skycatcher’s onchain strategy. Previously a founding partner at Senary Ventures and held product/strategy roles at MediaMath. enrichment.career_background: Joined Skycatcher in 2022 as a portfolio/GP on the Onchain Fund after co-founding Senary Ventures (2020–2021) where he managed token investments. Public profiles list a B.B.A. from Ithaca College and earlier experience in music/entertainment-adjacent roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Onchain digital assets and tokens, Web3/Blockchain protocols, gaming and entertainment platforms; primarily Seed–Series A and liquid onchain/public positions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and Managing Partner at Protofund, an early-stage VC focused on web3 and consumer products. Former product leader at Blockfolio/FTX, Flipagram (now TikTok) and Google. Holds a BS and an MBA from UCLA (per professional profiles).
enrichment.career_background: Jonathan Chu co‑founded Protofund in 2021 and serves as a managing partner investing in pre-seed to Series A web3 and consumer startups. Prior to Protofund he held senior product roles including Head of Product at the FTX (Blockfolio) app and product leadership at Flipagram/TikTok and Google; he has also co‑founded consumer startups (e.g., Zoomie).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed, seed, Series A) investments in web3/blockchain, consumer products, crypto/DeFi and financial-software startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor on TCG Crypto’s team focused on consumer Web3 and crypto. Formerly worked in credit and trading roles at Citi and holds a BBA from Emory University’s Goizueta Business School. Publicly active on crypto topics and based in the Los Angeles area.
enrichment.career_background: Jonathan Moore is an investor on TCG’s crypto team (TCG Crypto), where he focuses on early-stage consumer Web3 opportunities. Prior to TCG he worked in credit and trading roles at Citigroup and was involved in student-led impact investing at Emory University, where he earned a BBA from Goizueta Business School. He joined the TCG crypto effort as a founding member and has been publicly active on portfolio and sector commentary.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage consumer Web3/crypto (Seed–Series A/B); NFTs, gaming, on-chain payments and creator-focused products

enrichment.personal_bio: Joseph (Joe) Kelly is co‑founder and CEO of Unchained, a bitcoin‑native financial services company that builds collaborative multisignature custody, lending, trading, and retirement products for long‑term bitcoin holders. He leads company strategy and public communications about custody, bitcoin‑backed loans, and client self‑custody. Kelly previously co‑founded Infochimps and has appeared on industry podcasts and Unchained’s blog discussing bitcoin security and financial services.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Unchained in 2016 and serves as its CEO, guiding product and growth for bitcoin financial services (custody, loans, trading, IRAs). Prior to Unchained he co‑founded Infochimps (a big‑data company) and held executive roles there; he is also reported as a board member of the Texas Bitcoin Foundation and studied at The University of Texas at Austin.
enrichment.investment_focus: Bitcoin financial services: collaborative multisignature custody, bitcoin‑backed loans, trading/execution, and retirement (IRA) products.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at F-Prime Capital Partners and co‑founder of Stavvy. Former Chief Security Officer at DigitalOcean and VP of Information Security at Rapid7. Holds an MBA from MIT Sloan and a bachelor's degree from the University of Maryland.
enrichment.career_background: Josh Feinblum is a technologist and operator who has led security and product teams across startups and large technology companies. He co‑founded Stavvy (digital mortgage platform), served as CSO at DigitalOcean and VP of Information Security at Rapid7, and has been a Venture Partner at F‑Prime since 2017; he has an MBA from MIT Sloan.
enrichment.investment_focus: Cybersecurity, FinTech, E‑commerce; primarily Seed to Series A (Boston / New England focus)

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-career investor and writer focused on agrifood technology and CPG. Served as an Investor Intern at AgFunder (Aug 2020–Jan 2021) and contributed reporting to AgFunderNews. Active in early-stage (seed/pre-seed) ag/food investing and scouting.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an Investor Intern at AgFunder (Aug 2020–Jan 2021) and authored pieces for AgFunderNews (Nov 2020). Public profiles list him as a scout/early-stage investor with a focus on agri/foodtech and CPG.
enrichment.investment_focus: AgTech; food & beverage / CPG startups; seed and pre-seed stage; frontier agrifood technologies (AI, biotech, robotics)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Axial VC, an early-stage venture firm focused on life sciences. Trained as a biochemist (Harvard undergrad; graduate training at UC Berkeley), he previously advised DeepMind and worked at Wing Venture Capital. Publishes a Substack and hosts Axial podcasts about science and startups.
enrichment.career_background: Joshua Elkington studied molecular and cellular biology at Harvard and completed graduate training in biochemistry at UC Berkeley. He worked in scientific consulting and as a scientific advisor at DeepMind and as an analyst at Wing Venture Capital before founding Axial (2019) to invest in and support early-stage, founder-driven life sciences companies. He also publishes a Substack and produces Axial podcasts.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed, Series A) life sciences: biotechnology, drug discovery, protein engineering, and AI/ML applied to biology.

enrichment.personal_bio: Product Manager at Microsoft (Office) with a background in software engineering and founding early-stage startups. Music producer and creator; serves as an investor / limited partner associated with Platanus Ventures.
enrichment.career_background: Product manager on Microsoft Office (cross-app/desktop & mobile), previously a software engineer on Office for Mac. Founder of Heartlytics and has held advisor roles in startups and music/creator projects. Active as an angel/LP investor connected to Platanus Ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage Latin American technology startups (seed/accelerator); sectors include SaaS, marketplaces, fintech, Web3/crypto, and creator-economy tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Tectonic Ventures. Early‑stage investor with prior roles at General Catalyst and Javelin Venture Partners; co‑founded Ripple Concerts. Holds a B.S. (summa cum laude) from Boston University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Moved to the U.S. as a teenager and began a career spanning investment banking (J.P. Morgan), strategy/business roles (McGraw‑Hill), and venture investing (Primary/ Javelin/General Catalyst). Co‑founded Tectonic Ventures in 2017 and serves as a board participant or advisor across portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage technology startups, with emphasis on marketplaces/e‑commerce, education tech, and AI/ML.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Mammoth Scientific (aka Mammoth VC) and co‑founder of Milemarker. Experienced wealthtech and fintech operator who has served as CMO at Carson Group and an early product/marketing leader at Orion Advisor Services. Focused on modernizing wealth management, platform design, and making private investing more accessible to RIAs.
interests: Private investments for RIAs and advisor channels
AI applied to wealth management and data workflows
Data integration and APIs for financial firms
enrichment.career_background: Jud Mackrill is a fintech and wealthtech operator and investor. He co‑founded Milemarker (data/integration platform), co‑founded Mineral Interactive (acquired by Carson Group), served as CMO at Carson Group, was an early employee and head of design/marketing roles at Orion Advisor Services, and joined Mammoth as a General Partner where he helps lead the firm’s venture efforts in health science and technology. He has also served on advisory boards (e.g., LifeYield).
enrichment.investment_focus: Health science & technology, medical devices, biotechnology, digital health; fintech and wealthtech focused on RIA/advisor distribution; Series A and later-stage venture investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Cred Protocol (on‑chain credit scoring). Member of South Park Commons and partner at Turbo Labs. Former co‑founder & CEO of Xendo (acquired by AppDirect); engineering background with a master's from the University of Cambridge.
interests: Web3 / DeFi and on‑chain credit scoring
enrichment.career_background: Software engineer and product strategist educated at the University of Cambridge. Early career building derivatives trading systems at Deutsche Bank, later founded Filobite and Xendo (enterprise search). Xendo was acquired by AppDirect, where he served as General Manager for Appwise. Since 2019 he has been a partner at Turbo Labs and founded Cred Protocol (2021), while serving as a member/mentor in startup communities including South Park Commons, GBx, First Round Fast Track and Alchemist Accelerator.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage / pre‑seed & seed; Web3/DeFi, on‑chain credit and credit data infrastructure; fintech and enterprise SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur, operator, and investor; formerly an investor at Solana Ventures and an early hire at Solana Labs. Founder of New Block Capital and PacificBTM (acquired); currently Executive Director at the Sei Development Foundation and a Venture Partner at Faction VC.
enrichment.career_background: Worked across research, trading, and investments at Solana Labs and Solana Ventures; founded New Block Capital (multi‑strategy crypto fund) and PacificBTM (crypto ATM business, acquired 2021); served as analyst roles at TheTie, Millennium Management and USC endowment. Holds a bachelor’s degree from the University of Southern California and has taken on advisory/mentor roles (e.g., Techstars, gaming studios).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage Web3/Crypto (DeFi, gaming, infrastructure); consumer tech and fintech startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Kal Deutsch is a Bay Area entrepreneur, founder & CEO of DealEngine and a co‑founder of Silicon Valley in Your Pocket. He is a partner/founding investor-advisor at The Batchery and has served on screening and diligence committees for the Berkeley Angel Network. He holds an MBA from UC Berkeley (Haas) and works as an adjunct instructor and startup coach.
enrichment.career_background: Kal began his career in finance and corporate roles (Wells Fargo, Visa, Pricewaterhouse) before moving into startups and product roles in real‑estate tech (HomeGain, TotalMove) and founding companies (CineGoGo). In the 2010s he became active in angel investing and accelerators, serving as a founding partner/CEO at The Batchery, co‑founder of Silicon Valley in Your Pocket, adjunct instructor at UC Berkeley Extension, and founder/CEO of DealEngine (startup analytics).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups; analytics & startup success tools; FinTech/payments; Real Estate/PropTech; SaaS and enterprise software; accelerator-backed founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Katherine (Kate) Walker is a venture investor who served as Vice President at Bessemer Venture Partners. She focuses on early-stage vertical software and internet companies, supporting Seed–Series B founders on go-to-market, operations, and talent. She holds a BA from Stanford and an MBA from Harvard Business School and began her career at Goldman Sachs.
enrichment.career_background: Began at Goldman Sachs (technology & healthcare capital markets / alternative investments), then joined Geodesic Capital as an investor (2019–2021). Joined Bessemer Venture Partners in 2021 and was promoted to Vice President in May 2023, focusing on Seed–Series B vertical software and internet investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series B) vertical software and internet/consumer opportunities, go-to-market and scaling support

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Archetype and Chief Operating Officer at ENS Labs. Former Senior Lead at Coinbase Ventures and Principal at Notation Capital. Over a decade of experience across legal, investment, and advisory roles in the web3/crypto sector.
interests: Startup go-to-market and operations in crypto
enrichment.career_background: Started in law and transitioned into crypto operations and VC: first business hire at Messari, Principal at Notation Capital, Senior Lead at Coinbase Ventures, and now Venture Partner at Archetype while serving as COO of ENS Labs. Holds a J.D. from Cardozo School of Law and a B.A. from Johns Hopkins University.
enrichment.hometown: Grew up moving between California; Kunming (Yunnan, China); and Hong Kong.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage crypto / web3 (protocols, infrastructure, DeFi); seed to Series A investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Emmy-winning TV personality and consumer technology expert who runs Katie Linendoll Productions. Regular media contributor and keynote emcee; announced she is a partner at MetroCap Partners. Holds a BS in Information Technology New Media from Rochester Institute of Technology.
enrichment.career_background: Katie Linendoll began in production at ESPN (won an Emmy for SportsCenter), transitioned to on-air technology reporting and hosting for outlets including TODAY and The Weather Channel, founded Katie Linendoll Productions to produce tech stories, and in recent years joined MetroCap Partners as a partner focused on accelerating early-stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage startups; enterprise SaaS; PropTech; Future of Work; responsible AI; consumer products and consumer technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner / Venture Partner at Tribe Capital focusing on AI and product-led investments. Former Director of Product (AI for Ads) at Facebook/Meta and VP of Product at Reddit; co‑founder/CEO of Lolapps. Holds a BS in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Product leader turned investor — co‑founder and CEO of Lolapps; VP Product at Homejoy and Reddit; Director of Product (AI for Ads) at Facebook/Meta; currently Partner (AI & Venture Partner) at Tribe Capital. Educated at UC Berkeley (BS, EECS).
enrichment.investment_focus: AI and product-led consumer and enterprise startups; Web3/crypto and FinTech; invests across seed to growth stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Kevin Eun is an investor who previously served as an Associate at Griffin Gaming Partners (covering web2 and web3 gaming). He studied at the University of Southern California (BS) and has worked in investment banking and gaming-focused VC roles. He has later held investor roles at Shima Capital and Galaxy Interactive according to public profiles.
enrichment.career_background: Started in technology investment banking at Nomura, then joined Griffin Gaming Partners as an Associate (covering web2 and web3 gaming for Fund I/II). Subsequently worked at Shima Capital on blockchain/web3 gaming and took investor roles at Galaxy Interactive. Education: BS in Mathematics & Economics, University of Southern California.
enrichment.investment_focus: Gaming (web2 & web3) — content, software infrastructure, platforms; stages: Pre-seed through Series B

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Bain Capital Ventures based in the Bay Area. Joined BCV in 2017 and focuses on early to growth-stage enterprise application software and developer-focused products. Previously the first business hire and Head of Product at Fundera; graduated from Columbia University.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Bain Capital Ventures in 2017 and invests across seed to growth stages, with a focus on enterprise application software, developer products, and fintech. Prior to BCV he was the first business hire and Head of Product at Fundera. He has also served as a venture partner for Bain Capital Crypto and is active in BCV’s fintech and AI investing initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed through growth-stage investments in enterprise software (apps & infrastructure), fintech, AI infrastructure/developer tools, industrials/climate tech, and healthcare/biotech.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at BlackTech Capital who focuses on directing capital to underrepresented founders building ClimateTech/CleanTech solutions. Founder of ReRev (founder advisory/operations) and former investment strategist with experience in early-stage sourcing and founder education. Based in Birmingham, Alabama (professional location).
interests: AI, automation & no-code tools for startups
enrichment.career_background: Keyona Meeks is General Partner at BlackTech Capital and founder of ReRev (startup advisory focused on AI/automation and operations). She previously worked as an Investment Strategist at Bronze Valley and was a Venture for America fellow; her work includes founder programming, deal sourcing, and early-stage diligence for climate and impact startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed/seed investments in ClimateTech / CleanTech (carbon capture, sustainable materials, circular economy) with an explicit focus on Black and other underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage investor and operator; former Managing Partner at Amplify.LA and co‑founder of OpenNest Labs. MBA from USC Marshall and a BS in Finance from Virginia Tech. Advises and invests in LA‑based startups, with experience coaching founders on fundraising.
enrichment.career_background: Served in investing and operating roles including Managing Partner / Executive Director at Amplify.LA, venture/strategy roles at Crosscut Ventures and Wavemaker, and co‑founder/COO roles at OpenNest Labs and RealSleep. Prior to VC worked in finance (LPL Financial) and earlier served as an MBA intern at AngelVision. Holds an MBA from USC Marshall and a BS in Finance from Virginia Tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed / seed and early‑stage venture — consumer and enterprise tech, fintech, healthcare, marketplaces and e‑commerce, AI/automation.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CEO of Paladin (legal‑tech platform increasing access to pro bono services) and Partner at LongJump, a Chicago‑based first‑check VC. Formerly worked on international criminal matters at the U.S. Department of Justice and on early startup teams. Focuses on supporting underrepresented founders and early‑stage, founder‑led companies.
interests: Supporting underrepresented founders (Latinx, women, Black founders)
Early‑stage B2B startups and founder community building
enrichment.career_background: Kristen Sonday co‑founded Paladin (legal‑tech) and serves as its CEO; prior to Paladin she worked on international criminal matters at the U.S. Department of Justice and was on founding teams at startups including Grouper. She is a Partner at LongJump (first‑check VC focused on Chicago and underrepresented founders) and has served in leadership roles with the Legal Services Corporation and multiple legal‑tech and civic organizations.
enrichment.investment_focus: First‑check / pre‑seed and seed investments (early‑stage), industry‑agnostic but active in B2B SaaS, marketplaces, consumer and impact; intentionally focused on Chicago and underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Will Ventures focused on early-stage (Seed/Series A) investments. Concentrates on consumer, media/content and sports-related health and marketplace startups. Previously held investment and analytics roles at TrueBridge Capital Partners, IHS Markit, Morgan Stanley and Jefferies.
enrichment.career_background: Kristofer Martin is a principal at Will Ventures (joined mid‑2021) where he sources and leads seed and Series A investments across consumer, media and sports‑adjacent health tech. Before VC he worked in investment and research roles including TrueBridge Capital Partners, IHS Markit and trading/derivatives roles at Morgan Stanley and Jefferies. He has been public-facing on VC podcasts and industry events about athlete‑founders and consumer tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed, Series A) consumer, media/content and sports‑adjacent health technology — areas include fan engagement, athlete marketplaces, consumer health & wellness, and media platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner of the California Innovation Fund and a continuing lecturer at UC Berkeley Haas, where he teaches entrepreneurship. Former Principal at Parallel Advisors with institutional investment experience; author of Grace Hopper and the Invention of the Information Age. Former naval officer and holds a PhD from UC Berkeley (also MA, Oxford; BS, U.S. Naval Academy).
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Kurt Beyer is the founder and General Partner of the California Innovation Fund and a longtime faculty member at UC Berkeley Haas (Entrepreneurship & Executive Education). He previously served as a Principal at Parallel Advisors (institutional investment/advisory role), founded and led digital media ventures, and served as a naval aviator. He is the author of a book on Grace Hopper and holds degrees from the U.S. Naval Academy, Oxford, and UC Berkeley (PhD).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed to Series A); industry-agnostic with emphasis on university-affiliated (University of California) founders; sector interests include biotech, healthtech, AI and education technology.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor-Operating Partner at Florida Funders based in Tampa, Florida. Veteran technology entrepreneur who founded REPS Software and JazzMedia and has actively backed early-stage Tampa Bay startups. Serves on the boards of Tampa Bay Wave and (formerly) TSOLife; University of South Florida alumnus.
enrichment.career_background: Lance Raab is a long-time technology entrepreneur and investor. He founded REPS Software (an assisted-living CRM) and later JazzMedia (domain and web ventures), has been an Investor-Operating Partner at Florida Funders since 2013, and has served on local boards including Tampa Bay Wave and TSOLife. He holds a B.S. from the University of South Florida.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed & Series A) technology startups — SaaS and creator/passion-economy companies; regional focus on Florida / Southeast U.S.

enrichment.personal_bio: Laura “Lala” Elizondo is an entrepreneur and angel investor based in Austin, Texas. She co‑founded Tule Capital (real estate) and Glam Express, serves as an investor/LP in funds including 500 LatAm and Amplifica, and hosts a Real Estate podcast focused on Hispanic investors.
enrichment.career_background: Lala has 15+ years of experience across CPG and international business development (PepsiCo, Pernod Ricard), founded consumer businesses (Garden Station, Glam Express), and now runs Tule Capital (multifamily real estate). She is active as an angel investor, SPV manager, LP in VC funds, podcast host, and board member/advisor in Latin American entrepreneurial organizations.
enrichment.hometown: Born in Texas; raised in México
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage tech startups (pre‑seed to Series A) in Spanish‑speaking Latin America; sectors include FinTech, PropTech/Real Estate, Marketplaces, E‑commerce, HealthTech, Logistics

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Berkeley Catalyst Fund and founder of Mobius Photonics. Ph.D. in Physical Chemistry from UC Berkeley; experience commercializing hardware and deep-technology startups and mentoring technical founders. Served in leadership roles at Cria Innovations and as Executive Director of Stanford's Taiwan Science & Technology Hub.
interests: Cleantech & energy (clean air, clean water, energy storage)
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Laura Smoliar earned a Ph.D. in Physical Chemistry from UC Berkeley. She co-founded Mobius Photonics in 2005 and served as CEO and Chairman until its assets were acquired by IPG Photonics (2013). In 2016 she co-founded the Berkeley Catalyst Fund (BCF) as a hybrid fund tied to UC Berkeley, overseeing a portfolio of early-stage companies. She has also founded Cria Innovations and served as Executive Director of Stanford’s Taiwan Science & Technology Hub; she was elected a Senior Member of SPIE (2017).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and Series A investments sourced from the UC Berkeley ecosystem; sectors include life sciences/biotech, medical devices, agriculture, cleantech (clean air/water, energy storage), sensors, and deep hardware/photonic technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Los Angeles–based serial technology entrepreneur and former music promoter/manager. Co‑founder of Wave Digital Assets and early advisor/investor in multiple blockchain projects (including Ripple and Ethereum). Focuses on NFTs, crypto protocols and digital asset fund strategies.
interests: Digital asset fund and treasury management
enrichment.career_background: Borsai began in the music industry as a rave promoter and artist manager (clients have included Wynonna Judd and Jason Mraz), then founded digital music startups such as gridMob and SongLily. He advised blockchain firms (including Ripple) from the early 2010s and co‑founded Wave Digital Assets in 2018 to provide venture, fund, and wealth management for digital assets.
enrichment.investment_focus: Digital assets and blockchain: crypto protocols, DeFi, NFTs and collectibles, early‑stage blockchain ventures, institutional digital asset funds and treasury management.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Youbi Capital and a global investment advisor to HashKey Capital. Active in crypto investing since 2017 with experience sourcing and evaluating early-stage web3 projects. Holds an MBA from the University of Michigan and has worked on fundraising and partnerships for blockchain startups.
enrichment.career_background: Li Gong studied chemistry at Fudan University and later earned an MBA from the University of Michigan. She entered crypto investing in 2017, joined Youbi Capital full‑time around 2018, and serves as Managing Partner at Youbi while acting as a global investment advisor/venture partner to HashKey Capital. Her background includes work in the auto industry and roles focused on deal sourcing, fundraising and partnerships for blockchain startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage digital asset and web3 investments (blockchain protocols, infrastructure, DeFi, gaming/NFTs)

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner & Chief Operating Officer at Dragonfly Capital Partners. Oversees venture operations, legal and regulatory strategy, and portfolio support. Formerly first in-house legal counsel at Stellar Development Foundation. Holds a J.D. from Harvard Law School and a B.A. in Mathematics from the University of Virginia.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Dragonfly as Partner & Counsel (circa 2020), later promoted to Partner & Chief Operating Officer (circa 2022). Prior roles include Legal Counsel at Stellar Development Foundation and Interstellar, plus early-career roles/internships at the SEC, Davis Polk, Paul Weiss and Lazard. Academic background: J.D., Harvard Law; B.A. (Mathematics), University of Virginia.
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3/crypto (DeFi, protocols, L1/L2, infrastructure, NFT infra); typically seed through Series B; token and protocol investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and architect of Network, a project and foundation focused on brain–computer interfaces and what the project calls ‘virtual dreams’. Early-stage investor and researcher with prior research roles and fellowships reported at Harvard and educational ties to the London School of Economics. Publishes writing and whitepapers on neurotech, decentralized protocols, and dream exploration.
enrichment.career_background: Founder & Architect — Network (2020–present); Executive Director — Network Foundation; Managing Director — Network Fund (2016–2021); Research Director — Neuro Capital (2018–2019); researcher/roles at String Labs and Proton; reported post‑doctoral fellowship work at Harvard and study at LSE. Active as an early-stage investor and author on topics bridging neurotech and decentralized systems.
enrichment.investment_focus: Neurotechnology and brain–computer interfaces; Web3/crypto and decentralized protocols; early‑stage / seed investments in neurotech and crypto-related projects.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner / Limited Partner at Trammell Venture Partners and founder, CEO & CIO of Mimesis Capital. Active angel investor focused on Bitcoin and crypto-native businesses. Previously worked as an associate at BlockTower Capital and publishes research on Bitcoin investing.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Mimesis Capital (multi‑strategy family office) in 2020 and serves as its CEO/CIO. Joined Trammell Venture Partners as a Venture Partner / Limited Partner in 2020. Prior roles include Associate at BlockTower Capital (2019–2020) and venture/advisory roles at other crypto-focused groups; active public commentator and author on Bitcoin.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage, Bitcoin-native technologies, Web3/Crypto startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Luciana Borio, M.D., is a Venture Partner at ARCH Venture Partners advising on biologics manufacturing, clinical trials, novel therapies and other life‑science opportunities. She is a physician and public‑health specialist with extensive government and advisory experience in biodefense and emerging infectious diseases. She is an adjunct assistant professor at Johns Hopkins and a senior fellow for global health at the Council on Foreign Relations.
enrichment.career_background: Dr. Borio trained in medicine (M.D., George Washington University) and completed residency/fellowships at New York‑Presbyterian/Weill Cornell, Johns Hopkins and the NIH. She served in senior roles at the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (including Acting Chief Scientist and Assistant Commissioner for Counterterrorism Policy), was Director for Medical and Biodefense Preparedness at the National Security Council (2017–2019), and was a senior vice president at In‑Q‑Tel before joining ARCH. She continues part‑time clinical work and holds advisory and board roles in industry and non‑profits.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage life sciences (biotechnology/therapeutics), biologics manufacturing, clinical development and novel therapeutic platforms

enrichment.personal_bio: Lyle Berkowitz, MD, is a physician, informaticist and digital-health entrepreneur based in Chicago. He is founder & CEO of KeyCare and serves as a partner/general partner at 2Flo Ventures; he has founded and advised multiple health‑tech companies and holds academic and board roles in health IT and telehealth.
enrichment.career_background: MD-trained primary care physician and clinical informaticist. Longtime innovation leader at Northwestern Medicine; founder and chairman of Healthfinch (acquired); former Chief Medical Officer & EVP of Product at MDLIVE; founder & CEO of KeyCare; associate clinical professor at Northwestern Feinberg; partner/general partner at 2Flo Ventures and board member/advisor to multiple health‑tech companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage healthcare and life sciences (seed & Series A); digital health, virtual care, biotech and devices with emphasis on solutions addressing health disparities and system integration.

enrichment.personal_bio: 2x tech founder, author and pre-seed investor based in Pittsburgh. General Partner (Midwest) with The Fund / Everywhere Ventures and founder of ShowClix and LaneSpotter. Publishes the newsletter This Better Work and wrote the book This Better Work.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of ShowClix (online event ticketing) and founder of LaneSpotter (bike-safety mapping). Served as a General Partner for The Fund Midwest / Everywhere Ventures (pre-seed investing), held senior marketing roles (including at Graceful and Hive.co), and has led local startup ecosystem work in Pittsburgh (former PRA "startup czar"). Author of This Better Work.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed stage (typical checks $50–250k); sector emphasis on money/fintech, health, and work; regional focus for The Fund Midwest on Illinois, Michigan, Indiana, Ohio, Kentucky, and Western Pennsylvania.

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage crypto investor who joined OP Crypto (now Inception Capital) in 2023 after graduating from Babson College. Focuses on Web3, blockchain infrastructure and crypto-native startups; later listed as joining Figment Capital as a partner in 2024. Active on Medium writing about privacy and Web3 topics.
enrichment.career_background: BSc in Business Administration from Babson College; joined OP Crypto’s investment team in 2023 (roles listed as Deal Analyst / Investment Associate) and is reported to have moved to Figment Capital as a partner in 2024. Has published commentary on Web3 topics (privacy, infrastructure) on Medium and the firm blog.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / seed and early-stage Web3 & crypto (blockchain infrastructure, DeFi, NFT & gaming)
